name: LilleStorm på besøg
description:
LittleStorm is visiting the park, play ground, city and more. It's a game for 2.5-6 year olds.

Collect tiles and learn about locations and vocabulary. The first player to complete four tiles - finishing with LittleStorm - wins.

name: Ultimate Spider-man
description:
You are different characters from the Spider-man universe that compete to be first to beat Green Goblin, Doctor Octopus and The Lizzard.

The game is a simple roll and move game. You move the exact steps that the die shows and do what the spot you land on shows. Some spots you do nothing, on other you collect webb-tiles, on other you use the web-tiles that you have collected and then try to swing up to a roof-top where you try to win over one of the super-villians and last there are spot that you can get to a roof-top without webb-tiles.

The first player that have collected three different villians-tiles is the winner.

name: FISH! Bass Lake
description:
FISH! Bass Lake is a fishing tournament board game for 2-4 players ages 6 and up. The game is beautifully illustrated with over 12 different types of fish in various sizes. Players start by purchasing fishing tackle (using tackle tokens) based on their game strategy. On a players turn they have a limited number of actions such as... moving their boat to a different fishing location, casting for fish, selling fish for tokens, buying more tackle, etc. When a player rolls FISH!, they draw a FISH! card and, if they have the right tackle, they get to keep the fish! If the player does not have the right tackle, the fish must be placed back at bottom of fishing location's deck. The winner is the first player to reach the tournament target in fish.
This game is well-balanced between strategy, skill, & luck. Players with good memory & bluffing skills will do best. Perfect game for family get-togethers (young & old) or playing ruthlessly against friends.

name: Kombination
description:
Kombination is one of several horse racing games created by Swedish designer Jan Jangö. He would later combine elements from this game with an early 1956 incarnation of Jägersro to produce Glada galopp.

Kombination is a mechanically fairly simple game where players roll and move horses (which are not controlled by individual players) around a linear, looping track. After moving, a player may purchase a bet on a specific pair of horses, if they both occupy spaces indicating a value. The price of the bet is the sum of the values of the spaces occupied, those values increasing towards the goal spaces.

Once one or more bets have been acquired, a player must "score a combination" by moving the horses corresponding to a bet into goal spaces. (This may require some amount of rolling and looping, since any other player can move a horse past the goal spaces on their turn.) Once this is accomplished, the player scores a point and turns in the bet, again making it available for purchase.

There are several modes of play suggested depending on number of players and desired game length, but in the basic game, the first player to reach three points wins, obtaining all funds used to purchase bets (which may be just a flavour statement or hint at a possible metagame or gambling proposition).

The length and width dimensions given are for the folded board, while the depth is that of the folded board (0.6 mm) plus that of the box (2.2 mm). The width and length of the box itself are 17.3 x 13.7 mm.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Adéla ještě nevečeřela
description:
Adéla ještě nevečeřela is czech game based on same titled famous movie.
Players secretly draw character from the movie that determines whether they play on a good (as detectives) or bad side. Then they secretly tries to transport Adéla to the greenhouse and score victory points, if they bad, or to prevent it. First part of the game is about placing cards into the carriage when bad guys tries to place as many Adelas as thea can while trying to convince others that there's no Adela. detectives try to figure out what's in the carriage playing cards that allows them to search it. But nobody knows who is who, so it's only about bluffing.
When the carriage is full, it starts its journey to the greenhouse and each player has the oportunity to play a card and stop that carriage and search it. But the cards are revealed one by one and there are cards that can stop the search and help the bad guys, so detectives must be careful. But when they catch Adela, they have victory points. The team with most points wins the game.

name: Germany's next topmodel
description:
Taken from the back of the box:

Goal of the game is to become "Germany's next Topmodel". To achieve this, clothes and Makeup has to be close to perfect and also the performance on the catwalk must be the best possible.

Each player gets one pawn, symbolic for a model and one of five model-sedcards, showing only body contures. Each player tries to get the right clothes in his prep room and optimize the combinations to score high on the cat walk. At the same time, each player collects cards, which have an great impact on his or her performance - positive like negative!

Contents:
5 sedcards
6 pawns
6 clothing sets consisting of 4 pieces each
110 cards
2 six-sided dice
1 Gameboard
1 rulebook
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tom & Jerry
description:
The game is set on a gridded board seeded with face-down cheese and cat tiles. Each player begins in a designated corner and in order to win must a) cross to the opposite corner and b) collect two cheese tiles along the way. They are also in danger of turning up Tom tiles which force them to replace a cheese tile face down on the board, or failing that lose a turn.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sternbild
description:
Sternbild is a roll and move game on a board depicting our solar system and a little bit of what's beyond. Players roll four dice to move to the outer edges and eventually to the center of the galaxy. Certain fields have certain effects, and players can strike each other and send each other back to the center, although pawns which went through that get a bonus during the rest of the game.
From the outmost field players must roll a sequence of four numbers to reach the target field before being sent back by other players. The board shows names of planets and other orbital objects in many languages.

—user summary

name: Flygspelet ABA
description:
This is a game about around-the-world flight using a map showing the North Pole in the middle. Nominally there's an actual race, although this isn't really consistent with the leisurely sightseeing described in many events and use of contemporary passenger airliners. With its flavour texts and other enclosed information, the game is clearly meant to promote geographical knowledge as well as interest in commercial aviation.

Starting from Stockholm, each player colour has its own path connecting to the main circuit around the world. The spaces on the individual and common paths all have flavour texts, game instructions and/or point gains or losses associated with them. This information is found in player folders and the rules booklet, respectively.

Although most of the time players have no say in what happens, some spaces allow choices such as whether to gain a few points or move a step forward, and in a few spots, players are given small tasks such as drawing a llama, using an enclosed nomogram to calculate travel time, or explaining the significance of the International Date Line, which may gain or lose points as arbitrarily judged by an impartial scorekeeper (termed Traffic Controller) and/or the other players.

In addition to points gained from passing by or stopping in various locations, players also gain points based on the order in which they return to Stockholm. The player with the most total points is the winner. A variant to play the game purely as a race with no scorekeeping is also suggested.

Although only six players can fly planes, the rules include the role of scorekeeper in the player count.

ABA stands for AB Aerotransport, a Swedish airline which was folded into SAS just a few years after the publication of the game. Copies exist with just an ABA sticker on the cover or with ABA and SAS stickers; the contents otherwise seem identical.

—description from the publisher game submitter
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Murder Happens: Nefru's last night on the Nile
description:
Murder Mystery Party Game

Ancient Egyptian

Murder mystery party game for 8-12 players that you host at home. Each player dresses up as a character, one is the murderer and the rest must figure out who that is. To solve the mystery there are clues, police report, crime scene photos, and a map. You go over these materials then question all the players about what their characters did and saw to finally solve who done it. The game lasts a timed 2.5 hours.

Nefru's last night on the Nile.
Caravans crossing the Sahara reach Memphis on the banks of the Nile River. It’s a large city with mud hovels and stone palaces surrounded by the crops of a rich civilization. This is Egypt in 300 B.C.
The Hyskos, invaders from the northeast, have plundered and pillaged along the Nile from their base in the city of Avaris. These foreign kings have ruled Egypt for too many years. The true King of Egypt, Se Kahn-Re, has had little power, but now Se Kahn-Re has raised an army to defeat the Hyskos and unite the contentious principalities of Egypt under one rule.
In the developing power vacuum many minor and Pharonic nobles struggle to elevate their family lineage and establish political power. In the wake of these intrigues are others; priests, merchants, and military commanders jostling to attach themselves to the nobles who they think will come out on top. Throw into this mix the craven lust, greed, and deception of human affairs and you end up with an entangled hive of human endeavor that just boggles the mind! Then someone dies.

—description from the publisher

name: Flash Juice
description:
Fruits and vegetables are really delicious if we process it into juice. But, we can’t get fruits and vegetables easily because of limited stock. We must compete with other player to get it fast. So, who will be the best juice maker in the town?

In this game, players are challenged to make a quick decision which fruit to get to make a juice, based on the customer dice. While each fruit card is being covered in the color specific cover, players must also remember which fruit is being associated with which color every time the customer dice is being rolled. The fist player who shout the correct fruit get the Fruit card.

The game ends when one of the player get his/her fifth fruit card, then that player is declared as the winner of the flash juice competition.

name: Bottoms Up: Banana Skin Game – Unzip Game 4
description:
One of the games in the "banana skin game series"

Throw bottoms and score points by flicking them against each other.

name: 真贋のはざまで (Shingan no Hazama de)
description:
Publisher's summary
真贋のはざまで (Shingan no Hazama de) is a Japanese deduction game.In this game, famous masterpiece paintings are sold at auctions the players compete to sell them at higher prices.

The commentary on paintings is completely supervised by researchers at Tokyo University of the Art and you can learn Western art history while playing.

(The English edition is scheduled to be released in 2019, titled The Blackmarket.)

実在する名作絵画をオークションで売買し、その価格を競うゲームです。
絵画の解説文は東京藝大の研究者が完全監修しており、遊びながら西洋美術史が学べます。

name: Yorsh: Mini
description:
Yorsh is a liquor game helping to have a great time in a group. Inside the box there are task and bonus cards. The main principle is as follows: you either complete the task or you drink.If you draw bear card, consider yourself lucky.

You must say loudly “The Bear is Here!” and wait until all the players creep under the table.

The last player to crawl under the table is given the Bear card,
which is worth -5 points at the end of the game. Bonuses are for making tasks harder or easier. At end of the game each completed task is worth the number of points printed on it.

This is pocket edition of most destructive Russian game.

—description from the publisher

name: Do Not Disturb
description:
OBJECT OF THE GAME
Collect five (5) Pillow Cards by matching the answer of the “Room Owner.”

SETUP

Place 30 Image Cards inside the Wood Box. All other Image Cards may be set aside. They won’t be used in the game. The Image Cards do not need to be played by number sequence.
Give a matching set of three (3) Choice Cards to each player: Disturb and Join In, Shut the Door, and Call the Police.
Place the Pillow Cards in a pile to the right of the Wood Box.


Now you are ready to play.

WHAT TO KNOW ABOUT THE “DO NOT DISTURB” CHOICE CARDS
There are three choices, and these are the choices that players need to match to the Room Owner to win pillow cards. “Disturb and Join In” “Shut the Door” “Call the Police”

PLAYING THE GAME (LET’S DO IT)

The player who most recently spent a night in a hotel room goes first and is the Room Owner.
The Room Owner opens the Door of the Wood Box (without showing the other players) and sees what is happening behind the Door.
The Room Owner then takes one of his/her three Choice Cards and places it in the bottom section of the Wood Box. It is important that the “Do Not Disturb” side is face up so that other players don’t see the answer when they open the Door.
The Wood Box passes to the next player on the left to open the Door and make his/her choice. The player places his/her Choice Card in the bottom section of the Wood Box with the “Do Not Disturb” side facing up. All players are trying to correctly match what decision the Room Owner will make, not what they would do. To win a Pillow Card, players must match the response (Choice Card) that the Room Owner selected.
Play continues clockwise until all players have opened the Door and chosen the Choice Card that they think the Room Owner selected.
Once the Door has been passed to all players and returns to the Room Owner, he/she opens the Door and takes all of the Choice Cards out. Each player who matched the Room Owner wins a Pillow Card. If all players match the Room Owner, then the Room Owner also gets a Pillow Card.
. The Wood Box is then passed to the player on the left (the next Room Owner) who takes out the prior Image Card and secretly reveals a new Image Card so that other players don’t see the image. (The Image Cards are all stacked in the Wood Box, so when the prior Image Card is taken out, a new one will be revealed.)
The Room Owner then selects his/her Choice Card and puts it in the Wooden Box with the Do Not Disturb side up. Play again passes to the left as each player again chooses a Choice Card and places it inside the Wood Box. Play continues in this manner until one player has collected five Pillow Cards.


WINNING THE GAME

The first player to reach the RED space wins the game.


—description from the publisher

name: Vertical: Refuge Goodie
description:
Make a refuge on your way up the mountain so you won't fall down.

It works like a carabine, if your character climbs up the mountain and you get the fall down tile, you only fall down to the refuge.

name: Moja Slovenija
description:
Moja Slovenija is board game quiz for 2 to 4 players in teams, based on Slovenian TV show. There are 60 cards wit 161 questions about Slovenia. You try to reach inside circle with map of Slovenia and collect all 6 different symbols.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Non-Stop Christmas Shop
description:
Take your basket around the board as you collect a gift for everyone on your list. Can you be first to finish your shopping even as you donate some of those gifts? Whoever is first to collect 1 item for each character on the board wins the game.

A player begins by spinning the spinner and moving their basket the number of spaces indicated. On your turn, if you land on a character. Choose 1 item from the matching colored gifts and place it in your basket. If you land on a character you’ve already gotten a gift for you lose your turn.

There are two Christmas tree spaces on the board. One is a Donate-a-gift, pick one of the items in your basket and return it to the character space you took it from. If you land on the Receive-a-gift tree, you may choose an item from any pile and place it in your basket. Whoever is first to collect 1 item for each character on the board wins the game.

—user summary

name: What's the Word?: The Card Game
description:
Put those little grey cells to the test with What's the Word – a fun connecting game where players have to figure out the word that links four seemingly random pictures! Compete with friends and family to see who can make the connection quickest.

Players are confronted with picture cards featuring 4 linked images and are then required to come up with the single word that links all four! With 50 different picture cards included, What's the Word is great fun for parties and family occasions, and is sure to get everyone playing and having fun.

Easy to pick up and play, the game comes with full game play instructions, and is suitable for all the family. What's the Word is fun, yet challenging

—description from the publisher

name: Toys R Us: The Board Game
description: Toys R Us themed game with the basic mechanics of Monopoly.

name: Trivial Pursuit The Music Master Game: TV Edition
description:
An audio addition to the Trivial Pursuit family. Available in CD and cassette versions.

Features 99 of the best known themes and excerpts in TV history. Includes TV commercials, sports events, news reports, and classic programming theme tunes.

Can be played by itself or with a traditional Trivial Pursuit game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: What Are The Odds? Family Edition
description:
A roulette-style dare game where players take turns challenging each other to dares listed on black cards.

Each round, one player (The Challenger) draws a black card and challenges the rest of the players to do the task on the card. The rest of the players collectively decide what the odds are. On the count of 3, every player throws down one of their number cards. If your number matches The Challenger's, you have to do the challenge.

According to the publisher, this is not an adult game, but good with "friends or family, this game will DEFINITELY spice things up! It doesn't matter who, your family, teens, kids, adult parties, will get wild with this new game."

name: Small Number (ちいさいことはいいことだ )
description:
6種類の数字と+,-,×,÷の4種の計算式を使って
一番小さい数字を作ったプレイヤーが勝利。
ただし、計算式を見られるのは親プレイヤーだけ。
ブラフと推理力が試されるちょっと不思議なお手軽計算ゲームです。
—description from the publisher

Players attempt to make the smallest numbers with two numbers cards and a single calculation card. However, only the dealer knows which calculation will be used. ちいさいことはいいことだ ("Small Number") is a small and easy calculation game that puts bluffing and reasoning to the test.
—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Birdtrails
description:
Birdtrails is a pair of educational race games featuring 140 different kinds of North American birds.

In Game 1, placers roll and spin to make it back to the trailhead with the most impressive collection of birds seen. Special points are awarded for taking time to improve the birds' habitat!

In Game 2, players do not use the spinner, and can only collect birds if they are able to correctly identify them, based on a photo. Random events are reduced, making it more a game of skill and knowledge.

The game comes with 300 beautiful cards, featuring nature photography by Bob Ball. A handful of scoring variants are also included.

Endorsed by the Greater Ozarks Audubon Society.

name: Rafle
description:
One of the players plays the witness (the game is played in several rounds, each will be witness in turn).
The witness chooses from his package an individual who will be the murderer and who has several characteristics (age, face, eyes, hair, etc.)
Each turn, a police player draws a card from a common package that will allow him to ask a question or pass his turn.
By deduction, the luckiest player will discover the murderer by elimination. After each question he will have eliminate options such as "the murderer has brown eyes" or "the murderer is 45 years old", when he's sure of who is the murderer he makes a suggestion, if it's right, he wins.

name: Blondie-spelet
description:
Ordinary roll-and-move game along a 100-space track, with event spaces such as "lose a turn" and "move forward X spaces". There is one space involving player choice, as a risky shortcut can optionally be attempted. The illustrations and descriptions chronicle events in a normal day for Blondie and Dagwood in a largely non-chronological fashion.

There's no publication date, but the logo used is from the 40s or 50s.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: そのリスク、ヘッジしていこう！ (Sono Risuku, Hejji Shiteikou)
description:
In そのリスク、ヘッジしていこう！ (Sono Risuku, Hejji Shiteikou), which roughly translates as "The risk, let's hedge!", the players are risk managers on projects at work and aim to keep them from exploding from too much risk.

The cards in the game are ranked 1-8 in 4 suits. On their turn, a player draws a risk card from the deck and places it into a 3x3 area in front of them. If a player's area is full, their project has failed. However, certain criteria will allow the risks to be mitigated, such as adjacent pairs of numbers or straight flushes. There is some interaction between the players' risk areas.

If the game ends due to a player's project failing, all other players win. If the deck of cards is exhausted, the player with the highest total risk at the time loses.

—user summary
publishers: Narumi Factory (鳴海製作所娯楽部)

name: Beast Dice
description:
Beat Dice is a game where you push your luck to beat your opponent without going bust. It comes with an acrylic stand figure for each player to track health and victories.

Each player starts with 30 health. Each round you start by rolling your base die, numbered 2-7, to determine your base power. If you and your opponent tie you re-roll, but each re-roll adds to base power. Whoever gets the higher roll goes first.

On your turn you can pass or boost. If both players pass, the player with the lower power takes damage equal to difference in power. If you boost you can choose to roll the Light Boost Die or the Heavy Boost Die. Both have a 1/3 chance of Bursting, which means your power goes to 0 and your turn ends. The Light Boost Die has a 2/3 chance of doubling your power, while the Heavy Boost Die has a 1/3 chance of tripling your power and a 1/3 chance of dealing you three damage.

A round is over when one player runs out of health, and the game is played to the best of three rounds.

Can you boost without bursting?

—user summary

name: Lions Go
description:
Lions Go! Help Lion Cubs to reach Home Cave safely
- just a traditional diced board game, but played without dice with fingers. Don´t need to count steps, but vice a versa the target numbers are printed on the board.
- large, rollable gaming mat, suitable to play on the table or ground
- waterproof, easy-care and durable gaming mat
- new way to play, no necessary to throw a dice
- variety of gaming mats and sizes available
- family-friendly, travel friendly
- begin to play within 30 seconds!

The Lion Cubs are travelling home. Get them safely to their Home Cave. There are a lot of dangerous places on the route and the small lions may have to begin their journey from the Start again.
It offers lots of fun for any age players, possibilities to develop new skills in mathematics and tactics, yet is enough simple for any member of family. Youngest players can be helped and conducted a bit to keep on the route.
The package includes:
- Gaming mat, anti-slip bottomed polyester fabric (OEKO Certified)
- 4 x 4 pcs Lion Cubs,lion-shaped wooden pawns (4 sets in different colors)
Packed into Lions Go tube case 77 x ø 8 cm

The idea…
Lions Go board game is played just like a traditional diced board game. But without a dice. Four Lion cubs have to reach their home cave. The route goes around the playground and along the path to the cave. The cubs can be moved one by one or simultaneously along the route. If Lions of two players stop in the same spot, the one who was their earlier, has to come back to the Start (this rule can be skipped also). The first player who gets all four Lion Cubs to the Cave (Finish) is the winner.
The Route…
Start:
Roll open the Lite Lion Games “Lions Go” child-friendly gaming mat. The Players choose the color of Lion Cubs they would like to play. Each Player gets four same color tokens and place them to own Start edge. The initial Player can be chosen in any suitable way, e.g. throwing a dime. Other Players have one extra turn in the end of the game if the initial Players finishes the first.

Moves:
The Player moves the tokens along the route according to the number granted. The number is determined by random amount counted on fingers of two Players at once (e.g. the Players whose turn in coming and previous/next Player): the hand is hidden behind the back or under the table and when released, the amount can be counted on fingers as shown. The gross number is the spot to mover to. If both Players show same number, the token can move one space forward. If both Players show zero, the token can be moved to the random space in-between numbers 1-8 ahead, which is the first on the route.

One Lion Cub in the Spot:
If the other Player has to move their token to the spot, which is already occupied, the previous Player has to move their token to the Start. If there is Players own token in the Spot, the Player has to move other of own four tokens. If it is not possible, no move happens.

Arriving to Finish:
When arriving to the path leading to the Cave, only numbers 1,4 and 7 gives the opportunity to move to the Cave.

And the Winner is:
The game is over when one of the Players gets all the Lion Cubs safely to the Cave. The game can finish as a draw match, if the beginner was the fastest and next player finishes straight after next move.

—description from the publisher

name: Eternal Adversary
description:
Millennia ago, a cataclysmic event tore time apart when the agents of Chaos tried to change history and wipe out mankind. Now countless timelines of earth exist, with the different Ancient Empires of man thriving to this day. Chaos has begun the final battle to destroy all of the timelines of Earth.

A single timeline of Earth must remain for humankind. The ancient warrior societies must band together to fight for existence and Chaos must destroy Earth if they are to have a future in this final timeline..........Which side will you choose?

Eternal Adversary is a 2-5 player game between two teams. Build up your hero as you play, getting tougher, faster, deadlier. Do you fight for Order? Or for Chaos? If you are Order, you can use technology to bolster your hero. Battle for Chaos, and benefit from the random hells.

The two teams perform different tasks. Order heroes seek out and destroy Chaos Rifts, helping to heal the universe. Chaos heroes seek the tokens of disorder and bear them to their dark lord. Both teams advance their respective Doom in this manner.

Ultimately, a team reaches the end of its Doom track, and the final battle begins. Both sides stake everything on one great clash. Have you gained enough experience, or injured the enemy sufficiently? Will you win in the last conflict?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Full fart
description:
A simple racing game where you move your racing cars after the dots on the dice. If you land on a red field then a card is drawn and you do what the card says. It can be both negative and positive events. First in goal after three laps wins.

—user summary

name: Drop the Beat
description:
Time to make those secret dreams of hip hop superstardom a reality with this hysterical game of raps and rhymes!

Players take turns picking up topic cards to rap about- anything from birthdays or bodybuilders to Santa or spaceships- and a Worrrd Card containing a random word they can include in their rap to win an extra bonus point.

With thirty seconds on the clock, it's time to grab the mic and let the beat flow. Be warned though! The other players can buzz the rapper out for pausing too long, getting tongue-tied or for messing up their rhymes.

—description from the publisher

name: Patient Zero
description:
Lead the people of one of the four towns in a post-apocalyptic world. Complete secret objectives and compete against other players, for example find the Patient Zero, take him to the Research Center and save the world while making sure your citizens don't get infected and turn Zombie. Or intentionally get some of your people infected and direct a zombie herd to your opponents’ towns to disrupt their plans.

In this roll and move game there are 5 secret missions that are given out randomly among the 2 - 4 players. Each player will try and accomplish their mission to win all the while trying to prevent being turned into a zombie.

THE MECHANICS: a turn consists of 3-Steps: Produce (rolling a pair of dice), Move (up to 3 movements of 1 hex (w/an exception of the type of piece being moved), and Attack (either zombies in the area or other players). These actions must be done in this order. UNLESS a 7 is rolled, then infection spreads fast and pieces on the board, depending on their location, might turn into zombies and players lose control of their pieces in this event. These mechanics will be repeated until a player accomplishes their secret mission or all players have turned into zombies at which point everyone loses.

THE AREA BOARD: A 12 X 12 hexagonal grid with each hexagonal space representing different topographies and symbols that provide provide benefits or introduce restrictions. The board is also marked with grid areas designating areas of cities and buildings.

GAME PLAY: All of the areas and hexagonal spaces of the board are utilized in conjunction with the secret missions. Upon roll of the dice, the production phase begins and players decide on their tactics according to the secret mission they were given at the start of the game.

ATTACKS: Attacks are optional and are resolved by dice role. Depending on the number of units (maximum of three), dice are rolled and an attacking roll of 4, 5 or 6 is considered a hit while a 6 rolled by the defender is considered a successful defense with the defender winning any ties.

THE GOAL: Avoid being annihilated by other players or turned into a zombie and be the first to complete your secret mission.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Dragonfire: Adventures – Insanity in the Abyss
description:
Adventure Expansion to Dragonfire
Insanity in the Abyss is a Dragonfire Adventure Pack containing new character shields, market cards, encounter decks, adventures, and magic items.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: Dragonfire: Adventures – Into the Abyss
description:
Adventure Expansion to Dragonfire
Into the Abyss is a Dragonfire Adventure Pack containing new character shields, market cards, encounter decks, adventures, and magic items.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: Dragonfire: Adventures – Undermountain Madness
description:
Adventure Expansion to Dragonfire
Undermountain Madness is a Dragonfire Adventure Pack containing new character shields, market cards, encounter decks, adventures, and magic items.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: Dragonfire: Campaign – Waterdeep
description:
Campaign Expansion to Dragonfire
Waterdeep is Dragonfire Campaign Box containing new character shields, market cards, encounter decks, adventures, and magic items.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: Knight Rider
description:
A Knight Rider themed board game, made in Greece. It can be played from to 2 to 4 players. There is no dice, instead there is a wheel with numbers.

Every player in his turn spins the wheel, and moves in the board the exact spaces, as the number you have in the wheel. Some spaces on the board have different colours. When you reach them, you can lose a round (orange colour), go back 3 spaces (red colour) or move forward 5 spaces (green colour). There are also some other spaces, who have some orders written upon them. When you reach them you must follow the orders.

The winner is the first player, who reaches the end point.

—user summary

name: Landskapsspelet
description:
This is one of several themed Go Fish/Quartet variants published by K. Hjelm Förlag around the 2000s. The subject is the 25 Swedish provinces, each set of four cards consisting of: one showing the province on a map of Sweden, also listing significant towns, lakes and rivers; one showing the coat of arms; one showing the province animal; and one showing the province plant. A special bonus card shows the coat of arms of Stockholm.

Each player gets an initial hand of seven cards. Gameplay proceeds as normal for Go Fish, with players demanding cards from each other and drawing from the talon, setting any completed sets aside. Bonus points are given for scoring many sets from any of the three major regional divisions, and for drawing the Stockholm card.

There is no maximum number of players stated, but the deck size will support a deal to 14 players.

—user summary

name: Cirkus i Stan
description:
Each player has 4 pieces and competes to take them fasters through the cirkus. Anyone who has reached the manege in the middle first with all of their pieces wins.

The game is similar with Ludo. In ten places along the course, things happen that the player must follow, such as an extra throw.

—description from the publisher

name: Hikari Kagayaku Takanawa Unlimited Eternal Golden Greatest Super Strong Gateway (Kashou)
description:
This is a game about thinking up a name for a new station on the Yamanote train line in Tokyo. Each turn you add a word to the station name, and the first person to fail to say the name in one breath (with one retry) loses.

Inspired by the name of the "Takanawa Gateway" station announced in 2019.

新駅名を募集するというテーマで、200種類の単語の書いてあるカードを寿限無式につなげ、できるだけ長い名前の駅名を完成させる大喜利ゲーム。ルールはただ一つ、「駅名は、一息で読めること」。プレイヤー全員で一つの駅名を作っていくシステムで、プレイヤーは１回の手番に１枚ずつワードカードを繋げてその駅名を二回一息で読む。一息で読めず失敗した場合、直前のプレイヤーが紡いだ駅名が採用となり採用者が勝利する。

—user summary

name: Kiss My Bass
description:
This fish doesn’t shy away from us humans! He wants to be touched, tapped, squeezed and kissed…and if you don’t give him attention quickly enough, he’s sure to razz you! The bass isn’t nice or sweet, and eventually he’ll fart on someone…and that means you lose! It’s a funny game or novelty gift! The talking fish includes batteries and features seven electronic touch points.

—description from the publisher

name: Santa's Magic Christmas Game
description:
Christmas is coming so join in the fun with Santa's Magic Christmas. The only game to play on Christmas eve. It's fun for all the family
Become one of Santa's Reindeer and join in the race around Santa's Grotto where his helpers are making Christmas presents.
But beware of Santa squares or else you may end up singing Jingle bells or telling a bad joke or worse- listening to someone else telling a joke

—description from the back of the box

name: Kes? Mida? Kus?
description:
Kes? Mida? Kus? ("Who? What? Where?") is board game about story telling. Each round one player is story teller. He chooses charakter from first card, activity from second card and location from third card and try to put the words to his/her story. If sand timer runs out other players must guess the 3 words from the story teller´s cards and earn points if guessed correctly. Story tellers earn points if nobody guesses the words. If every player has been story teller once the game ends and the winner is the player with the most points.

—user summary

name: Little Island Gift Shops
description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

In Little Island Gift Shops, each player assumes the role of a shop owner which sells ocean treasures to the passer by, but is also part of the local community trying to thrive. In this cooperative game, players dive for goods and try to put the best possible combinations of goods in all shops, to get the best score possible for everyone. The lowest scoring shop determines the score for the group. Little Island Gift Shops is a set collection game at its core.

On your turn:

Decide how many hours you will dive,
Roll the corresponding dice: the longer you take, the more dice you roll;
Determine which goods you find,
Then either pay the goods as tribute to the ocean to gain powers, put them in your shop for sale, or gift them to your fellow shop owners.
To be successful in Little Island, you will have to both chase your own high score, but also care for the others at the table.

Little Island Gift Shops requires a four-sided die, a six-sided die, an eight-sided die, and a ten-sided die. Components include one player sheet per player, and one communal player aide.

—description from the publisher

name: Staple, Gun
description:
Staple, Gun is a 4-6 player free-for-all party card game.

In the far-off future of 2060, a super-powered crime lord Badass Harry rules the world with a tyrannical corporate grip.

Meanwhile back in 2020, an inept office worker Hapless Harry has just found himself in the midst of a battle between assassins, all who want to see him dead and take the future crime lord spot for themselves...

The goal of Staple, Gun is to find and kill Hapless Harry. Players draw and play 1 card each turn, from three different factions; Office who find Harry, Assassins who kill Harry, and Chaos who want to see the world burn

If player's fail to kill Hapless Harry before the deck runs out, then they all enter a final brawl to determine the winner and savior of the future.

—description from the publisher

name: Icy Dice
description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

Icy Dice is a semi-cooperative worker placement and route building game: build sleds, harvest food, and brave the treacherous journey across a frozen ocean of acid, in order to trade food for valuable medicine. Beware, the temperature is on the rise, which could spell doom!

On your turn:

Roll the dice and assign the results to
Harvest the food that grows so well in your village,
Build a sled sturdy enough to carry drivers and goods across the ice,
Or drive sleds to make trades and return with the goods!
Plan your route carefully, because you can only pass over the ice so many times. Will you have enough space for the goods on the return trip, or will you leave a worker behind to rest? In any case, time is of the essence as the ice melts and jeopardizes your sleds.

Icy Dice requires six standard six-sided dice at minimum, but we recommend two sets of six standard six-sided dice, with each set in a different color. Components include one player sheet per player, and a shared sheet per game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Print & Play, Racing, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Line Drawing, Map Reduction, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: Jogo (das coisas que fiz na) Vida
description: Ideal for getting to know your group better, it is a game of questions, answers, and bets to reveal funny situations in life. Each card has a different situation, and everyone must vote for how many players in the wheel they believe have already made the situation for the card of the round. Ex: I already rang the bell and ran out. Hopefully someone will be ashamed.

name: Sprichbilder
description:
A collection of games for 2-10 outspoken players, aged 10 years and upward, created by Karin Herrmann and Otmar Bettscheider.
Central to these games are the colloquialisms, proverbs and familiar quotations, along with expressions and collocations, which we use in the course of a normal day. The 72 picture cards contain a multitude of pointers to these. The purpose of the game is to recognize the visual stimuli and make sayings out of them.
The box contains four very different games which are based on this simple principle. Depending on which game you choose, one of the following skills will be primarily required: imagination, wit, memory or speed. And if you can add a sense of humour to the game, then you will always be in amongst the winners, whatever your final score!

—description from the publisher

name: Azzelij (Second Edition)
description:
The arabic word "Azzelij" means "small polished stone" and is known as the historical origin of the world "Tile".

In Azzelij, two to four players compete to build a beautiful tile panel, trying to get more points with your own colors.

Each player have 12 tile pieces at their stock pile that are used do form circle patterns, like an artist trying to get the best part of the pannel! At first round, each player get 3 tiles from their pile and than draw one each subsequent round, maintaining 3 options to play at almost all time. In your turn, you must place one tile (considering that you cant extend the panel mor than 7x7 tiles away) and optionally rotate 90º clockwise another placed tile (only if the rotated tile is not forming a circle pattern yet). The turns goes until the 7x7 panel is created.

You score one point creating circle patterns with absolute majority of your colour and 3 points if the circle created has only your color. You also score bonus points (1 for each circle) if the scored circle is created only by your pieces.

Ar fisrt glance, Azzelij seems to be a simple tile placement, but as the game flows players faces lots of hard decisions to make: May I get a point or avoid another player to get a better position? May I close the 7 piece limit to stop opponents to grow at one edge or stay creating my pattern? May I risk to get a full-colored circle of mine or get two or more majority-only circle points?

As the game flows, the decisions ar harder to take and the panel gets its 7x7 piece formation, that increases the difficulty and fun!

---

The second edition incorporates an expansion that was formerly only available as a print & play. This expansion introduces task cards with patterns. Placing your tiles in a way that they form these patterns will score extra points.

name: Fate of the Elder Gods: Cerulean Tendril
description:
Single card promo sponsored by Unpub.
Allows you to roll one die and apply an effect based on the result.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Spyfest: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
description:
Three brand-new cards for use in the upcoming game SpyCon!

Includes: Kong, Hat, and a rules card.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Modular Board, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: SkirmishCampaigns: Poland '39 – The Black Brigade
description:
Poland '39-The Black Brigade
On September 1, 1939 the German army invaded Poland and started the greatest war the earth had ever seen. Contrary to popular myth, the Polish army fought with determination and skill. Poland managed to hold out nearly as long against Germany as France and Britain did a year later.

This book traces the saga of the brave Polish 10th Mechanized Division, the "Black Brigade" from the opening days of invasion to the fall of Poland.

Elements of the intrepid Black Brigade eventually withdrew from Poland and formed the nucleous of the Polish 1st Armored Division that would in 1944 close the Falaise Gap and play a key role in the capture of thousands of German troops.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the Polish Campaign of 1939.

Includes:

10 Scenarios,
4 Campaigns.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: All About Terre Haute Indiana
description:
Limited Edition promotional board game from 1982 about the city of Terre Haute.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list.
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Terre Haute, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About Asheville
description:
Limited Edition promotional board game from 1982 about the city of Asheville, NC.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list.
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Asheville, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About Nashville Tennessee
description:
Limited Edition promotional board game from 1982 about the city of Nashville.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list.
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Nashville, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Memorizzers
description:
New observation game which use the classic board game and App.
Different categories and levels of difficult depending on the age of the players. All can play with the same options to win.
The App shows one picture during few seconds, you should remember all the details and answer the question of the app.
Win who arrives first at the end of the board answering the questions of the app.

name: Airline Jet Pilots Game
description:
"Educational, entertaining and challenging" - a roll of two dice each turn determines if your jet plane moves to one of 54 cities on the map of the United States or remains idle due to a mishap!

Up to four players use their flight schedules and dice to determine where they will fly and therefore how many miles they can log each turn. A large map assists with the colorful airplane placement for each player on their turn each round.

A designated "flight captain pilot" is a player as well but is also nominally in charge of each game - their extra duties include controlling the game, assisting with the flight milage sheets, map and ensuring correct logging of milage by all players as well as assessing penalties for logging false data. They also determine at the start of the game how many rounds the game will comprise - 4, 6, 8, 10, etc.

Player rolls may result in no milage for a pilot's turn due to fog, illness, hijackings, FAA inspections and more, as described on their individual flight schedule. On the last round after everyone has had their turn, the pilot with the most logged miles wins the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Player Elimination, Player Judge, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Pixel Code
description:
Youngil was an ordinary student who enjoyed playing computer games. One day, he was trapped in cyberspace and can only escape by making binary numbers.

Roll the dice and flip your personal binary numbers cards by the number shown on the dice. If you can match the decimal numbers in the centre of the board then collect the matched cards. Each card is worth a point, plus any bonus points shown. At the end of the game, flip your score cards over and see if you can match a bonus pattern for extra points.

name: Amfitryon
description:
A trivia game about food, wine and etiquette.

The gameplay is similar to Trivial Pursuit, you roll a die to move, and pick up question cards. From the card, you're posed an easy (A) or difficult (B) question in one of three categories (food, wine or etiquette). Answer the question correctly, and you get to roll the die and move again.

When landing on a corner tile, you'll need to answer both the A and the B questions on the card correctly. If you do, you'll earn a special "diploma card". The first person to get three diploma cards wins the game.

name: Franklin and Ghost: Bad Guy Brawl
description:
Franklin, Ghost and Delilah are coming back at ya in a brand new card game full of chaos, backstabbing, bluffing, and of course... Mayhem.

You and up to 5 friends are helping your favorite heroes take on hordes of bad guys. Every round you'll be fighting off aliens, robots, rednecks and of course some big bads all while competing to see who can take down the most of them. Be careful though if you take on too many you're going down. Call in help from Franklin Ghost and Delilah for special effects and powers!

You are dueling symbiotes trying to rack up the most impressive kill combos without biting off more than they can chew and getting killed. You need to lock in the highest scoring hand you can without busting. Points are scored for pairs of cards and runs at least three cards long. You bust if you draw 3-of-a-kind (they were overwhelmed by a group of the same type of enemy). Gameplay begins with all players being dealt a hand of 3 cards. On your turn you first draw a card from the deck and can then choose to lock your hand in by placing their cards face down on the table. You also have action tokens that let you do all sorts of things to help yourself and trip up the other players.

It’s a quick push your luck card game with enough special powers to keep things fresh.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Skal du være fræk!?
description:
Combine cards in the funniest way to make up new words, and use these to win the card reader's favor. For example by naming his or her autobiography, butt or the erotic short story that the card reader wrote as a teenager.

A crazy, cheeky and maybe a little naughty pun-game where you pull both compliments and insults out of the hat.

A hilarious game that combines naughty humor and creative word-puzzling. Perfect for a party or hanging out with friends.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Entkommen!: Die geheime Bibliothek
description:
Locked up in the secret library.
A series of puzzles.
A locked door without a key.
60 minutes.
Can you "ESCAPE"?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: Svenska konungar och drottningar
description:
This game has a basic Go Fish gameplay but with changes to set make-up, collection and scoring. Each card features a king, queen or queen consort of Sweden, most of them grouped into royal houses. Sets are collected as singles where applicable, complete houses, or "families" (partial houses). If a family has been collected, remaining cards from that house can be freely collected as "bonus cards" for lesser points, but whichever other conditions apply, a king must be collected along with their consort or consorts. Play continues as in regular Go Fish until the draw deck is empty and all cards have been claimed, at which time points are counted up from singles, houses, families and bonus cards to find the winner.

—user summary

name: Pensilly
description:
Have you ever tried to draw on a rumbling train or draw a maze puzzle on a spin washing machine? No??? No wonder, since drawing in calm conditions on a secure basis may be best. And then comes this rounded giant pencil that keeps squirming, vibrating. With this, try to put together a normal figure. It’s very funny when you can’t draw a simple picture like an apple because of the constant squirming-twitching of your drawing tool. And then we didn’t even talk about the more complicated images. We tried and laughed a lot. A real good party game for kids, but also a good party for adults.
Adult companies can also undertake to draw more complex diagrams. The set includes 2 felt-tip pens, which can be replaced with tools of the same size. It can be played as a team game, like activity.

name: Count Up
description:
Count Up is a card game from Japan. Players draw from a deck and play cards from their hand face-up to a central stack, accumulating the total as they go. If a player can exactly hit a target, 11, 22, 33 and so on, the other players take penalty chips.

Instead of a number card, a player can place an action card, which trigger simple effects. Players fight a duel with hand cards, exchange cards, change direction, play two cards, play a wild card 1-3 and so on.

The game ends when a player takes the total over 100, and hand cards force more penalties. The player with the fewest penalty chips at the end is the winner.

The action cards have a simple English keyword and graphics, so the game is playable by anyone who can count.
user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Take That

name: 九龙城寨 (The City of Darkness)
description:
City of Darkness(Chinese name:九龙城寨/九龍城寨,means Kowloon walled city) is a board game adapted from the comic of the same name.
Players play the roles in the comics and use their unique decks to fight for territory in Kowloon Walled City.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: Phineas and Ferb Action Game
description:
A 2-in-1 card game based on the popular animated series.

Action Game:
A shedding game in which it's vital to plan ahead. Make good use of the special power cards, and be the first to play your last card (together with a quip from the show), and you're the winner!

Happy Families
Reunite separated characters by trying to steal them from your opponents in a Go Fish-style family card game. Collect the most sets to be victorious.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deduction, Lose a Turn, Set Collection

name: Bilda regering
description:
Bilda regering ("Forming a government") is a game that wants to show how the work is done in the government and parliament in a country where the people can have their say in free elections. Wants to provide a basic understanding of how democracy works.

Each player represents each of the parties that existed in the Swedish parliament during the seventies. In turn, you roll a dice and walk so many steps along the playing field. After that, you do what is written on the box you have landed on. It may be, for example, that you may place a proposal in one of the Riksdag's committees and mark the relevant sectors of society with a marker, or move the proposals from the committees to the Riksdag's chamber pending a vote that occurs when someone lands on a box marked with a vote.

As soon as there are markers in all sectors of society on the opposition part of the playing field, a government can be formed. The party that has the most markers in the sectors of society is given the task of trying to form a majority government or minority government together with another party.

Every three years there is an election to the Riksdag (represented by the fastest player having reached the start after three laps). Which may lead to the formation of a new government depending on the conditions of the markers in the sectors of society.

Before the game, the player decides how the winner will be chosen. It can, for example, be the party that succeeds in pushing through the most proposals in the Riksdag, the party that after a certain number of rounds has the most points or the party that has managed to stay in government for the longest time.

name: Circino: le Chasseur de Trésors – Destination Seine-et-Marne
description:
Circino A Treasure Hunt in Seine-et-Marne

From Meaux to Fontainebleau, via Chelles, Provins, Melun etc ... 36 municipalities of the "77" department will occupy a central and predominant spot in the game.

Goal of the game
The players select 8 "Objective" cards (= 8 communes) and they collect the 8 "Objective" pellets corresponding to these 8 cards. They shuffle them face down then place them on the different chests on the game board.

Each player then collects at random or he chooses 2 "Objective" cards among the 8 selected.

The goal of the game will consist in finding the 2 “Objective” pellets corresponding to his 2 cards then in bringing them back the 1st to Circino in the center of the board ... with as only weapons the dice and his sense of adventure!

In their quest, players will not be alone and can count on the help of members of the Circino family through Bonus Cards.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mi Butto... O Non Mi Butto...
description: Mi Butto... O Non Mi Butto is a card game in which players are trying to create sets of cards that contains: one sky card, one plane card and one paratrooper card. When a set is complete you can add a "landing" card to score points. Other players can try to block your sets using their cards. At the end of the game, the player with the most points, wins.

name: Yoga 4 Kids: In the Rainforest
description:
Meet Yoga, Oscar, Grace, and Alex and journey with them through the rain forest. They will teach you ways to bend, stretch, and twist your body and brain. You will grow taller and leaner, but never meaner. Did you know that yoga breathing techniques have proven to increase test scores in school age children 84%? Kids learn best through play. With 52 cards (13 sets of 4) you'll have fun learning yoga and card games galore!

Yoga 4 Kids: In the Rainforest comes with rules for 5 games: In the Rainforest, Yoga 4 Kids, Yoga Memory, Old Maid Yoga Style, and Go Yoga.

—user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Matching, Melding and Splaying, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monster's Castle
description:
In "The Monster's Castle", players (monsters) race to be the first to arrive at the end of the gameboard track and "rent" the last remaining castle on the block. But can they avoid the traps and the double traps as they each race to reach their new home?

A colorful but simple spin and move game, this is one of five similar titles from Warren publications (best known for publishing the Creepy, Eerie and Vampirella magazines of the mid 70's).

This game appeared in the "Famous Monsters of Filmland" magazine issue #106 (April 1974) and was also offered as part of a separate 5 game mail-order bundle (#2661 for $2.50) from Warren magazines - the bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle, all of which were printed from '73 to '74 on thin glossy magazine cover stock paper. Unlike the other four games which were credited to Bill DuBay, this one is credited to W.R. Mohalley.

name: World Geo Cards
description:
Five card games in one that make geography fun! 50 Jumbo-sized (4" x 6") cards represent the world's largest countries and include capitals, population, and land area. In addition, game instructions are included for five different easy-to-learn games for 1-4 players.

—user summary

name: Cul-de-Sac
description: Players take turns placing tiles to connect roads. Straight edge must connect with straight edge and curved edge must connect with curved edge. If a player cannot connect a tile's straight edge to another that is already in play, he/she may use a bridge to connect to a curved edge. The player with the least tiles when no further moves can be made is the winner.

name: Tombola degli animali
description:
A simple and fun bingo to get to know the animals and contextualise them in their environment. The kit includes six environment cards and thirty-six animals to be placed in the corresponding spaces.
We can decide to use the material to organise a bingo, or to present the individual animals as flashcards to be placed in the corresponding environment. In this case, the recognition of the animals is contextualised in the environment in which the animal lives. This allows the child to place the learning in a meaningful context.

THE BINGO
To play the game, all that is needed is to distribute an environment board to each player and to place the animals covered on the playing surface. In turn, the children discover an animal. If the discovered animal is present in their board, they take it and place it in the corresponding space, otherwise they place it covered on the table. The winner is whoever is first to complete their environment board with all six animals.

DISCOVERING ANIMALS AND ENVIRONMENTS
To make the experience richer, the material in the pack can also be used in an unstructured way, i.e. by presenting the cards to the children as if they were flashcards.

name: How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World Path Game
description:
From the How to Train Your Dragon: Hidden World movie. Spin to move along the path and collect Dragon Tokens along the way. But watch out for the Dragon Catchers! The player with the most Tokens at the end of the path is the winner.

Includes: 4 character movers, 4 character stands, 1 light fury token, 1 spinner, 1 gameboard, 50 dragon tokens.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Vilket hundkaos
description: One hundred dogs are on the run and you want to gather as many as possible in your kennel. Why is the dog's nose cold? Yes, answer that and other fun questions about dogs. Luck with the dice and good memory means that you can paw forward with Anders Bagge on the wonderfully mischievous playing field. A fun and varied game that is filled to the brim with dogs.

name: KFC's Actiespel
description:
This game is closely related to KFC's Assano.
Just like KFC's Assano, this Bigger version is a promotional game.

The box contains the same cards as KFC's Assano, but expands them with the following:

This version has a few extra cards compared to the Multi-Lingual version, namely:

7 Cards with number 6-9, plus 1 "draw-1" card, in the color yellow.
7 Cards with number 6-9, plus 1 "draw-1" card, in the color blue.
7 Cards with number 6-9, plus 1 "draw-1" card, in the color green.
7 Cards with number 6-9, plus 1 "draw-1" card, in the color red.


As this is a Dutch only version, the rules are only in Dutch, but on two cards instead of one.

Gameplay and rules are basically the same KFC's Assano.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Piraten Duel
description: In a journey over land and sea pirates are in a quest for the treasure map. They have to duel other pirates to get it. Every player tries to make smart use of their cards to get to the treasure first.

name: Shoeby Card Game
description:
The game contains cards with numbers and 'actions' printed on them, in several colors plus a few jokers.

This game is closely related to Crazy Eights, UNO, KFC's Assano and KFC's Actiespel.
General game-play and basic rules are the same those games, the take-that cards might be different from specific versions of those games.

The purpose of the game is to get rid of your own hand cards first. To do this, when it's your turn, you try to match on of your own cards with the color or symbol of the last played card. Jokers are always valid to play, if you have them. If you can't match, you draw a card from a shared draw pile. If you can match that card, you can instantly play it.

The game-box contains 36 card, divided as follows:

3 Cards with the rules in Dutch.
9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color yellow.
9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color blue.
9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color green.
9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color red.
4 Colorless Cards with additional actions, 2 "take-4" cards, 3 "change color" card.


This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the Shoeby clothes stores.

—user summary

name: ペンデュラム・ドールズ (Pendulum Dolls)
description:
ペンデュラム・ドールズ (Pendulum Dolls) is a combative card game from Japan, sent in a dystopian fantasy world. Players are building up their Dolls to fight their way to freedom.

After the Great War, you decide to escape the crumbling underground city and reach the surface that you have yet to see. By exploring the underground city and strengthening the Pendulum Dolls that will become your partners, with your completed doll, you fight a decisive battle.

Pendulum Dolls has two modes of play, which you can choose from:

Story mode (for 1 or 2 players): Co-operative play
Players work together to complete the game. Strengthen your Pendulum Doll, defeat Enemy Dolls and reach the surface.

Duel mode (for 2-4 players): Competitive play
Players strengthen their own Pendulum Doll and defeat all other players' Pendulum Doll to prove that their own Pendulum Doll is the best.

大戦の後、崩壊していく地下都市を脱出すると決めたあなたは、この地下都市を探索して、パートナーとなるペンデュラムドールを強化し、完成したドールと共に決戦に挑み、まだ見ぬ地上を目指します。
ペンデュラム・ドールズには二つのモードがあり、どちらかを選んで遊ぶことができます。

・ストーリーモード（1～2人用）：協力プレイ
プレイヤーは協力して、ゲームクリアを目指します。自分のペンデュラムドールを強化し、エネミードールを撃破し、地上を目指します。

・デュエルモード（2～4人用）：対戦プレイ
プレイヤーは自分のペンデュラムドールを強化し、他のプレイヤーのペンデュラムドールを全て戦闘不能にし、自身のペンデュラムドールが最優であることを証明します。
user summary
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Disney's Sport Goofy Tiddly Wink Tournament of Games
description:
A "Tiddly Wink Tournament of Games", Disney's Sport Goofy Games features six different sports to play with friends and family. Included sports are soccer, basketball, baseball, golf, shuffleboard, and tennis.

In soccer, players drop 5 tiddly winks of their color randomly on their half of the field and take turns trying to use their Goofy figure base to shoot all 5 winks into their opponent's goal first.

In basketball, players try to shoot all 5 winks in the basket first in a h-o-r-s-e style game shooting a wink from each of the marked areas around the court.

In baseball, players take turns flipping winks across the diamond from home plate trying to land in hits and runs while not causing any fouls or outs. The player with the highest number wins.

In Golf, players take turns flipping winks from the tee towards a number of golf holes on a golf course printed sheet. The player with the lowest number wins.

In Shuffleboard, players take turns flipping their winks towards the scoring pyramid trying to rack up points without hitting the minus 10 zone. the player with the highest number wins.

Finally in tennis, players take turns flipping a wink over the cardboard net trying to force their opponent to miss the net or shoot out of bounds.

—user summary

name: SwitchBack
description:
Players' teams consist of four hikers, who all start on the corresponding color base camp at the bottom of the mountain.
On a turn, the player rolls two dice, and may move either one or two of their hikers in a clockwise direction on the game board. Upon reaching a trail marker of their own color, the hiker climbs a level towards the mountain summit.

Special movements, called Bump, Switch, and Conditional Switch, can quickly change the game. "Bumping" allows you to knock rival's hiker down a level, and "switching" allows you to trade your hiker's place with an opponent's hiker's place.

Be the first team to get all four hikers to the summit to win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Sesamstraat Kids Bingo
description:
The boards show pictures from Sesame Street or the five letters of the word BINGO in a 5 x 5 grid. Two dice are rolled to determine the field. The first person to cover five pictures horizontally, vertically or diagonally is the winner.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sprengstoff Vorsicht!
description:
From the powder room of the author of Zündstoff. 312 brand new questions about everyday life, career, sex, friends, family, psychoanalysis and philosophy. Each player will ask one of the 6 questions to the other players and a voting system allow to give points for each answer.

—user summay

name: Vocabulary Building
description:
Players try to give correct definitions to words in order to advance their spaceship back to Earth. Spaces either require a player to pick Intergalactic cards or Earth cards, which require them to either advance on the board or define a word. The first player to have left Earth, visited Granada and returned to Earth (by exact count) is the winner.

—user summary

name: Muerte Subita
description:
If you like to have fun with card games, as easy to learn as UNO, you will love this game, it is very easy and fun.

Each player starts with 5 lives (sets). Every turn, the player has to put a card on the center trying not to pass 21. Players count the numbers on their cards and, if they are more than 21, you lose one of your 5 sets. If a player loses all 5 sets (lives), they are eliminated from the game. The winner is the last player in the game.

Cards have a Tennis theme.

name: Speak Out: Fun With Food
description:
Put in your mouthpiece and read the wacky phrases!

This expansion includes one new mousepiece and 72 additional cards all about fun with food.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Cloud of Witnesses: Bible Character Card Game
description:
The object of the game is to match quotations to the person from the Bible, on character cards, the first player to match all of their character cards is the winner.

Each player starts with seven character cards, on their turn, they draw a quote card and (if they can) they play the appropriate character card from their hand, if they are wrong they draw a new character card.

The game ends when one player has played all of their character cards, and that player is the winner.

name: Do You Know Me? Expansion Pack
description: It’s about to get personal with the Do You Know Me? Expansion Pack! Find out how well you really know your friends with 180 new hilarious and oh-no-you-didn't questions to add to the Do You Know Me? Core game.

name: Snyder-opoly
description:
How do you make a game about the great city of Snyder, Texas?

While it's impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Snyder we could into this box. It's full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, rich history, and of course... Towle Memorial Park - a little something for everyone! Looking for a fun way to experience Snyder?

Here's a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite SNYDER properties, increase your rent by collection City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax, and the IRS and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

Get your game on!

Choose your token and advance to Go Snyder! You may soon be the Mayor... or out of the game for drinking too many Chocolate Shakes from the Sweet Shop!

This is Snyder... and it's your roll!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Rondel, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Oganika: Geometria
description: An extension pack of 36 stand alone designs which compliment the initial set of Oganika puzzles contained within the main Oganika box. Each geometric design consists of 36 tiles meaning that puzzlers must implement the whole tile set in order to solve.
publishers: Blood Moon Games Ltd, NewRoads Gaming

name: Shaking Sunflower
description: The game consist of a shaking sunflower that is dancing during the game to make the players' task more difficult. Each player has their own set of marbles which they shall place on the sunflower's flowers. The first player to place all their marbles is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Real-time

name: Flippity Frog
description:
First player to return 4 Froglets safely home wins!

Mummy frog must successfully carry her Froglets on her back across the pond, leaping from lilypad to lilypad. Each lilypad is turned over to reveal the next step mummy frog can take.

If you come across Big Bad Fish it’s the end of your go! Or, take a Super Jump home!

Mummy frog must flip over four lilypads to safely cross the pond!

—description from the publisher

name: Gran Chef
description:
Are you ready to become a Gran Chef? The objective is to be able to make the recipes that the game proposes, using money to buy food in the different stores that the route of the board has and buy only the exact amounts of each ingredient. This game invites you to train mathematical operations at two possible levels of difficulty. Awarded for "Let's Play Together" in the inclusive game design contest.

The objective of the game is to first get all the food that your recipe needs. You can play two levels: on the first level, the missions propose you to get food according to its value (additions and substractions); on the second level, the weight of each food is also added (multiplications and divisions).

On each turn, the player will throw the dice. When they fall in a store, they can buy everything they need for their recipe. Calculations should be done by the player, for younger kids there is a multiplication table to help. Each lap on the board, the player earns $50. The player who buys everything needed for their recipe, wins.

name: Pop-A-Tops: Bake-A-Cake
description:
Pop the top to “roll” the dice! Race to collect and match the cake topping card to build your cupcake!

Assemble your cupcake in order by colour, case, cake, icing and cherry. The case colour determines the cupcake you make. Keep an eye out for your colour! If you roll the ‘swap’ arrows, you can swap cakes with the opponent of your choice.

If you roll the Cake Monster’s mouth your cake is guzzled and its back to the start! The player who creates the perfect cupcake first wins!

— description from the publisher

On a player's turn they roll the dice which show a shape and a color of the part of the cake. Immediately each player has to grab the corresponding tile. The colors of the tiles are hidden because the tiles lay face down, so at first no one knows which is correct. But during the game players can memorize which tiles lay where. The dice also show two special effect, one of each orders the active player to return particular piece, while another allow players to steal from others. The first player to collect 3 different pieces of a cupcake wins the game.

— user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Real-Time, Set Collection, Speed Matching, Take That

name: The Diver's Luck
description:
Two players compete to reach 100 on opposing but not completely identical tracks. The theme of the game is deep-sea diving with a beautiful and apparently quite large illustrated board. The visual interest is much of the natural appeal of the game, which is a simple roll-and-move race.

It's a nearly straight drop for the first 25 to 30 spaces on either side. Landing on circled spaces, which become more frequent from that point on, send a player back three spaces. There are a couple of obvious "log jam" areas on either side where players may find themselves circling for several turns.

The game is undated but likely comes from 1910–1920. Brian Love's "Play the Game" (1978) suggests one player is red and one is yellow (matching the tracks on the board), but we do not know if this is supported by the original designers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jeździectwo: konkurs skoków przez przeszkody
description:
The rules of the game are similar to a horse jumping competition.

A player has to go trougth the course without single mistakes. He is allowed to roll a dice 17 times during a game. Player gets 1 penalty point when he throws a dice over that limit (the norm of time). Moreover, when a player places his horse (pawn) on the obstacle he gets penalty points too. The person with the lowest number of penalty points wins.

—user summary
publishers: Fundacja dla Dzieci Chorych na Białaczkę i Choroby Nowotworowe "Krwinka"

name: Dipsticks: Names
description: This is clearly intended as an implementation of Charades. There are no rules supplied with this "game" other than the package blurb: "Dip in, pick a stick and have a laugh! Describe famous names for your friends and family to guess."

name: Hero's Journey: Original
description:
Hero's Journey is a fully cooperative, card-based, adventure game with rogue-like elements to be enjoyed solo or with up to 5 of your closest friends. Experience adventure with 12 unique Heroes as you navigate through dozens of guided Encounters with dangerous Monsters, intriguing Scenarios, and mesmerizing Locations; all with plenty of Loot and ever-changing Qualities to ultimately face the deadly Boss waiting at the end of the Round. No session is quite the same with dynamic, journey-altering gameplay and creative Quests. There's no time to waste, gather your party and embark on your own Hero's Journey!

The game is played with cards, dice, and tokens in a series of Rounds with a set number of Encounters in each and concluded with a Boss fight. Each player takes a turn as the Revealer, to flip an Encounter card face up to resolve combat with a Monster, make decisions in a Scenario, or feel the effects of a new Location. Play then continues with a new Revealer each Encounter until ultimately facing a Boss at the end of the Round.

Throughout the game, Qualities and Loot will play a huge part in the success or failure of the Party's journey. There are intangible Qualities that provide new active Abilities or passive Positive/Negative Traits with lingering effects. Additionally, there are physical Loot objects with powerful one-time or on-going effects. Players can never be too comfortable with their load-outs as these elements of the game are constantly changing.

This is a new take on the well-loved fantasy RPG genre allowing for solo or group play with up to six players who may all enjoy the experience simultaneously.
