The self-narrating story provides an opportunity for everyone to be a part without a game master or hours of preparation. The design allows for simple set-up and a low learning curve including jump-in-jump-out play without compromising on the amount of depth the experience provides. With 148 cards in the base deck and character perma-death, you'll never play the same adventure twice thanks to the well-thought out rogue-like mechanics.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Middara: Kickstarter Cross-Promotion Pack
description:
We promised y'all last year we’d be providing any resin kits we make in plastic. This pack includes all ten of the miniatures we made in Resin from our last Kickstarter. This also includes their Item Cards, Combatant Cards, and Adventurer Cards.


boxes in images not included


That means that this pack adds new Adventurers, Combatants, Espers, Items, and some alternate art cards for the starting four adventurers.

—description from the publisher

name: Dziki futbol
description:
African animals gather on the savannah to watch the Wildlife League final. Who will be the winner? The Brave Lions or the Charging Rhinos?

Players lead their teams to victory in the final game. To win the trophy, a team must win 2 games.

Players shuffle the Action cards and the Referee cards to create two decks of face down cards.

The Ball marker will move from player to player during the game, depending on how the game goes. The Action card is always revealed by the player who is in possession of the ball.
The player with the ball reveals the first card from the Action card pile and considers its effect.

After the Action card or the Referee card has been drawn, each player's active player cards are discarded into the discard pile.
A player takes a shot at the goal when a Shot Action card is revealed or it results from the contents of other Action cards.
If a Referee card is drawn players consider a card from the Referee card pile e.g. penalty kick, free kick, injury.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Afrykańskie zwierzęta gromadzą się na sawannie, aby zobaczyć finał Ligi Dzikich Zwierząt. Kto zostanie zwycięzcą? Odważne Lwy czy Szarżujące Nosorożce?

Gracze prowadzą swoje drużyny do zwycięstwa w finałowym meczu. Aby zdobyć puchar, drużyna musi wygrać 2 mecze.
Gracze tasują karty Akcji i karty Sędziego, tworząc dwie talie zakrytych kart.
Znacznik Piłki w trakcie gry będzie przechodził z jednego gracza do drugiego, w zależności od przebiegu gry. Kartę Akcji zawsze odkrywa gracz, który jest w posiadaniu piłki.
Gracz przy piłce odkrywa ze stosu kart Akcji pierwszą kartę i rozpatruje jej efekt.
Po wykonaniu akcji z karty Akcji lub karty Sędziego, karty aktywnych zawodników każdego gracza zostają odrzucone na stos kart wykorzystanych.
Gracz oddaje strzał na bramkę w momencie, gdy zostanie odsłonięta karta Akcji albo wynika on z treści innych kart.
Jeśli wylosowana zostanie karta Sędziego gracze rozpatrują kartę ze stosu kart Sędziego np. rzut karny, rzut wolny, kontuzja.

—description from the publisher

name: Disney Princess: Home Sprint
description:
Play the Disney Princess Home Sprint Game, choose one of your favorite princesses: Ariel, Cinderella, Jasmine and Belle, then be the first home to win! While on the way home be careful as some spaces leap you forward, but others can make you miss a turn. This family-friendly game is fun for all ages from 4 years old upwards for 2-4 players, roll the dice and start your race home.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Trust Me I'm a Doctor: Witchcraft & Wizardry
description:
Prepare to be spellbound and horrified in the world of Witchcraft and Wizardry, as you conjure up strange cries to your superstitious fears!

This expansion adds 33 new witchy Cures and 20 new spooky Ailments to your TRUST ME I'M A DOCTOR card game!

Based on real methods used around historical superstitions and fictitious fun.

—description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Medical, Negotiation, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Negotiation, Real-Time, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: MasterChef: Green
description:
Do you see yourself as MasterChef? Now you can prove it in a delicious Vegetarian cooking fight! Beat other players in cooking mini-challenges and choose the best ingredients. Use them to create an unforgettable dish, get as many points as possible and win.

In fast-paced mini-games, players collect ingredient cards and create a culinary masterpiece at the end. Players will score each others dish and the player with the highest score, wins!

You need a little creativity and a sense of humor to win!
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Dress Up game
description:
The aim of the game is to get dressed in the colors of the rainbow before the sun come out. The game can be played by 2–4 children either cooperative or competitive.

At each turn the player rolls a dice and moves his figure as indicated by the dice 1 to 3 fields to the next unoccupied square. Depending on the landing field the player usually takes a wooden stick (representing a dress) in the specified color. Alternatively the turn is passed to the next player or - after passing on a special square for the fourth time - the game ends.

When a player finishes dressing their character by all 6 colors, they can either continue to play to help their friends or win immediately.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Mentsd meg a bolygót
description:
Mentsd meg a bolygót ("Save the Planet") is an environmental and ecological family board game in which you can learn how to become an active participant in the fight to save the Earth.
The mission cards ask the players to replace the polluting power plants on the world map with renewable energy plants.
The goal is to save our beautiful planet, and we can't help that better than by making children think.
Players must answer questions about energy, nature or the environment.
Event cards can not only help players, they can also cause unpleasant surprises and turn the tide of the game.
Example of questions for the cards:

how much water do we lose on average per day due to a dripping tap? - 4 liters, or 9 liters, or 10 liters? (9 liters is the correct answer, which can be seen underlined on the card)
which tree's fruit is edible? - chestnut, sweet chestnut, oak, beech, birch? (chestnut can be seen underlined)
which of the following plants can help with orientation? - wild violet, nettle, moss, lace bush? (Moss)


Example of a mission card task:

At least half of the power plants in Asia should be your wind farms!


A very beautiful, detailed world map board game for children and adults, which provides everyone with obtainable knowledge, new information, a new way of thinking, and adequate motivation to minimize the ecological footprint.

name: KLAW: Were-Wars
description:
KLAW: Were-Wars is a card-and-dice game of conquest and combat set amidst a secret, ancient struggle between supernormal animal spirits and their human Dizhi hosts since pre-recorded time. The goal of the game is simple: Become the most powerful Dizhi, eliminating all contenders.

Based on the international best-selling graphic novel series by Antoine Ozanam, Joel Jurion, and Yoann Guille, KLAW is an exciting world of noble heroes, despicable villains, unpredictable intrigue, and action-packed combat -- the perfect setting for an exciting card game!

Featuring a vast and diverse array of unique human Host characters and two dozen interchangeable animal Totems that can be combined almost indefinitely, the possible number of Dizhi power configurations is in the millions.

KLAW: Were-Wars has been designed to be incredibly easy to learn, but with so many unique combinations of powers, defenses, and game-changing actions available, every session is guaranteed to be unique and unpredictable. There's no such thing as an unbeatable hand or strategy, and the tables can turn 180 degrees in an instant, pulling a player from last place into the lead with a lucky dice roll or draw from the deck. Stay sharp and be prepared to avoid having the rug pulled out from under you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, King of the Hill, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: M. Gourmand
description:
Collect ingredients from the board game until you have gathered all items indicated on your dessert card. But watch out! Mr. Gourmand will try to eat your ingredients and your opponents might rummage through your stash of food!

Goal of the game : Complete two dessert recipes.
To complete a recipe, you must collect the three basic ingredients indicated on your card.

How to play? Draw a card and move your pawn on the board the number of spaces indicated on the card to collect the ingredient associated with the square where you end your move. You can also choose to move your pawn and take a slimy fly waffles.

If you draw a Mr. Gourmand card, all players (including you) must feed Mr. Gourmand by putting one of their own ingredient on his stomach.

The third time Mr. Gourmand is drawn, he has eaten too
much and his belly explodes! The player who drew
Mr. Gourmand chooses an ingredient from
Mr. Gourmand’s belly.

If you have a slimy fly waffles, you can steal an opponent’s
ingredient. You can also use them to feed Mr. Gourmand to get a protection card (that will protect you from next Mr. Gourmand visit).

This board game asks children to think about what they need and how to get it. With the different elements of surprise, the game makes them laugh too! M. Gourmand is quick to install and play. And it's fun to play for all ages!

As a bonus, the 15 recipes of the game are available on the Internet to make them in real life. Ideal for prolonging family fun and feasting!

—description from the designer

name: Five Nights at Freddy's: Scare-in-the-Box Game
description:
Five Nights at Freddy's Scare-in-the-Box Game mixes roulette with a Jack-in-the-box.

To play, pass the box around from player to player. On a turn, choose to either turn the crank and tempt fate, or play a pass token to skip your turn and play it safe. Should you fall into Freddy's clutches, you have a chance to use scare tokens to try to steal the win from any remaining players. Compete to be the last person to survive.

name: Stockholms-spelet
description:
Stockholms-spelet is a trivia game (basically a Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition clone), with questions about the Swedish capitol.

—user summary

name: Komma Lika
description:
Komma Lika (Come Equally)

Every time you do something for the shared household – the dishes, replace a broken light bulb, take the car to the auto shop, etc. – you get points. The points consist of triangular shaped magnets of different sizes. Each member of the household gets his/her own color, and together the different colored magnets form a nice pattern. When the game period is finished, the colors should ideally be balanced and equally distributed. Everybody wins by getting equal.

It is up to you to decide how long you want the game period to be. A week or two, until you run out of magnets, or until you together have formed one of the figures shown on the cards that come with the game.

Try playing a first round while leading your lives as usual, collecting points according to the rules. Evaluate the results. Are the colors balanced? Play again – this time, try to get as equal as possible.

Who wins? It’s not about winning – it’s about getting equal.

name: Monopoly: McDonald's Happy Meal
description:
A pure luck roll-and-move game themed after Monopoly as a McDonald’s Happy Meal item. The gameplay is different from the previous Happy Meal game. When a player lands on an unowned property, they claim it’s deed. The game ends when all properties are taken.

The components include puzzle pieces that form a board, deed cards, four plastic tokens, and a punched card that folds into a die.

name: Space Chase
description:
Your mission is to journey through outer space in your rocket ship trying to catch your opponents before they catch you! Be aware of black holes, they could lead to your undoing or they may be your flight path to victory!

Players roll a randomized number with the "ray gun" and moves the corresponding amount of spaces. If you land on another rocket ship, they're out! Be the first one to tag all your opponents!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Antikrundan
description: Themed on the popular Swedish TV show Antikrundan. Players bid on antiques, trying to estimate their true value.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Matchmaking: The Jane Austen Memory Game
description:
PUT YOUR MEMORY SKILLS TO THE TEST as you pair up Austen's most famous couples.

SIMPLE GAME PLAY that everyone will understand and enjoy
THE PERFECT GIFT for fans of Jane Austen.

LEARN MORE ABOUT THE CHARACTERS and their relationships in the accompanying booklet.

It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of a wife'! Help Jane Austen's most eligible characters find their perfect partners in this matchmaking memory game. With all the cards face down, you must turn over two at a time in hopes of pairing up Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy, Emma Woodhouse and Mr Knightley, and many more couples besides. Put your literary knowledge and memory skills to the test as you piece together romantic courtships, rash, ill-advised matches, long, comfortable marriages and everything in between.

name: Journal d'un noob: le jeu!
description:
Find, inside this box, a board game to have fun and challenge your friends with a booklet full of surprises, a game board, pawns, a dice and an hourglass to get into the mood.

Find Minus and his friends and fill up on adventures and challenges! Prove that you're the strongest by answering quizzes on the Minecraft universe and become an army leader to fight the terrible Herobrine! So who is the Noob?

Put yourself in noob mode for a crazy evening!
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Life Skills: Uczę się rozwiązywać problemy
description:
The World Health Organization has identified 10 life skills that are needed to grow into a better and happier person, who is able to lead a dignified life. And it is these skills that are developed in the games in this series, which are also great fun for the child. These are soft skills that are essential in everyday life. They allow children to get to know themselves, their emotions better, make contacts with other people easier or cope with stress.

This game teaches children to solve problems when they find themselves in a difficult situation. Children, using elements in the game, have to talk about a given situation and try to find a way out of it together with their parent.

—description from publisher

Every player receives at the start of the game 5 problem tiles. The goal is to solve those problems. Each turn a player spins a spinner which has 4 outcomes:

Solve a problem: To solve a problem a player has to choose one of the solution tokens that is a dedicated solution for one of their problems - it is checked by flipping the token and check if the number on the other side match the number on the problem tile. If correct, the player flips their problem to the solved side. If not, nothing happens, end of player's turn.
Solve a big problem: If a player has a medal, nothing happens, end of turn. If not, an opponent draws a big problem card and reads to the active player. There are always two questions with answers beneath them. If the active player replies to both questions correctly, they receive a medal.
Change a problem: Player changes an unsolved problem tile for another one from the pool.
Lose a solved problem: Player loses on of their solved problem, if any.


The first player to solve all 5 problems and get a medal wins.

—user summary

name: StoryCards: Die drei ??? Kids – Fußball-Stars
description: StoryCards: Die drei ??? Kids – Football-Stars is a storytelling game of sorts in which a player or team is confronted by a situation that presents them with two options for a journey. Which way should they go to solve the mystery? Once they choose, they lay down the card, then search for the appropriately numbered card that they chose. The more cards they lay down, the more they score. If a card is no longer available, however, then the game ends and the detective trio has failed.

name: Test board game with honor
description: testing

name: Curse Words
description:
A word making & guessing party game for filthy people.

- Pick and pass letter cards
- Build a word, play it face-down
- Race to guess other players' words
- Use prompt cards to direct your word-making & guessing, and to score extra points
- Bad language scores double!

The game ends after up to 3 rounds (determined by player count), at which point the player with the highest final score wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: FFF Fly Funky Fly
description:
What is the theme and goal of the game?

Fancy catching flies? This card game is for you!
Be the best serial fly catcher getting less number of flies at the end of the game.
Heaps of flies make you crazy but luckily action cards, means Frustrated cards, may upturn the game at any game. This is a game of strategy, but with some luck involved.

About the cards and the game-play

It is a game for +8YO and for 2-4 players.
Including 54 blue point cards (the flies) and 43 orange game cards.

At the beginning of the game, you deal 5 blue point cards and 4 orange game cards. You need to always have 4 game cards in your hand. Flies (blue points cards) move from a deck to another player deck.

Depends on game cards you play, you decrease your own points (flies) and/or increase points of the other players.


If your card is marked with a specific symbol, you can play a pair to use them simultaneously, which doubles the flies given and decreases yours accordingly.


You can given points to the player of your choice if you play a game card with a star on it.

The "Frightened Fly" card gives flies to everyone unless you've got an action card like "Block" card or "Back To You" card.
The "Serial Fly Catcher" card decreases your number of flies.
The "Swap" card allows you to exchange your "points cards or seat!
The "Skip" card means the next player to your left misses a turn.
The "Draws" card allows the players playing it to take a card from any players hand.


The end of the game

The game immediately ends when the first player has no game cards left. Each player count their point cards to know their final score. Caution : +30 points per "Frustrated cards", action cards, remaining at the end of the game!
The player with least number of flies wins the game and is the Serial Fly catcher.

This FFF card game is created by a family for families. The design and quick stories on each card make the game unique!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Alliances, Push Your Luck, Speed Matching, Take That

name: Scale-Up!: The Business Game
description:
Scale-Up! The Business Game

“I am done, I quit!” are the words you said to your manager
3 months ago. With $50k of savings, you are ready to start a
new adventure: launch the furniture business you have always
dreamed of starting.

A month later, your company (MyOffice Inc.) is incorporated!
The next step is to recruit a great team. After a few interviews,you hire Sophia as Sales Manager, Marc as Purchase Manager, now it's to start doing business; purchase your first products, market your company, sell those products and, hopefully, make a profit!

The game has 7 business cases each with 8-10 cards.

Read the business case on the front of the card. Don’t look at the back yet!

Using the online app follow and complete the tasks one card at a time.

Compare what you did with the solution on the back of the card. Each case has one right answer.
mechanics: Income, Investment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pocket Ungame: Singles Version
description:
"Pocket Ungame - Singles Version" is another expansion for "The Ungame" that can be used as part of the original board game or by itself as a standalone talking game. Like other Ungame expansions, this one comes with 2 decks. Deck one contains light questions meant as ice breakers and deck 2 contains questions meant to spark deeper conversations.

In "Pocket Ungame - Singles Version", players are encouraged to share their opinions, feelings, and beliefs through the asking of simple questions. Questions come from card prompts & encourage storytelling. Ideal as an ice-breaker as it is fundamentally non-competitive.

Contains 140 cards.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Questions and Answers, Storytelling

name: Apéricube 2
description:
Inside the box in the shape of Apéricube cheese, the 400 questions and challenges are divided in 5 sections : People, Trendy, Waouh, Fiestas and Challenges.

During their turn, each player chooses a number between 1 and 400. If he succeds to answer the question or accomplish the challenge corresponding to the number, they score one point. The first player to score 10 points wins the game.

name: Mot i Brøstet Det Orginale Brettspillet
description:
The second board game based on the Norwegian sitcom "Mot i Brøstet". This one is very reminiscent of Ludo, with elements from Monopoly and Quiz-games.
Each player start with 5 pieces connected to one of the characters from the show; Karl, Henry, Nils, Målfrid, Trine or Edna. They start on their own separate tile beside the game board. Each turn the players roll 2 dice, and send their pieces circling around the abstract gameboard. On their way they might land on specific spaces which might give out trivia questions from the show, random events inspired from episodes, spaces which gives you benefit if the right character land on them or the Mot i Brøstet-space giving you a Mot i Brøstet-token. These spaces might give different benefits, and the Mot i Brøstet-token can be used in a variety of ways. Once a player have gotten all their pieces one round around the board and then into the center up each characters own path to the goal, they win.

name: Mot i Brøstet Nytt Spill!
description:
Join the crazy gang from the TV series "Mot i Brøstet" in a wild game in familiar surroundings. From the start in the corner of the sofa, it's all about solving the task you are assigned as quickly as possible, but beware, the other players can actively destroy you. This is the third board game based on the Norwegian sitcom Mot i Brøstet.

The board is designed after the set from the show, with both the Kitchen, Living room, Entrance and Upstairs. Each player starts on the sofa in the living room with a piece reperecenting one character from the show; Karl, Nils, Henry, Målfrid, Trine or Edna. Taking turns, a player need to roll a 6 on a die before they can leave the sofa and enter the start space. Then they have to choose a task, either Kitchen, Entrance, or Upstairs. There are only 2 or each, so only 2 can choose the same. Then the players need to manuver the house moving spaces to the question space on their chosen room, where another player can freely chose a trivia question from the trivia manual. If the player chose correctly, they can move back to the sofa to win. If not, they need to move back to the sofa and pick a new task.

If player chose to take certant detours to their task, they can aquire a detroy chip. Each destroy chip is catogarized with the different task, and once used, get placed on a space in the middle of the living room named "Ø". Any player with that task must go back to that space to remove that chip before they can answer any trivia questions.

There are also banana peel-spaces, forcing a player to lose a turn if landed on.

—user summary

name: The Cruise Ship Escape
description:
This date centers around the importance of unity in your relationship and working together in all things. You'll get the chance to test your teamwork skills. in an escape room game designed by the Happily team.

You'll be working against the clock to solve the clues given in the game before the time limit expires. In your box, you'll also find some great snacks to make your date night that much sweeter.

—description from publisher

name: Breakaway: CCG
description:
Create your own hockey team and compete against your friends. With new cards coming out every year, you can replicate any action or situation from hockey. It is as fun and exciting as hockey. Score, Save, Fight, and bodycheck. All this and more are available in Breakaway:CCG

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Memory, Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Multiple Maps, Real-Time, Relative Movement, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Simulation, Single Loser Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Phase Order

name: Texts From Your Ex
description:
Texts From Your Ex is a fast-paced party game where you race to get rid of all your ex’s texts first! Get rid of all your cards and then Block the conversation to win a round. The first player to play all of their Block tokens wins!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Endless Games (I), Goliath Games, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Hyperspace: Space Monsters
description: Space monsters can shake up your games of Hyperspace. Space Monster come into play through the Secret cards decks.

name: Mistery English
description:
Mistery English is similar to the Game of the Goose. Players have to complete an itinerary. In order to do so, they roll a dice and, every time they enter a box something happens. Sometimes, they have to answer questions, other times they advance 2 boxes extra or they re-roll the dice, etc.

The board is divided into 4 different rooms and, before leaving any room, each player must recover a token with his colour (green, yellow, red or blue).

A player keeps rolling until he misses a question or ends up in a box where he cannot do anything else. The questions in the cards are all related to language and are very basic. Things like: “How do you say (WORD) in English?” “What does (WORD) mean?”, etc.

—user summary
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Clue: Giant Edition
description:
One mystery . . . 6 suspects. It’s the classic game of Clue with a giant twist! Can you figure out who’s responsible for hijinks in the mansion? Nine mysterious rooms are laid out in a circle, each holding dark secrets inside to discover. Spin the spinner and move to a room by standing beside the room’s large vinyl mat. Inside, you can pick up 2 Evidence Cards – but you can keep only one. Or you might spin and take possession of another big piece of evidence: one of 6 large, foam Tools. Your goal: Move from room to room, collecting matching colored Suspect, Room, and Tool cards, along with the matching foam Tool, and you’ll solve the case! Was it Professor Plum with the Rubber Mallet in the Library? Or Mr. Green with the Trumpet in the Billiard Room? No case is too small to solve with Clue: GIANT Edition!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Grid Movement, Memory, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Poop Wars
description: Players choose their poop personality and plop them into toilet bowls. Twenty game cards form the outer track that changes from game to game. Fun and quick to play. It takes strategy and good dice rolls to avoid getting flushed and remain the last poop floating.

name: Midnight in the Garden of Cuteness and Catastrophe
description:
It has similarities to Stud and Whiskey Poker. Players are dealt eight cards, some face-up, some face-down, then have three turns to draw and discard cards to try and get a good hand: five of a kind, four of a kind, three of a kind with one pair, one trio, two pairs, or one pair (in order of rank).
After three turns, everyone plays their hand to win a blue flower card. The game is played for nine rounds and whoever has the most of the nine flower cards wins.

name: Intelect números
description:
Game of simple mathematical operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) and crossed numbers in which chance, taking the numbers and skill in calculating the operations are combined to obtain the highest possible score in the game.
The score of each player depends on the result of the number obtained, stipulated by certain positions that double or triple the absolute value of the numbers.
The scores obtained by each player accumulate until the end of the game, with the winner being the one with the highest score.

name: Curiosity
description:
In this game, you will play the role of a scheming hacker, hired by a space agency, with the intention of using it for your own benefit. Your mission is simple: operate to discover valuable and strange mineral deposits on the arid alien landscape. But be careful! While looking for treasures, you could find remainder of old missions from your own space agency, which failed and left space junk all over the alien ground. You must avoid these failures from being discovered, while competing for being the player getting the location with the highest number of mineral deposits.

Choose between sending a command to Curiosity or placing a study object in the area. At the end of the round, only the third or fourth command sent at each coordinate will be processed by Curiosity.

All the pieces of study that curiosity comes across will be revealed.

name: Ternion Factor
description:
Contains rules for two games.

Ternion Factor: on a unique grid of squares and triangles, players vie to get all their pieces on the board by occupying intersections and forcing their opponents to make unfortunate moves. Each turn a player does three actions, which have three interwoven consequences of adding or removing pieces, with a bit of luck thrown into the choice process. The first person with all eighteen pawns in the play area at the end of their turn is the winner.

In "Escape!": this is a Halma variant using this board. Escape! is a strategy game where pawns are jumped across the board to reach one of the intersections beyond the blue line on the other player's side of the board. The first player whose pawns all Escape! is the winner.

name: Medabots: Robattle Arena
description:
ROBBATTLE your Medabots in the arena!
You can battle up to 6 figures at a time! Exchange robot parts with opponents to win!

4 Game Modes

One-on-One battles (basic & advanced versions)!
Battle for points to win!
Battle to cross the bridge first!
Team battles for bigger challenges!
categories: Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Great Minds Think Alike
description:
Which of your friends share your future? Find out in this mystical game of matching answers!

Pick a card with a question about your future, which could be anything from "In ten years, I'll be working as ...", to "What crime will I go to prison for?" Each player then writes their answer and revelas what they wrote. If a player matches your answer, they win a point.

Will you and your besties prove you have a spiritual connection, or will you be on totally different wavelengths?

name: Alphabet Soup
description: A roll-n-write game featuring a drawing of a bowl of soup with a grid of letters worth 1 to 3 points. Each round, roll a d6 and a d8 to pick letters from the corresponding row and column to create a word at least 4 letters long. After three words are created, tally one's score. Can be either played as a solo game or competing against others for higher score.

name: Cutie Bug
description: Each player gets a sheet covered in a grid of bugs and clovers. Drawing two domino-like cards from the 10-card bug deck, players fold a corner of their page with the same number of clovers matching the card drawn, then place their initials over any bugs matching the other card and pass their sheet to the player on their left. After four rounds the initialed bugs in the folded corners are tallied and whoever found the most bugs wins.

name: Pick N' Nick
description: Played on a modular board with tiles that look like picnic tables, each with one to two plates, and numbered 1-9+. Each player gets ten friend tokens and a goal card displaying a polyomino with either the ability to re-roll or switch a die roll. Each turn, players roll both dice to place their tokens on the 5x5 grid with a corresponding number in an attempt to reconstruct their polyomino while trying to grab the table with the most forks. The game ends when one player has all ten of their tokens on the board, then everyone tallies their forks, highest score winning.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Roll-With-It: Modern Series
description:
The Roll-With-It System is a roll-and-write adventure game system featuring thematic variety and endless adventure possibilities due to its flexible core rules system. The round-based gameplay involves managing a pool of dice, activating them to take actions such as moving, fighting, jumping, interrogation, disarming bombs, searching for treasure, and more. The function of the dice changes from module to module, providing much thematic variety.

The system's basic rules provide a “skeleton” rules framework on which all of the adventure modules are structured. Each adventure module puts the “flesh” on the rules with theme and creative new mechanisms.

The Roll-With-It Modern Series continues the Roll-With-It system with six new adventure modules featuring "modern", real-world themes:


Highways of Speed
Outlaws of Deadwood
Theme Park of Chaos
Lost City of Gold
Shadows of Espionage
Wasteland of Survival


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, American West, Dice, Exploration, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle, Racing, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Critters at War: Ultimatum Promo Card
description:
Promotional card, sharing the rules from similar promo to Air, Land & Sea.

Available as add-on for preorders of Ukrainian version of Air, Land & Sea: Critters at War.

Play with normal scoring rules.
Neither player can withdraw from battles.

At the start of each battle, place this card in the middle of the table with 1 VP on it. At the end of the battle, the winner takes all tokens on this card.

At the start of your turn, before playing, you may give your opponent an Ultimatum. Your opponent must choose to either Surrender or Resist.

If they Surrender: You win the battle! Collect all VP tokens on this card.
If they Resist: Double the total value of VP tokens on this card. Then, Slide this card toward your opponent.

Once a player has this card, only they can offer the next Ultimatum.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Dutch Roulette
description: A children's version of roulette in which the turning blades of a windmill push each players token into a numbered hole. The winner is the one whose token gets to the highest number. Unlike most roulette games, the windmill is set in the middle of a rectangle.

name: Rainbow Fish and the Big Blue Whale Game
description:
From the box: Join Rainbow Fish and friends in a race through the ocean. Be the first player to reach the krill feeding ground and you win!

This action-filled game, based on Marcus Pfister's book, Rainbow Fish and the Big Blue Whale, will take you on many adventures. Try to avoid the obstacles in your path, such as getting sent back by the angry blue whale's swooshing tail or getting trapped in the cave.

name: Bratz Rockin' Chic Board Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Rock to the top! It's a race to stardom at the biggest rock concert of the year! Take a spin to create a stylin' wardrobe! Gather rockin' music and stock up on lots of bling! The right combination will land you onstage, where you win the game- and you rock the spotlight!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Redneckopoly
description: Getting down and dirty at the local Ho Down, making moonshine, having your latest batch of crystal meth blowing up in your face, building trailers and double-wides, are some of the elements of the game. Not dope enough? ... If you can't pass the field sobriety test you might just land yourself in da drunk tank.

name: How to Be a Complete Bitch
description: A simple roll, move and pick up card game. On picking up a card the other players decide what answer they believe you will give, if they are correct you move back, if they are wrong you move on.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Dozens
description: Based on the classic urban pastime of exchanging "Yo Mama" jokes with your friends, this collectible trading card version features 150 different "snaps", complete with point rankings. Challengers can compete by trying to outrank each other by having an audience decide which insults are the funniest. Rare "Oooh!" cards are randomly inserted into packs, allowing players to make up their own jokes.

name: Bible Books: Match
description:
All Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness, that the man of God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work. ~ 2 Timothy 3:16-17

Bible Books: Match is a fun game and an educational tool to help young and old alike learn and remember the books of the Bible.

The game contains 110 cards which when combined form 32 different game decks of 36 cards each.

Players (or teams) take turns matching pairs of books that fall sequentially in the standard Christian Bible.

Can be played solo as well to test your own memory!

—description from the publisher

name: Dropsy
description:
Players take turns drawing cards until someone gets THREE of the same color. But there’s a twist… instead of discarding the cards you don’t want, you must hold ALL your cards, and you must hold them in the manner directed on the card! UNDER YOUR CHIN; ON YOUR HAND; ON YOUR HEAD; UNDER YOUR ARM; INSIDE YOUR ELBOW; or BETWEEN YOUR FINGERS.

—description from the publisher

name: Neighbors
description:
extrapolated from sessions report:

The game comes in the long, flat Monopoly-style box. The 3-fold map depicts a circular "street" with 6 colored houses numbered 1 to 6 distributed evenly around the street. These are the player houses, assigned at game start by a die-roll. In between the player houses are other spaces such as "S" (Slob), "C" (Clean), Mischief Night, Recycle, Lose A Turn, Pot Luck, Wild, Sue Neighbour! and Start. There are 6 coloured heads (to match the player's houses), money in 10/20/50/100 bill denominations, 10 Slumrunner cards and 50 Slob cards. Slob cards have values from 10 to 70 on them and say things like "Overgrown grass and weeds", or "Junk Vehicles In Yard". Starred (*) cards don't count against you when a round ends. The rules are brief and are printed on the game-box insert.

The idea of the game is to be a clean/good neighbor and hence become the wealthiest neighbor on the block.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Esperanca
description: Players try to discover and salvage treasures in sunken ships. Start of the game all 'sea sectors' are auctioned off. After that players have to buy equipment, travel to their sectors and try to salvage the treasures (if there's a ship in the sector). But even if they do pirates may steal the treasure again.

name: From Sailor Boy to Admiral
description:
From Sailor Boy to Admiral, A New Naval Game of Great Interest, was produced by C.W. Faulkner & Co. around 1900 and printed in Bavaria. The game was one of their "Upidee" series which featured cards laid out to form a track for a race game. The set includes 20 cards with numbered and beautifully illustrated slots, six standing figures of "Sailor boys", bifold instructions, spinning die called a teetotum and box.

The game is played by first laying out the cards in order to form a track. Each player chooses a sailor boy, paying five counters into the pool. Players spin the teetotum and place their sailor on that number, and continue to move him along the board based on the teetotum numbers thrown. When a player lands on a picture, they must follow certain rules, such as: 1 – Enter the Royal Navy and join the training ship. Receives one counter from each player. 50 – is tried by courtmartial on a charge of drunkenness on duty, and sentenced to lose five years seniority. Pays three counters into the pool and goes back to 39.

The box measures 3 13/16" x 4 3/4" 1 1/4". The cards (track) measure 3 5/8" x 2 1/8". The sailor boys stand 2 1/2". Teetotum measures 2" x 1".

name: Stanford
description:
A trick-taking game based upon Philip Zimbardo's 1971 Stanford Prison Experiment. The games' cards represent inmates, guards, warnings resulting from audits of the experiment, and the guards' "curriculum".

Cards played to the trick may affect an inmates ego or body. At the end of a round it is possible for an inmates' ego to reach 0, meaning their "education" is complete. If an inmates body reaches 0, they are considered to have died and an audit is initiated. Warnings will be issued for various curriculum cards which were played.

At the end of the game, the winner will be the player who scored the most points by completing the "education" of inmates.

—user summary

name: Escape Game: L'Ascenseur Infernal
description:
You get stuck in the Diabolical Elevator, Solve the puzzles and take the elevator to 10F! Hurry, you only have 60 mins!

—user summary

Piégés dans un ascenseur infernal, vous n'avez pas le choix: résolvez les énigmes, atteignez le dixième étage et méfiez-vous des apparences.

Des cartes "énigmes" pour aller d'étage en étage
Des cartes "code" pour trouver des combinaisons secrètes


Déconseillé aux claustrophobes!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Real-Time, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Challenge the Zodiac
description: A Trival Pursuit style game with the object to increase your knowledge of the planetary system and obtain as many earth symbols as possible. Uses dice to establish movement around the board of 44 spaces. Every space has instructions for the player to follow. If instructed to read a Planet card or a Sun card, the person on the right has first chance to answer, continuing around the board to the right (counter-clockwise). The first person with the correct answer receives the earth symbol. Recommended ages 10 and up.

name: The Zodiac Game
description: Russell Grant was a popular, jolly, rotund, camp TV astrologist in the 80s in the UK and this game contains advertising for his horoscopes, his premium rate phone lines and his personal charts by computer. The game is a simple quiz style effort in which you try to identify the Sun Signs and win tokens. Curiously, the game includes a d10 and a d12, which would have been a revelation to your family gamer in the 80s. If you happen to need photos of Russell Grant, this game is a must

name: Beat the Traffic Warden
description:
(from the back of the box)
"Give him back that ticket!
Ever since September 1960, when the very first parking ticket was given to an unsuspecting Doctor on call. It has been a global game not to get a ticket.
Now the game has come to life and you can "Give him back that ticket!" Over thirty years later and the game is still being played on the streets. Even if you have never had a parking ticket, Beat the Traffic Warden will appeal to all as a fun, spirited and enjoyable board game. It is not a game of pure chance, you need skill, tactical risk taking and determination to beat the Traffic Warden.
A game that generates great excitement and may bring out the rebel in you! It's a game we can all relate to. Feel really good handing the tickets back to the Traffic Warden, or get a great buzz from playing the Warden and handing out tickets yourself. Whatever side suits your personality. Beat the Traffic Warden makes the impossible possible."

Functionally, this is a straight-forward roll-and-move Monopoly game, but with a player-controlled adversary to add extra interaction to the game. The plastic bits are very nice.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Babar Game
description:
A simple children's roll and move game with Babar as a backdrop. This is different than the Babar King of the Elephant game which is a bit more elaborate. It is targeted for Ages 4 - 7
.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Your Best Life Now:  The Game
description:
From the publisher's website:
"The best selling book is now an
at-home experience like no other!

“Your Best Life Now” by Joel Osteen has sold over 3 million copies and has been on the New York Times and Publisher’s Weekly Best Seller list for over 50 consecutive weeks. The game enables players to step beyond the one-on-one nature of the book and feel, touch, and live Joel’s 7 Steps To Living At Your Full Potential with your friends and family. Your Best Life Now: The Game is an entertaining and educational way to take inventory of yourself and accountability of your actions. Climb the mountain as you

• Enlarge Your Vision

• Develop a Healthy Self Image

• Discover the Power of your Thoughts and Words

• Let Go of the Past

• Find Strength Through Adversity

• Live To Give

And • Choose to Be Happy

Each new plateau represents a challenge and a chance to open up and experience these steps first hand as you learn to live Your Best Life Now.

name: Taatuu-taatuu
description: Children's game where players are firemen. Players roll the die and move their fireman, putting on pieces of equipment or taking them off as dictated by the space. When you land on a fire space, an inertia fire engine is pushed, and it speeds around the board: if it stops next to you, the fireman gets to put on two items. First dressed wins. No thought required. The pieces are pretty decent to look at.

name: Maantie
description:
Description in the back of the box:

"Maantie [Highway] is an easily adopted dice game, where combining the spot counts and summation skills are the key to victory. Maantie is an excellent way to train mental arithmetics and thus has long been the dice game favourite of the young.

Abroad Maantie is known as Matterhorn, which is also played as a gambling game."

The idea of the game is to get all the numbers from 1 to 12 and back to 1, in order, by a single die or by combining multiple dice.

Maantie includes three dice, a scratch pad with scoring tracks, the rules and a pen.

To be precise, 'Maantie is NOT Matterhorn as the publisher claims. There is a slight difference in the rules. Instead, Maantie is better known as Centennial, Ohio or Martinetti.

name: What Would Jesus Do?
description:
From the Box: WWJD? What Would Jesus Do? The life-changing Game About Good Decisions

WWJD? is a fun-filled, fast-paced board game fo kids that the entire family will want to play. WWJD? provides hours of exciting game-play while developing the life-changing habit of asking, "What would Jesus Do?" every time a decision needs to be made. Laugh along with Jason and Mx as you encounter 150 comical, yet true-to-life situations built around six major Christ-like character traits: love, obedience, generosity, humility, faithfulness and truthfulness.

Stars Jason and Mx from the highly successful 101 Questions Children Ask book series.

Features a full color action gameboard with tunnels, bridges and dead ends

Includes 150 WWJD? situation cards, 60 Character Cards, six playing pieces and one die.

Designed for family fun, ages six and up.

Can be played in teams or by 2-6 individual players.

name: Row
description:
From Zabazoo:

"Take turns playing your hand of color tiles onto the board to create sets of three or more of a single color in a row. Be the first to get rid of all your pieces to win. New ROW from Zabazoo is hours of strategy fun ideal for the whole family. Made in Canada using natural materials."

A variant on the many classic Connect4 style games.

name: The New & Favorite Game of Mother Goose and the Golden Egg
description: A race game with golden eggs, on which the player can take a counter from the pool.

name: G-Force: the game
description:
The agents (which aren't assigned to individual players - anyone can move any agent) start at the center of the board. From there they are moved towards face-down disks which, when flipped up, show opponents and the agents which are necessary to defeat these. A disk is flipped open when a new agent moves into a position next to it. Then all other agents (those not adjacent to that disk) are moved back to the board center and the disk is flipped back again, unless all necessary agents are in place to defeat it. In that case, the active player gets the disk (it counts victory points).
Movement is determined by dice rolls. All movement points have to be used before a disk can be flipped over.
When all opponents are defeated, the player with most points wins.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Animals, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sinnet
description: This game Sinnet (Tennis spelled backwards) is from Chad Valley, Harborne, England. It is for 2,3 or 4 players. The server throws the die and moves the ball counter to which ever linked circle is indicated. After a successful service throw. the receiving player throws the die and moves the ball accordingly. If during the course of play the ball falls outside of the court (x,y,z) or on the players own side of the net the point goes to the opponent. The ball must always move forward never backwards

name: Alfons kuliga kojspel
description:
Alfons Åberg is the main character in a series of very popular children’s books from Sweden.

It´s a game in two steps. First it is a memory and roadbuilding-game, there the players pick-up puzzle-shaped tiles and try to finish the path to the treehouse. When the last piece is placed and the path is finished, that player can then start to move their pawns. First player that reach the treehouse with his/hers pawns wins.

name: A la Conquista del Reino Cobra
description:
Game Objective: Conquering the Kingdom Cobra, dominator of all Tribes; in each of the four tribes they have been chosen the three best warriors in order to go and fight and kill Cobra, so grab your kingdom and dominate the other tribes.

How to play: Each player will choose three tiles of the same color, and place them in the corresponding color Tribe.

Each player may draw the first tile with any number, the following can only put them into play when you take out a 1 with the dice, once you have 3 chips in play, you can move on every play you prefer.

Each time a player take out a 1 with the dice can repeat turn, but if you take a 3 consecutive results dice with 1 on the dice, will have to return to the Tribe box that matches your color and wait to get out again, can meanwhile play with the other tiles.

When a tile falls into a square in which there is already a tile from another player "kills" it, forcing her to return to her "tribe". The player who has "killed" advance 10 squares with any of your tiles (in the boxes marked with a circle can not kill another tile).

Two cards of the same color in a square form a barrier that can not be overridden by other tiles. These barriers can also be formed in the boxed circled by two different colored tiles. These barriers have to be dissolved when the player or players that have formed check out a 6 with the dice.

Each player will have to go around the board with each of his tiles and end its route (by its corresponding color) in the center of the board to get the "Kingdom Cobra". Each tile will introduce each player will have to fight the "Cobra". You will have to throw the dice once by its tile and again by the "Cobra". If the number drawn by the Cobra is higher than yours, your chip will return to his tribe, having it put back into play. But if the player takes the number is greater than remove the Cobra, the "Kingdom Cobra" will stay.

Winner: The first player who wins their three tiles at the Cobra, gets overcome, takes over the "Kingdom Cobra, and winning the game.

name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Earth vs Wind
description:
Welcome to world of Dark Legacy. A world ruled by the ruthless battle mage by the name of the Kaiser. The planet of Titan is at war. The Kaiser is bringing the world to its knees. This is a war where anything is possible and anyone can become a legend. It is here where your journey begins.

Dark Legacy is a unique strategy game that mixes the best elements of campaign-style adventure games and tactical customizable card games and wraps them all up into an in-depth sci-fi/fantasy story. In Dark Legacy, players are no longer bystanders of the battle, they get to be part of it as a war general within one of six different factions. With the unique and various weapons, armor, and relics, that a player can equip themselves with, players can become whomever they imagine themselves to be.

In Dark Legacy, it is the players objective to destroy their opponents and their armies, by building a deck of magic spells that no one can withstand, rolling the d20 in their favor and strategically summoning their army to be the strongest. Just like in a real battle you will have to anticipate the probability of the unexpected. Don't make choices too hastily for they may be the demise of your army and yourself.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: HashTagIt!: Family Edition
description:
TheHystericalGameOfTaggingPhotos


The Party Game of tagging photos with outrageous Hashtags!

Play the best Hashtag caption from the cards in your hand. If yours is voted the Best, You win the Round!

name: Sombreros
description:
Sombreros is a basic shedding and bluffing game. The main components are 25 plastic sombrero-shaped hats, each concealing a sticker in one of five colours.

At the beginning of each round, players are dealt a set of hats and three hats are placed on the table. The player in turn to play may conditionally peek at the colour of a lone hat, and must then place one of their hats on one of the three piles, calling out a colour as they do so. Stating a colour is purely psychological though, as the player is only required to match colours with the hat underneath and whatever is said is disregarded entirely when confirming this. It is also possible to pass at the cost of taking a hat from the "deck".

Another player may challenge a placement, at which point the newly placed hat and the one underneath are inspected to see if they match. In typical bluffing game fashion, whichever of the challenged and challenging player is in the wrong is penalized by having to pick up the entire pile in question, and the other continues play by beginning a replacement pile.

The goal of each round is to be the first player to get rid of all hats, at which point the other players get penalty points based on the hats they still hold. The player with the least penalty points after three rounds wins the game.

—description from the publisher game submitter

name: Hildes wilde Wäschespinne
description: Can you help Hilde to hang up the laundry? Not really a problem, but beware: It's pretty windy outside today and that makes the game an entertaining challenge for children! Throw the Weather Die: If the sun is shining you're lucky and you can hang up a piece of laundry, but if there's a storm you have to press the button and the rotary clothesline will start spinning. Hilde can just hold on tight, but if the clothes fall off the line, you have to start hanging them up again! Whoever hangs up all the clothes of their color first wins.

name: Incarceration
description:
Incarceration is the game about life as seen by offenders 'serving time' in HM Prison. The board reflects the prison itself and the winner is the inmate who passes through the prison system the quickest. This is acheived by collecting discharge cards and throwing the release dice.

The game consists of a board, dice, cards and player markers.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Parliament
description:
In this game players take the role of politicians in the Australian Parliament.

Introduce bills "to turn Sydney Harbour Bridge upside down", or to "make time go metric", or to "ban any work between meals..." and get them passed through the House of Representatives and through the Senate and turn them into Acts.

During the game the players will need to 'debate' their bills and argue for or against.

name: Lil' Bratz Amusement Park Funk
description: This game is essentially a remake of Snakes (Chutes) & Ladders. The board is a series of spaces with various amusement park rides (Ferris Wheel, Roller Coaster, Tunnel of Love etc.) depicted on it. When you land on a ride entrance space, you immediately move your pawn to the rides exit space. This will take you either forwards or backwards on the path. The first player to make it through the park wins.

name: Klunsa
description: Rock paper and scissors card game.

name: The Bible Stories Game
description:
The object of the game is to collect matching cards that tell familiar Bible stories, including Noah's Ark, David & Goliath, Joseph and the Coat of Many Colors, Jesus in the Temple, and others. The player completing the most stories is the winner.

Two of each picture are used for younger children, four of each picture for younger children. The only distinguishing feature from Go Fish is an optional rule where the set collector must tell the Bible Story pictured before counting the set.

Features "Precious Moments" artwork on the cards.

name: Robin Hood and the Friends of Sherwood Forest
description:
"You are Robin Hood and your friends Will Scarlet, Maid Marian, Little John and Friar Tuck have been captured by the evil Sheriff of Nottingham and taken to his castle. You must rescue them and steal some of the Sheriff's treasures and return to Sherwood Forest. The first player back wins the game".

During his turn a player has two goes:

In the first part of his turn the player throws the dice and moves the piece representing the Sheriff of Nottingham. The aim of this is to attempt to capture your opponents' pieces by landing on the square that they occupy. If this happens then the captured player loses one of his rescued friends or treasures and has to go back to the start.

The second throw of the dice allows a player to move his own piece (Robin Hood). The aim is to reach the green squares in order to rescue his friends.

On landing on a green square with an exact throw of the dice a player may collect a "Robin Hood" card which reveals the friend or treasure that you have found.

To win the game you have to be the first player to visit the green Robin Hood squares, rescued all of your four friends, stolen some treasure, and returned to the start square.

name: Miss World Game
description:
Players select their contestant from a pool of four supplied small dolls, complete with swimsuit. A robe is purchased for each and play commences with Miss World contestants circling the board on their 'World Tour', earning money for various tasks. When a contestant thinks they have accrued enough money (points) they may elect to parade on the Miss World catwalk stage. Each space on the stage costs points (money) and any contestant who runs out of points is eliminated.

The first player to reach the Golden Spotlight on the stage is awarded the winner's crown and the title of Miss World 'to the enthusiastic applause of all beaten contestants' - so sayeth the rules!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Franklin
description: It's Franklin's birthday and his friends are bringing presents. On his turn, a player spins the spinner. Franklin is moved first, then the player token. When a player ends up in a present square of his player color, or shares a square with Franklin, he can give a present to Franklin. Then the player must go and pick up another present from his starting square. The first player to deliver three presents to Franklin wins the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jogo de Guerra
description: Jogo de Guerra (literally, "War Game") is a Risk-like game of war and conquest. Players throw dice to "liberate" countries and accomplish missions.

name: Bible Search: Sunday School Edition
description: Bible Search – Sunday School Edition is a trivia game for children of all ages. Players ask each other questions extracted from better-known Bible stories. A die is tossed by each player on his or her turn to determine the question category and degree of difficulty of the question to be answered. For each correct answer, a player may place one of his or her pawns on the game board, or remove an opponent’s pawn. The first player to place three pawns in a row wins the game. The game includes a game board, cards with 3000 questions and answers, pawns in four different colors, a die, and instructions.

name: Flights of Fantasy
description:
Destini Productions presents the first collector card/game to bridge the gap between Fantasy Art collectors, Literary Enthusiasts and Gamers. All this in one product called, "Flights of Fantasy". The core set will consist of 90 cards divided into three subsets: Science Fiction, Fantasy and Horror. Each subset of 30 cards will bring forth an intense story line on the backs of these cards. Corresponding with the storyline will be a specially designed game concept never before seen in this format. All the art work for the core set of 90 cards has been exclusively produced by internationally known Game Illustrator, Ed Beard, Jr. Ed began this May of 1992. All work on the 90 card core set has been painstakingly created to the exact specifications of the storyline. This is the first and only "Flights of Fantasy" Collector card set and Game of its kind. March 1992

This never before seen concept will appeal to the traditional role playing gamer due to the highly realistic and detailed fantasy art work, as well as the graphic novel like backs to the cards. In addition the game has a fresh new approach that allows the player to engage in a quick and fierce battle based on the storyline concept. There are a variety of alternative ways to play depending on which you prefer. Uniquely designed random elements decide the games fate to assure fair play. Destini Productions is most proud to be able to guarantee that in each box of "Flights of Fantasy" the customer is rewarded with not one, not two but three complete core sets. We have gone to great extremes to collate this product this way for an affordable product. That means three different game themes times three complete sets, all for the price of a traditional fantasy card set.

- From the "Flights of Fantasy" promo sheet

Set contents:
30 Fantasy themed cards (numbered 1-30)
30 Horror themed cards (numbered 1-30)
30 Science Fiction themed cards (numbered 1-30)
2 Checklist cards
3 Rules cards
10 Puzzle cards (9 puzzle pieces and 1 overview card)
12 Gallery cards
3 special insert cards (1 bonus Rule card and 2 signed Gallery cards)
7 promo cards (5 bonus Rule cards and 2 promotional cards)

An unnamed expansion set, bolstering the character roster and adding official multiplayer support alongside more supplemental rules, was planned but never published.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Horror, Science Fiction

name: Barbary Coast War (Second Edition)
description:
From the Guild of Blades "Empires of History" series of Axis and Allies style historical games. Based very loosely on America's war with the Barbary pirates. This new edition features a color box and color components. In addition, boarding combat and ports are now represented by separate mapsheets.

From the back of the box: "Take a side in the first war against terror fought by the young United States against the Barbary Coast Nations. Historically the War lasted from 1801 till about 1806. The War started when the Barbary Nations would board vessels that flew the US flag and take those US citizens as slaves. The U.S. DID at first pay tribute to the King of Tripoli which did make the US a vassal State of the Ottoman Empire (technically speaking). How and if the United States wins is up to you."

Components: small rectangular box, 3 paper game maps, 3 sheets of rules, cut-em-yourself counters, cardboard sheets for mounting counters, ten-sided die.

name: Konduktööripeli
description: In this simple children's card game the players move their pieces across face down cards according to die roll. A card where player landed is turned and the task described in the card is carried out. These tasks include singing, greeting and other fairly simple stuff. The player that reveals the conductor card is the winner.

name: The Block
description:
Join the renovation game!

Based on the smash hot television show.

Renovate Your Apartment in one of four styles - Retro, Contemporary, Shabby Chic or Seaside in this game of skill and luck.

Will you property sell for the most profit or will you blow the budget? Test your skills as you race around the board in this fast paced game for family and friends. The fun builds with every roll of the dice as you renovate each of the five rooms by collecting and swapping renovation cards.There are Boom cards for that lucky break, adding big bucks to your budget, and Bust cards to set you back. Who will win? You won't know until the last players finishes and you play the Auction cards.

Learn about Renovations, styles & budgets in this fun and exciting game for between 2 & 8 players.

name: Bobry
description: 'Bobry' is a simple children's game. It has two variants. One of them - 'Swimmers race' - is a racing game. In the other one - 'Building beaver's lodge' - players collect tokens with elements depicted on them. The first player to collect four different elements of the construction wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Matchplay: The Card Game
description:
from publisher website
Matchplay is the challenging new golf theme card game from PlayMore Games! Matchplay was inspired by a centuries old Scottish golf competition that paired players in a challenge match where each hole contested was worth up to one point. In keeping with the time honored Scottish tradition Matchplay is designed to recreate that competitive format by offering non-stop strategic decision making opportunities.

The game can be played as a traditional tabletop card game or as an online game. The online option allows players to choose from three different opponent options.

MatchPlay is simply about winning more holes than your opponent. Players compete for the lowest score on each hole. If a player records a lower hole-score than their opponent they receive a one point advantage. If both players record the same score, they tie the hole and neither player receives a point. Players use any scorecard for an 18-Holes match, contest 3- Holes per deal, and try to outpoint their opponent.

name: Desmond Lynam's Sports Trivia
description:
Trivia game, using a name of a popular TV sport presenter of the time. It was a stand alone game but was primarily aimed at the Trivial Pursuit player who wanted more questions/categories. Each card has 6 questions, each in a different category. A die is provided. The player rolls the die and answers the question allocated to the die roll. If it is answered correctly, two points are scored and the same player can roll for another question.If it is a wrong answer, the player to the left gets a chance and scores one point. The first to 40 points, wins.The 6 categories are;
Names including Nicknames
Numbers
Home Events occuring in UK
Events occuring abroad
Olympic Games
Miscellaneous including Quotations
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Flipper
description: Flipper is a simple dice rolling and move game. Very similar to Pachisi, players roll dice to move their pieces around the board. Unlike in Pachisi, a player does not have to go all the way around the board, but may hit a shortcut to the center exactly and than move meet Flipper in the middle.

name: Function Well
description: Players are dealt gameboards with three numbers printed on them on the left edge and three numbers on the right edge. In the middle there is a hole called well. Small function tiles are randomly drawn from the bag. Each tile has a number and either summation, subtraction, division or multiplication sign. Player who has the matching board takes the tile and places it in the well of the board. First player to fill all of his/hers wells is the winner.

name: Original Spin
description: Original Spin is whatever the equivalent of "vaporware" is. It doesn't exist. No one has seen an actual final copy.

name: W ruinach Wrocławia
description:
Game is set in the city of Wroclaw, which has been reduced to ruins in the aftermath of III World War. Game-play consists of 1) drawing card from the "threat deck" (these cards represent threats posed by post-apocalyptic world) and rolling dice (which affect shooting accuracy of characters taking part in combat) 2) secretly selecting character cards and maneuvers 3) drawing another threat card and rolling third, final die 4) resolving combat. Player who, after end of the turn, has got less than three character cards in his or her hand loses the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: New Osaka
description:
Introduction: Welcome to New Osaka, a game where 2 to 5 players runs an organization vying for control. Build mechs, buildings, & defenses, produce resources, use research labs to earn new tech, and fight off various monsters, including a giant final boss at the end of the game. Will your organization come out on top in defending New Osaka? Time to see if you have what it takes!

Background: In the year 2055, a Great War raged across the globe against the vile forces of Max Von Fury. Max was a mad genius bent on taking over the world with his AI infused robotic creations. He very nearly succeeded. Allied forces discovered his home base in the Old Osaka Prefecture of Japan and that was where Max’s last stand took place, destroying much of Old Osaka in the process. In his defeat, his final act of defiance was to open portals to another dimension within Neyagawa, Yao, and Ikoma, unleashing great monsters into our world. After a time, other portals started appearing in various nations, small at first, but slowly getting bigger.

Now, major organizations fight for control over New Osaka, the great bastion standing against the first major source of the monsters. Whichever group proves they have what it takes to defend New Osaka against the monster threat will earn major contracts around the world when the other portals start becoming a threat. Untold power and control awaits the organization that proves itself worthy!

Gameplay: You have 'motor cars' and characters you use to activate buildings on the map. You have battle mechs you can move around to take over research stations and take on monsters (rolling dice to beat the monster level). Beating monsters produce special resources and points. And you also have production mechs that you can move to factories to produce resources that let you upgrade buildings, mechs, and earn points. The final round, all players fight a giant monster. Players generate points for how they do all of these actions and the player with the most points wins.
categories: City Building, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Worker Placement

name: Wings over Pyrrhia
description:
Wings over Pyrrhia is a simple set collection game based on the Wings of Fire children's fantasy book series by Tui T. Sutherland.

Players choose a dragon and roll two dice to determine which region of a map they move to. Each die roll/region affects different types of dragon in different ways (for example, on a roll of 2, IceWing dragons move to a kingdom of their choice. All other reroll).

Some regions are kingdoms. When a dragon visits a kingdom, it collects a token.

When dragons are in the same kingdom, they can trade tokens or fight to try to steal tokens from the other dragon--high roll wins.

The first dragon to collect all seven kingdom tokens wins.

This game was included as a tear-out insert in one or more books from the Wings of Fire series. Additional components and rules are available for download on the Scholastic website.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Matti on maailman paras!
description: Matti Nykänen is maybe the best ski jumper of all time. After a glorious sports career he has lived a really colorful life including numerous marriages, jail, booze, professional singing and lots and lots of other interesting things. After they made a movie about his life they also created this trivia game about his life. The name of the game translates into English as "Matti is the best of the world!"

name: Juden Raus
description:
WARNING: This game is considered offensive by many and is part of the BGG database for completeness

A sort of amalgam of Monopoly and Halma, where the objective was to collect as many Jews as you could, and get them off the board. The pieces were little pawns wearing pointed medieval Jewish hats; the players moved them by rolling dice; the child winning was the one whose Jews scurried out, 'off to Palestine!' through the gates of a walled city.

name: Bratz Mall Crawl! Game
description: Bratz Mall Crawl! Game - compete to be the best professional buyer of the bunch. Look around the mall for fashion and food stores, then buy the items you think will be the best.

name: Zaczęło się w Polsce
description: "Zaczęło się w Polsce" - is an adventure game based almost completely on the mechanics Talisman (the only significant difference is the possibility of playing cards on the opponents). Players take roles of the typical polish characters from the years 1939 - 1989 (doctor, journalist, etc.).. The goal of the game is to cross the fields of World War II (first circle), to survive the times of communism (second circle) and take part in the deliberations of the Round Table (third circle). The player who first reaches the goal wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Klovn Spillet
description: Trivia game based on the danish comedy series "Klovn". Players each turn roll and move. If the square the player ends on determines if the player answer a question about the show or takes a special action like re-rolling.

name: Lawsuit!
description:
From the publisher's website:
Lawsuit! is an educational game for adults and children ages 6 and up. Players experience and learn about the law as they make their way through law school, past the bar exam and into their own law practice and the courtroom.

The board is divided into 62 spaces. Players proceed through law school; the nitty gritty of running a law practice (hiring a secretary, paying office rent); and the ups and downs of bringing a case (preparing papers for court, going to trial). Players also land on spaces, where they are directed to pick cards describing all sorts of interesting and amusing (and family-friendly) case scenarios.

When a card is chosen, a player must decide whether to accept the result or appeal it. On an appeal, a player may double or even triple his award -- or lose some or even all of it.

Instead of advancing when it's their turn, players may also choose to settle a case by drawing a Settlement card. Like appealing, settling a case can result in gaining -- or losing -- part or all of one's winnings.

Players may also double the stakes by buying into a partnership. All awards and costs are doubled for partners. Whether or not to become a partner is therefore a key strategic decision, and adds to the suspense and intrigue, as everyone wonders whether it will pay to have become one.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Butterfly Effect
description:
Butterfly Effect is the game of Unintended Consequences. A hilarious game where you put your mind to the test. Can you explain what happened? Use your quick wits and a healthy dose of the ridiculous. Fun for friends and family as you compete to see who can master the CHAOS.

How to play:
The Butterfly Effect (also known as Chaos Theory) came from an age old saying - A butterfly flaps its wings in China causing a Tornado in America. This is the idea that a small change can create far reaching ramifications somewhere else.
So how do you play?
It’s very easy to play. Each player gets handed out a series of cards:
A Person
An Action
A Start Location
Players take it in turns with the first player putting down 2 cards:
A Disaster
A Destination
The other players then have to select a Person, Action and Start Location set of cards to create a story of how the Disaster happened at the Destination location.

—description from the publisher

name: Ivy Towers
description: Each player has a ladder of success that he must climb. Each rung of the ladder has a corresponding space on the outer (Monopoly like) track of the board and you must land on that space to progress. On a roll of the dice you can move forward the difference or backward the total of the dice. You cannot land on a space occupied by another player (the only interaction) and there are the ever present "chance cards" here in 2 flavors, credit and society. The playing pieces are appropriately Izod alligators. First player to climb to the top of the ladder of success is the winner.

name: Drug Attack
description:
Drug Attack
Springboard to Family Communications
An informative game on drug abuse

Something unseen is happening in your community now! Are you aware of the drug culture? How does drug abuse affect your community, your family? What can be done about the problem? Solutions are necessary here and now!

The answer to these problems await you when you play Drug Attack. Learn how to identify and help drug abusers. Learn how to cope with criminal drug pushers.

Drug Attack involves you as a Mayor, Health Officer, or Agent striving to save their community from a drug disaster. Together, they must detect the attack, meet it, and treat its victims.

Drug Attack is being played in schools throughout the United States. It is an ideal game for establishing family communication on the subject of drugs. It is a game of urgency -- a game of today!
