publishers: Dynamic Games / Dynamic Design Industries, Technicon Medical Information Systems Corporation

name: Captain Caveman and the Teen Angels Game
description: Children's game in which players move around the board collecting Trouble Cards that randomly appear.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dilemma
description:
The designer writes:

"Dilemma is a two player strategy game that is easy to learn and its fast-paced action creates extreme adrenaline pumping excitement. Dilemma has been designed to be played at a swift pace which calls for instant decision making, when players are faced with the Dilemma of attacking their opponents advancement or running for Home Base.

Dilemma is unique, a completely new concept unlike any other board game. From strategies taken from the worlds leading board games, chess and backgammon, comes 13 years of development to create the fast-paced, quick thinking, adrenaline pumping board game Dilemma."

In reality this is a dice rolling game seemingly targeted at children (Ages 7 and up). Two players have three kinds of pieces on an abstract board: Attackers, Beacons and Guardians. The Attackers are numbered 1 to 5 and each turn a die is rolled - the Attacker with that number may move. The Attackers take two steps each to surround a Beacon, which, when surrounded by three Attackers is destroyed and one of the Attackers teleports to another board to attack the opponents Guardian. You win by either surrounding the opponents Guardian by three Attackers in this manner of moving your Guardian to Home Base. The Guardian can move whenever you roll a 6. Alternately on a roll of 6 you may remove one your opponents Attackers from around one of your Beacons. On 6 you can advance or defend - this is apparently the dilemma.

In this manner you roll dice, move, roll, dice, move until someone wins. The strategy content is literally zero and there seems a reasonable chance the game won't end at all (as it is less likely to roll the numbers needed to advance than to hinder your opponent).

The pieces are elegantly cast out of soft plastic and the board is attractive in a spacey abstract kind of way.

The game was published on the Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia, and was probably never widely circulated in spite of the designers claim:

"Social Championships and World Championships are to be played using the same rules. The rules are: You must declare you are playing for the championship title. The best player over three games only is the champion. If you lose to the champion you cannot challenge again for twelve months, The only way you can challenge before that time is if the champ loses the title to another challenger, you may then challenge that champion. It is advisable not to play for the championship title until you are confident that you have played enough games to learn all strategies involved in winning the game. The longest title held by a champion (as at December 1994) is 23 challenges over 1 year."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reunion
description:
From the box:
"How can an ordinary game bring people together in an extraordinary way? By encouraging them to share--about their childhood, their feelings, about imaginary situations, about their perceptions of others, and much more. REUNION invites people to express themselves in a warm, non-competitive atmosphere. You'll find excitement, surprises, and the delight of getting to know others better.
Play as long as you like. There are no losers. Everyone is a winner!"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Escape from Frankenstein
description:
From the box:

Build the Monster then get ready to run! If he catches you - he'll scare you back to the start!

In the dungeon is a laboratory with parts from an experiment that was never finished - an experiment to build the legendary Frankenstein! But suddenly - piece by piece - he comes together. Then he starts to come after you!

On each turn, you roll the die, move your playing piece and start to build Frankenstein.

First you add the head, then the arms, and finally the legs. When he is totally built, he starts moving along the gameboard...one space at a time. If he catches you...he'll send you back to the start!

So don't look back! Just keep on moving and trying to Escape from Frankenstein! The first player to race out of the dungeon wins!

2 to 4 players Ages 6 and up
publishers: Peter Pan Playthings, Playtoy Industries, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Operation Grozny the SS Strikes 1942
description:
On Sept. 26, 1942, the last German effort north of the Terek river in the Caucasus began. This time it was the 5th SS Wiking conducting the attack through the narrow Altar valley near Malobek. The object was to reach Grozny and its oil or to move south to force the entrenched Russians to retreat. Facing the SS were a collection of Soviet forces well dug in and supplied with artillery on the 1000-2000 ft hills surrounding the valley. Their armor amounted to mostly British Valentine and American M3 tanks. The SS plan called for the infantry to clear the towering hills overlooking the valley while the 50 Panzers and SPWs raced through the narrow valley filled with defensive positions and AT trenches. The SS Commander, Steiner, had strong reservations about this attack and for good reason.

The game comes with over 270 counters, rulebook, playing aid, one 11 x 17 map. Game scale is company/battalion, 800 yds a hex, daily turns.

name: Flaggparad
description:
A ludo type game where the colors are replaced with the Danish, Norwegian, Swedish and Finish flags.

The difference from ludo is that you want to land on another players flag-symbol on the board to collect either one of your flag (worth 2 points) or steal a flag from another player (worth 1 point). If a player no longer have any of his/her flags, that player is out from the game, otherwise is the player with most points that wins.

name: Familienfeier
description: Family Fire is a card game published by the designer Edith Schlichting, who also drew the pictures. The cards show a variety of portraits of family members, men, women and children of all ages. The 70 cards are also numbered 0-9. You must build a set to complete your guest list before the others.

name: Spot-A-Shot
description: First basketball board game played with customized dice. Follows the rules of basketball. Only game exhibited in the Indiana Basketball Hall of Fame.

name: Dudley Dodo's Environment Game
description:
DUDLEY DODO'S ENVIRONMENT GAME is aimed at teaching about the environment and the sensitive relationship between man and other forms of life.

Players take it in turns to roll the dice and move the playing piece in a clockwise or anticlockwise direction around the board answering questions on the environment as they go.

A majority of the squares on the board are coloured red, brown, blue or green representing the following subjects - animals, the universe, water and plants. On landing on one of these squares a question is asked corresponding to the colour of the square. A successfully answered question allows a player to roll and move again. If the question is answered incorrectly, the turn ends. It should be noted that there are "family" questions for older players and "junior" questions for younger players.

If a player lands on one of the four "Dudley Dodo" squares (there is one for each category/colour) he is similarly asked a question of the appropriate category. A correct answer at this point earns one piece of the four-piece Dudley Dodo jigsaw.

The environment square requires players to draw a card and follow the instructions (miss a turn, gain/lose a Dudley Dodo card, etc.).

The first player to successfully collect all four pices of the Dudley Dodo jigsaw wins the game.

name: Black Magic Ritual Kit
description:
Avalon Hill's trademark for its Psychic Demonstration Kit.

Produced by AH in 1974, concurrent with the Witchcraft Ritual Kit.
Both kits were based on research by Dr. Brooke Hayward Jennings.

From the back of the box:

"Please read carefully. You have in your possession a kit that allows you to simulate the magic circle accurate with all the specifics needed for the hour of casting according to traditional rituals.

You have further a ritual made of authentic, traditional passages of the textbooks of magic.

It is precisely from such elements that the tradition of magic and spirit conjuration have been derived.

The makers of this kit have been concerned only to explain the principle parts and demonstrate how the magic tradition is used. The consequences of performing the ritual are dependent upon the psychic awareness level and skill of the performer. It is here recognized that persons vary as to their level of psychic awareness and belief in spirit worlds.

No claims are made with this kit as to results. The ritual has been modified to assure beneficial spirits. Use of the kits for other purposes is beyond control of the maker.

Use the kit in fun and stay within the confines of the spirit indicated. These spirits are good and will serve you well. And, you may have fun as your mind and spirit relate to these forces.

Convert the image to malevolent spirits at your risk. Remember Crowley's warning that the textbooks of magic are all that are required to conjure any spirit."

name: How To Lose A Guy in 10 Days
description: Very simple roll and move game, where players try to pick up rewards and avoid traps. It was released as a promotional tie-in to the film.

name: Buck Fever Challenge
description:
From the box back:

"Are you ready for the ULTIMATE hunting challenge? If so, Buck Fever Challenge puts the challenge of the hunt at your fingertips. This award-winning board game puts you in the pursuit of the North American deer in the comfort of your own home. The objective of the game is to be the first hunter to obtain a legal deer and return to camp. To accomplish this, you the hunter may be challenged by other hunters, bears, wolves, nature’s obstacles, and the law. Buck Fever Challenge can be enjoyed by the entire family. From the novice hunter to the seasoned hunter."

name: Masters of the Universe Snake Mountain Rescue Game
description: Very similar to Operation. Players must use a special sword to pick cards out of a plastic 3D Snake Mountain. Hitting the sides of the card holder results in Skeletor popping up and the card being eaten. Requires batteries.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Roll-a-Role
description:
Roll-a-Role is a game in which the participants become actors presenting three minute dramas focused on particular situations. And they're not only actors, they provide their own script and direction.

All that's required is a free-spirited and imaginative group of players - Roll-a-Role provides the rest!

name: The Stupid Game
description:
At the beginning of the game, each player places a randomly selected sign/label on their head that only the other players can see. This sign/label either says "I'm supposed to be stupid", "I'm supposed to be smart", "I can't win" or "I can't lose". Each player in turn moves one of their three playing pieces from a start position around a dartboard-shaped board.
The playing field has various colored and uncolored spaces on it. Movement is done by using dice rolls and following arrows on the board.
Every time the player lands on a colored space they must claim that space by performing a "Stupid Stunt" from the rule book. Failure to perform the stunts means the player must start over.
Each player is trying to land on either three spaces of the same color if they think they have a smart sign/label on their head or three different colored spaces if they think they have a stupid sign/label on their head. Once they get the three spaces they want they stand up and shout they are smart or stupid. If they are correct in their guess they win, if not they get a new label and start over.

name: Frank Hyde's Footy Game
description:
Simulating a game of Rugby League of Australia vs England.

Spin the spinner to select a player to move. Roll the dice, move chosen player that many squares. Take an 'Action' card and follow instructions. Object is to get a player over the opponents try line.

name: College Pursuit
description:
(from the rules booklet)

The purpose of College Pursuit is to make studying for the Scholastic Aptitude Tests (SATs) a little easier, a lot more fun, and consequently, much more valuable to you. It is both a game, which encourages repeated play and review, and an educational tool that:

Increases your comprehension and retention of material;

Pinpoints each player's area of weakness;

Gives you actual SAT equivalent scores as an indication of accomplishment.
publishers: Cowan and Gadd, Simon & Schuster, Inc.

name: DidYa Know
description: A wonderfully simple game that can be enjoyed by young and old alike. Whether spending time together at home or traveling on vacation, families and friends can have a few laughs together sharing their own life stories by answering the DidYa Know story questions. Things really get interesting when players swap cards and then attempt to re-tell each other’s stories.

name: Grand Slam Tennisspel
description:
A tennis game where the outcome of each shot is determined by rolling a die. Each ball is a series of rolls of the five different dice. There is one die for serves, one for second serve, one for baseline play, one for short balls and one for high balls.

There are no choices to be made. The dice are rolled back and forth between the two players until someone wins the ball. With this tool for determine balls, matches can be played according to normal tennis rules. There are no rules for which of the players of one side is rolling dice when, when playing doubles.

From package (rough translation from Swedish): "With Grand Slam Tennisspel you can play tennis wherever you are. You can play single or double. Always exciting."

name: Panda Picnic Party
description: Four real, plush panda bears are included. The bears must gather apples, oranges, pears, and plums as they climb through the trees. But they must also be careful not to fall out. Is that branch strong enough to hold a panda? How high can you go? It's easy to cuddle up to this game. Hold on tight!

name: Your Hometown Tycoon Game
description: Your Hometown Tycoon Game, published by Fun & Games, offers up a gaming experience similar to, or perhaps simpler than monopoly and other basic roll-and-move/property accumulation type games. Various editions exist each of which are marketed with a local context by including pictures, properties, and business names familiar to specific city (e.g. Madison, WI). Each edition is identifiable not only by its contents, but also by paste-ups featuring a "hometown" applied to the box front.

name: VitiVini
description:
From the Press release:

VitiVini is a fun new card game that is based on wine and how to pair it with food. We have put an entire course on wine into a fun game that does not require you to know anything about wine to have fun playing it. The game is played with Question Cards that have three questions on three difficulty levels, Fact Cards in five different categories (Grapes, Regions, Wine Making, History, and Food Pairing), six types of Wild Cards (Challenge, Confiscate, Money, Return, Skip, and Reverse), and Coins. Players take turns answering questions to earn Fact Cards and Coins that they can use towards creating a winning hand. A die is also included for players who want to randomize question selection. The game is accompanied by a brochure containing an overview on wine, the wine regions, maps, and the rules to the game.

name: The Irish Rhyming Game
description: A simple roll-and-move game which is designed to give even footing to children and adults. Be the first around the board rhyming your words before the timer runs out and you win. On each move, a player rolls the die and selects a card from the appropriate deck. They then have 30 seconds to list words that rhyme with the word on the card. The number on the die indicates how many rhyming words they need to name, and if the succeed, that is how many spaces they move ahead. The cards for adults have more difficult words. Manufacturers recommend the game for ages 5 through adult.

name: Bark Future
description:
Bark Future - Where Dogs Rule and Humans Drool.

The game is set in post-apocalypse USA. The majority of the Earth’s surface has been destroyed in a nuclear holocaust and mankind was largely wiped out. In their place has stepped the mutated canines who now rule the world. They are picking out a future from the dustbins of history.

Published in Games Review Monthly, June 1989, Issue 9.

name: The Kanji Game
description:
From the back of the box: Kanji symbols are an ancient Chinese method of writing that was introduced to Japan almost 2,000 years ago. Kanji symbols are visual representations of words, word fragments or entire ideas. While there are as many as 50,000 Kanji in existence, Japanese people use only about 2,000 today.

For 2 to 4 players ages 5 and up.

THE OBJECT: To be the player to collect the most points by the end of the round.

HOW TO PLAY: The Kanji game has three levels of play. Set up the double-sided playing board according to the level of play you choose. Divide the 176 cards into four card groups: GO, 1-2-3, Kanji and Dot. Give the arrow a spin and let the race begin.

A card is drawn and players must think and react quickly as they learn how to speak, read and visualize Kanji symbols. The first player to find the card's exact match on the playing board (matching color and symbol) and to place his or her pawn on the match wins the card. Did you draw a Kanji Samurai card? Now you must draw the Kanji symbol, the final step in putting it all together!

Whoever has the most points at the end of the round wins that game! Sounds easy? Think again!

What are you learning? Not only are players learning the elements of a foreign language, they are also building the skills necessary to improve mathematics, memory, concentration and visual relationships while actively being motivated to think, respond and learn!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Let's F*ck!
description:
From the publisher:

"Do you like to F*ck? If so, you'll love this f*cking game! Use the spinner to move around the board until one of your markers lands on the bed. Then you spin the spinner and start F*cking in the position the spinner points to."

Components: Board, spinner, four pawns.

name: Opportunity
description:
Opportunity is a political game from back in the Reagan era. It is subtitled "or how to get out of tough situations" and also lists what appears to be a quote from Ronald Reagan "Play this game at the first opportunity"

This game is Vagabondo, in a different box.

name: Commands of Christ
description: This game is basically a vehicle for memorizing Scripture to overcome sin and temptation. Players use the spinner to move around the board. After landing on a "Wisdom Card" space, a player has the opportunity to collect 1 to 3 Wisdom cards if he can memorize "Commands of Christ" (Bible verses) printed on the cards. A Temptation space causes a player to go to one of the 3 pits, where he must memorize a verse for overcoming temptation. If the verse can't be quoted within the allotted time frame, a Pit card must be drawn and acted upon with negative results such as making the player lose cards already collected. The player with the most cards collected at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Bible Card Game
description:
Bible Card Game is a religious variation on Go Fish. Cards are numbered 1-13, with each number representing a biblical prophets and persons. (The cards go from Adam and Eve to Paul.) There are also four suits, Churches, Stars, Stone Tablets, and Rods. Players ask others for the cards they need to complete the "Books" by asking for the name of the person pictured on the card.

The rules make note that this deck of cards is appropriate for other standard card games as well.

name: Euro-game
description: The goal of of the game is to let people get acquainted with the new European currency, the Euro. The game is a roll-and-move game with questions and answers and chance, option and assignment cards. You win by getting a complete series of Euro-coins and notes.

name: Jimmyjack Baseball
description:
From the box:

"Uncle Jimmy, let's play some baseball."
"OK Jack, batter up!"
Baseball fans everywhere understand a solo homer, a two run dinger and a grand slam. However, during the early days of baseball, a three run homer was called a JIMMYjack.
JIMMYjack BASEBALL
Paying tribute to a special relationship and the always exciting three run homer.
Each JIMMYjack game box includes two decks of game cards, one game board, one scoring pad, two dice, 18 baseball tokens and one JIMMYjack Baseball ground rules and instruction manual.

Ages 8 and Up.

name: Władcy Smoków
description:
Simple bluffing game for youngsters. Every player has miniatures dragons and an identical set of order cards. The play consists of simultaneous secret assignment of orders to the dragons. The point is to outsmart your opponent and kill his dragon by wounding him 3 times.

'Władcy Smoków' (Dragon Lords) were included as a free gift in issue 46 and 47 of the Polish edition of 'Kaczor Donald' (Donald Duck) magazine published December 2007.

name: EcoRanch
description: The game is set on a ranch that takes in abused and neglected animals. The players are volunteers who adopt an animal and try to herd animals to the foster pens while caring for all their needs. In the process, players have to make choices, either just do the work, or stop and help others with theirs, which earns enlightened point chips. The winner of the game has the most of those.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Speed Racer Collectible Card Game
description:
Hurtling down the track, careening around, over, and through the competition, Speed Racer is a natural behind the wheel. Born to race cars, Speed is aggressive, instinctive and, most of all, fearless. His only real competition is the memory of the brother he idolized - the legendary Rex Racer - whose death in a race has left behind a legacy that Speed is driven to fulfill. Playground Maniacs announces this brand-new Clear Card Game series featuring 130 game cards boasting stunning transparent technology and randomly inserted 'Glitter' chase cards. 5 cards per pack / 24 packs per box.


Microbadges:

name: Touneril
description:
Two players have an army of 1 flag, 11 sailors, 1 submarine and 2 torpedo-boats. The game is strongly focused on geometry. The goal of the game is to either capture the enemy flag or take possession of the island in the middle of the board.

36 diagrams are included in the rulebook.

name: Global Ody-See
description:
Global Ody-See is a three-dimensional (3-D) travel game designed to teach people about the world, its natural features, nations, people and their culture. Our first version will be a traditional board game but it will be special in many respects. The game uses beautiful satellite imagery and players can choose to travel along realistic 3-D routes between places of interest using different transportation modes.

Watch it being played: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dsx8nP6m0KY

name: Oluja 1995
description:
Croation kids game for 4 kids. Called "Oluja 1995" in Croation, this game is sure to be controversial.

Josip Brnic explains to Croatian media:
"I came up with this idea around 3 years ago, listening to all negative stories about the Operation Storm. I didn't want that people forget about this very important moment for Croatia. The game is meant for 4 players, and each one has it's figure and throws the dice. Depending on the dice result, player takes over the fields on the board, and the start position is in the area of Croatian Kostajnica (pron. as "Ko-staay-nee-tza"). All along the line where Croatian army passed are drawn tanks, Serbian soldier and Croatian soldiers, that are shown as bigger and stronger. The winner is the first one that reaches Knin".

name: Kyllingjakten
description:
Kyllingjakten is a children's game with an interesting use of magnets. The players move a hen around the board to try to find her missing chickens. When the hen reaches designated places, the player moves them next to the nearby chicken to see if they attract each other. If they do, they belong together, and the player must bring the chicken back to the hen house.

The hens and the chickens have plastic feet with magnets of both orientations, so that each chicken belongs to exactly two hens. With two players, one should use two hens of opposite orientations, and with three players, the game is very unbalanced.

Contents: Game board, die, hens and chickens, magnetic plastic feet.

name: Cayley's Mousetrap
description:
This is a nineteenth century solitaire card game invented by Arthur Cayley, one of the most famous mathematicians in history.

The game uses a set of numerically numbered cards instead of a standard playing card deck.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cayley%27s_mousetrap

name: Gossip Girl Never Have I Ever Game
description:
Popularity is not a game - play at your own risk
There's a price to pay to be a part of that world
Each card has 5 types of juicy questions: Gossip, Style, School, Family and Dating
You win when you have taken down all the other players and you are the Queen Bee holding all the cash
Includes 5-sided die, allowance money, rule sheet, key card and 100 question cards
Manufacturer's Suggested Ages 16 and up
For 3 or More Players
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Bible Basketball
description:
Essentially a timed Bible trivia game with questions that a high school kid who attended a Christian school could answer. There can be two players or teams of players, along with one quizmaster. Games can be two 15-minute halves or four 8-minute quarters.

Sample Question:
Hook shot; two points.
Q: What was the name of the angel who told Mary she would be the mother of Jesus?
A: Gabriel.

name: Picture Puzzles
description:
A simple word deduction game from the 1930s, produced as part of a series by Party Game Publishers (PGP) of Luton in Bedfordshire, England.

The games consist of 18 cards (games), each of which is printed with a black and white line drawing. Beneath the drawing is a cryptic clue to look for something in the drawing - for example, the drawing might be of two boxers fighting, and the cryptic clue might be, "spot the drink". The answer is "punch", which is something depicted in the drawing and which is also a drink.

The purpose of the game is for each player to see all 18 cards, and solve as many of the clues as they can within a set time.

Good production values - cards are heavy duty and well printed - but limited replay value, as once you have worked out the clues on each card there is no point in playing the game again as you know all of the answers. Simple pleasures for simple folk.

name: Dice Motor Racing Game
description:
Dice Motor Racing Game is a small dice racing game which comes in a tube.

Content:

2 spot dice
1 special chance die
4 counters
1 race circuit board
1 instruction

The players try to reach the finish at first to win the race. At some situations the player have to roll the chance die which brings some positve or negative effects like moving some spaces forward or backward.

name: The Underground Railroad
description:
Navigate your way throughout the United States and learn about the Safe Houses throughout the United States. Traveling along the Underground Railroad to freedom took weeks, if not months and years, to accomplish. Relive the African American struggle for freedom and the courage it took for the slaves to trek their way all over the United States as you move your piece along the map of the Underground Railroad.

Part of Pressman's Black Heritage Series.
categories: American Civil War, Children's Game, Educational
publishers: Geebee Marketing, Inc., Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Operation Ufo
description:
Very basic electronic game that transfers a stone/paper/scissors mechanic to a UFO battle game. Was heavily advertised on German tv when published.
A nice curiosity is the "upside down" Enterprise masquerarding as a UFO on the cover. Production values were very cheap, even for it's time.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Electronic, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Bank of America Baseball
description: Monopoly game with Major League Baseball teams as the properties and other baseball related themes for the other board spaces. The game is branded with 'Bank of America'.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: MacBeth
description:
Mac Beth is a hexagonal variant of Othello and is played on a 6x6 hexagonal board.
On each turn,each player pass his turn or drops a stone on an empty cell if at least one opponent stone is between that stone and another friendly stone.All opponent stones that were between those stones flip their color.
The flip may occur in more than one direction in the same turn.
When both players have passed,wins the one with more stones.

name: Grand Slam
description:
A Game for Two Players

The object of the game is to try to place four counters of the same colour in a row. Players take turns to throw the four dice (2 yellow, 2 white), and put a counter on a square on the board according to the dice score, with yellow dice counting on the horizontal axis, and white dice on the vertical axis.

The game art is tennis based, but there is no real tie in with tennis in the game itself.

This is a precis of the rules from the rule book.

name: Sacramento-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Sacramento! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some gold miners, cobbled steets, the arts, a great big Tower Bridge, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; Sacramento-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Sacramento! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Aqua: Around the World
description:
Aqua Around the World is a trivia game based on the pop band Aqua. It is branded official Aqua merchandise.

From the back of the box (translated from Swedish):
You are Aqua's manager and supposed to plan the coming world tour - a task that takes both overview and planning!
You compete for becoming the player that first completes their Aqua world tour by visiting all cities, assigned at game start. During the game you will encounter chance-cards, where you will try your luck and thus you may get an extra dice throw or miss your next turn.
You will also have to answer questions about the group and the group members.
Much enjoyment!

name: A Cut Above
description:
Trivia game from an age when smoking and board games could be related. Unusual large triangular box. Published by a cigarette maker, intending that pub landlords might leave the game in the bar for customers to play. Game equipment:
1 Magnetic Playing Board
A set of 5 playing counters (and 2 spare sets)
896 Question and Answer cards
4 Winner's Medals
1 cord to hang the board on a wall if required
The board looks like a cross between Pictionary and Ludo. It is intended that teams of 4 people play. When your team gets to answer a question, they can choose A Snip (easy), A Cut (medium) or A Cut Above (difficult). The subject they get is determined by the colour of the space they are on. The sujects are:
Purple: General Knowledge
Blue: Sport
Red: TV and Films
Yellow: Music
If you are correct, your marker moves forward either 1, 2 or 3 spaces on your track. The winning team is the first to get to the end of their track. And, Yes, the team get real-life metal medals, each with a ribbon cord.

name: Spartuna
description:
Monopoly-Style game branded for the "Sparkasse Osterholz Scharmbeck". In the game you try to get the most victory points. Money is just worth one VP each, debts are minus and you get VP for your career. All players are workers in the bank you start from "clerk" and can end as director.

Game end after one player is a director

name: Egg-a-thon
description:
Egg-a-thon is a free game given out by Cadbury's and Royal Mail to celebrate the 2012 Olympic games.

The aim of the game is to move your two pieces from one side of the board to the other by rolling and moving the rolled number. the bad egg roll is miss a go, and the good egg roll is move one space and roll again.

The game includes two traffic cones but no rules for them. the rules state they are for you to be creative with.

The board is an 11x4 grid so a total of 22 is required to win, hoever you can move to block others if you wish. Overall a very simple game with very limited strategy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pyramid Game
description: Simple roll and move around a plastic pyramid. On the top of the pyramid there is a big gem. Thise gem will be spinned and shows different numbers (works as a die). There are also mummies hindering the players to reach the top. First player to reach the top on his colored stairs wins.

name: Knuff
description:
This is supposedly a traditional Swedish game, although no information is given about its age or origin.

The two players begin with six pawns each arranged around a grid of squares. A player takes their turn by rolling a die and moving a pawn that many squares in a straight line. Landing on a pawn of your own colour knocks it back to a starting position. Landing on a pawn of your opponent's colour captures it.

When one player has captured all the opposing pawns, they receive points equal to their own number of remaining pawns, and the board is set up for another round. The winner of the game is the first to reach 50 points.

name: Him and Her
description: Distribute the cards all round the room where the party is being held. Guests are encouraged to mingle and, whilst chatting, note down the answers to the 12 cartoon images. Each image depicts a character doing something - the guests have to work out what.

name: Air Soccer
description:
A plastic board and 4 plastic foorballers are attached to handles. They work exactly the same as a pinball machine. Both players try to swing their footballers so that they can 'kick' the ball towards the opponent's goal.

The winner is the one who scores the most goals.

name: Soccer
description:
British edition. The board has little indentations, into which the ball might roll. When it settles into the indentation in front of one of your players, you can bend him a little and let go. The ball will now be 'kicked', hopefully to one of your other players.

Most goals wins.

name: Paths of Destiny
description:
Paths of Destiny takes players into the world of fantasy arena. In this turn based strategy game two players will command a team of 5 Pathwalkers, selected from a lineup of 8 different Pathwalkers with individual unique abilities and pit their tactical skills against one another in an intense battle of life and death.

Players will take turns to maneuver their Pathwalkers on a hexagonal grid, and using cards that represent different body parts, players will engage in a game of chance and guesswork that simulates the exchanging of blows.

Players score points by injuring their opponent’s Pathwalkers, incapacitating their body parts and rendering them unconscious. The player that scores 20 points first wins the game.

name: Reguły Gry
description:
Reguły Gry is fast, simple, card game licensed television station TVN7. It is based on the mechanism of exchange of cards and memory. Reguły Gry is also a Polish television series production of all-star cast (Julia Kaminska, Maciej Zakościelny, Paweł Wilczak, Katarzyna Kwiatkowska and Jan Jankowski).

The goal is to get 5 tokens with images of the main characters from Reguły Gry TV series. In turn, each player plays in front of him one of the four cards and must remember the name of this card. Then each player gives their cards to the left neighbor ang gains cards from the right neighbor (after that each player refills his hand up to 4 cards from the deck). Once the face-down in the stack to make the cards a player collects 4 cards with the image of the same characters from the show, to announce it. If he was right - achieved the first token. First collect five tokens wins the game.


Reguły Gry to szybka, nieskomplikowana, karciana gra imprezowa na licencji stacji telewizyjnej TVN7. Oparta jest na mechanizmie wymiany kart i zapamiętywaniu. Reguły Gry to także polski serial produkcji telewizji TVN z gwiazdorską obsadą (Julia Kamińska, Maciej Zakościelny, Paweł Wilczak, Katarzyna Kwiatkowska oraz Jan Jankowski).

Celem gry jest zdobycie 5 żetonów z wizerunkami głównych bohaterów serialu. W turze każdy z graczy zagrywa przed siebie jedną z 4 kart i powinien zapamiętać jaka to karta. Następnie podaje swoje karty sąsiadowi i otrzymuje nowe od drugiego z sąsiadów (dobiera do nich jedną kartę z talii). Gdy tylko w zakrytym stosie do którego dokłada karty, któryś z graczy zbierze 4 karty z wizerunkiem tej samej postaci z serialu, ogłasza to. Jeśli nie pomylił się - uzyskuje pierwszy żeton. Kto pierwszy zbierze 5 żetonów wygrywa grę.

name: Pass out
description:
Object of the Game: To be the player with the most markers on the board at the end of the game.

Game Play: Two (2) players need a pair of dice and fifteen (15) markers each. Player with the dark markers throws the dice first. The numbers as shown on the dice (either individual numbers or combination of the two dice) are then covered on the board. When all twenty-one (21) spaces on the board are covered, the game is over.

The game board contains 21 squares each containing a picture of 2 dice rolls (i.e. one square has a picture of 2 smaller squares, one with three (3) dots, the other with two (2), representing a possible roll) each square contains a different possible roll.

name: Nový mejdan
description:
Go on a real party with unrestrained entertainment and a number of pitfalls. The game is great, especially when meeting the company of close friends. Joint moments full of fun!

Each player has two same color pieces with which progresses to a party and then back home to bed after party. First player marching with one, and only after a successful trip with the other one.

Players roll a dice, make move and complete tasks; such as beg coin from other players, make them give their hair, tell some story etc.

---
Vydej se na opravdový mejdan s nevázanou zábavou a množstvím nástrah. Hra je skvělá, zejména sejde-li se společnost blízkých přátel. Společné chvíle plné zábavy!

name: Monkey go!
description: The monkeys need to cross a river full of dangers. The length of the playing field is determined at the players' discretion. A starting shore is set up. The active player rolls a die, then picks up the corresponding number of tiles from a stack and places them adjacent to the starting shore. The tiles have different effects, there are crocodiles or tree trunks which slow down the monkeys, other tiles speed them up. The first player to reach the other side of the river wins.

name: TAG: Terrorist Attack Game
description:
"Whoever you may be: Terrorist, Insurgent, Mercenary, Marine, Sailor, Soldier or Airman: Know your terrain, your weapon, your equipment and conquer your opponent! The new fast moving strategic card name - TAG Stunning original artwork and ever changing, unique game play!"

The game is won or lost over a number of rounds. After choosing your character roll the d6 to equip them with weapons, armor, training or vehicles. The more the better, but remember your opponent will be doing the same, try not to get weapons or items that are incompatible with the terrain you are battling on. Once you feel you are equipped enough face your opponent in singles combat where only one person will come out alive! The game consists of 150 cards and 3 dice two of which are unique to this game.

name: Owl Game
description:
The owl game was one of the most popular games during Mozart's time in Salzburg. It is a game of pure luck, with three dice for two or more players.
Each player receives a decided number of chips (e.g. twelve) and puts half of them in the center of the board. The first player then throws the dice. The combination of the three values of the dice can be found on the board and the instructions written underneath each combination must be followed. If, for example, the field says "bezahlt" (or, in the mediaevel version, "bezalt", meaning: paid), the player has to pay the specified number of chips into the center of the board. But, if it says "nimmt" (or, in the mediaevel version, "nimbt" meaning: take), the player takes the specified number of chips fromt he center of the board. If a player cannot pay sufficient quantities of chips, he places the remaining chips from his/her stash into the center and drops out of this round of the game.

The game lasts until only one player is left with chips, or until any one player has thrown three sixes. In this lucky case, she/he gets all the chips fromt he center of the board and is thus the big winner of the round. Then, a new round can be started.

name: Babes in the Woods
description:
Objective: players striving to be the first to reach center and back out again.
- moving by turns -
each player moves according spinner, starting from a pink corner space; each player attempts to move towards the center space - called 'Heart of the Woods'. Red spaces on the board must be reached by exact spin in order to move in (later out) of the circle; once reaching the centre, players then turn around and move back out to any of the (pink) starting spaces.
remarks:
should be published ~ 1900

name: Don't Tip the Waiter
description:
Objective: be the first one getting rid of all your pieces
- acting by turns -
Each player at the start of the game has a set of pieces in one colour. Two dice direct a.) the tray & b.) how many playing pieces must be placed on the waiters’ trays.
Playing pieces may be placed in any order except for the coffee pot and the cheese dish which must be the last items.
The six waiters are positioned in such a way that as one falls, the next waiter may also tumble. Dropped pieces must be taken of whatever colour and add them to your own.

Note:
This is not the same game as Don't Tip the Waiter, Don't Tip the Waiter or Don't Tip The Waiter.

name: Beer Fest The Board Game
description:
Beer drinking trivia game.2-8 players
Realy learn about beer! Collect cards to gain advantages over you opponet. No dice.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Leben in Göttingen
description:
Published about the German City of Göttingen.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Bielefeld. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: The Reservation Road Planner: Tribal Board Game
description: The Reservation Road Planner: Tribal Board Game which was developed to educate its players about the environment in which transportation is planning, financed, and developed and to help facilitate increased public involvement within the tribal community in their transportation initiatives. This game has been effective in increasing the availability of user-friendly information regarding the transportation planning process. It has also enabled the tribal community to understand the challenges associated with highway planning and to become more engaged in transportation planning projects in their community. The game describes the various stages involved in reservation road planning including: Develop a Plan, Indian Reservation Road Inventory, Funding, Preconstruction, and Construction. An overview is also provided regarding the various public involvement options associated with each planning stage. The game utilizes scenarios to explain the challenges associated with each stage. Some of the lessons learned that will be featured include the utilization of user-friendly techniques for communicating the transportation planning process, the importance of tailoring information to meet specific needs of the tribal community, and the use of interactive techniques to engage the public in the transportation planning process. The board game was available by request at www.roadplanner.org, but the site is now defunct. You can still request a copy by contacting your local Bureau of Indian Affairs, or the public affairs department of the US Dept. of Transportation.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: U.S. Department of Transportation, United States Department of Transportation (USDOT), US Bureau of Indian Affairs (USBIA)

name: Culica
description:
Culica is a collection of 5 games all played with the same equipment. The game components consist of a 3 inch cube which has a 3 by 3 array of holes in each face, a set of pegs (which fit in the cube holes) of 4 different colours and a black bag.

Along with the normal meaning of adjacent, pegs are considered adjacent even if round the corner on an adjacent face.

The following are the rules to one of these games, "CuColours"
14 pegs of each colour are put in the bag. On their turn players draw one cube from the bag and place it in a legal hole on the cube if possible. Pegs may only be placed if adjacent to at least one other peg and no peg may adjacent to a peg of the same colour as that peg. The winner is the player who placed most pegs.
The other games are CuMolecula, CuSnakes, CuMatch and CuCombat.

name: War Eternal
description:
War Eternal is an epic strategy fantasy board game for 3-6 players in which players take on the roles of leaders of fantasy races fighting for the throne of ancient empire

War Eternal is played simultaneously, on a dynamic board that discourages "turtling". Players have to take terrain and change of season in account that greatly change in game conditions.
In game are introduced flexible magic system where depending on other factors spells can have various bonus effects, and rich economy system that gives every player possibility to play his race in many different ways.

name: Game of Goosey Gander
description:
Simple children's race game. Players roll a die to determine how many spaces to move and race around board to get back to the nest which contains the "Golden egg". It would take 68 spaces to go around the track from, and back to, the nest.

Markers - Each player gets one marker of a unique color.

Die - The player can advance as many spaces as thrown on the die. However there are three exceptions:


A player cannot pass another Goose. So if a player rolls a 3, and the space 3 spaces ahead is occupied, then the player can only move forward two spaces.
If a player lands on an egg spaces then he must move behind the the last player on the board. If there is still a player in the nest, then the move is back to the nest.
You don't have to return to the nest by an exact roll.


This game should not be confused with McLoughlin Bros.' "Goosy Goosy Gander" (1896), which is referred to as "Game of Goosey Gander" on the inside of the box. (Last-minute realization, perhaps?)
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Menko
description:
Menko is a Japanese game for two or more players. Originating during the middle Edo period (1700s), Menko was a popular children's game during that time.

The objective of the game is to flip the other players' cards or cardboard chips by striking the play area from above with a card or chip from the hand. The purpose is to create a gust of wind with the intent of flipping over one or more cards on the table. If a card is flipped, the player gets to keep it. The game continues until one player has won a set number or all of the cards in the game, and this player is the winner.

Menko cards are often decorated with images of power and military from the time. They continue to be made today in Japan.

It is assumed that Menko was brought to Hawaii at some point during the early 20th-century and eventually evolved into another popular and similar game, Pogs.

name: King's Night
description:
From the publisher:

An easy card & board & drinking game with many mini games, simple rules and cruel skills.

Every player draws a card at their turn. There are 3 types of cards in the deck: a mini-game, a skill and a rule.

If you draw a mini-game, you are going to play the game that is displayed on the card. Mini games are super easy to play and very exciting.
If you draw a skill, you can use it anytime you want. Items are powerful abilities that can be used to attack your enemy.
If you draw a rule, from now on, everyone must obey this rule.


Every time you lose a mini-game, disobey a rule or get hurt by a skill, you have to move your pawn on the board.

The player that reaches the exit first, has to drink the King's s shot. This is a mix of different drinks in one glass. Cards in the deck decide when & who is allowed to create this disgusting cocktail.

name: Alchemy of Askrias
description:
Alchemy of Askrias is a casual board game for 1 to 3 players (1 to 5 players with the added 4 to 5 player expansion). The game uses 'Askrias Cubes' which allow the players to socket game tiles, each of which have different abilities on them; which then allows the players to either create the victory points for the win or powerful spells to interfere with your opposing Alchemist's!

The game is focused mainly on actual dice building - each turn players will have the chance to add tiles to a 'Askrias Cube' depending on the formula that they choose which will then alter the way the game is played.

With extra cubes, the game can also be expanded up to 5 players.

name: You & Me: a game of love and intimacy
description:
A fun game for lovers promising exciting encounters and romantic inspirations. With 90 innovative ideas, sexy suggestions and adventurous activities, You & Me is a game where the taking part really is almost as good as winning!

Roll the dice to see who will enjoy the intimate attentions of their lover as they perform one of the many passionate pleasures prescribed by the cards.
The player performing the action is the one who receives the points.
The winner is the first player to reach 30 points.

name: Cooks of Cthulhu
description: The COOKS of the CULT OF CTHULHU meet for the annual cooking ceremony of the tentacle stew. Whoever manages to chop the best pieces off the RITUAL TENTACLE will be appointed CULT CHEF for the next year.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination

name: I'm so happy
description: Learn to recognize and name the 4 basic emotions with this game. The children take turns in rotating the dial. When the dial stops, the child whose turn it is, takes a card with the same face as indicated by the dial and places it on his assignment card. The first to fill his or her assignment card wins the game. The assignment cards are all different. It is possible to do a group activity with the large emotion cards or use the cards for group discussion.

name: Speak Out: Joe Santagato Edition
description:
Description from the publisher:

Pop a plastic mouthpiece in, say a phrase appearing on one of the game cards, and get your teammates to understand the phrase. Easy, right? No way! In this special edition of the popular SPEAK OUT game, with content written by Joe Santagato, the challenge is to speak clearly even though your mouth is just not working right! It's maddeningly fun to play, and absolutely hilarious to watch! For adults.

name: Monopoly Junior: Bakugan Battle Brawlers
description:
This appears to be one of several unlicensed themed versions of Monopoly Junior originating in China. Although Uncle Pennybags appears on the Monopoly Junior logo and (incongruously) on some game spaces and cards, there are no publisher logos or other crediting.

It seems there exist at least five cover variations: two with the Bakugan logo under the Monopoly logo ringed by characters, one of them with a flat Monopoly logo and one with a more elaborate fake-3D one; one with the Bakugan logo in the bottom left and three foreground characters; and two with the Bakugan logo at the bottom flanked by two foreground characters, one with English text and one with a Romanian flag and text.

The gameplay is identical to regular Monopoly Junior, with a nearly complete lack of player decisions. Players roll and move along the board, automatically purchasing visited properties, drawing chance cards, and performing monetary transactions until someone runs out of money. Properties are a selection of characters and other features from the Bakugan franchise.
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Planet Infraserv
description:
A promotional game from Infraserv Höchst. There is a game board depicting a central and eight outer planet, connected by paths. Players roll and move over the field, trying to reach the outer planets to collect one tile from each planet. On the way, players reach special fields where they can draw cards which speed up movement (or slows it down), or occasionally have other effects. Barricades can be used to block other players' ideal path. When a pawn steps on the same field as another pawn, it can steal a tile from that player.
The first player to collect all eight different tiles is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Paw Patrol Pups In Training
description:
Paw Patrol Pups in Training is a frantic, real-time game in which players mash spring-loaded "flippers" that cause their pups to leap into the air and -- hopefully! -- knock badges and treats off of a spinning, overhead carousel.

There are four badges and eight treats in all, with 'Badges' worth 3 points and 'Treats' 1 point each. When all badges and treats have been knocked off the carousel the players add up their points and the player with the most points wins!

(Game play is similar in style to Hungry Hungry Hippos.)

From the website:

Paw Patrol is on a roll!

Spring into action with the Paw Patrol Pups In Training Game! Your mission is to collect as many treats and badges as you can from the spinning target ring. Set up is easy, just place the treats and badges on the target ring and give it a spin. Then get behind your favorite Paw Patrol Character and press the Pup Flipper.

When you knock off a badge or treat hold on to it, each one is worth points. The player with the most points at the end wins!

(No batteries required.)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Gaming Quiz
description:
The perfect quiz for gaming fans. Put your knowledge to the test with this fast paced quiz game!

Contains 50 quiz cards & instructions.
categories: Card Game, Trivia, Video Game Theme

name: Trash
description:
"Ah, the life of a junk dealer. It always has been a romantic notion. Of course, the competition is a bit fierce at time.

For instance. You've got a whole load of junk to get rid of, but so do all the other dealers. And since you all use the same corporate buyer, you've always got to have something different in order to keep his attention.

So Load up the truck and get ready to deal before your competitors sell off their whole loads."

--From the front of the envelope

name: Warmaster Chess 2000. vol. 3
description:
New counters and rules for Warmaster Chess 2000, like Mines, Mountains and Nukes.

Published in 1998 and contained in Command magazine #51

name: Speak Out: All About Sports & Games
description: All About Sports & Games adds 144 new phrases to Speak Out.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Ανακύκλωσέ το
description: Recycling is very important! In this game players roll dice and move their pawns around the city. During their movement they come across different kinds of litter which they have to put in the according recyling bin in order to be the first one to entirely fill up their own bins and win the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Forgotten Legends: The Worm Emperor
description:
Forgotten Legends : The Worm Emperor is a high fantasy game set in the magical world of Aiine. Your goal is to prepare a foothold into an uncharted territory and sustain your war effort. Find and defeat the Prince of Despair, his majesty, the Worm Emperor, by breaking the three magic seals which protect his fortress and challenge him to a deadly duel.

Lured by the promise of earthly riches and eternal knowledge in an uncharted region of the realm, the party of Heroes must battle chimeric creatures, flesh and dark thoughts mingled together by magic and molded into fierce monsters born from the depths of a dreadful mind, complete trials which will reveal the very fabric of their soul, fight, scavenge, loot and trade to survive the journey and ultimately face the abominable overlord, the Master of Lies and Prince of Despair, his majesty, the Worm Emperor.

Replayability : The core of the game is entirely player driven. Heroes decide (individually or as a group) where the game is heading, from fighting an epic monster down to trading and building new dwellings in the castle they settled in. Many paths lead to victory.

Automa System: You move, his majesty, the Worm Emperor and his acolytes are moving as well. The enemy army is already on the march to conquer the regions and consolidate the domain of despair. Sooner or later, your armies will meet.

Castles and Outposts: A game within a game. You may start the adventure from any sub-region on the outskirts of the adventure map. Once settled in, you can build new dwellings, trade in the market for items, recruit creatures, complete puzzles and more.

Unique Adventure Map: Divided into three major regions and a fourth special inner region (controlled by the Worm Emperor) and counting more than 65 independent sub-regions the party of Heroes will have the freedom to explore a uniquely designed map with one-of-a-kind characteristics. Conquer cities, acquire resources, uncover mysteries and secret locations.

Modular Battlefield: Constantly changing its configuration depending on the sub-region you are exploring. The setup is randomly created each time your party clashes with a monster or a group of monsters. Terrain obstacles, power-up spots or de-buffs areas will hinder you or help you win the day.

---description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Negotiation
mechanics: Action/Event, Auction/Bidding, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Events, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Say What?!: The Adult Party Game!
description:
Say What?! The Adult Party Game!

The adult party game about conjuring up clues about ridiculously disgusting cards with sneaky deceptions and challenging bids.

Contents: 250 cards, 150 betting chips and a bottle opener to mark the correct card.

Go from party zero, to party hero – and reap the rewards that come along with Party Champ status.

An unsavory, nauseating and unwholesome specimen of a card game. Not to be confused with a savory, uneasy and wholesome legume.


Each player gets 10 of the sick and twisted cards, enough voting cards as there are players, and 10 green chips.
On your go pick one of your cards and say a clue about the card. The clue can be anything like “This is something Dave would do.” or “If my wife caught me doing this then she would probably join in.” or “This card is like something from Jurassic Park.” or if you don’t have much imagination then you can just say “This is very painful.”. The clue shouldn’t be too obvious or too obscure so finding the perfect balance is crucial.
Place your card face down on the table. All other players then choose one card from their hand that closely matches the clue. All cards are placed face down on the table and shuffled together.
All cards are then dealt face up on the place holder cards which are lettered A-F (for up to 6 players).
Once all ridiculous cards have been read out it is then time for all other players to choose a letter card and bet some chips on which card you think the initial clue was about.
Once all players have placed their bets with the somewhat strange betting chips the original card is revealed by placing the bottle opener on it.
All players can now reveal which card they thought it was by turning over their letter card. The players that guessed the correct card win the same amount of chips that they bet.
The players that guessed incorrectly have to give all of their bet chips to the player who played the card that misdirected them.
The winner is the player with the most chips!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Communication Limits, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Creepy Crawley Castle Game
description:
One player is the scantily clad "Victim" trying to escape the horrors of the Creepy-Crawley Castle to reach the "Castle of Safety"... the other players are a Mummy, Werewolf or Vampire trying to catch her! The victim will have a head start but the path to salvation is strewn with both dubiously useful weapons and horrifying setbacks (for victim and villain alike). And that dastardly gargoyle at the end may even decree that EVERYONE loses, dear reader... thus the corpse crumbles.

This is one of five somewhat tongue-in-cheek games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie, Vampirella and others) that features their rad 70s artwork, creepy critters, sly wit and perilous situations in classic monster chase "spin and move" gameplay.

The Creepy Crawley Castle Game was created by Bill DuBay and appeared in Creepy magazine #55 (August 1973) and Eerie magazine #50 (August 1973) as inside the magazine cover items, ready to cut out and play, and separately in 1974 as a bundle of "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order (#2661 for $2.50). The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Superyum!
description:
Intended for ages 3 and up, in this delicious game, players will travel through Breakfastland, Lunchland, Dinnerland, and Dessertland, down slides made of bacon and through towers of sushi to experience cuisines of various cultures in this flavorful race to delivery!

As a brand that stands for #EveryFlavorWelcome, this game features a wide variety of cuisines, sparking conversation about different cultures and helping customers travel through playing the game.

Be the first player to reach the winner space, and choose dinner to order for everyone. Delivery is just one tap away!

DoorDash's first ever board game.

-description from publisher's website

name: Isogame
description:
An abstract strategy game for 2 players.

Each player has 4 tiles - 1 of each isogram. These are placed on their end of the board matching the isogram and the direction its facing (orientation). Using the roulette wheel, pieces are moved and rotated per the wheel's diagrams.

The goal is for one player to land their isograms on the matching squares (color and orientation) of the opponent's baseline (or his matching tile piece) and remove their own piece from the board. The first player to remove their four pieces from the board wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Matching, Pattern Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La Fête des Vignerons, le jeu
description:
In "La Fête des Vignerons, le jeu", you play as gods who control (with varying degrees of success) the weather.

Helping each one a winegrower from the region, and for the good of the grapes and the wine, you will try to manage the elements.

Your objective: to protect you from the elements by guiding them to your opponents in order to guarantee you a great wine-growing year.

The player with the most saved vineyard at the end of the game wins!

name: E.T. Phone Home: Card Game
description:
Help E.T. phone home before the Agents find him. Work together using Action cards to inspect and manipulate the Movie Deck to find E.T.'s Phone parts hidden within.

On your turn, you play one action card and carry out each row of instructions from left to right, starting at the top. At the end of your turn draw back to 4 cards.

Find all 6 parts to save E.T. from the Agents scattered throughout the deck. If you find all 6 Agents and lose all of E.T.'s disguises, he will be captured and your mission will be over!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dinosaurios en el mundo perdido
description:
Up to four journalists - two men and two women - travel to a remote island in the Pacific Ocean to take pictures of dinosaurs.

At the beginning of the game, every player draws a number of cards featuring a picture and the name of the species they have to photograph, plus some info and a difficulty number.

A dice roll equal or great than this number means the picture was taken.

Players then roll and move across the island following paths trying to reach their dinosaur targets. In their journey they can fall in "roll again" and "lose your turn" squares, and there are "air transport" and "sea transport" too, and a bridge!

The winner is the first player to leave the island with all its photographs done.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Verralia: Kingdoms at War
description:
I know some of you might be saying, another "dudes on a map" game, a "Risklike", but Verralia: Kingdoms at War stands out for several reasons. One, its sheer simplicity, the core rules is summarised in just two pages, while the Special Ability Keywords, one can say the meat of the game, is summarised in a single page. The game itself plays rather fast for the genre of game it is, as a strategy board game, not in the least due to its simplicity. You get your finances at the start of the game, you build Units to fight and explore with, then you build further Cities and Forts, Cities for monetary income, and Forts for advanced positional deployment of your men. It is as simple as it gets for a strategy board game, with games taking from 40 minutes to an hour, even with a 10 Rounds system.

At present, there are six Kingdoms in the game, each with their themes and strengths. Elindrian have strong defence and good ranged support, Zhongdi are all-rounded, Yishitarian are a glass cannon, Morlain win through attrition, Sarcrean have the cheapest and most numerous troops, with the strongest economy, and the Golgorth, who are very fast and have strong staying power.

Each Kingdom has two Technological Upgrades they can pursue, as well as having certain Special Actions that can be taken for four of the Kingdoms, the Spells of the Elindrian Wizards, the Chants of the Yishitarian Sohei, the Commands of the Morlain Centurions, and the Prayers of the Golgorth Sacred Clowns. There are also rules for alliances and terrain, and Units can begin concealed, with so called Hidden Movement, so the game is both tactical and strategic.

We feel that how Verralia: Kingdoms at War stands out on is its simplicity, with a low entry level, and despite that, a rich strategic and tactical depth to your decisions, as you attempt to conquer the lands of Verralia. Add on to that Kingdom-specific technology you can research, and the varied unit special abilities, what which framework is a very simplified system, becomes complex. Verralia: Kingdoms at War uses a simple rules system that relies on unique asymmetric unit abilities to provide a challenging experience every game.

—description from designer
categories: Fantasy, Medieval, Negotiation, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Income, Secret Unit Deployment, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Panama
description:
Panama is a board game for the entire family. The game involves conducting various forms of trade and business activities that generate returns and contribute to welfare, products at competitive prices, pension payments, etcetera. During the game, the participants come into contact with both local and international trade in, for example, oil, cotton, pharmaceuticals and weapons.

—user summary
mechanics: Investment, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Мемы Нейро (Memes: AI-gen)
description: Мемы Нейро ("Memes: AI-gen") is a party game about picking the best meme-picture to a random situation. The tricky point is the speed: the faster you are – the more points you get! In the box you will find 100 AI/IT-thematic situations and 250 original and high-quality AI-generated pictures inspired by popular memes – how many of them can you recognise? Create new senses with this new version of old classic memes!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Rapid Dungeon
description:
Rapid Dungeon is a simultaneous turn-based game.
Each player reveals one card simultaneously.
If the card you desire is among them, try to acquire it faster than anyone else.
The score varies depending on how you collect the cards.
The cards can be white or black, or red traps.
Player tiles have two sides, one white and one black.
To acquire a card, you need to place a player tile on it.
When placing a tile, you must choose either side to match the color of the card.
If there is at least one red trap card in the mix, the rules will be reversed.
This is a tabletop game that combines elements of speed gaming and set collection, testing your quick decision-making skills.

name: Crypto Cartel
description:
The Drug Enforcement Agency has descended upon the illegal operations of the international black market. With very few resources at their disposal, international outlaws must rely on one of the biggest technological breakthroughs of the twenty-first century: the Blockchain.

Crypto Cartel is a Card Game where players must establish resources in order to exchange them for Cryptocurrency -- or Crypto. During exchanges, players may also earn Silk Road Cards, which can give you the opportunity to descend upon your opponents and their resources or to defend yourself from any attacks. Trading is also one of the main centerpieces of the game: while trading might give your opponents the ability to move ahead quicker in the game, trading can also help you maintain your production lines much longer. While earning high amounts of Crypto might be beneficial at first, it won’t guarantee that you’ll come out on top. Crypto Cartel encourages an aggressive playing style, but play too hard too fast and your opponents will quickly descend upon you.

Crypto Cartel has two different versions to play: a quick 30 minute game, or an epic one to two-hour game.

—description from the designer

name: Who Said... Bible Match Game
description:
Memory-matching card game to match bible quotes with bible characters. Very attractive artwork. Three other play methods, including Guess Who, and Fill in the Blank.

From the back of the box:

Who said what in the Bible? If you know, you win! If you don't, you learn! And if you're just a kid, you match the pictures! You can use the cards according to game instructions, or you can make up games of your own.

Individuals and families will love matching up their favorite Book of Mormon characters with the memorable things they said. Popular artist Val Chadwick Bagley has created dozens of charming, colorful drawings that bring these characters straight out of history and into your life.

Perfect for:
-Family Home Evenings
-Sunday Activities
-Whenever you're in the mood for a great time!
-Primary and Sunday School Classes
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game, Religious

name: The Journey or Cross Roads to Conqueror's Castle
description: The race game comprises of a number of roads leading to the goal at the castle. Humorous figures occupy the spaces between the roads. The game poses difficulties that must be overcome. For example: Before attempting to pass along Mad Bull Lane, the player is told to 'take 2 from the Pool to raise your courage'.

name: Bl'nd P'g without any Eyes
description:
From Play The Game description:

Game for two players

Circa 1920

Information on gameplay from Play the Game by Brian Love.

Two farmers try to force their apparently 1-eyed if not totally blind pigs up the road to market. The route is a minefield of detours. The only consolation is that the players get to control 2 pigs rather than 1 and can decide in which order the beasts shall be moved nearer to the finish enclosure. You roll two dice and then determine which one will move . Both of your pigs must get to the finish line in order to win. If your pig gets to a field marked IN it must enter the field and go through it until it gets back to the out gate. Once 1 pig has reached the MARKET you can only roll one die for the remaining pig.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Duellum
description:
You and your friends must complete the mission. The king needs your help. The goal is complete the mission figured on the mission´card or destroy your enemies (the opposite team)
Put 4 Crystals anywhere on the gameboard and begin your adventure.
To move your heroes, you must roll the roulette in the center on the board.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: The Star Trek Make-A-Game Book
description:
Start Trek: The Motion Picture license published in book form with punch out pieces.

The rules state that the goal is to circle the ship spaces on the board until you get six "deflector shields." Then you are supposed to go up the "special corridor" spaces that lead to the bridge. The first player to reach the bridge wins.

Unfortunately, I see no "special corridor" spaces that lead to the bridge, so this game is broken right from the outset.

_____________________________________

In fact, this is a misprint on the cover and in most copies of the game board that I've seen (including my own). There is supposed to be a "ladder" of three spaces between the TURBO-ELEVATOR space and the Bridge image in the center of the board making up the "special corridor", as (admittedly) very vaguely described in the last paragraph of the rules. (Seeing as how the rules DO specify starting on the REC DECK space, which is just to the left of the TURBO-ELEVATOR space, this presumes that movement around the board is in a clockwise method--something again NOT specified in the rules.)

This missing "corridor" can be drawn in with a white or metallic-ink paint marker as shown in the photo of the board in the IMAGES section. Apparently, someone caught this toward the end of the book's run, and some of the gameboards have this fixed.

A revised set of rules to clarify these points are also available in the FILES section.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Busy Bodies
description:
From the publisher:

The outrageous mix-and-match game of quick-changing characters, cards, and scores! Collect body parts with the highest value around the game board to match your character. Beware, the board will bump you back, push you forward and switch your body part cards on every roll. Busy Bodies is easy to learn, fun for the whole family and guaranteed to crack you up on every play. Game includes 1 game board, 21 character cards, 42 body parts (3 make up a character with values 4 or 6), score pad, dice, 6 pawns and instructions.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Disney My Friends Tigger & Pooh
description:
This is a game that was mailed exclusively to Disney Rewards Visa Card members. The game is for preschoolers and is based on the new Playhouse Disney show.
You can be one of four Super Sleuths in the game: Pooh, Tigger, Darby or Buster. On your turn you spin the spinner and advance to that color. You will follow any directions on that square. The player to get around the 21 squares first is the declared the winner and told he solved the mystery.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Jersey Shore Trivia Game
description:
Come on down to the Jersey Shore and test your knowledge. Do you know what "GTL" stands for? What's a grenade? What's creeping? Do you know more about the Shore than your friends?

Based on the hot TV show. Test your knowledge about the Jersey Shore cast and their wild adventures Comes with 500 trivia questions. Based on the popular TV series. Test your jersey Shore knowledge. Recommended for ages 18+. 2-4 players.

name: The Glory of Champions: Formula edition
description: A simple roll and move racing game. Players may get some benefits or suffer from technical problems by taking special cards during the race. There are some light tactical elements in the game, but it's clearly designed for children.

name: Die, Romeo, Die!
description:
West Side Story meets Grand Theft Auto in Die, Romeo, Die!

Imagine you are playing GTA 6, a game that doesn't exist – yet. In between crimes, you see a story about forbidden Shakespearean love among rival street gangs unfolding in the cut scenes...and it's going to end badly! Hoping to detour the inevitable tragedy, you attempt to influence the transitions and guide the story to a less-than-catastrophic, more "Happily Ever After" conclusion.

name: Old Masters Memory Game
description:
This game is a variation of the classic Memory.

With the stroke of their paintbrush, the old masters changed the art of painting around the sixteenth and seventeenth century. But also in the centuries preceding and following that, they pioneered with their characteristic painting styles and emotional depictions on canvas. The power of paint, colors, brushes and spatulas, combined with the genius of the painters created a new world, illusive in between reality and abstraction.

Old Master Memory Game challenges you to expand your knowledge and refresh your memory regarding the old masters. In the Old Masters Memory Game you seek and match two different portrait paintings from the same painter. One set of two cards always offers a clear relationship or clues. These vary from painting style to visible attributes such as colors, flowers and head dresses, or color and facial expression.

name: Watch Ya' Mouth: Bible Expansion #1
description:
Description from the publisher:
