Have you been praying for more Watch Ya’ Mouth fun? Well, hallelujah, the time has come! Introducing Watch Ya’ Mouth Bible Expansion Pack #1. Not only does this pack bring friends and family together to play but the citations at the bottom of most cards will be sure to start conversations about all things Bible. It’s about to get holy up in here!
Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Authentic Mouthguard Party Game. Often imitated, never duplicated.

3-10 players
Hampered by mouthpieces, teams attempt to read and interpret phrases, like:
Flame of fire (Ex 3:2)
Psalms
Breastplate of righteousness (Eph 6:14)

Watch Ya’ Mouth Bible Expansion Pack #1 comes with 200 family friendly phrase cards, including 5 blank cards to write in your own phrases. Our cards are strong, thick, and durable for years of sticky-fingered quality time.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Religious

name: Hacked
description:
We've hacked into the standard playing cards with Hacked, our first card game.

Hacked is a 2-4 player card game that plays in 10-30 minutes.

You will take on the roll of a cyber security meeple working in virtual reality to safeguard your companies server from competitors who want to gain the upper hand by obtaining your secrets.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Keep a Straight Face
description:
Act, sing, and dance your way through these cringe-worthy and laughter-worthy cards. Suitable for little ones and big ones this card game is fun for the whole family! Be warned as the crack of a smile can mean losing the game.

A player spins the spinner to select another player to try to make laugh. That person then draws a card and performs the silly action printed on it, hoping to make one or more players at the table break their stoicism. If the targeted player laughs, the active player collects the card.

Collect 10 cards and you win!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Aerial Attack
description:
This is a race game from 1 to 60 and was produced during the black-out period of the Blitz in Britain. Special squares on the game board resulted in different things happening during the course of the game (i.e. Dogfight in the sky, stop to watch and lose your turn, Red plane shoots down enemy, receive two tokens, black and red flyers collide, lose two turns, etc.) Players start with a number of tokens which are at different times placed in the kitty or removed from the kitty. The first player to reach #60 wins and gets 2/3rds of the kitty the second place player gets the rest.

Objective: be the first arriving at target space 60, moving by turns. Simple 'Roll & Move' game.
Translation of the title "Feindliche Flieger in Sicht!" "Enemy Planes in Sight" - see further remarks about the Klee company in the data base
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Educational, World War II
mechanics: Action/Event, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 39 Clues: Cahill Commotion
description:
From the Publisher:

Race to be the first player to collect 39 points. You may need to be sneaky - You may need to out-bluff the others - You may need help from the Man in Black - Yet to win, you must collect 39 Clue Points first. May the cleverest Cahill control the world!

Players work to achieve 39 clue point by playing in turns. The turn consists of a player playing one of five types of cards (family, clue, transportation, block/unblock, or person). The cards must be played in a certain order in the "stack". With the exception of the block/unblock cards which can be used to stop a stack from progressing or to unblock a stoped stack. Once the pre-defined order is met the player that completed the stack gets to score the clue points from the stack. Sound easy? It's not! When it is time for a player to score a stack, all players, including the player who finished the stack must subtract points from thier score equal to all clue points in their hand. Conversly whom ever has either Amy or Dan Cahill will score one point for each card even if they did not finish the stack.

Game play typically lasts 20-30 mintues.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based

name: Doubloon Dippity
description:
Doubloon Dippidy is the game that comes with the "collectible" octopus, Dip. The game is similar to LCR. Players start with 2 coins. Players take turns rolling a pair of dice. Depending one what is rolled, the player may have to give coins to the bank or the player on the left or collect to coins. Play continues until only one player has coins left.

The game brings an Octopus, special dice, 30 plastic doubloons & a drawstring bag.

name: Topic Bible Game
description:
From a contemporary brochure from the publisher: "The object of the game is to form books of four cards each. The 60 cards in the game deal with 15 different Bible topics. For 3 or more players of all ages."

(Contrary to the publisher's brochure, there are in fact only 56 cards on 14 topics; the rules on the back of the box state the correct count.)

Game play is similar to Go Fish, but with additional luck and memory elements. Each card contains a topic, such as Patience or Forgiveness, and four relevant verses from the Bible. A player may keep a requested card if he or she can recite the requested verse from memory. If the defending player fails to recite the requested verse, the requesting player draws a random card from the defending player's hand, discarding it if it is not the requested card.

The winner is the player who collects the most complete sets of four cards with the same topic.

name: Traffic USA
description:
Traffic USA is the exciting reality board game of driving in the United States of America. If is fun, informative and engaging. Traffic USA is a game for both young and old, that the entire family will enjoy.

Object of the Game:
The object of the game is to be the first player to travel from "START HERE" to "FINISH HERE" by completing a trip around the board.

How to Play:
There are three kinds of play: (A) Single Play - one round trip; (B) Double Play - two round trips; (C) Triple Play - three round trips. Players must choose a game play before the start of the game.

(1) Each player chooses one car token and gets $1,000.00 play money.

(2) Each player rolls the die to see who plays first.

(3) If two players roll the same number, both must roll again.

(4) The player that rolls the highest "mph" plays first. Play continues from left to right, so that the person sitting to the left of player #1 becomes players #2 and so on.

(5) To start the game, player #1 rolls the die and moves forward in the direction of the green arrow the number of miles rolled on the die. For example, if player #1 rolls "10 mph" on the die, he or she moves forward two spaces (each space equals five miles). If player #2 rolls "25 mph", he or she moves forward five spaces.

(6) When a player lands on a space with a traffic sign, he or she must obey the sign as instructed.

(7) When a player lands on a space with a store or business, he or she can buy the store or business for the purchase price on the deed card. If another player already owns the business, then the player must pay the owner the revenue as stated on the deed card.

(8) Play continues as players take turns playing and obeying all traffic rules and regulations along the route from "START HERE" to "FINISH HERE".

Winning the game:
The player to reach "FINISH HERE" first after completing a trip around the board wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dice Age, Proxy Edition
description:
Dice Age is a game of unbalanced, figurative, and toyish collectible dice which are both cool to look at and fun to roll! They are utilized in a game of strategy and risk-taking with simple but engaging rules. On his turn, a player rolls one of his dice, with the goal of never overshooting the last number rolled, or he loses all the dice he rolled in the round. The last player in play wins the game.
The Proxy edition, made by hand in the author's garage, gave birth to the Alpha Edition, plastic injected, and was used from 1997 to 2011: the early development of the game.

name: Linknotize
description:
Linknotize is the first ever board game to integrate the use of online information and tools into more traditional off-line game play. Linknotize asks players to roll two color-coded dice and then pick two, corresponding color-coded topic cards. The topic cards are chosen from six subject areas: History, The Arts, Sports, Geography, Entertainment, and Science. By using a device like a smartphone, tablet, SmartTV or computer, the player or team must “link” the two topics by traveling through the embedded links within an online encyclopedia like Wikipedia. The player or team has three minutes and/or a maximum of ten clicks to “link” the starting card topic to the destination card topic with the object to accomplish it both the fastest and/or with the fewest number of clicks. The first to combine online search and discovery with offline traditional board game features, Linknotize allows players to capitalize on their general knowledge of a wide variety of cultural and historical topics along with their web browsing skills to connect two topics online while racing the clock.
Linknotize forges a path for a completely innovative category of gaming that juxtaposes technology with more conventional play. The result is the perfect party game that is designed to entertain all audiences. Testing knowledge of categories ranging from pop culture to geography to history to sports, the game is as much about quick thinking as it is about strategically analyzing relationships to link seemingly unrelated topics.

Playing on the “six degrees” phenomenon, Linknotize, proves the idea that everyone and everything can be connected. While it may not seem obvious on the surface, our lives are truly a “World Wide Web” of related concepts, interactions and ideas that lead to common destinations.

name: The Blue Bird
description:
A roll-and-move children's game where the players travel over the ten spaces of the board collecting Blue Birds. The winner is the player with the most Blue Birds at the end of the game. The game portrays scenes inspired by Maurice Maeterlinck's L'oiseau Bleu.

The game uses a four-sided totem marked 3, 2, 1 to regulate movement and with a Blue Bird on the fourth side. A player receives a Blue Bird when they spin that figure on the totem, or for landing on certain spaces.

name: The Worst-Case Scenario Card Game: Cooking
description:
The Worst-Case Scenario card Game - Cooking

Back of the Box:
Boost your kitchen savvy. Learn to survive culinary catastrophes - from opening a bottle of wine without a corkscrew to fixing an over-salted soup. Whether it's dinner for 10 or a meal on the go - you'll be prepared to handle any cooking crisis.

Contents
55 Cards with 108 Questions

Object of the Game
Be the first to consecutively survive 5 scenarios

Players take turns to ask each other the questions on the cards: a correct answer means that they continue asking, wrong means that they pass the questions to the player who was answering who then proceeds.

name: The Invasion of Europe: The Great War Game
description: This strategic war game was produced in the years leading up to World War I. Two invading forces are set against each other, a 4 strong Navy against a 5 strong Army. The object is to secure possession of Europe by placing pieces on squares containing "Ringed Cities". Moves are made by both a die roll and a compass spinner which determines the direction that all moves must be made in. If either Commander cannot move a single one of his forces he must "pass" and offer his roll to his opponent who can either use the move or chose to reroll the die.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Asanakids
description:
The princess feels bad. She has decided to meditate but the bad emotions can block her chakras. However if the chakras are aligned in time, the good emotions will flow sweeping away the bad ones. So, do yoga poses! align the chakras! Practice mindfulness to teach the princess how to feel better before it is soo late!

Asanakids is a fun board game to initiate the practice of yoga and mindfullness to kids. It is a family game that can be played until 6 players (o even more) from the age of 4 but it can be played alone too.

It is a cooperative game where the players must help the princess too feel better. To achieve this the players will have to do yoga poses (called asanas) and express their feelings. It is a beautiful game with watercolour pictures and mandalas, that nothing has to do with religion and metaphysical believes.

The game has four key aspects:

Fun: First and foremost, Asanakids is a game, so fun and light-hearted time with friends and familly is the main purpose.

Fitness: Doing the yoga poses the players will excercise the body. Don't worry, the poses are thought for begginers. Also see the companion trying to stay in balance on one feet in 'tree pose' can be very fun too, doesn't it?

Memory: A part of the game mechanic requieres to remember the tokens position, so the players stimulate the memory and concentration.

Emotional Inteligence: Another important par of the game is learning to recognise the emotions and express them. Also the players will improve their empathy seeing what the others feel.

—description from the designer

name: What the F*ck!
description:
What the fuck ! is a politically incorrect and sassy party game.
Its nomadic format makes it easy to take anywhere with you.

An adult game of questions and answers in which you will have to try to keep your composure in the face of unsettling questions.

Don't blush!

Content: 140 cards, 1 hourglass, 1 dice, the rules of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Judge, Set Collection

name: We Didn't Playtest This: Animals
description:
For this installment in the "We Didn't Playtest This" series, designer Chris Cieslik collaborated with Japanese publisher Group SNE.

In this version, each player is given an animal super power so you can enjoy a new tactical (questionable!) approach to the game.

Game play is the same as We Didn’t Playtest This At All. On their turn, players draw a card to their hand and then proceed to play a card by following the card’s instructions resulting in general goofiness.

This version can be combined with other games in the series.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Ghost Star
description:
All you have is a sound mind as you face-off against a mysterious Entity aboard a labyrinth-like space station. Survive an early emotional onslaught and later an assault on your disciplines as you search for doors into the entity’s psyche. Traverse three progressively challenging sectors in your hunt for the final sector and Ruling Entity.
Ghost Star gives you control of a highly disciplined mind, access to an incredibly vast labyrinth and a cunning, unpredictable enemy.
Ghost Star provides the framework and context for your imagination, the story ultimately plays out in your mind.

Captain Meghan Ohtani
You play the mind of one incredible human being. Probably the best representative of humanity for this type of challenge.

Exploring the Labyrinth
Players traverse the station by choosing main navigation cards (North, South, East and West). Each card describes what you experience and displays the available content and exits. There are also Missions posted in secondary navigation (North East, South East, North West and South West). Each mission rewards greatly for success. As you explore you will be haunted by flashing images, scenes and entities that will attack your emotions to get in your head and pick you apart. Or assault your disciplines to cripple your offense or drive you mad. There are 3 levels/sectors of Sentinel Entities and each level has 5 options. There are 5 possible Ruling Entities that have a main attribute card and 4 possible sub-traits. You reveal the Ruling Entity and sub-traits randomly during game play. These sub-traits add unique abilities to the Ruling Entities.

Battle
You will use Telepathic Strikes to "Unravel" Entities using combinations of scenes, imagery, emotions and disciplines. Keeping the mind “sound”/"balanced" is critical for success.

Memory
Memory is access to past experience. Every action requires Memory and when an Emotional Defense is depleted you lose 1 Memory for every turn it stays at 0. You can spend Critical Thinking to increase Memory. If you run out of Memory your Mind is separated from your Psyche which is a fate worse than physical death.

Weapons of a Sound Mind
Critical Thinking
Critical Thinking accesses your sub-conscious allowing you to perform multiple actions while only spending 1 Memory point.

Empathy
All Entities aboard the ship despise Empathy because their psyches are based in conceit. The thought of anything trying to understand and sympathize with them lights the furnace of their emotions. Stronger Entities require Empathy to unravel them and the strongest require Empathy and other support to Unravel of them.

Informed Decisions
The Captain is rewarded with Informed Decision making after successfully defeating Entities. Informed Decisions can be used to increase any of the other attributes including Memory.

Reason
Under such incredibly crushing circumstances it takes a lot of reasoning to make it through this labyrinth. Reason is required to unravel all Entities.

Scales of Discipline
Judgment
We all know what happens when we are too quick to judge and act on it. It usually ends up bad. Manage your Judgment because if it gets to 0, you can no longer use Critical Thinking.

Conscience
It is important to confide in your conscience, don’t let the Entities disconnect your mind form your conscience or you are nothing but a serial killer and become an Entity yourself.

Tribalism
One of Man’s greatest weaknesses; being pulled towards the ideology of the Tribe. It is easy to lose perspective under such an overwhelming circumstances and submit to pounding of the tribal drums. If your Tribalism hits 0 you can no longer use Reason.

Emotional Defenses
Fear, Sorrow and Anger
Your enemies attack your most triggering emotions: Fear, Sorrow and Anger. The goal is to get them to 0 causing you to lose Memory every turn.

How to win
Keep your mind Sound through 3 progressively challenging Sectors of Sentinel Entities and Unravel the Ruling Entity in the 4rth Sector. Ruling Entities are randomly selected and strengthened by your decisions along the way.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Science Fiction

name: Lunarbaboon's Parenting is Easy
description:
Is being a parent easy? Are your feelings of anxiety trolling you? If only life had some uncomplicated way to explain everything, like it used to be when all we had to worry about was our ABC's.

Parenting is Easy is a casual board game for 2 to 4 players, meant for high strung adults, hyperactive kids, or anyone in between. Quick and easy to learn, everyone's goal is to drive their parents completely insane by causing as much chaos as possible in their family home.

name: Anastyr: The Fog of Revolt
description: The Fog of Revolt expansion (set in the Kingdom of Stone-Hills region), which again offers you a FULL environment, with all the figures and tiles related to this adventure that the Companions of the Spear will live. Note that if you take this expansion, the 5 scenarios (3 scenarios + 1 Mini-Boss scenario + 1 Boss scenario) included will be part of the full campaign. But this remains optional and you can still play the campaign without this expansion. In other words, the campaign will adapt to the expansions you have: it will offer ellipses and an experience system adapted to the expansions you own besides the Core Box. Also note that the Core Box will contain 4 regions: Jade Sea, Forge and Anastyr’s Fortress (already in the Core Box) + 1 region (Bone Swamp) that will be unlocked as stretch goals (it will by the end of the campaign!). That’s a total for this Core Box campaign of 18 scenarios.

name: Jockey: Corrida de Cavalos
description: Jockey - Corrida de Cavalos (Jockey - Horse Race) is a simple game of roll and move released by Big Toy, Brazilian publisher no longer in existence.

name: Jagd-Freude
description:
In this pure roll-and-move game, each player is a hunter. Each hunter moves along his own path. When reaching an animal field exactly, the animal is shot and the player gains points. There are some positions on the board where a player can shoot another player's animal.

The player with most points in the end wins.

name: Black Elephant Gift Exchange
description:
Elephant Gift Exchange is the most fun you can have playing one of the crappiest games there is. You know those lame Christmas gift exchange games you are always plagued with at Christmas parties. We give you a super charged, fast paced version of that crappy game but in a simple 5-minute game with hilarious present cards. Presents range from pop culture taboo items to a multitude of adult humor items. You will spend more time laughing about what present you just had then you will playing the actual game. Additionally we include one blank card so you can add your own family members and terrible gifts to your game. Pass the cards, laugh with each other, and whoever has the winner gift “wins” the game once all the foolish presents are opened. Enjoy!

One card in the game is labeled as the "Winner" and one as the "Loser". Roll the die, pass your crap however the die tells you to then, when the last player opens their present by turning it face up (unwrapped) the game is over. Whomever has the "Winner" card is the winner of their great, exciting, and fantastically crappy game. If no player has the "Winner" card, then the player with the "Loser" card is just the big loser.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Monster Match
description:
In Uncle Creepy's Monster Match, you are attempting to amass an army of monsters by collecting two matching monsters from each of the four sides of the game board - the first player to do this wins! And everyone else presumably has a lot of hungry monsters to feed. Will they turn on their captors? You bet!

2 to 6 players spin a paper spinner to move about the board and may claim a monster if they land on it. If you land on an already claimed monster, you must battle the owner for control by betting one of your own monsters against theirs- the highest spin wins them both! As a side option, players may also offer to trade monsters to other players during their turn.

This is one of five somewhat tongue-in-cheek games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie, Vampirella and others) featuring rad 70s monster artwork.

Monster Match was released in Creepy Magazine #56 (September 1973), Eerie Magazine #51 (September 1973), and the "Famous Monsters Game Book #1" magazine from June of 1982 as "cut out and play editions", as well as available separately in a bundle as "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order (#2661 for $2.50). The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

name: Blackjack-Tar
description:
Blackjack-Tar is a variant of Blackjack that uses six black dice instead of the usual deck of cards.

On set-up, each player adds five tokens to the pot. Players take turns, starting with the youngest player.

On their turn, a player bets one to three tokens, adding them to the pot, then rolls the dice one by one until they either quit or bust by rolling over 21.

If a player quits, they receive a payout depending on what they rolled. 16 or fewer has no payout. 17 through 21 gives a payout of 1 through 5 times your bet, respectively. A street (rolling one through six) gives you the entire jackpot. There is no dealer to try and match your roll.

The game ends when the pot is empty, and the winner is the player with the most tokens.

Unlike other black jack dice games, this game uses regular six-sided dice, as opposed to ten- or twelve-sided dice or dice that use suits or the letters J/Q/K/A.

—user summary

name: Le Seigneur des Anneaux: La Quête de l'Anneau
description:
As Frodo, Aragorn, Gimli or Legolas, try to destroy the One Ring! With the cards you have in hand and the new cards drawn throughout the game, you will have to thwart obstacles and enemies. It will be essential to cooperate to continue your journey and get closer to your goal: Mordor and the freedom of Middle-earth!

Partez à l’aventure en incarnant Frodon, Aragorn, Gimli ou Legolas avec l’aide de Gandalf, Sam ou Boromir et prenez la route du Mordor pour essayer de détruire l’Anneau !
Depuis la maison de Bilbon, affrontez les dangers et progressez jusqu’à la Montagne du Destin pour enfin débarrasser le monde du maléfique Anneau unique. Avec les cartes que vous avez en main et les nouvelles cartes piochées tout au long de la partie, vous devrez déjouer les obstacles et les ennemis. Il sera indispensable de coopérer pour continuer votre route et vous rapprocher de votre but : le Mordor et la liberté de la Terre du Milieu !
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fun at the Zoo Game
description: A variation on Candy Land, in which the players draw cards to move to the nearest square of that color as they advance towards the goal. Differing from Along the way, they may draw a card inviting all players to a party being held at specially-marked squares on the path.

name: Monumental Duel: Espionage
description:
Build your city in a fast and intense game. Through the ages, from antiquity to modern times, create the most brilliant of civilizations.

Espionage Box: Aksum, Greece, Aztec - Act in the shadows, forming and deploying your spies to sow chaos in your opponent's city. Witness their downfall as you acquire wealth and resources! A deckbuilding game where each civilization can be played with any other box, where the gameplay of each box can be combined with the other two, offering a very high replay value!

The three Monumental Duel titles are playable independently or combined to discover all the richness of the game!
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Menagerie Mogul
description:
From the prototype rulebook:

"You have been hired as curator of a brand new zoo in Europe. Your job is to build a world-class collection of animals for the awaiting public. However, your opponents have been hired in similar positions at competing zoos. Be strategic in the use of your resources, and assemble your collection wisely. If you succeed, you will be known the world over as Menagerie Mogul!

Over the course of five rounds, players will draft resource cards from an ever-changing selection. They will then use these resources to compete against one another in hopes of acquiring the most prestigious animals in the world for their zoos. At the end of the five rounds, whoever has achieved the goal of curating the most profitable zoo, wins."
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Sleepover Party Game
description: Break out the sleeping bags and leave the lights on. It’s a SLEEPOVER PARTY and we’re staying up late! Spin the spinner and attempt to complete one of over 200 ACT IT, WORK IT, or PARTY Challenges. Be the Human Mirror and copy everything another player does! Take Part in the “Funny Sound Competition” and make the most ridiculous noise you can!! Try to lick your own elbow!!! Being silly and having fun is the name of the game at this Sleepover, so be prepared to sing, laugh, perform, and make a general fool of yourself! Don’t fall asleep early, or you’ll miss out on earning the most cards and staying up all night! Kids rule at the SLEEPOVER PARTY, but mom and dad can play too… if they behave! First to 10 points wins!

name: MediCumLaude
description:
A trivia game in which the indicated youngest age for play is "5th year of medical school". The goal of the game is to answer 5 questions in 4 topic areas, mirroring the exams one takes to become a licensed medical doctor. The game is considered good enough to prepare students for their first official exam. Others may not enjoy the game all that much.

May be played in partnerships.

Components include large gameboard, sand timer, 6 large pawns, 1 large die, rules, 580 multiple choice question cards, color double-sized cards with posters of the exams.

name: Euro
description:
Players are dealt 7 cards and must discard to clear their hand first. Cards left in your hand score against you. You can dump a card onto the discard pile if it has the same color, or number/symbol as the last. As well as the cards numbered 1-8, there are action cards that affect the next player. These may cause you to draw cards, reverse play, elect a colour and so on. But if you have a matching action card, you may play it immediately in reply as a discard, and your card then affects the next player. The action cards cost -10 to -20, the number cards cost their value.
Vague rules in German, English, French, Italian, Spanish and Dutch.

name: Counter Space: The CGME Space Opera Gameworld
description: Counter Space is a Game World for the CounterMoves Generic Microgame Engine, simulating space opera-style interstellar combat and exploration.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Kata-Kiuchi: The Raid on Lord Kira's House
description:
The plastic game board represents an ancient Japanese warlord's home, with the sides of the box bottom representing the walls around the home. There are grooves in the board for sliding bamboo screens to fit into.

White plays Lord Kira's forces, who set up 9 samurai figures in the home. Black plays the attacking Ako Ronin, represented by 8 samurai figures that are set up outside the home. The White player is attempting to sneak Lord Kira out of the house before the Black player can find him and kill him.

Each samurai figure has a secret strength value printed beneath the block that they stand on. These values range from 0 to 5, with the Black pieces having stronger values overall. One of the white figures is also secretly designated as Lord Kira, the object of the attack.

During each turn, you can move all of your samurai figures 1 or 2 spaces. The samurai may also be used to slide an adjacent bamboo screen once during his move. When an enemy samurai enters a space with an opponent’s samurai, the players each roll a die and add the result to their samurai's strength value. The player with the lower total is the loser and that figure is removed from the map board. Tie rolls result in both pieces being removed.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: To Forge a Nation
description:
Each of these games in the HISTORICAL SERIES contains a trio of strategic simulations utilizing the same system which feature: Plastic pieces and metal markers; Three separate laminated mapsheets; Only eight pages of standard rules; Hidden force attributes, and; A unique correlation of leadership, morale, troop quality, and strength ratings. Emphasis is on playability, quality components, and accurate options.

TO FORGE A NATION contains three wars of North America. The American Revolution, The War Of 1812, and Manifest Destiny (the Mexican War). The War of 1812 covers the Canadian and Chesapeake Bay theaters, while Manifest Destiny reaches from Texas to California.

For more information, contact: raysmith@kuhncom.net
mechanics: Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Raconteur
description:
From the box:

'Raconteur is entertainment, a game of shared stories, fun and laughter. Friends and family will enjoy this game again and again. Each story is different and there are over 10,000 combinations. You will live your stories as they unfold . . .

Be a Magician. Be an Explorer. Be Yourself. Be Extended. Be Amused!

name: Soccer-Football
description: A dice-driven simulation of football (which Americans call soccer). The odd player gets to be the referee; when playing with 4 or 5, each team is split between offensive and defensive team players.

name: WorldWide Cruise Line's Caribbean Cruise Board Game
description:
Player rolls dice and moves their gamepiece across the gameboard - which is a stylized map of the Caribbean on a backgroud of varied hues of blue. The players goal is to visit / collect a pre-determined number of islands from a scorecard of 160 Caribbean Island destinations.

Islands are added or subtracted to individual scores by landing on island squares on the gameboard or by landing on the Island Card or Ship Cards squares on the gameboard, and taking the top card from the appropriate deck. These Island and Ship cards (approximately 400 total) reveal information about the islands and their people, cultures, foods, carnivals, languages, art and design, beaches, scuba dives, tropical rainforests, exotic animals, multicoloured fish and corals and much more.

The Cards also feature information about the Cruise Experience - shipboard activities, shoreside excursions and the wonder of awaking to a new destination aboard your floating luxury hotel with it's multi-national staff and crew.

Designer Notes

In designing this game, I have gone against the grain in accepted board game strategies where the norm is to win at any cost; destroying, trivializing or bankrupting other players along the way to a so called victory. The main theme of this game is of the Journey ~ not the finish, and it is hoped that in playing this game people will be encouraged to take a real journey, maybe to the beautiful islands and waters of the Caribbean or maybe further afield where they can interact with others, break down barriers and fears, find new life-paths and celebrate the world in a more spititual and humanitarian light.

The Game is packaged in a clear polycarbonate Captain's Chart Tube ( a virtually unbreakable and watertight container, adding to the nautical theme ). To repackage Game ~ roll up all game contents in the laminated gameboard and slide game back into chart tube. Gameboard may also be left out of tube and bluetacked to wall as a poster between uses.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Exploration, Nautical, Travel

name: Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball Expansion Kit
description:
This expansion requires the Wizardry Wiz Ball base game. This adds items and spells to the game, as well as more characters.

Expands:

Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Sports

name: Conundrum
description: Similar to the word game ghosts. Players alternate playing letter cards onto a string of cards that eventually forms a word - and when it does the person placed the last letter wins some chips from the pot - and the person who couldn't continue antes some chips. Cards can be played to front or end of the word, and there are some special cards, like wilds, and "inserts".

name: Wild: Cribbage Expansion
description: Wild is a cribbage additive... it is a deck of 31 playing cards that are set beside the crib board. When a player counts a multiple of 5, that player draws a Wild card and follows the instructions on it.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Mindfield: The Game of US Military Trivia
description:
Like the military? Are you a trivia and/or history buff? Play the new game, MINDFIELD, The Game of US Military Trivia. The game is designed for 4 players or 4 teams. Players roll a die and move tanks around the board, answering a question depending on the category landed upon. Categories include: Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Equipment, Battles, Presidents and Miscellaneous. The questions range from continental times through the beginning of 2002. The question and answer cards have been designed with large font for ease in reading. Get one question right in each category and win the game! Beware of the bomb!
Gontza Games
www.gontzagames.com
.
categories: American Civil War, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Educational, Korean War, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Party Game, Political, Trivia, Vietnam War, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Holiday Hop!
description: A unique look at history, inventions, people and events. Your children will love the ups and downs of this fast-paced stroll through the calendar year. Parents love that it is 100% factual!!!!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: What Shall I Be? The Exciting Career Game for Boys
description:
Object of the game is to be the first player to achieve his career.

Players move around the board collecting School Cards, Subject Cards and Personality Cards.

Game ends when one of the players has collected 4 School Cards of one Profession and 2 Subject Cards and 2 Personality Cards that are good for that Profession.

Professions and their respective schools are:

Law School - Statesman
Graduate School - Scientist
College - Athlete
Medical School - Doctor
Technical School - Engineer
Flight School - Astronaut
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Das Original Herzblattspiel
description: This is a game for the German show: Herzblatt. Everyone has to find a partner who matches best to each other.

name: U.F.O.ria
description:
"Object of the Game
Travel to all the planets, reach the center of the SEVEN-LEVEL PYRAMID, and answer the final question correctly. In doing so, YOU WILL TRANSCEND ALL SPACE AND TIME AND BECOME IMMORTAL!"

A 'Trivial Pursuit' style of card-driven questions and answer with a SERIOUS UFO theme. Players move by die roll around a segmented outer orbit ring, then to an inner orbit and on to the center of each of three successive 'planets'; answering questions in four categories and also collecting Energy Cards (required to move from level to level and planet to planet). Players then move to a seven-level pyramid and continue to roll-move-answer until, by exact die count, the last level is reach and the final question is answered correctly. Question categories include: UFO Trivia, UFO True/False or Yes/No, ESP, and Impromptu.

name: Popstars
description: This is a license game for a German TV series where people apply to become a popstar. Rolling dice and drawing cards is the main thing, with a "final round" in which the person who reaches the center of the plan trying to sing karaoke. However, this creative part of the game is rather short compared to what happens before.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Domino Duett
description:
From the box:
There are two different games in Duet Dominoes. On one side of the cards is the Picture Dominoes "What goes together?" and on the other side is the Story Dominoes "What happens next?"

A visual domino game for kids, Ages 4 - 8.

name: Real to Reel
description: Unravel the clues to reveal your favorite stars in the roles and films that have created movie history.

name: Pretty Fingernail Game
description: Spin the spinner and race through the beauty shop trying to collect all five of your fingernails to become the winner.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Adultrivia II: The Joker's Edition
description:
Color coded cards for use with the most popular trivia game boards. Contains 2,472 interesting and hilarious questions and answers from the world of adult humor.Categories are:
1 General Offense
2 Bawdy Jokes For Sexy Folks
3 Moldy Old Sitcoms
4 Jokers Are Wild
5 Jocular Potpourri
6 Limericks

box cover age: Suggested for Ages 17 and up
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Memory, Trivia

name: Nerf Slamkick Soccer
description: Striker slam kicks soccer ball at goal while goalie tries to block/save ball from getting in the goal. After the striker has shot all three soccer balls, switch sides and repeat. Keep score on the base of the goal. The first player to score nine goals is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Gates Skill
description:
Gates Skill is a connection game. The board is an 8x8 array of holes, and the pieces are gates - effectively a line between one hole and an orthogonally adjacent one, with one end attached to a hole, which it can rotate around.
The object is to have an unbroken series of your gates connecting two opposite sides of the board.

It's possible to capture opposing gates by surrounding them with yours and possibly the edge of the board.

The key gimmick is that, as noted, the gates can rotate. On your turn you can rotate a gate instead of placing one, and if you can win or capture by rotating gates you can rotate any number of them at once.
publishers: Skirrid Company of Great Britain, Ltd.

name: Going-Going Crazy
description: Players take turns spinning a spinner to determine direction and using dice or cards to determine distance. The first person to exactly reach a win space (one at the end of each of the 42 space long forward and backward tracks) is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: That's Incredible!
description:
The game deck consists of eighty-one cards. Each card has a letter of the alphabet, a slot machine symbol, a number between one and twenty-six and is one of four colors. The game comes with instructions to play nine games with the deck. Dice and a game pad complete the package.

Zenith – A crossword game.
Beat the Bandit – The dealer accepts bets and pays the punters for certain slot machine symbol combinations.
That’s Incredible! – A memory game that uses the colors on the cards.
Castaways – The players use the cards dealt to them to calculate a target number determined by the dealer.
Sequence 26 – A memory game that uses the letters on the cards.
Corner Bank – Players score for remembering combinations of colors.
Preposterous – Players score for remembering sequences of numbers.
Unravel – The dealer selects a secret combination of colors and the other player must deduce the combination by making guesses.
Shootout – The colors have rank and the player who reveals the highest ranked card during a round wins all cards of all the other players.

The rules give a post office box and a toll-free telephone number to encourage players to contact the publisher with game results. The game is a promotional tie-in to a popular television series of the eighties.
categories: Card Game, Math, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Gallop
description: This board is actually a system for five games: Gallop, a race to the opposite side of the board using two d6 dice. Queen's Four, a 4-n-row game. Leap Over, a Halma variant on half the board (6x12) where leaping is the only legal move. Skwhere, making enclosures to remove opponent's pieces; and Sidle, Gallop using 4 stick dice.

name: A Week with Mary and  Julep
description:
Poor Mary. She has her hands full with Julep, her six-year-old who is full of mischief. Mary really needs help to keep herself from blowing her top or doing the wrong thing with her daughter. In this cooperative game, two to four players (twelve years and up) play cards from their hands to help Mary manage the anger she feels.
The game consists of 21 turns, at three time periods for seven days. Each turn an Event card is played to reveal the stressful challenge Mary faces that provokes her anger. The player can then play a Response card to reduce the impact of the event. Chance cards are also revealed to introduce unexpected events for Mary, both negative and positive.
If the players can keep Mary's stress and her relationship with Julep from reaching a blowup point, then they win. If not, everyone loses. This is a challenging game that will play different every time because of the random events that plague Mary both at home and at work.
The game board and three decks of cards are all in full color on quality stock. Cards will have to be cut from larger sheets.

name: Snipe Hunt
description:
From the box:

As part of initiation, all Squirrel Scouts must participate in the traditional Snipe Hunt. Hunting the elusive Snipe is not an easy task. Wind your way through an ever-changing maze of trees, throwing rivals off the trail with crafty moves and collected equipment. Watch out for alien abductions, the werewolf's curse, Bigfoot's appetite, and the legendary Zamboni Tribe!

name: Body English
description: This is an adult variation on Twister. Players try to guess secret words based on clues provided by their team mates who place their feet over letters on the play mat.

name: The Golden Hegemony Presents Its House Rules for Napolconic Wargaming
description: Rules and 7 countersheets (yes, counters for a miniatures set of rules) included in issue 26 (Sept 73) of "Battle Flag - the magazine of encounter" published by Third Millenia, Inc of Philadelphia, Mississippi. The funny part is this paragraph from section titled "how to use this rule set". "A great deal is left unsaid about Napoleonic warfare in this rule set. The reader is supposed to know something on the subject. If you don't, go out and read some general works on the subject." There are no scenarios or suggested setups.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: Yahoo! Web Speak
description:
For this game the players rotate as the role of host. The host takes a card and selects one of the three Web Speaks to use. For example, the host might choose the acronym category question, such as ROFL. S/he then reads the acronym aloud and all the other players write down either what they think it means, or a bluff answer to fool the other players.

The host puts the answers in a folder and reads all the answers aloud. Each player then votes what S/he thinks is the correct answer. Players that guess correctly move ahead 3 spaces on the game board. Any player who receives votes for the Web Speak they make up (that isn’t the same as the correct Web Speak) moves ahead 2 spaces for each vote they get. The first player to reach the FIN space wins.

name: Christian Endeavor
description: This is a very old track game for children in Christian households. According to the rulebook: "... its moral tone will commend itself to all those who desire to place in the hands of their children a game teaching the good results sure to follow an upright life". A spinner is used for movement. You must follow the directions of any space you land on that has any, which will either send you forward or backward an additional number of spaces. The first player to reach the "Honest, Honored and Upright Citizen" space wins the game.

name: Drugopoly
description:
Drugopoly is a game about supply and demand.
Although it takes its name from the dreaded Mon-, this is not a variant –opoly.
Drugopoly is played over two boards – the left hand (square) stash board where all the cash goes. And the right hand (circular) board where the players move and take control of the drugs. The aim of Drugopoly is to control the majority of the drugs using your dealers. The money builds up on the left hand board until someone takes control of that drug and wins the stash, cash is then paid straight to the player until they lose control. A bit like a tug of war the drugs can pass back and forth several times before someone takes the majority. In the meantime the more you control the more you make! The less you control the more you Pay! Avoiding the pitfalls of the police, jail, gang land shootings and rehab players take control of the ten different drug squares by winning possession or taking them by force through dice rolling. Players have to pay for the drugs they use as they move around the board, unless they own them then the money is theirs. By holding the more lucrative drugs in their control, players will begin to make a tidy sum from the other players. This can be played using any unit price (1p, 5p, 10p £1 etc) Create your own Drugopoly with no care for the consequences. Control the majority of the board and you win! Taking the cash and the glory….
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Economic, Educational, Humor, Mafia, Math, Medical, Number, Territory Building, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: YY classic (YinYang)
description:
A board game for 2 to 8 players. The aim of the game is to form a lifeline using matching symbols. The first player to form a lifeline when he places his last stone is the winner. Chinese sticks (dinner-things) are used to allow fate to determine a lifeline. Anticipation and planning largely determine the chance of success. The element of chance means that everyone ultimately has a chance. The game is derived from Chinese philosophy, which says that all things in life must be in balance. Every object has its opposite, or if you like its complementary element. Black and white, man and woman, water and fire. In short, Yin and Yang. It sounds floating but it isn’t. Before the game starts the stones are shuffled and placed on the white triangles on the perimeter with the symbols face down. The numbers in the black triangles remain visible. The color of the pawns is also the color of your starting field. Each player drops the three sticks on each turn. Move the total of the throw (6, 7, 8, or 9) on the main field. The used the philosophy that extremes are changeable. You can make a 6 a 7 and a 9 a 8. There are two rounds. In the first round you collect the stones and in the second round you have to make a line (lifeline) between 2 triangles. Therefore, players may lay a stone on the main field on each turn. Each stone laid down must be able to form a pair. This is an import point. It must be able, nothing more than that. Different pairs may be placed against each other. In this way a lifeline can be formed or stones can be played out. The first player to add his last stone to the lifeline is the winner.
It is a new kind of game. You have to get used to it. But after a few times of playing you will find the pleasure of this strategic game.

name: Flying Squad
description:
The game is played on a square grid and represents a manhunt by the police and a race to safety by the fugitive. One player plays the Fugitive and the others are Police. The Fugitive player wins by reaching the home space at the center of the board by exact count, otherwise the first Police player to capture the fugitive wins.

The movement of the police units is governed by the arrow on the space that they start on, while the fugitive moves in a circular path in the order that the spaces are numbered.

Flying Squad was a nickname dating back to 1920 when Scotland Yard bought two motor vans for use by members of the Special Squad.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Track Movement

name: Soccer Stars
description: Accordig to Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games": On a field of many squares, players move their men and dribble the ball. To pass, a target space is choosen. A spinner then indicates if the pass is on target or how far off it is, longer passes going further astray.

name: FemWarriors
description: An independently produced CCG, or card game with hopes of becoming collectible one day, FemWarriors represents gladiatorial combat between teams of scantily-dressed female warriors arranged in ranks and equipped with SF weapons and skills. It comes in a case with a playing mat, quick-start instructions, and 50 cards. More complete instructions and back-story are available at the product/company website, www.femwarriors.com.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Humor, Science Fiction, Sports

name: Operation Vital Ground 1944
description: Vital Ground 1944 covers the 12SS Panzer divisions counterattack on June 7th against the strung out Canadian forces west of Caen. The 12thSS struck with 45 tanks and quickly advanced causing a panic to the allies. The Canadians had little armor and were out of artillery and shore support range. The battle lasted 6 hours and the SS advanced only a few miles but this attack delayed the allied advance for another 30 days! The game has over 160 counters and one 11x17" map, 12 page rulebook.
publishers: Perry Moore Games, Strategy Gaming Society

name: La Bible en questions
description: A trivia game based on the Bible de Jérusalem

name: The Game of Pride
description:
Simple roll / trivia / party game aimed at the GLBT crowd,parents, and families. Object is to race from "Out of the Closet" to the final square "Pride".

According to the publisher: "It's a cross between Taboo and Charades, with players advancing by drawing cards and getting their teammates correctly to guess the word or phrase on the card through either verbal descriptions, drawing a picture, or pantomime gestures."

name: Tektolio
description:
Players explore the strange island Villa of Tektolio where you have become stranded. There, you find all sorts of objects such as point-earning items from a special card deck, as well as random other things. Other card decks send you to different parts of the board, or cause gains, losses, or trades of cards.

You'll encounter some uniquely odd characters and be plunged into some bizarre and possibly life-threatening situations. You have to use the items you find to build "Kontraptions" that will remedy the situations (the more card items you use, the more points you get). The first player to reach 500 points (or any prearranged victory condition that players agree to) wins the game and may leave the island...if the other players allow it...

name: HotFlash! The Menopause Game
description:
The object is to make your way around the board and be the first to reach Hormone Free Haven. Along the way, win or lose, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to laugh and learn.

When you land on Raging Hormones you’ll discover some little known facts about women, your body, peri-menopause, and lots of other stuff.

When you land on a HotFlash!, you’ll have a chance to act a little goofy or ask your friends about some deep, dark secret like “Have you ever had a one-night stand?”

Be sure to avoid PMS Purgatory, and be careful not to go down the Fallopian Tubes. They’ll take you backwards through Weepy Way, Lustless Lane, Bitchy Boulevard, Insomnia Aisle and The Forgetful Forest.

Whether you play to win or just play to play, after an evening of HotFlash!, you’ll never think of Menopause the same way again.

name: Le Grand jeu de l'OM
description:
Soccer game where the players play the French team l'Olympique de Marseille.

Each player starts with its soccer player in the center of the stadium.
The player throws a die and gets a question corresponding to the diffculty level. There are questions in 3 difficulty levels. If a player answers a question correctly he/she moves the soccer player. After the movement the player gets a Chance' card and follows the instructions.
When a player lands on a space with the number 42-44-46 he/she has to answer a question corrseponding to the diffculty level 2-4-6. If the player corretly answers this question he/she scores.
The player with 6 goals wins the game. Or the player with the most goals after 45-60-90 minutes.

name: Judah the Christian Soldier Game
description:
Judah the Christian Soldier Game's object is to complete the picture of Judah the Christian Soldier by placing armor cards in the correct location on the game board.
This is done by obtaining game pieces by flicking the spinner, and if it lands on a piece of the armor that you do not have, you get it.

The game is simple and easy to learn. The premise of the game is to help teach children about the spiritual armor of God that is referred to in the book of Ephesians 6:10-18 in the Bible.

name: Sypil
description:
French 2-player abstract game from Jacques Le Floc'h.

There are three types of counters in the game (triangles, hexagons and circles. These counters can be moved on the matching designs located on the board. They can also pile up and in that case their powers accrue. A triangle-hexagon can so move as a triangle and as a hexagon.

1 Hexagonal board
9 pieces per side (3 triangle, 3 hexagon, 3 circles).

name: The Vodka Party Game
description:
Components:

Folding Game Board, Playing pieces, Playing cards, Dice, Full Instructions

Publisher's Description:

"You're inside the iron curtain. The Cold War is on. You must eliminate your own 'super villain', acquire by various means secret documents on microfilm and get out alive. As a secret agent, licensed to kill, you are prepared to do anything to win. Watch out for the double agents secretly working against you. Copious amounts of drinking and eating to be had!"

Brief Notes:

The beverage of choice can be adjusted to the crowd playing (and doesn't necessarily have to be vodka), so this makes for a decent party game among any crowd of reasonable adults.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Counter All Terrorists!
description:
"Counter All Terrorists" challenges its players to defend against a series of terrorist attacks on the United States. The game may be played solitaire, or by up to six players. As the title suggests, the object is to counter terrorists' attacks on the "White House, Pentagon, CIA, FBI, Air Force One, and many military bases and cities across the United States."

It is an unusual title in terms of historical insight, having been published in 1986 and embellishing its instructions with Albert Einstein's quote, "imagination is more important than knowledge." The game treats a subject that few would take seriously at the time -- though, in hindsight, its designers also failed in imagination for the weights given the various terror targets.

name: The Narc Game
description:
"The Narc Game" strikes an unusual, and perhaps unintentional, balance between the blatantly drug-sympathetic "Dealer McDope" and the "just say no" approach of "Decisions". From the lid description above, it would appear to be a strictly anti-drug game. Yet, curiously, actual game play comes across more as a "beat the system" game than one of social value education.

Two to six players compete, with the object of the game being to accumulate the fewest arrests. The game ends when all players have successfully made it from the "START" square to the "HOME" square. Along the way, players gain and lose money in various drug deals, and must try to avoid a stint in the Criminal Justice system that costs them money and sends them back to "START".

The joke of the game, of course, is that it is almost impossible to go from START to HOME without getting sent back to START.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rungs
description:
From the Crosstown Games website:

Far away, in the land of Elm, there is a majestic tree reaching up to the clouds. Legend has it that he who successfully reaches the top of this giant will gain untold fortunes and become ruler of a vast unknown land. But this is no easy task. The branches of the tree on which to climb do not stoop low to the reach of man… they are but twigs when viewed from the ground. All that you dream of the kingdom is yours by successfully building a ladder to reach the first branch. Beware though; others are trying to get there first! They will stop at nothing to see you fail.


Not available anymore from here:


http://www.geocities.com/ctg_rungs/

name: Sexpressions
description:
SEXPRESSIONS is a (very) adult game, absolutely dripping with sexual innuendo, to be played by 2 or 4 players with equal amounts of both sexes.

Players move their "nudes" (playing pieces) around the board according to dice rolls the aim being to collect a total of 35 points. These points are earned through ownership of Company/Product squares (the least racy of which is called Rolsex Watches) which the other players have to pay to visit, and through complete circuits of the board. Points are also won and lost through reward and penalty cards which are gender specific.

First to 35 is the winner.

name: Pow Wow!
description:
"Parker Brothers Slapping Clapping Rhythm Game"

A game using an electronic device that requires players to beat out a rhythm.

name: Football Poker
description:
The Football Poker Card Game is a two-player game for Ages 8 and up. Compare poker hands and play football action by the cards you get!

Contains: Colored football field playing board, complete rules, and one regular poker deck of cards

name: Brit Quiz II
description:
The second in a series of quiz games that require, as the name suggests, knowledge of British trivia...

Game play is as for the first edition:

Players take turns to roll a die and move that number of spaces round the board. The player then tries to answer a question determined by both the colour of the space he or she lands on, and the actual number rolled on the die. If the question is answered correctly the player moves forwards an additional three spaces as a reward. There is no penalty for getting the answer wrong.

'Up The Creek' is a special category that asks the player to perform an activity rather than answer a question. If the player fails to carry out the activity to the satisfaction of the other players, or refuses to even try, he or she has to move backwards three spaces.

The winner is the first player to complete a circuit of the track around the board.

Question categories are slightly changed from the first edition, and the questions are new:

Orange - History & This And That
Yellow - People
White - Places
Green - Showbiz
Blue - Animals & Plants
Red - Sport
Brown - Up The Creek

name: Fel, fel vitézek!
description:
Classic battle game from World War II. Two enemy players fight on the opposite sides (the red and the blue bases).
The game includes a classic gameboard for the trench fighting, and 20-20 amazingly detailed hand painted army miniatures. Commanders deploy their soldiers through the fields, special terrains, and other objects.
The game mechanics are quite simple. Dice rolling movement, and special fields. (POW camps, Hospitals)
Average game length is between 30 and 60 minutes.

The title translates as "Get up! Get up, valiants!"
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Block Off
description:
Block Off consists of a playing board, with a plain 8x8 grid, and a bunch of triangular plastic tiles (diagonal cut squares) in white and blue and a single die.

Players alternate placing 3 triangles of their color, attempting to complete squares in their color, and patterns of completed squares as well. On a single turn they may ONLY complete squares of their color by playing against pieces already on the board.

The game is an instant tie if played symmetrically. (The rules even warn against this.)

The mode described above is called "Thinker Style," vs the "Gambler Style" where each player rolls a die to determine how many pieces they can place. This is intended to eliminate ties.

name: Counter Punch
description:
Counter Punch, designed for the real fight fan, is a game that combines the excitement and strategy of boxing. Counter Punch is a game where everyone has an equal chance to win. As in an actual boxing match, this card game requires strategy or you could find yourself on the seat of your pants or, even worse, KO'd!

Counter Punch is a 2 player card game. There are 49 cards total, on which appear numbers and punch words. Example: Jab-1, Body-2, Hook-3, Overhand-4, Uppercut-5, Combo-6 and Power Punch-7. The higher the number, the harder the punch.

Before each round of play, 12 cards are dealt to each player. The last player to win each trick, throws out the next card first. Whoever played the highest card wins the trick. After the end of each round (each has played their 12 cards), scoring is as follows:

6 to 6 = even round
7 to 5 = Out Pointed Opponent
8 to 4 = Opponent was Hurt
9 to 3 = Knocked Opponent Down
10 to 2 (or better) = Knockout (instant victory)
3 knockdowns in one bout = a Technical Knockout Victory

name: All About Harrisburg
description: "Two to six players attempt to outsmart and out-luck each other in a riotous race ALL ABOUT TOWN. The first player to collect a total of eight (8) Travel Cards and return to his/her Residence is declared the winner."
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crazy Golf!
description:
Play nine holes of Crazy Golf. Each player starts at the Tee and rolls two dice (one 4-sided, one 6-sided). These dice determine the movement of the ball. The goal is to get the ball into the hole and move onto the next course. The winner is the player who completes all nine holes first.

The game is one small fold-away board, 4 player markers and two dice.

name: Odds-On Baseball / Odds-On Football
description:
This is a combination set of two betting games, both of which are meant to be played while watching the appropriate sport (baseball or football) on TV. Players watch the live game and use the various events to gamble on the outcome.

In Odds-On Baseball, players bet on the likelihood of such events as singles, extra base hits, double and triple plays, etc. Similarly, in Odds-On Football players wager on the likelihood of touchdowns, field goals, running and passing plays, etc.

The player with the highest value in betting chips at the end of the game is the winner.

name: The Motor Carriage Game
description:
A roll-and-move race game involving early automobiles racing through the park.

"At this time, when the use of electric carriages is growing so rapidly, a game of this subject is most opportune. The board represents a handsome park suggestive of Morningside and Central Parks, New York. The game consists of a race between rival drivers of Motor Carriages, mounted in our best manner."
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: One Stop Sexual Shop
description:
As recently spotted on eBay:

The "Shop for a Prop" game. An adult novelty game with the stated object being to collect the most Prop cards from the sex shop. Spaces on the board include: Kiss and Your Choice, Remove 1 Piece of Clothing, and Kiss and Fondle.

Components include instructions, game board, Prop cards, sand timer, money, pawns and a die.

name: Lucifer's War
description:
Lucifer's War is a tabletop miniatures battle game designed that players may simulate the war between the immortal creatures that comprise the Celestial Hierarchy. As a warband led by the Archangel Michael you could battle to defend the divine order from jealous usurpers or wage war as Lucifer and fight to take the position in the cosmos that is yours by right. Stain the Gates of Heaven with the blood of those who dare question the Will, or rend asunder those that dared to cast you from the light of the upper planes into realms of black stone and sulfur.

Lucifer's War uses the Goalsystem mechanics made popular by West Wind's previous skirmish games, SuperSystem and Chaos In Cairo. Battles in Lucifer's War can involve as few as two models per side, or as many as the players desire. There are two basic types of models in Lucifer's War: Angelic or Demonic Orders and Minions. The Orders are the immortal creatures that occupy lofty positions within the Celestial Hierarchy. Minions represent the lower classes of servants or constructs employed by the Orders in their struggles for power or vengeance.

name: Cricket: Interactive Television Game
description:
Players toss a coin, the winner having the choice of batting or fielding. Place the video cassette in player and press start/play and you will be in the thick of the action of World Cup Cricket.

The 3 hour VHS video contains three condensed world cup matches from the 1982 Cricket World Cup. Using the score cards supplied the game can be played 72 times with a different ending to each game. The games feature teams from Australia, New Zealand, India and Pakistan.

Once you press play the battle commences, and the batting team strives to obtain the highest number of runs while the fielding team endeavours to take all their wickets before the end of the innings and so restricting the number of runs.
The winner of the game is the team with the highest run total after both innings have been played.

name: TAG, The Transactional Awareness Game
description: The childhood game of tag us based on making contact. So is TAG. More than an exciting game based on Transactional Awareness, TAG is a revelation of the constant interplay of human interaction at all levels and movements. Accepting acknowledged insights into the nature of interpersonal behavior, TAG identifies and summarizes the 16 basic interactional styles, from the authoritarian "Director" to the acquiescent "Follower" to the headstrong "Individualist". By understanding how every person's own style interacts with the style of others, the player can better understand the roots of empathy or antagonism experienced in relationships. Through TAG, the player discovers more complementary transactions and avoids stifling ploys and fruitless struggles. Beyond discussing the dynamics of relationships, TAG provides ethical norms for transactions designed to equalize and bring them to greater fulfillment.

name: Bible Mystery Events:  The Case of the Missing Professor
description:
Strange things are afoot in the small Appalachian town of Wallar Hollar. Recently the great Professor Davidson was killed in a prison riot. And now his body has gone missing. On top of this a strange man named Jesse Coleman has appeared in Wallar Hollar asking everyone uncomfortable and probing questions about these unusual events . . . Welcome to The Case of the Missing Professor.

In this interactive murder mystery event, 5 to 25 players each take on the role of a unique character in this quaint little mountain town as they try to discover what happened to Professor Davidson's body and who this Jesse Coleman fellow really is.

name: Rolf Harris Cartoon Pics
description:
From the Box:
Let's see who's Quickest on the Draw with Rolf Harris's new drawing game! Turn the eggtimer and race against your friends. The idea is sketching charades on paper. The first team to successfully guess 8 charades wins.

Contents:
6 Non-toxic crayons
Over 2000 words and phrases
8 Wipe-off boards
One die.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Schweine Backe
description:
From the publisher's website:
Swearword memo-game.

name: The Minneapolis-St. Paul opolygame
description:
A Monopoly variant based in the Minneapolis-St. Paul area of Minnesota. Comes with a 1-page sheet that gives a short history of the Twin Cities.

From the instructions: "Entrepreneurs acquire Business Licenses, develop Offices, and purchase various goods and services (thereby stimulating the local economy)... Accumulate the portfolio of business holdings with the greatest net worth."

About NationalOpoly Sales Corporation: "Headquartered in San Diego, California, has produced city games in Chicago, Detroit, Honolulu, Minneapolis-St. Paul, Sacramento, and San Diego. Nationalopoly has made a commitment to aiding community organizations in each of these cities. As a result, NationalOpoly will contribute a minimum of $.50 of every Minneapolis-St. Paul game sold to the Boys & Girls Club of Minneapolis."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Company
description: "Company, play the principles" is a board game issued by Siemens probably to educate their personnel about corporate values. Players have to move through the 5 values (People, Innovation, Value, Responsibility, Customers) to reach the goal. In each player's turn the movement is driven by dice for the player and a whirling arrow for all the players together.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Underdog to the Rescue
description:
A children's game for 2 to 4 players Ages 6-10. Players race to see who is the first person to rescue Sweet Polly. Spin the spinner, move the number of spaces, look at the hidden tokens.

Simple game for kids.

Underdog rocks.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Full Armor of God
description:
This "peel `n' play" game comes with silver vinyl armor for each board. Play the game in the car or at home to take advantage of the opportunities to teach your child about the Full Armor of God. Just spin the dial and see who can be the first to get a full suit of armor.

• Helps children grasp the concept of putting on the Full Armor of God.

• Includes a Faith Parenting Guide® that provides ideas to reinforce the values of the product into the life of the child.

name: Kid's Bible Challenge
description:
OBJECT: To be the first Player or team to move from Genesis (start) to Revelation (finish),

CONTENTS: 100 trivia cards that are divided into 6 categories.

Each Category is represented by a color/symbol:

Orange / Tablets = 0ld Testament

Green / Cross = New Testament

Red / City = Places

Yellow / Rainbow = Objects and Events

Brown / 123 = Numbers

Blue / ? = General

- 4 colored player markers, a 6-sided die, playing board and travel box,

name: Friendzee: Christian Character Edition
description:
Players move game pieces around the Friendzee game board by rolling cubes that direct them to draw from three sets of cards:
1) LIVE OUT LOUD--surprising and meaningful experiences challenge participants to tell stories, sculpt clay, write, sketch, perform charades...and more.
2) DIVE IN DEEP--gets them digging into Bible passages and studying God's Word together on a more personal level.
3) RISKZEE--a roll of the dice directs players to do both wacky and Bible-themed activities as they explore Scripture.
All three cards guide teens around the game board and to the ENDZEE. There are no winners and no losers--the game ends when everyone reaches the ENDZEE and commits to a challenge for the week.

The Christian Character Edition encourages teen to deepen their faith by discussing Courage, Integrity, Humility, Grace, Compassion, and Perseverance.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Find the Lady
description:
Recommended for ages 8 to Adult

A game based on the Quadrant motion picture of the same title. A comedy starring: Larry Dane, John Candy, Mickey Rooney, Peter Cook, Dick Emery, and Alexandra Bastedo.

Follow the roads to the "Crazy House" and find the lady before your opponents. Fun for the entire family!

COMPONENTS:

Game board
Crazy House centerpiece
6 player tokens
6 plastic stands
6 "?" tokens (one with the Lady)
Die
Rules

name: Spin for Sin
description:
Players spin a spinner to select a category ("Sexy Sayings", "Gidgets and Gadgets", "Fantasies", "Hot Spots" and "Opponents Choice"). The opponent then draws a card with a phrase on it and must list out the number of words and letters with a series of dashes as if it were a game of hangman. The player then gets to select five letters of the alphabet, which the opponent must write in place in the phrase (if applicable). The player then gets an opportunity to guess the phrase. If successful, the player gets five points. If not, the player has the opportunity to select more letters, but decreasing the number of points awarded. The first player to 20 points wins, and is entitled to cash in a "Fantasy favor" check.

The phrases range from flirtatious to naughty but manage to avoid obscenity. This 'adult' game is for two, however there are references in the rules to "team" play as well.

name: Das wilde Fussball-Quiz
description: Quiz game about Soccer published in "DIE WILDEN FUSSBALL KERLE" Series

name: Beeline
description:
On a 16-hex gameboard (4x4 quadrilateral) of a honeycomb, two players each control three bees. The object of the game is maneuver all of your bees so that they are adjacent to any one of your opponent's bees. Either player may declare a "swarm" at the end of their turn, meaning that for the rest of the game, each player must move twice per turn.

This game was published in the March 2006 issue of GAMES Magazine.

It was reprinted in the August 2010 issue, on page 10. In this issue the board and rules were printed on the same page.

name: Futility
description: Developed as an educational (or perhaps a tongue-in-cheek)game by Midland Insurance Co. in 1984, Futility is a game of buying and selling insurance. Each player, or "Risk Manager", starts out with $3,000,000. Movement around the game board, via rolling of the die, allows for the opportunity to buy and sell insurance (certificate of insurance cards). There are also spaces where an "occurance" ...umm, occurs. At that time you take an "occurance card" whereupon one of your insureds has made a claim. Hopefully you bought the right insurance and the "occurance card" does not affect you, otherwise you'll end up paying some of your (ahem) hard earned cash. Play continues around an endless loop (similar to Monopoly, say). Risk Managers decide at what point they choose to withdraw from the game, as the rules explain: "when frustration level or boredom so indicates."

name: Spaghetti and Math Balls
description:
Each player gets a spaghetti bowl game board and six meatballs. All players put their meatballs above the spaghetti pile on the big game board.

All players spin the spinner and moves the number of spaces indicated. They must answer the math problem posted on the space they land on. If they answer the math problem correctly, they get to continue their turn and spin again to move. If answered incorrectly, their turn ends and the next player's turn begins.

A player gets to put a meatball in their scoring bowl each time they pass the "Start" space. The first player to put all six meatballs into his or her bowl wins the game!

The game board has two sides. One side is an addition game. The other side is a subtraction game. The instructions are the same for both sides.

name: Africa's 30 Year War: Chad Vs. Libya – The Toyota War
description: In this game, players take control of Libya, Chad, the French Foreign Legion, Sudan Militants or the Islamic Legion and re-fight the Toyota War between Chad and Libya. This game includes a 17" x 22" four piece game map on quality index card stock, 216 tokens, 216 stickers for the tokens, 1D10, game rule & scenario booklet, and nation score sheet.

name: Fallen Blackhawk: Somalia
description: This game recreates the "Blackhawk Down" conflict of the early nineties in Somalia between the US forces and the forces of the Somali warlord Adid. As the US Army Rangers and Special Forces, your troops are stranded in the middle of a hostile city, and you will have to fight your way back to the US army base, with what little assistance from the air you can receive. As the warlord Adid, your goal is to kill the US soldiers before they can escape. This game includes a 2 piece, 17" x 33" map, 134 counters, game rules, and 1D10.

name: Spin-A-Shape
description:
