From the box: "Children are introduced to basic geometrical shapes as they have fun playing 4 different games. The colorful graphics of familiar, everyday objects make it easy for young game players to understand and enjoy."

All games are variants on using a spinner to tell you which of your cardboard pieces to put into your cardboard frame.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Life as a Liberal/Life as a Conservative
description:
A board game that tries to bridge to red state/blue state divide. The left side of the box pictures Jesse Jackson, Ted Kennedy, Hillary, Al Gore, Al Sharpton and other liberal icons. On the right side is The Gipper, Charlton Heston holding a rifle, W, Rush, Rummy, Ashcroft and Arnold.

A roll and move game with 7 types of cards (Education, Diversity Training, Work, Police, Society, Leisure, and Political Power). The goal is to be the last player with any political capital.

name: Pit Fighting Were-Critters
description:
Battle for supremacy of the pit.

Use the "Vulgar Were-Bunny", or the "Malicious Were-Monkey" and whatever else you find, such as the human meat missiles.

Implementing the Combat Card System, Pit Fighting Were-Critters comes {complete} with four pewter miniatures (two were-critters and two human meat-missiles), rules, and combat cards.

Sold as a boxed game (not as individual components).
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports

name: Daystar
description:
From the rulebook:

"Enjoy the Daystar challenge of applying Bible verses to life-like circumstances. Daystar imitates the Christian life with seventy numbered spaces that represent years of human life. You'll need to first get "saved" and then "mature in Christ" by gaining your four Christian Essentials cards. Once saved, you can "witness," "fellowship," and battle the "spiritual warfare" situations found in the Christian Life Experience (CLE) cards. "Redeem the time" and strategize with your valuable Time chips, and "edify" one another with your spiritual gifts while you bear fruit to the Lord. Correctly answer a Topical Verse, and you can identify one of 100 Extraordinary Christians of the Past!

"Be sure you "discern" the correct Virtue/Vice answers, and also watch out for the Wiles of the Devil temptations and the Broken Fellowship spaces -- or you'll end up in the Backslider's Valley and need to "repent" to get out! You'll have many trials and joys on your Daystar path to Heaven (You can even be martyred!), trying to collect as many Gold, Silver, and Precious Gems chips -- and as few Wood, Hay, or Stubble chips -- as possible before you get there!"
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Love Game
description:
This game contains four pieces representing men and four pieces representing women. Either up to four men chase one ideal woman in hopes of getting dates or four women chase one ideal man. Players simultaneously set their love-o-meters to indicate movement for either themselves or (by paying a gift chip) the ideal member of the appropriate sex. Dates lead to heart chips, which can be lost for various reasons. Landing on the spot with another figure, a die is rolled for a random consequence (losing a turn, losing a heart chip, gaining a heart chip). When all heart chips are distributed, the player with the most wins.

Illustrations by Mordillo. Ages 14+. L-Series of games.

name: Original Sudoku Card Game
description:
Just like Sudoku game, the original one.
But the numbers are presented by playing card forms.

name: Bible Action Heroes Matching Game
description: Match the Bible Hero with their Biblical action he or she performed. Suitable for ages 4 & up.
publishers: David C. Cook Publishing, Faith Kidz

name: Bomben auf England
description:
Bomben auf England, published by Spear Spiele, is a board game that was presumably available to German gamers at the star of World War II. The game involves a version of Tiddly Winks in which the tail of a "bomber" flicks chips on to a map of England, where English cities are the targets.

Pictured in the book Games We Play.

name: Go Ho: The Ultimate Card Game
description: This is a card game based on the sport of Ultimate. Players must use the cards dealt them to move the disc up the field until they score a point or turn the disc over. Special cards can be played that represent aspects unique to the game of Ultimate. Winner is the first person to score five points.

name: Pocket Pastimes Motor Racing
description:
From the box:
Two to four people may compete, each choosing one peg as a car. The pegs are then lined up at the starting post. Each player in turn throws the dice and moves their peg the number of sections thrown. If a six is thrown, you get another throw. If a player should land on the following numbers; 8, 15, 20, 26, 32, 36, 45, 50, 57, 69, 78, 82, follow the appropriate instructions. The winner is the first player to reach no. 86.

name: Bible Anagrams
description:
"A Bible-centered word building game for ages 9 and up."

A Scrabble-like board and letter tiles is used by a "Leader" to form five to eleven words related to the Bible, face-down except for the first letter. Each square on the board has one, two, or three dots. Players have tokens that move around the letters of the alphabet that encircle the board. These letters have a numerical value associated with each, with (like Scrabble) the less often used letters having a higher value.

On their turn, players guess a letter in a single word, but are restricted to guessing the letter their token is on or one of the next seven letters. The Leader moderates. Players get points based on the value of the letter correctly guessed times the number of dots in the square it rests on. Players may move their token ahead seven letters around the board instead of guessing, to get within range of a letter they want to guess.

The Leader keeps score, and the leading scorer when all the words are guessed wins.

name: Healthy Habits
description:
From Dr. Toy:

"Players will have a blast moving around the game as they are the game pieces. The set comes with 30 cards that use the topics of nutrition, exercise, sleep and personal hygiene. The game doesn't have a board. Rather, the cards can be set up in any pattern you wish, winding around the room, under tables, in and out of doors, etc. The children move forward by rolling the large foam dice included in the game. For example, "You rode your bike, move ahead three spaces.", and "You sat in front of the TV set all day and didn't get any exercise, move back to the square." This educational game is a great way to promote the values of good nutrition, exercise, healthy sleep habits and personal hygiene."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Medical
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Yachting
description: YACHTING is colorful, easy to understand and easy to play, suitable for players aged 5 and up, where players players pick a Yacht and using only a wind direction dice, they must attempt to navigate out of the harbor and round the course, from buoys 1 to 6, and back to the harbor.

name: Bunny Hop
description:
Bunny Hop is a large boxed game, where players build the playing area out of 1 foot diameter circles. Using a spinner and action cards players 'bunny hop' trying to be the first from the 'Bunny Hutch' to the 'Cabbage Patch' by the way of the numbered stars.
One player acts as a referee and spins and draws cards for the other players.

name: Button Wars: Quo-Ti Clans
description:
A race of legendary, bioengineered warriors known as the Quo-Ti have long been the stuff of myth and legends. A topic of ancient lore for historians to explore and subject of horror stories told to the young children of a hundreds of civilizations for thousands of years.

But the Quo-Ti are indeed real. Originally bioengineered by the great Ucharian Republic to help them confront their many powerful enemies back at the dawn of known history. The Tygernians, Empire of Froth, Gra-Nari Emporium, the Darks, the Old Ones; one and all, none could defeat the Quo-Ti. At least until the day the Quo-Ti Queen led her people in revolt against their Ucharian masters. The ensuing conflict nearly bought the Ucharian republic to its knees and led to the near extinction of the Quo-Ti as a race.

Over a hundred thousand years have passed. The Quo-Ti, once exiled from the Milky Way and hunted across the Universe, have risen to dominance. They have multiplied and spread out among a dozen galaxies, gaining dominion wherever they go. Now a single Clan has led its people back to its origins and established itself along the outer rim of the Alpha Quadrant. Are any of the humanoid races safe? Will the long forgotten Ucharians resurface once more to confront their greatest nemesis?

This 5 page PDF includes the spaceships, fighters and Pods belonging to the Quo-Ti Clans. Two pages of new ship special abilities, 1 page of full color spaceship playing pieces, and one page of fighter and Pod playing pieces.

Expands:

Button Wars
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Mountaineer Mania: The Game
description:
Mountaineer Mania: The Game is an educational roll-and-move game about the state of West Virginia. Players roll the die and move their pawns along a highway winding through each county in the state. If the pawn lands on a numbered county, the opposing player or team draws a card and asks the current player or team a trivia question in one of three categories: People, Places, and Pot Luck.

The first player or team to answer two questions correctly in each category and then land in the winner's circle by an exact roll wins.

name: Sheriff pass auf!
description:
This is a game for ages 5 and up. The box contains a board, 1 die, 24 wooden pawns (in 6 different colors) and 1 sheriff.

The board contains a star shaped plan. The sheriff is placed in the middle of the board. The start fields for the pawns are on the edge of the board.

Aim of the game is to get your pawns as fast as possible past the sheriff to their destination field. Each player gets 4 pawns of the same color.

When on your turn you don't have a pawn on the road, you can roll the die 3 times in order to get a "6". If you succeed in rolling a "6" you can put one of your pawns on the first field of the road and you get an other roll. The pawn moves accordingly to the die roll, but for each "6" you roll your turn continues. On crossings you can choose to take the short trajectory across the center or to stay on the saver loop. When you end up on an occupied field, you can throw that first pawn off the board. This pawn has to start all over again.

The sheriff can reach all pawns on the fields within the loop. If a player rolls a number that allows the sheriff to take one or more pawns, the sheriff has to be played. All pawns that are caught by the sheriff have to restart. The sheriff never beats the pawns of the player who has made the sheriff active.

The game ends as soon as a player has his 4 pawns on his destination field.
categories: American West, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Slaughter & Carnage: Kursk's Stalingrad at Ponyri
description: two 11 x 17 mapsheets, 560 DTP counters. Tactical recreation of the battle of Ponyri, during July 7-10, 1943 at platoon level for tanks and company level for infantry and artillery. Lots of tanks on both side, on the German side, Ferdinand, Brummbar, Pz III, Pz IV, Marders and Sturmgeschutz, on the Russian side T-34, of course, plus KV-1, SU-152, T-60, T-70, and plenty of antitank guns and other artillery in addition to the infantry. Beautiful counters. Tense slugfest over a town located on the Northern salient of Kursk which is astride of the main German efforts

name: The Singing Bone
description:
Who Will Try to Slay the Dragon First? The object is to be the first player to slay the dragon. Players use a spinner to move. They are trying to collect enough "Dragon Cards" (20)so that they can enter the "Dragons Secret Cave". Once in the cave players do battle with the Dragon by spinning the spinner if you spin the number "one" the Dragon is has been slain, any other number and you have to make another round through the cave and try again.

This is based on one of the episodes in the movie The Wonderful World of the Brothers Grimm.

name: The Sex Education Game
description:
Players must collect a complete set of 6 male or female sex organ cards. To win with the male organs, he/she must collect 500 million sperm and then land on the motel. To win with the female organs, he/she must also have one unfertilized egg and land on the bedroom.

The male sex organs are:

Snake of Life
Jewel Plum of Naughty Desires
Valve of Relief
Horn of Plenty
Boulevard of Urgency
Sack of Containment

The female sex organs are:

Gates of Forbidden Pleasures
Avenue of Rapture
Digit of Delight
Tube of Sanctuary
Basket of Hidden Danger
Hall of Conception
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Terror
description:
From the box:

A game of strategy and tactics where the horror of the future is in the monstrous, cybernetic, hybrids you control! Depend not on luck, but instead, on your mind! A stand alone game where every card counts and no card is useless!

Mandibles is a sub-set of cards playable with any other Terror cards including the basic Terror game system, Terror: Adventures, Terror: Combat, and Terror: Death by Dungeon.

name: Battle
description: “Battle” is a deluxe version of the traditional battleship pencil and paper game. There are several significant additions to this new game. The playing grid is a larger 15 by 22 playing area that contains both land and water squares. The forces of both sides contain ships for the water squares, gun batteries for the land squares, and air formations that can occupy either type of square. Players alternate shots by calling out grid locations. The objective is simply to seek and destroy the opposing force before your own force is destroyed.

name: Word Quest
description: Players compete in a quest through a challenging maze of thought-provoking and brain-teasing word definitions. Travel around the word quest game board, collecting letters from words to attain your final word quest and win the game.

name: Griddly Headz Soccer Game
description:
One of seven in the line of Griddly Headz Boardgames, Soccer sees a different cast of “Griddly Headz” (regular Joes) duking it out on the field for ultimate supremacy.

Played on a large, two-tiered board, Griddly Headz features the chance to choose both your team and how your individual players match up against your opponent’s.

Gameplay consists of numerous dice challenges that take place when two players meet on the same play square of the board; the loser forfeits a piece of a player (represented by puzzle pieces). If a player loses all twelve pieces of a player, or one of their Griddly Headz is ejected from play, they are immediately eliminated from the game.

To win, you must score 10 goals – one for each goal or penalty kick dice challenge won by your “regular”, and two points for each challenge won by your “striker”. Points can also be gained through special cards acquired during play.

Available in Special, Deluxe, Family, and Mini editions.

name: Silly Sammy Seagull
description:
"The quick, funny fishing game! Catch the fish as they swim around."

Silly Sammy Seagull is a children's' action/dexterity game for 2-4 players, and is remarkably similar to Hungry Hungry Hippos. Each player has a lever-activated seagull that magnetically picks up fish tokens from a electrically-driven turntable. Catching a fish requires the right balance of force and timing, and captured fish are cleared manually. When all fish have been caught, the player with the most captured fish wins.

Recommended for ages 4 and up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic

name: Henry Ford's River Rouge
description: This educational game recreates Henry Ford's immense industrial complex outside of Detroit. Players or teams compete to most efficiently produce Model A automobiles, while overcoming difficulties in production and management. The game was produced in cooperation with the Henry Ford Museum & Greenfield Village.

name: All About Delaware
description: The All-About-Delaware-Game is an educational exploration of the state of Delaware. The large six piece board is a relative map of Delaware's three counties, with parks, natural resources, shopping centers, highways and places of interest noted on the board. Players start at a residence and must travel via dice rolling along the varied highways of Delaware to nine locations, shopping, exploring, and gathering items. The first player to collect travel cards for everything on their list and return to their residence wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: All About Town, Inc., Windsor Publications

name: Leben in Paderborn
description:
A simple game published by the German City of Paderborn. By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.
During each players' turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Paderborn. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.
The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Feeding Frenzy
description:
Two games in one!

FEEDING FRENZY

Eat your way to the top in this fast, fun, frenzied game! When a card is played, your goal is to eat it using animal cards in your hand. But you better hurry because the frenzy is on and other players are hungry too! The one who eats the most cards becomes the feeding frenzy champion!

FOOD CHAIN

The name of the game is to finish the chain! Using the animal cards in your hand, your goal is to knock other players out of the game by filling in their food chains - from spider (#1) to man (#10). The last player left becomes the king of the food chain!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental

name: Truity
description:
It really makes you think! A game to challenge and inspire, getting you to stand in someone else's shoes while thinking outside the square as to how to solve daily dilemmas. Designed by Lesley Williams, this product is covered by Patent, Trade Mark and Copyright, and only available through TRUITY associated websites. The game is hilariously funny, yet astounding in its ability to move peoples perspective, getting people dealing with issues in constructive ways in just minutes. Deals with all areas of life, from environmental to social, to abuse, to financial decision, there are hundreds of questions in the pack and even blank cards so that you can write your own questions for others to answer. This product was designed to stimulate the creation of new neural pathways, and develop conscious choices, this product is being used in areas of family welfare, social welfare, hospitals, mental health hospitals, correctional facilities and more.A vanity press publication supporting a psychological counselling service.

From the box:

A game to challenge and inspire.

The vision of Truity International is to inspire, mentor and facilitate people from all walks of life which includes health, peace and success.

Truity the game is a tool which leads people to develop enhanced thinking skills aligned with principles for ethical achievement. Play and enjoy.

name: Hilton Head Island Fever
description:
Hilton Head Island Fever can be best described as a Monopoly variant. Players move around a board and can buy properties by landing on them and having the appropriate card in hand.

The businesses on the board are (or were) actual businesses on Hilton Head Island.

The goal of the game is to be the first person to make $250,000 and land on their plantation space.

name: Lemon's Bible Game
description: 12 different games in one. Ranging from solitary play to up to 12 player games. Entertaining and educational.
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Portfolio
description:
Portfolio is a board game with simple instructions and a realistic view of the stock market: buy and sell shares, currencies and options.
A game designed for amateur traders, investor's clubs, and budding financial minds. . .
A game concept with guaranteed accuracy and quality by stock exchange and financial experts.
Four levels of difficulty allow players to progressively learn the logic behind trading shares, currencies and options
Objective of the game:
You are a major player on the stock market. Any decision you make has a significant impact on the current rates.
Your objective is simple: finish with a bigger fortune than your competitors!
To do this, you must successfully invest and manage your portfolio given the 20 market situation cards presented throughout the game.
Each of the four levels of difficulty is represented by 20 market situation cards (available in Dutch, French and English) to which all players must react
Do not depend on luck! Only good common sense, strategic thinking and a clear understanding of the various market mechanisms will make the difference.

name: De Wraak van Seth: Papyrus
description: A long time ago Gods were disputing who would rule the world. Horus would claim power on Egypt and Seth on the desert. Seth wasn't content with this and would soon take revenge. This game is based upon a comic book and cartoon of Papyrus. It's aimed at children starting from age 6.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Scenario Sports
description:
"The Game You Play, While The Game Is On"

From 2 and up to an unprecedented 50 players, ages 8 & up of all genders, will have a blast winning play money throughout the telecast. For example:

When a soft drink commercial is shown......YOU WIN MONEY!
If a commentator says a certain word.........YOU WIN MONEY!
If an official/referee falls down...................YOU WIN MONEY!

There are 51 fun filled scenario cards in the game and when a "scenario" occurs and you hold the corresponding scenario card, you will win the amount of money printed on the card...The player with the most money at the end of the game, WINS!

The special feature of this game is that YOU can choose on how long you want to play the scenario game. You may play by periods/quarters, the whole game or YOU may set a TIME LIMIT on the scenario game.

You do NOT have to play through a 3 hour telecast.
Another special feature of the game is that you may start or stop play at any point during the telecast of the game.
To view the 4 easy direction on how to play, you may visit our web-site at http://www.scenariosports.com

name: Gay Purr-ee Game
description: Spin and move children's game. Featuring the cats Jean-Tom and Mewsette traveling through Paris.

name: Scene it? Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten
description:
In this version of "Scene It?: The DVD Movie Game?" you find scenes and questions about the German daily soap "Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten".] It is a stand alone DVD game about famous german TV show.

"How much do you know about Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten (as seen on TV)? Test your knowledge of the entire Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten gang with Scene It? The Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten Game Pack. Featuring clips, puzzlers and questions from all seasons! Scene It? The Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten Game Pack can add to any Scene It? game or play as a stand-alone title. For 2 or more adult players."
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game
publishers: Fremantle Media, Mattel, Inc., RTL Games, Screenlife, LLC

name: Barbie Rapunzel
description: 2 players compete by rolling the color die and moving around the board to avoid trouble with the bad witch. There is a gizmo that, when pressed, drops a disc which may be a helper or may be the witch. Each player plays as Barbie. The game includes 7 figurines and two 3-D castles (one functioning as the gizmo).

name: Questival
description:
Questival is a trivia boardgame published in the Philippines. Game components is composed of 2 dice, 1 hourglass, 8 plastic chips, play money, and a rule sheet.

Players are divided into two separate teams (Red and White) that must compete in answering questions from cards randomly drawn with the use of a dice. There is a plastic hourglass included in the game to set a time limit on how long each team can answer a question. Correctly answered questions allow that team to win play money and to have another turn. So there can be a chain of turns for a team until a question has not been answered correctly and the time runs out. The gameboard acts as a scoring track and for separating the question cards based on its points. The team which earned the highest score and grabbed the most in prize money is the winner.

name: Shift
description:
From the publisher's web site:

Shift is a board game for 2-6 players.
It is about Love, Fear, Work, Relationships and Human Behavior and it might just change your life.

Have you ever wondered why some see a sunset and immediately become grateful while others see a sunset and immediately think, "Man, where did the day go?"

Or why some people can spill a glass of wine and think that will make a great story, while others will see it as having the same catastrophic impact as the sinking of The Titanic, and then conclude it was the vineyards fault for making the wine? Then, get these answers and more… Shift is a personality x-ray machine that enables you to see what’s driving your friends and most importantly, what’s driving you.

All it takes is a shift in thought to shift your life…

Play Shift and Make your Move.

Home Page: http://www.shiftthegame.com/
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: C'est la Vie! The Game of Lesbian Life
description:
A limited edition board game manufactured by Play on Words in Ann Arbor, Michigan. The game had one printing of 2,000 copies, and was stocked in bookstores across America and Canada in the mid-nineties.

Players travel "the lesbian path of life" through areas such as "coming out", "career", "Womyn's Festival", and "Lovely Lesbians Retirement Villa"; each area with a separate card stack.
Some squares have you draw a karma card, which describes a social situation and how you did in the situation. Some cards give you one karma token (e.g. "You listen objectively to your straight friend's problems with her stupid boyfriend. Collect one token."), while some things cost you two karma tokens (e.g. "You see your best friend's girlfriend at a party - without your best friend - and make out with her until 4:00 am. Forfeit two tokens").
Some squares are 'It's Time to Take Action" squares, which instruct you to perform some action: recite a limerick, tell about the first girl you had a crush on, do the hula, etc.

The winner of the game is the one with the most karma tokens at game end.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Storytelling

name: Battleague
description:
Battleague is a collectible miniatures game produced by Mattel. It uses a combat system similar to Attacktix Battle Figure Game Marvel Superheroes. Figures are eliminated by physically knocking them over using the physical abilities of other figures (i.e. shooting projectiles, punching, etc). More advanced rules exist that include mission cards and power chips.

From the publisher:

This the latest action-figure board game (without the board) by Mattel. Using beautifully sculpted figures by the Four Horsemen, kids can build their armies of heroes and villains with booster packs, and set up elaborate play environments thanks to packaging that actually transforms into city buildings.

Battleague Starter Set: Kids can battle like a hero with Battleague the new action figure board game, but without the board. The starter set includes everything kids need to gear up for battle, including four beautifully-sculpted figures, mission cards with four power chips and two tokens. All Battleague packages convert into battlefield buildings, from city hall to banks and more. Battleague offers many different games in one, including mission play, last man standing and first to score 10 battle blows.

$9.99 Age: 7+ Available: July 2007

Battleague Booster Set: The Battleague Booster Set expands the play of Battleague by adding new heroes and villains to one’s army of action figures. Each booster pack includes two surprise figures, a mission card, four power chips and two tokens. Additionally, each booster box converts into a building to help players create the ultimate urban battlefield.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Road Safety
description:
Players roll the dice and completes a driving test in order to move their token through the driving circuit.

Contains a road safety message from Jack Brabham.

Produced by "Ampol - The Australian Company".

name: Consequences
description: The game of Consequences is a fun way to introduce or reinforce the idea that there is a consequence for all actions and behavior. Each card has an everyday task or behavior that results in a forward or backwards move. Roll the Dice to see how many stones you may travel. Follow the colorful stone path to the park, take a ride on the slide, go for ice cream and end at WATERLAND!! Ages 3 and up

name: Playoff Soccer
description: Players attempt to score goals by rolling three dice and moving a ball peg on a peg board. There is a different die for passes, shots and kicks.

name: Jewel of Truth
description:
Jewel of Truth is a boardgame version of spin-the-bottle, designed for young girls.

From the manufacturer:

"Jewel of Truth will expose your innermost secrets and reveal your future! If the Jewel of Truth points to your colored jewel, you must reveal a secret, while other players try to
guess what you will say. When players match your answer, you both earn fortune cards."

There are five types of fortune cards; each player may hold no more than one of each type. The first player to collect five fortune cards wins.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Sport Dice: Soccer
description:
Simple dice game simulating a soccer match.
Two dice, a timer, counters, score pad and a pencil are provided.
Other games in this series - Golf, Tennis and Cricket

name: Football
description:
Listed in American Games, #4186. 1946, Sports, Football, Board game.

This two-player football game featured a folding game board (football field), 36 play cards, a metal football, a first down marker, and wooden markers to track the down, quarter, and score.

Play begins with the play cards shuffled and placed face down on the board. The player on offense calls a play from a limited menu (long pass, short pass, end run, line buck, punt, field goal), and the top card is then turned over to determine the result of the play.

There is a good variety of play outcomes, including fumbles, intercepted passes, and penalties. However, the game was designed in an era when single wing formations dominated, passing was relatively rare, and offenses were often "three yards and a cloud of dust." As a result, long advances from scrimmage are rare. The longest possible gain is 41 yards on a long pass.

Defense does not come into play, and the player on defense simply must hope that the player on offense fails to achieve successful play outcomes.

One pass through the card deck constitutes a quarter of football.

This game might have nostalgic value for those who played it as youngsters, but there are far better football games available today.

name: Bratz Head Gamez
description: It's funky fashion fun as you travel the board, pickin' up cosmetics and accessories to make over your Bratz™ girl! If your Bratz™ is completely made up and you reach the end first, you win!

name: League Leader Soccer
description:
This boardgame has all the familiar aspects of soccer including rules, terminology, tactics, and of course, excitement.

Players play their games against the board.
A single game is played by traveling from the kick-off square to the final whistle square.
Goals are scored during each game.

Essentially, the board creates realistic results that players record on a league table.
Each player has their own league table for recording results.
When each players league table has been completed, the player with the most league points wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mage Wars: Call to Arms
description:
Lord Yar issued the command with a wave of his hand. With a surge his mounted knights leaped into the charge, their lances lowered, ready to trample and pierce their goblin foes under heavy warhorses.

With a scream the Warlock’s dragon plunged out of the clouds above the battlefield, dropping down onto the charging knights. Flames and death followed as the mounted warriors charge was broken by the great beast of scales and wing. The victory did not last long though, as the high lord Wizard cast a mighty lighting bolt to strike the dragon dead, it falling out of the skies and crashing into the front lines of the goblin hoards.

Lord Yar cringed at the carnage that was already sweeping over the battlefield. The two great mages would both continue to throw their forces at each other, cast spells and counter these magics with their own powerful spells. By the end of the day, Yar doubted that anyone would be left alive.

This is Mage Wars, the newest Mini-Game from Bad Baby Productions. Mage Wars is a fast, fun game of magical conquest and war. Can your forces defeat your rivals before they grind you under their boot? Fully expandable, the system will showcase two new mages with each edition, as well as new hex boards, troops, magic and more. Gathered together, these different editions will create a massive game system which will devour hours of your time, so be warned, this game can be additive.

This first set covers the forces and magic of the Arch-Mage and the Vile Warlock Lord. Each set comes with enough counters, map tiles and goodies to play, and when combined with other sets you can create a massive game system where several players can struggle for control of the magical realms of Mage War.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Little Black Sambo
description:
WARNING: This game is considered offensive by many and is part of the BGG database for completeness

Understanding and apologizing that this is a very politically incorrect game for this day and age. I have included this game (dated from 1924) for completeness. The games information comes from the AGPC Archives of Games.

" Happy Children are found whenever they are grouped around the new board game of LITTLE BLACK SAMBO. If the eager child listens in open-mouthed wonder to the story of how Little Black Sambo met all those 4 tigers in the jungle, gave up and then won back from them his little red coat, the pair of beautiful blue trousers, the green umbrella and the purple shoes with crimson linings what do you think he will do when given a handsome game board on which he and his little friends play out the story. There is Little Black Sambo himself, he is pursued by the 4 great tigers with the clothes as forfeits, when he is overtaken and of course returns home at the end. The game board is handsomely lithographed in colors. There is a separate carton which contains the substantial spinner and the men." Each game comes in a separate wrapper and is attractively labeled and sells for $1.00 per game. Saafield Publishing Company, Akron, Ohio.

name: Danger Zones
description:
Danger Zones is a board game intended to teach children about safety. Players roll the dice and move on a board to various colored spaces and attempt to answer corresponding questions. The questions are directed at educating and testing children's knowledge on various safety issues such as water safety, strangers, bicycle/vehicle safety, etc. When a player answers correctly, he receives a black velcro piece representing a jail bar that is affixed to the player's card. When the player has accumulated sufficient jail bars to lock up "Wacko Weasel" and "Pud Possum" (pictured on the cards), he wins. A player may also be sent to a "Danger Zone" space which requires the additional answering of a question or other penalizing action.

The game has an interesting feature which allows children to play even when there is not an adult available--a cassette tape which has a voice reading questions and answers than can be used instead of the cards.

name: Franchise Mania
description:
This game simulates owning a hockey franchise. Owners guide their team through a season and playoffs.

Owners spend money to increase their team's skill and roll dice, modified by skill points, to generate game scores against other owner's teams during the season. Periodically a team must draw a card from one of two decks that alter the fortunes of the team, for good or bad.

Play continues until a 40-game season is completed. Teams are seeded into a playoff tree. Each 7-game round, the winner moves on until there is a champion.

name: Ninja School
description:
Aim to attract the most agile ninja into your new Ninja School, supply them with equipment then send them out to attack other ninja schools to maintain your position as the best master.

Players collect ninja in 7 different styles of fighting, each ninja being of different strength. The game ends when one person has played one ninja from five different styles into their school or seven ninjas in total from any style. Points are scored for the value of the ninja and bonuses depending on how many styles are in the school and how many ninja are in each style.

Players may equip their ninja with items to improve their strength, stealth or weapons which are kept hidden until they are attacked or are sent out to attack another players ninja.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Disciple
description: This is a religious themed game where players answer trivia/knowledge questions about Jesus Christ and his teachings in order to advance on the board and earn the status of a "Disciple." There are various levels of questions so that adults and children can play together

name: Admiral
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to attain the Admiral rank.

You start the game as a Midshipman (Naval Cadet) and get promoted to the next higher rank when you achieve the required points at the "Promotion Board".

Use a combination of "Naval Academy" cards and dice roll to help you meet the necessary points. Other players can attempt to sabotage your promotion by using "Top Secret" cards. However, these "Top Secret" cards, once used, are removed from the game, so the timing and frequency of use can be a factor.

ADMIRAL can be classified as a family game - providing enough element of luck for children to win yet offering light strategy play for adults to stay engaged.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Where Jesus Walked
description:
Be one of Jesus’ disciples as you follow Him around Galilee and Judea. Learn about miracles, teaching, and famous journeys and where to find them in the Bible.

Beginning at Nazareth, players start out on a journey to other places on the map. As each place is visited an event card is taken from the pile which refers to an event in Jesus’ life which occurred at a certain place. The basic idea is to match up event cards with places visited.

Once you have visited 7 places and you have an event Card for each of those places, you immediately begin your journey to Jerusalem. On arrival you have one minute to memorize the information on your 7 cards. You score one point for each piece of information you remember, with a total of 3 points per card, making a maximum of 21 points. The winner is the one who ends the game with the highest score.
publishers: Autumn House, Review and Herald Publishing

name: Bible Bonanza
description:
How well do you know your Bible? Do you know which book comes before Habakkuk? How many chapters are there in the book of Titus?

Bible Bonanza is a package of six Bible based card games that will test your knowledge of Biblical trivia. The included games are:

1. Bible Pairs
2. Bible Runs
3. Book Piles
4. Book Ends
5. Challenging Chapters
6. Impasse!

Ages 5 and up.

name: Bible Scramble
description:
Bible Scramble is a game that turns Bible trivia into lively entertainment. It is both a battle of wits and a race against time as players flip over cards and dig into the letter pile to spell out their answers to Bible trivia.

The object is to be the first person to spell out the answers to your card questions with letter tiles, and to clean your opponents out of shekels. Each card supplies a Bible text just in case memory fails.

Ages 10 and up.

name: The Junkie Game
description:
An educational board game made to illustrate the destructive nature of addiction. Its mechanics are described by the author as a reverse of games like Monopoly; instead of acquiring wealth, the players lose money, their job, and their possessions throughout the course of play.

From the author's own description:

"Up to [seven] players play at being heroin addicts... the last to lose all his assets is the winner... It was meant as a kind of teaching aid for people who worked for drug programs, or wanted to learn that sort of thing.

"Three to five [players] is ideal... You roll dice and advance to heavier habits ($10/day, $20/day, etc.)
as you spiral inward. There are Hassle and Wisdom cards, when you land on red or green squares, kind of like Chance and Community Chest in Monopoly."

When the player loses his or her job due to varying circumstances, hustles help replace player income. These could be described as variable player powers, because in a sense, different hustles earn a player income in different ways.

As the game progresses, players are likely to acquire more expensive habits which require more money to maintain, as well as suffering the loss of their job, arrests by law enforcement, and negative conseqences of board spaces. The player who survives the longest is declared the winner, though the true goal of the game is to show that getting involved in the real-life junkie game is always a losing proposition.

name: Bratz: Make Me Up!
description:
From the back of the box:

It's a real fashion emergency as everybody's favorite girls with a passion for fashion, the Bratz, find themselves in a crazy race to see who can put together the hottest fashion first! Create the perfect look to make heads turn all night! The first girl to complete her outfit and make it home first WINS the game & gets TOP fashion honors!

Game includes: Game Board, Dice, 16 Player Pieces
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Zog Off!
description: Zog Off! Ya Thievin' Lil Git! appeared in White Dwarf #117. It was a clever use of the bits from Trolls in the Pantry along with some cut outs from the magazine. The goal for each gobbo is to collect sets of food and get them into the pantry. The trolls are trying to collect ALL the food and get it into the troll cave.

name: Grandmama's New Testament Questions & Answers
description: Typical Q&A card game for children.

name: I Love Chautauqua
description: This is a Monopoly-style game using the theme of Jamestown, New York (USA) and the surrounding Chautauqua County. The various properties and spaces on the board reflect businesses, landmarks, and locations in Jamestown and Chautauqua County. This game also incorporates the history of the area, as the event cards in the game contain various historical anecdotes.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Traxs
description:
The Music Challenge

Ready! Steady! Go!

All you get is 15 seconds to come up with a tune.

A card is flipped over that contains a specific word. Within 15 seconds, the active player has to sing any tune in which the word appears.

Any age, any generation, from Rock ‘n Roll to Rap, TRAXS covers it all!

name: Drill
description:
The goal is to collect moving birds of different colours.

Everyone has a player mat with an unique combination of coloured circles to place birds on. To get a bird one will have to roll the three dices to show the same colour. First one to fill the player mat wins.

name: Pilgrim: A Game of Christian Challenge and Progress
description:
Pilgrim: A Game of Christian Challenge and Progress is a Christian-themed religious game that uses mechanics something like recent party games like "Cranium." Players move on a board, and depending on where they land, they might have to do one of various activities such as: perform a charade, sing a verse of a (religious) song or chorus, give a testimony, answer multiple choice questions, do a word challenges, answer true or false questions, or do a bible character identification.

Game includes 600 Cards (100 in each color: Red, Yellow, Blue, Purple, Green and White); 6 Colored Pawns; 140 Coin Cards (for moving or navigating on the board); One Minute Timer; Gameboard; and Game Rules

name: Tim Lahaye's Bible Trivia
description: Be the first player or team to collect 6 Bible coins by answering questions correctly. Includes 500 cards with 2000 questions.

name: The Algae Eater
description:
From the Instructions:

The object of the game is to be the first player to get all your game pieces into the mouth, down to the stomach, around the body and to the Finish Area (on the person's left shoulder). As you are playing, the Energy Cards will teach you about Klamath Lake Blue Green Algae. Game recommended for ages 8 to adult.

Contents:

1 Tri-fold Game Board depicting the pathway of a person ingesting Algae and it's route through the body
24 game pieces representing vitamin-like bottles
54 energy Cards

A variant of Parcheesi with the intent of educating people to the benefits of eating Algae. Each space is colored and acts as a "safe" area to pawns of a matching color.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Titans of Terror vs. The Forces of Good
description:
If you would dare to experience a maelstrom of miniature mayhem, then enter the world of "The Titans of Terror vs. The Forces of Good", Ral Partha's first installment in a throat-clutching trilogy of horror. This foray into the fantastic has been created exclusively for Sculptor's Row by one of the world's top fantasy sculptors, Dennis Mize.

An avid collector of classic monster movies, Dennis Mize has designed the "Titans" to capture the look and feel of the classic Fantasy and Sci-Fi films of the 50's and 60's. The "Titans" are presented in a "serial" format, so that each new boxed set will contain the latest "episode". These scenarios, when combined, will reveal the complete and mesmerizing tale of "The Titans of Terror".

name: Bible Match Ups
description:
Includes a 2-sided gameboard to play two separate games:

" Match*A*Book "
" The object of the game is to match books of the Bible in pairs.
Any two books in order are considered a pair.
For example: if Luke is captured, it would take either Mark or John to make a pair. "

" Match*A*Verse "
" The object of the game is to match halves of Bible verses. "

name: Master Farmer
description: This is a nice little self-published game by John Deere. Essentially a spin-and-move race game with a farming theme.

name: Fun with Lotto: A Bible Game
description:
This is a biblical themed Lotto or Bingo like game. A fun way to learn about biblical persons.

The game comes with 16 large Lotto cards, 128 small reading cards and an instruction sheet.

name: Young People's Bible Game: David and Goliath
description: In this game from the 1890s, one player reads a card while the other guesses the subject. If correct, they get the card.

name: The Hawaii Game
description: Race your sailboat through the Hawaiian Islands! Be the first to win the ract to the finish! Can you accept the risks? You could be dismasted? You could find yourself bacalmed...you could sail into a hurricane! But then again you could see a double rainbow and gain an extra turn, or race ahead of pirates to the next port of call. To win, you must be the first player to sail through the warm Hawaiian waters to the finish, and collect 5,000 points during the trip.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Chip 'n' Dale Nuts! Game
description:
This is from the rules:

The goal of the game is to collect the most nuts.

Each player at his (or her) turn spins the spinner, then moves the Chip 'N' Dale playing piece, from tree to tree, clockwise around the game board according to the number spun.
When a player lands on a tree which contains no nuts, he takes nuts -- according to the number spun -- from the center of the game board and places them on the tree where he landed. For example, a player who spins 3, moves three spaces, and if the tree where he lands has no nuts, takes three nuts from the center of the game board and places them on that tree. If, however, a player lands on a tree already containing nuts, he removes all the nuts from that tree and places them off the game board on the table in front of him. His turn ends.
Play continues in this way and tell no nights are left on the center of the game board. Game ends as soon as the last nut is taken from the center of the game board.
Winner is a player with the most nuts on the table in front of him.

name: Zombie Apocalypse
description:
"Everybody said you were crazy, but you knew it was only a matter of time... and you were right.

Now they've risen, cold and hungry from the grave. Time to break out the shotguns and crowbars, and start laying the smackdown on some walking dead chumps!

'Zombie Apocalypse' is a miniatures game based on a stripped-down version of the "Action Dice" system. Included in the 22-page rulebook are simple rules for playing out your zombie infestation, 120 Gear Cards, and 70 Zombie Tokens.

Survival is no game, especially on the mean streets of the near future."

name: Survival Terror
description:
Another free game from DaVinci games. This game attempts to recreate the horror and tension from Romero's Living Dead movies in a tongue-in-cheek way. Using hex maps, the player is put into a house, shopping mall or army base where they are fighting for their lives against zombies.

This is not an actual game, but a humoristic take on zombie games hosted in a issue about funny games.

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

name: Bible Characters Game
description:
Coming straight from the Bible, this card game familiarizes players with important Bible characters. Playing the Bible Characters Game plugs you into the thoughts and actions of people in the Bible and challenges each player to learn, remember, and share important Bible truths.

Fun and rewarding for all ages, the Bible Characters Game keeps God’s dealings with His people in every age fresh in the minds of modern-day Christians. A biblical alternative to secular games.

For two or more players Ages 8 and up.

name: Pog Soccer
description:
From the publisher's website:

POG Soccer combines the Classic Game of POG with the real action of soccer. You can score a goal, make a save or get a red card. You must outscore your opponent by flipping over the most POG. The player who scores more points wins the game! Includes 22 POG, 2 Slammers, 1 Game board, 1 Die, 1 Official Rule Sheet and 1 Score Pad.

Reimplements: Pogs

name: Bible Knows
description:
The Holy Scriptures are written inside the cards with numbers. The Bible Knows cards are in order from Double 7 to Double 0.

There are 8 sets in the deck of 36 cards. The Double sets have "Bonus" points. When a player scores with a double, and connects the numbers, the player gets the regular points plus the bonus points.

You can play 150 to 1,000 points. Each player is dealt 7 cards. Whoever has the Double 7 plays first, or, if a double 5 is played first, player receives points plus bonus. The highest double goes first. If a player scores with a double you get the points plus the bonus points.

All players must quote the scripture out loud before connecting the numbers. The first player to run out of cards must say, "Bible Knows". The one who wins the hand receives all points in the other players hand except the bonus points.

name: Gotcher
description: The gameboard is made of molded plastic and consists of raised islands connected by a series of raised paths. Some paths allow two-way traffic; other only allow one-way traffic. Players choose to be either hunters or fugitives. The object for the fugitives is to make their way across the gameboard. The hunters are trying to capture the fugitives before they reach their objective. In turn, the players advance one of their pawns the number of spaces generated by a Traka, an electronic number generator included with the game.

name: The Greatest Adventure: Stories from the Bible – The Nativity
description:
The Nativity

Journey through the Holy Land when Jesus was born.

This fun and easy game is intended to help understand the stories, events, and people in the Bible with questions and answers.

Each player in turn reads a question card. The player turns over the question card to see if the question was answered correctly. If correct, the player moves forward on the game path the same number of spaces indicated on the card.

No spinners or dice are used.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Questions and Answers, Race, Track Movement

name: Indulto: The Game of Bullfighting
description:
Features:
The top 50 matadors of 2006 rated in every category
Large list of bulls, including weight & color. Bulls' behavior may lead to matador injuries.
63 of the world's top bull rings rated; the crowds play a part in the outcome
Fast action card driven; the matador performs the appropriate action for each tercio
Both matador and bull influence the action; a skilled matador will be awarded more trophies than those of inferior skill

name: Limit: The Game of Pro Bass Fishing
description:
Features:
The top 104 elite anglers of 2006, along with hundreds of other regional anglers, are all included and rated in individual angling skill.
All major lakes on the pro bass tour included and charted for catching frequency and weight base
Fact action cards drive the angling; obtain results for each angler quickly; "phase" system splits the fishing day into 5 segments.
Full featured events chart; experience all the oddities, fish patterns and angler behavior just as you would in real life
Optional practice session system allow anglers to get the feel of the lake; a good practice may raise their odds. Weigh-in system in which penalties may occur at weigh-in Weather system also affects the angling performance. Anglers may even catch foreign objects or suffer boating mishaps!

name: Cosmic Journey
description:
This is a new age game that combines elements of a trivia game with a roll & move random result element. Players earn points representing their spiritual enlightenment leading to Ascension (winning).

Cards are divided into three types.
Question Cards or trivia cards, sample question: It is said the energy that surrounds a person or object. In Russia they are supposed to have a camera that can photograph this energy. What is the name for this energy?

Karma Cards, sample card: In a past life you were a bigot. Your karma has descended upon you. Lose 10 points.

Risk Cards, sample card: What if the Pituitary, Pineal, and Lyden glands formed the silver cord in the human body? You earn 5 points for contemplating this possibility.

Who knew you could actually keep score on your path to perfection?

name: New Orleans Scene
description:
New Orleans Scene is a Monopoly variant taking place in set in New Orleans, LA. The board spaces are late 1970s-era business from the city.

Part of the Hansen's City Scene Games Series.

From the publisher: Wheel and deal on the Waterfront, befriend a glamorous socialite, explore the French Quarter, and retain a shrewed lawyer to stay out of trouble - all part of the New Orleans Scene.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Progression
description:
Progression is a game that illustrates God's plan as taught by the LDS church. Players begin in the pre-existence and are either born as a member or non-member of the Mormon church. They then proceed through earth life, death, judgment, Paradise or Spirit Prison, the 2nd coming and Millennium, and finally gaining eternal glory in one of the three levels of heaven or being cast out into outer darkness.

The game is fairly non-PC by today's standards and would probably not be endorsed by the LDS as non-members of the church are portrayed as sinners.

The first person to achieve eternal glory is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cheerios Check-A-Lot
description:
A checkers variant published on the back of Cheerios cereal boxes for one summer during the 1990's. The game was displayed on boxes that contained promotional 'X' shaped pieces of cereal amongst the tradiational 'O' shaped pieces, and different boxes featured different games to play with those pieces.

In the Check-A-Lot game, each player has an array of pieces -- either all x's or all o's -- arranged on both red and white squares. Players alternate making checkers-style movement across the board, obeying the special squares indicated on the board. Naturally, you are encouraged to eat any opposing pieces you capture.

name: Boondoggling
description:
Boondoggling is one of several games published during Franklin Roosevelt's administration criticizing the WPA (Work Projects Administration) and Roosevelt's "brain trust" of advisers for his "New Deal" economic program. In the game, players compete to spend all of their money and return to Washington with no money in hand. The challenge, however, is to avoid collecting new funds from the Treasury on the Road to Inflation, which means that a player's best chance to win is both when his own funds and the Treasury's are exhausted.

As with many political games, more attention is paid to the political statements being made than to producing a playable game design. The only choices a player has in the game are whether to keep a roll of doubles or to re-roll the dice, and when to take the Road to Inflation to try to win the game. All else is driven by the dice and the spaces on the game board.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 1, 2, 3: Drachenrechnerei
description: This game of HABA is created to teach kids to calculate and count. It's a game which can be played in different ways, so it is useful for a wider range of ages. It is themed in a dragon style to make it look nice for the group of users.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Math, Number

name: 1, 2, 3 ... wie lerne ich die Zahlen?
description: This is a German board game for children to learn counting. Your target in this game is to place all shoes, boxes and bags in the right place. You play as a team to get to this target. You lose as a team when there are then feet on the Fridolin-strip. This means you have to work using good tactics.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Dora the Explorer Story Maze
description:
Using picture cards, creativity and imagination, children move Dora and her friends to the center of the board by developing stories about the journey.

In the two player game, the player who helps the most characters to the center wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Scooby-Doo Gold Rush Game
description:
Join Scooby-Doo and his friends on a clue seeking adventure! SPin the spinner and move your character along the path. If you land on the right space you get a clue token.....But, this special spinner has a monster at the other end and if it lands on a Gotcha! space - Look Out! One of the players is going to have to go for a ride. If it's you, you'll go spinning around, but you won't be able to collect clue tokens until your luck gets better and you get out! The first player to collect three tokens and get back to start wins!

Includes: Game board, deluxe plastic spinner, 5 movers, 5 mover stands, monster piece, clue tokens, snack tokens, game die, label sheet, and instructions.

From Pressman Games.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Cartoon Network, Pressman Toy Corp., Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment (WBIE)

name: Ambassadeur: Een reis om de wereld in 80 rechten
description:
This game with a special formed board is released in the Netherlands as a promotion of the Stichting Kinderpostzegels.

Every players starts in a capital city of a country and the first person who reaches his orher capital city again (by going around the board once) wins the game. Winning is just a matter of luck in this game.

Components: gameboard, 50 law cards, 30 challenge cards, 6 pawns, 2 dice, 6 "unlucky" containers and the rules.

name: Republocrat
description:
(From the back of the box) Republocrat is a game which combines a basic knowledge of American History along with luck and skill. Players travel around a circle of spaces named Democracy Boulevard to work towards their ultimate goal: Election to the Presidency. the spaces on the board allow the players to consecutively move into 5 offices prior to reaching the final stage of the game. The final stage of the game finds players at the National Convention and the White House. The offices that players must pass through are: City Council, State Senate, US House of Representitives, Governor of the State and US Senate.

Players may suffer setbacks or gain sudden rewards during the game. Depending if the player answers the question correctly determines if the player moves ahead. In addition, when a player receives a "Republocrat Card", it may require the player to move ahead or go back as indicated on the card.

Republocrat not only entertains, it challenges and informs those seeking election to the presidency. The 240 United States of America questions will allow people to play the game many, many times and enjoy a new experience each time.

name: Schlaufuchs und Stachelhaut
description:
Hedgehogs are useful animals, but the fox is one of their natural enemies. They find shelter for themselves by rolling themselves together into a bowl.

A highway with cars is a dangerous place for them. On land without bushes and hedges they cannot hide themselves. The players must try to keep the hedgehogs out of danger. The player who finishes his tour around the board and back to the nest with hedgehogs first is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bratz Charmed Life Game
description:
From the publisher:

Be the first beautiful Bratz girl to make a round on the red carpet, answer questions from reporters, agents, fans and photographers and fill up her necklace with stylish and chic charms. The first player to reach superstar celeb status by collecting eight funky charms wins the game.

Game includes: red carpet backdrop game board, 4 molded BRATZ girl game pieces, 32 charms (8 per girl), 4 charm necklaces, 120 game cards (photo, press, agent and fan), 12 charmed cards, 16 multiple-choice letter cards, 4 yes/no cards and die.

name: Bursa
description:
Each player buys and sells stocks in this educational financing game, trying to accomplish her secret mission. You get only 20 trade opportunities to make your millions!

Awards

2007 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Japanese Game

name: Comball
description:
"A new concept of logic and strategy game."

The game consists of five shallow metal dishes that sit on a cruciform plastic holder. Each dish is a different primary color, and there are five marbles that match the dish colors. The last component is a deck of cards that show the five dishes as colored circles. Each card has a different combination of the five marbles (smaller colored circles) distributed among the dishes.

name: Soccer- Hart am Ball
description:
Content:
16 players' cards, 1 field card, 1 ball, 4 instruction cards

"Soccer" is a trick-taking card game with the subject "Soccer" (=european football) that was edited in time around world championship 2006.

name: Tim LaHaye's Deluxe Bible Trivia Game
description: Be the first player or team to collect 6 Bible coins by answering questions correctly. Includes 500 cards with 2000 questions.

name: Talking Trivia
description: Containing 6000 Trivia questions, spanning 5 categories, players compete to be the first to amass 1000 points

name: I Have a Bible Secret
description:
Players take turns answering questions about characters from the Bible. Ten clues are provided on each card. Ten points are given for the correct answer on the first clue, nine for the second, eight for the third, etc. However, no set amount of points for victory is specified in the rules; perhaps that's the Bible Secret in question. As Ned Flanders might say, see how long it takes you to answer 100 points worth of Bible questions, then try to break that record.

From box front:
"Leisure time activities that sharpen the mind and improve the character are true Christian recreation."

name: Bible Bookmates
description: Memory game that involves matching tiles of sequential books of the Bible. Players score 5 points for each matching pair and 20 points extra for collecting four tiles in sequence in any of the the following groups: Law, History, Poetry, Major Prophets, Minor Prophets, The Gospels, Epistles of Paul, General Epistles.

name: Dice GOLF Game
description: AIM : To complete 9 or 18 holes , using the dice to make your way around the course, with the lowest score possible (to play 18 holes, turn around at hole 9 and proceed back to hole 1 ) .

name: The Greatest Adventure: Stories from the Bible – Moses
description:
"Journey with Moses as he frees his people from slavery."

"This fun and easy game is intended to help understand the stories, events, and people in the Bible with questions and answers."

"Each player in turn reads a question card. The player turns over the question card to see if the question was answered correctly. If correct, the player moves forward on the game path the same number of spaces indicated on the card."

No spinners or dice are used.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Questions and Answers, Race, Track Movement

name: Soccer Action Packed Dice Game
description:
Off-the-field fun for players. Roll the dice to see if you hit a corner kick, made the goal, got a penalty kick, etc. Fast-paced dice game with four dice, a small duffel/carry bag and score sheet. For one or more players.

Features
Includes set of offensive and a set of defensive dice
Mini black duffel bag storage case
Ages 6 and up
1-2 Players

Also included are instructions as to what the die rolls mean and how to score based on the die results.

name: Election of the King
description:
In Königswahl, each player takes the role of a medieval dynasty in the Holy Roman Empire between 1000 and 1600. Players start as bondsman and attempt to ascent ranks, with the goal to obtain ministry positions at the court of the kaiser. Each ministry equals one vote. The objective of the game is to gain enough votes to assign the new emperor after the old kaiser died.

By managing workers, building new buildings, trading with cities, raising taxes, diplomacy and using political influence, cultural development, population growth, and military actions, each player tries to reach specific conditions which qualify him/her for either secular or religious ascension. Moreover, each player has to guarantee the continuous existence of her/his dynasty by getting offspring and marrying offspring with the offspring of other players.

In each round, every player plans ahead 5 actions which, in most of the cases, can be played simultaneously. Seven different kinds of actions are possible (diplomacy/intrigue; get influence cards; income/trading; build; development; expansion; action upgrade), each of which can be improved up to five levels (except for "action upgrade").
The population size determines the number of workers a player commands. Workers are necessary for military expansion, operating buildings, trading with cities etc.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Economic, Medieval, Print & Play

name: House of Tudor
description:
House of Tudor includes 5 pewter miniatures 35 mm high, including a Tudor king, queen, gentleman, bishop, and jester, as well as a 4 x 10 checkerboard and 12 lines of rules. One player takes starts four pieces at one end of the board, able to move only forward, and the other takes one piece at the other end, able to move orthogonally. A player wins by getting a piece to the end of the board.
The same rules and board are sold with numerous other collections of pewter figures.

name: Playoff Tennis
description:
A very simple dice game consisting of a wooden board, three dice, three pegs, and rules all kept in a small plastic container.

This game attempts to simulate the basics of tennis. There is a Serve Die and two Volley Dice to determine the outcome of given actions. Two pegs track the score while the other one represents the ball as it goes from side to side.

name: Generosity Bible Game
description: Christian game with the appearance of Monopoly, but players are not required to purchase properties to acquire riches. Instead, merely landing on a square results in the blessing of generosity. Spaces for answering Bible trivia questions are included for good measure.

name: Bible Quotto
description: Bible-themed combination of bingo and trivia. Players draw cards printed with incomplete Bible quotations and must then find the missing portion on their player cards. The first player to completely fill out their card is the winner.

name: El Tesoro Escondido
description: In this children's game, the players must reach the treasure by throwing the dice and moving on the board. During journey they will find dangers such as the giant octopus, the dungeon of doom, the infected rats and the great volcano. They should avoid these risks to get the treasure trove and win.

name: Derek Jameson's Headliners
description:
Based on the classic TV show this is a fun board game for teams to play.
The players divide into 2 teams and compete playing as The Daily Mail or The Express.
Each team has a score pad divided into 4 decades and each decade is divided into 4 categories. The object of the game is to tick off each box by the correct answering of relevant questions.
The first team to fill their card wins the game.

name: Bible ABC's
description: A card game from the twenties or thirties. Each card is marked at the top with a letter of the alphabet followed by a list of persons, places, and things from the Bible which start with the same letter. A Biblical quotation is also included on the cards. The rules specify twelve different games and game variations for use with the cards, including one game for younger children that can't read the cards well.

name: Bible Books
description: A card game from the twenties or thirties based on the books of the Bible, from the Old Testament through the New Testament. Each card describes a specific book and contains a number of questions about it. The rules specify seven different games to be played with the cards.

name: Bible Cities
description: Game 3 of the Profitable Play series from Judson. A card game from the twenties or thirties. Consists of a custom deck of cards, each featuring a city from the Bible and related Biblical quotations. Rules are given for four different games, including games designed for younger children and children who cannot read. In addition, there are five suggested methods for using the cards for study.

name: The Christian Life Game
description:
"A game designed to help you master the basic principles in the Christian life."
Each player has an individual board on which their pawn moves from Salvation at game start to Future Things at game end. To advance one's pawn along this journey, players must answer Biblical questions in the categories of Prayer, Bible Study, Fellowship, Witnessing, Doctrine, and Promises.

name: Bible Dot-O
description: An educational card game consisting of 24 matching pairs of cards. Players take turns drawing from a pile of white cards on which is printed a scripture passage that tells an incident in the Bible. Green cards that describe the incident are held in the players' hands. If a card drawn can be matched with one of the player's green cards, the pair is set aside. The first player to match all his green cards wins the game.

name: Head Hunter
description:
Players embody fledgling companies with ruthless recruitment strategies. Each turn the companies may Hire and Fire, create patents, materials or goods, but they must also sell enough to be able to pay their employees.

The most evil aspect is stealing another players' employee by offering them a pay rise...or was it a bluff forcing the player to increase his own wage bill for no reason?!

name: Space 1889 Empires
description:
"Space 1889 Theme. Various Victorian Powers fight for control of Mars."

The players take control of one of nine armies: British, German, Canal Martian, High Martian, French, Russian, American, Belgian, or Japanese. The object of the game is to control at least half of the cities on Mars.

Components include an area movement map of Mars, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and a set of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Allo... Docteur?
description:
The goal of the game is to be the first doctor to correctly diagnose the illness of the patient. This is achieved by a process of elimination.

The components are the best part of this game as it comes with a complete set of diagnosis tools and a patient.

name: First Aid Challenge
description:
From the Publisher:

FIRST AID CHALLENGE is a board game that promotes first aid awareness. The game consists of one game board, 4 colored tokens, one die, 40 kit cards, and 40 event cards. The goal of the game is for each player to move around the game board collecting kit cards.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Six Flags 3-D Board Game
description:
Six Flags It's Playtime! 3-D Board Game

Youngest Player goes first. Draw cards move the number of spaces shown. Follow directions on spaces when they are landed. It's a race to the finish weaving around the 3-D amusement rides. First one to finish wins.

name: The School Shooting Game That Really Doesn't Have a Name
description:
From the publishers website:

They've called you a lot of things over the last three years, and now they're going to pay. You have a semi-automatic rifle and a death wish. They have a detailed building evacuation plan and a history test after lunch. It's schoolin' time.

Wander around school mowing down your classmates. Whoever has the most kills at the end of the game wins.

name: Bible Kids on Stage
description: Bravo! Encore! Play the award-winning Kids on Stage™ game with a new Bible twist! Everyone's applauding Kids on Stage™ Bible Charades, the fun, creative way to encourage confidence and develop communication skills in young children. Everyone gets in on the act on every turn. Each player takes a turn acting out animals, objects or actions from the Bible while the other players guess. It's a learning game the whole family can play and enjoy. National Parenting Publications Award and Early Childhood News 100 Best Picks. Contents include 60 Bible themed topic cards (Animals, Objects and Actions), game board with spinner, 4 playing pieces & instructions. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 3 - 8.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reis Kuule
description: Players roll a dice and move that many steps. Some spaces take You back and some of them advance Your place. Whoever reaches the Moon first wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Football Game in a Tin
description: This is a 2-4 player game. The components include a folding game board, four different colored pawns, two dice, rules, and pocket sized tin. Players roll dice to make yardage on the field and push their luck to get to the next down, and ultimately try to make a goal.

name: Lariat
description:
Lariat is played on the surface of a cylinder with one open end and one closed end. As the name suggests, players must form a "lariat", a group of stones which either includes the center cell or surrounds the center cell, and which includes a cell on the lip of the cylinder.

Lariat rule sheet:
http://www.marksteeregames.com/Lariat_rules.pdf

name: ZORBOW: A Galactic Adventure With Numbers
description:
ZORBOW was designed to teach and reinforce the math skills in addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

Players place number and problem cards in the correct patterns as they attempt to solve math problems.

Can be used in the classroom as a team game.

Contains 1080 cards, plastic card holders, and rules.

Includes a Sign Language version.

(c)1989 Abby Educational Products, Atlanta GA

name: SOCCO: the Soccer Skills Game!
description:
From its front cover art for this:
SOCCO: The Soccer Skills Game! Helps kids become better Soccer Players! Fun for the whole family! Endorsed by Professional Soccer Coaches.

Players draw a card from one of the 3 types and correctly answer for that, or perhaps spin from this with the appropriate spinner, and may even "Lose a Turn", in order to advance the ball down the field of spots and eventually score! This continues for as long that the game had been agreed upon beforehand in total goals, until one side has scored enough goals to meet the amount for this, and thereby is declared the winner!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Bratz Babyz 3D Memory Game
description: A variation on the classic memory game using 3D pieces, Bratz Babyz 3D Memory Game contains 20 cups and 10 Bratz Babyz and Bratz Petz figures. The figures break apart into upper and lower pieces and are hidden under the cups. Players then take turns trying to match the pieces parts, with the player making the most complete pieces declared the winner.

name: Super Lariat
description:
Super Lariat is a connection game played on the surface of a three dimensional, three pronged shape. The goal is to form a double ended "lariat", lassoing two of the three prongs.

Super Lariat rules:
http://www.marksteeregames.com/Super_Lariat_rules.html

name: Unee tugaluulax
description:
A mancala game. From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Unee_Tugaluulach:

"Unee Tugaluulach (Mongolian: Үнээ тугалуулах, "let the cows calve"), also spelled Unee Tugaluulax, is a mancala game played by Kazakhs in western Mongolia near the Chinese border. It was described by Namzhildorzh in 1963 for the first time.
