Although a very small board is used, the game is challenging for humans (not so much for computers) because it usually takes more than 150 moves.

Rules:

The game is played on a board (khölög) of 2 x 3 = 6 holes. Initially each hole contains six dungballs (khorgol), excrements of camels, goats and sheep are recommended.

At his turn a player distributes the contents of one of his holes, one by one, in a clockwise direction (viewed as the male direction in Mongolia). The first ball must be dropped into the succeeding hole.

If the last ball is dropped into one of your own holes which then contains four balls, you capture the contents (four balls).

The game ends when a player cannot move or the board position repeats.

If a player cannot move, the remaining balls are captured by the player who was able to move last. The player with most balls wins.

The traditional rule for what happens when the board position repeats is unknown. In other mancala games, counters that continue to circulate around the board are either divided between the players (Oware) or they are not counted (Cross-Wari). It is also possible that the game is considered to end without result (Aw-li On-nam Ot-tjin)."

name: High Stakes Fast Action at the Track
description: High Stakes is a game of thoroughbred horse racing. There are 11 horses in the race, along with four other "scratch" horses. Four "scratch" cards are drawn to remove 4 horses and replace them with penalty horses. The deck is then reshuffled and players are dealt a hand of cards from the 44. Players are given an equal amount of 5 point chips, and they each ante into the Winner's Circle. Roll the dice and move that horse forward one space, if you roll a penalty horse you pay the penalty in chips. The race is over when one horse crosses the finish line. Every player with that horse's number takes an equal share. If you hold more then one, you get multiple shares.

name: Strategy Cup Soccer
description:
Strategy Cup Soccer is the thinking man's game of soccer. You, the coach, must select your players and devise a winning strategy.

No matter who you are in the soccer community, this game will bring you challenging soccer action match after match.

The soccer coach can use Strategy Cup Soccer to develop that winning strategy. The soccer player can use Strategy Cup Soccer to better his understanding of the player's role on the field. The soccer fan will no longer have to be content watching because you call the shots!

Strategy Cup Soccer includes a full color gameboard, die-cut pieces, easy to use Action Tables, complete rules booklet, and score pads. Everything you need to create your own soccer match simulation is in this box."

name: The Game of Tilting the Bucket
description: For any number of players from British Manufacturer of Gloucester and is listed on the box as being from the "Glevum Series". You insert uprights (sort of like goal posts) firmly in the stand of division. Then you place dice in a bucket. You then shoot a marble through the aperture and try to hit the target bucket. This will "Tilt the Bucket" and cause a die to fall on one of the colored squares. You score by adding the results of where the die falls on the gameboard with the pip value on the die. Game is to 100.

name: Bible Football
description:
This is a trivia game played out on a plastic football field. Each question, if answered correctly, awards a set amount of yardage depending on the question's difficulty. A wooden football is marched up and down the field until a score is made.

Components:
Plastic playing field
Football marker
Number cube (Note: this is not called a die!)
Down marker
Head linesman marker
Scoring crayon
Instructions and question book

The year of publication, 1963 is a guesstimate, as no date appears on the box or in the booklet of rules and questions. Unfortunately even the publisher doesn't know what year this came out! They checked, and their finding was it must be "decades ago."

name: Ride the Dragon
description: This is a novelty game about riding a motorcycle through "The Dragon", that is US 129 through Deal's Gap in Tennessee. It has novelty motorcycle figures and is a basic roll and move game.

name: Save The Selkie
description:
Each player chooses a magical creature to be their game piece. Players explore an island, gathering clues until they find the Selkie skin and defeat the guardian creature.

A spinner built into the board determines movement as well as battle outcomes. Players move to different parts of the board and make a hypothesis. This involves telling another player what you think is the creature guarding the Selkie's skin, and what part of the island. If that player is holding either card, they must reveal one, disproving the player's hypothesis. A player who thinks he or she knows the answers can make a guess and check the set aside cards. If they are incorrect, the player must go back to Start.

When a player guesses correctly, they must spin the spinner for a battle. If they spin the right magic weapon, they win the game. If they don't, the other players get to move.

name: Squire Fight
description:
Squire Fight is a game played on a three by three grid. A spinner or die is used for movement on the grid, then used to decide the result of combat. When a player loses ten "hit points," he/she is out of the game.

This game is found in the book "Knight: A Noble Guide for Young Squires."

name: ABX Forces
description: Belgian cycling game released as a promotional game for ABX Logistics. The board is rather big, measuring 69x49cm and comes with 6 cupboard pawns and 54 cards. Movement is not decided by dice but by playing out action cards. Incidents like a flat tyre, a fall or a broken pedal could happen.

name: Mini World Cup Soccer
description:
"The Original Board Game of International Soccer Competition"

You run an entire soccer team as they work their way through a tournament. The object is to win enough games and enough money to advance through the tournament rounds to the Champion round, and then win the final match to capture the Mini Gold Cup.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dig & Play Medieval Quest
description: Dig and excavate 12 medieval soldiers, assemble a cardboard castle and play an exciting medieval quest board game. The board game mainly consists of rolling a die and moving your 6 soldiers (6 gold and 6 silver)around the board to try and be the first to get all 6 in the castle. Soldiers can lose their turn or be sent back to the starting space.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Magnewand
description:
On a player's turn, the dice are rolled to determine how many magnets must be moved to the center pit. These are moved by means of the metal wand. The required number of magnets must be dropped in the pit in a single trip -- if more or fewer magnets find their way to the pit in a single attempt the player scores no points. Likewise, if the player drops any magnets along the way no points are scored.

Magnets are assigned 15, 10 or 5 points each, depending on their size (the larger the magnet, the more points it is worth). The first player to 500 wins.

name: Bible Heroes
description:
3 Bible Heroes Games

(c)1963 Warner Press

Contains three separate game boards featuring St. Paul, St. Peter, and David vs. Goliath. Players move along a track that features Biblical illustrations. Each illustration features a matching Bible verse.

Also includes a plastic storage box containing 12 colored tokens.

"Bible Journeys for children Ages 4 - 14"

name: Googly Moogly
description:
"The dice game with the magic dots"

This simple game's theme is from the "Maggie and the Ferocious Beast" franchise.

It is meant for 1-4 players from Ages 3 1/2 to 6.

It involves rolling a special dice: two sides have a 1 and get the roller one dot from the middle of the table; two sides have a 2 and get two dots; one side is a hat that gets a dot from another player; one side is a hat which loses a dot to the player on the left.

The winner is the first player to fill his or her board's monster with dots.

Ravensburger Game no. 23 137 9

name: Soccer Shootout
description:
From the box:

"With a super-strong leg that kicks the ball over 16 feet, this soccer star can score from anywhere on the field! Simply rotate his leg to angle the kick, then softly tap on his head to shoot short distances or whack him harder for extra-long shots. But watch out for the goalie as your opponent tries to block each shot and keep you from scoring! Comes complete with a scoreboard, 2 soft foam balls and 9 distance markers. Sturdy plastic goal is 15 1/2".

name: Bible Spell
description:
A Bible-oriented word card game. The deck has 52 letter cards and 2 wild cards, with values ranging from 2 to 20 points -- the rarer, the higher.

Deal 10 cards each if 2 play, 7 if 3 or 4, 6 cards if 5 or 6 play. In a turn, a player draws the top of the draw or discard pile, lays down a word or adds to an existing word or name from the Bible, and discards a card. They may also replace a wild card on the table with the letter it is currently standing for, from their hand.

The first player to get rid of all their cards wins the hand and its points. Each word's score is the sum of its cards' values; proper names from the Bible are doubled. If a player plays all their hand in one turn, their total for the hand is doubled. Play until reaching an agreed number of points or hands.

Novar Cottage also published a different version called Alphacard Word Rummy. The rules are identical except they don't mention Bible names as acceptable words.

name: Max's Advanced Rules for Axis and Allies: Europe
description:
This expansion to Axis & Allies: Europe was sold at Origins 2000. It takes the rules from Max's Advanced Rules for Axis and Allies and adds new rules covering such subjects as Armored Spearheads and Encirclements, Partisans, Economic Investment and a more advanced system for Convoys.

These rules may be used separately or together to add to A&A Europe.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Type Trumps
description: Type Trumps, a play on Top Trumps, is a game in which different typefaces are attributed numerical values. These figures are then used to enable the cards to be won or lost using some of the tried & tested "Top Trumps" rules. The Type Trumps have a "ranking", which is a subjectively ascribed positional value based on Rick Banks personal favourites.

name: Contract Madness
description:
The players negotiate a contract that the loser of the game has to reward the winner in some way.

Everyone begins with $1000, two letter cards, and a pawn on the start square. Each players roll in the dice and moves one's pawn in turn. The space one lands on tells the player was action must be done: collect a letter, conduct an auction for a letter, hold a lottery, etc. The winner is the first person who can spell "C-O-N-T-R-A-C-T" with the letters one has or has $200 for each letter missing from the word.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Das Jubiläumsspiel 1200 Jahre Münster
description:
Trivia game on the occasion of the 1200th birthday of the city of Münster/Westfalia in Germany coupled with the occasions of the 300th birthday of Johann Conrad Schlaunn, the 200th birthday of Annette von Droste-Hülshoff and the 350 years of Westfalian Peace. The game was published by an insurance company for that occasion.
The game comes with a board which has two different prints on both sides several colour coded memory cards depicting events of the city history, pawns, dice and a rule book.
The game allows for four different variations. Two of them are roll and move while the other two require knowledge of the city history.
Variant 1: The players alternate in rolling dice. If they can exactly move their pawn on a field featuring the same colour as the topmost of the cards they can gain it. Whoever has the most at the games end wins.
Variant 2: A team game. Two players each play together. Unlike variant 1 it is only allowed to move one space. The rules for collecting are the same. One team wins if they have six of a colour.
Variant 3: Like variant 2 but you only get the card if you can answer the question printed on the backside.
Variant 4: Not really a competitive game. On the backside of the board are squares to hold each memory card. The cards are randomly shuffled into the squares and the players alternate in trying to put the right card into the right square until all cards are sorted.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Lockpick
description:
Setup:
Each player takes two of the tumbler tiles and places them one at a time on the table. The tiles may be oriented any way but they must be placed next to each other in a horizontal line. (My example is vertical, but it works the same)

The sides that touch are considered to be locked. The players start with a tile on the farthest left. They each takes turns dropping their dice on the tile from no less than two inches up. Any dice that fall or roll more than half off the tile are removed and are not re-rolled. Leave all dice on the tile until both players have finished rolling as they can be knocked off as more dice are rolled.

Now compare the results to the locked side (the side touching the next time), there are three numbers on this side. The player that has the most dice still on the tile with these numbers has successfully 'picked that tumbler' and takes the tile.

In the case of a tie, both players begin rolling one die at a time, the first player to roll one of the locked side numbers wins the tile.

Winning the Game:
First player to win three tiles wins. If both players win two tiles each player takes one of their tiles and 'locks' it to the other players on a side of their choice. Players roll one die at a time, dice that roll of the tile are not counted. The first player to roll all three numbers on the 'locked' side of their tile wins.

Part of the 4 Tile Contest:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/383408

Freely available: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/3166518#3166518

name: The Mummy Hunters
description:
The hunt is on!
The Heroes' mission is to move through the Tombs, collecting Mystic Mummy Element Coins. But beware the Mummy, who seeks to foil the Heroes, stalking them across the board to steal their treasure!

Movement around the board is unusual in that a spinner is used to randomly choose one of eight symbols, and the player then moves to the nearest space displaying that symbol. Landing on certain spaces results in a question being read from a deck of question cards, if the player correctly answers the question they are rewarded with an extra turn and possibly an Element Coin (the collection of which is the key to winning the game for the Heroes).

The Mummy Hunters is a board game included in a box set "The Mummy Collection" along with a 6 DVD set of the three Mummy movies (The Mummy, The Mummy Returns and The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor) as well as a "pictorial movie book" of The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor.
categories: Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Het Antwerps Gezelschapsspel
description: A real estate game of Antwerp. The goal is to own as many properties possible. For each property you need to pass by the cityhall, the bank, the notary and the real estate broker. You can also grap someone elses properties if they haven't finalized their business in time.

name: Bibleland
description:
This children's game has the players playing the role of "travelers" through Bibleland.

Each player has a pawn which is in the shape of a plastic dinosaur toy.

The players take turns flipping over the top card of the deck. The player moves their dinosaur to the next space with that color. If the dinosaur lands on special spaces (rainbow, Noah's ark, etc) called "gifts" they take a special card depicting that "gift" from the pile.

The player who is first to go around the track back to the start OR collect all 5 of the prizes is the winner.

From the website:

"Bibleland is a fun educational board game for children ages three and up. It is designed to teach youngsters both the correct order and pronunciation of all 66 books of the Bible. Bibleland provides a fine opportunity for parents to spend quality time helping their children to pronounce the names of the more difficult books.

Entertaining, fun, and easy to learn, the games players (also referred to as "Travelers") move toy dinosaurs on a winding path though beautifully illustrated mountains, sea, and desert, ending in paradise. As many as six people can play at once.

Along the way, youngsters learn the Bible books, and are introduced to great biblical stories, including Noah's Ark and the Tree of Life."

name: Deutsche Post Treasure Hunt
description:
This is a promotional Game from "Deutsche Post World Net".
It has some very nice plastic components and a colorfull gameboard.

Description from Cover:
Treasure Hunt is a dicing game of much fun and thrill.
The task is to bury all the symbols given at the start and collected during the game as quick as possible. Corresponding to the thrown numbers of the two dices, or as wished by the players, doubled or trippled numbers the players are asked to bury all the symbols on their hands with skillful moves on the gameboard. There are many unforeseeable obstacles to overcome by the players.

name: Bible Trav-E-Log
description:
The game of Bible Trav-E-Log by ZONDERVAN PUBLISHING of Grand Rapids, Michigan is played by 2, 3, or 4 players.

The game comes with "Quiz Strips" which have questions on them. Players begin with a pawn on the square called "THE BEGINNING" on the trail of the CHART, with the object being to get one's pawn to "JOURNEYS END" by answering questions correctly.

The directions state that "this is an exciting contest which will afford hours of pleasant entertainment and a wealth of Bible knowledge".

When a question is answered correctly the question sheet is turned over showing a number. A correct answer has a value of one more than the number showing on the card. If the question is not answered correctly the player still scores the value of the number. The game rewards the "Bible student" but permits the uninformed to enjoy the game. "You learn as you play." The first to reach the 'JOURNEYS END' by exact count wins the game.

name: Pollice Verso
description:
Pollice Verso is gladiatorial game also covering horse and chariot mounted gladiators. The original rules by Patrick Mahe give an accurate depiction of gladiatorial combats.

Boxed set includes:

4 Gladiators (Myrmillo, 2 x Retarius, and Secator)
Hex bases
Dice
Hex Grid Sheet
Rules

name: Barber Pole
description: A late 19th century dexterity game with rings made of bone. Basically a ring toss game.

name: Micro-Golf
description: A dice and cards golfing simulation. No publisher is credited.

name: micropul dynamo
description:
In this dice-laying game players are scientists trying to harvest precious micropul matter from an energy core; while using their dynamo dice to claim territory and to affect the playable dice in each other's hands.

Each player has a hand of dice they must play optimally to keep a flow of new dice coming in and if possible keep aside some dice in a supply stack that will be worth more points at the end of the game. Drawing new dice is done by activating catalysts in the dice playing area. Dynamo dice can be used to alter the dice-tile faces showing in a players hand and their opponent's hand, resulting in additional strategies and adds a strong adversarial component to game. During the game, groups of micropul of the same color will get formed. These groups can be claimed using dynamo dice and will be worth a lot of points if they are closed at the end of the game; however, the special power of that dynamo in the new dynamo action is sacrificed as a claim is made.

This game is based upon micropul, but uses dice instead of tiles and has an additional action (making it more adversarial) and adjustments to hand size and core size to take the dynamo effects into account.

The game can be played as a solitaire puzzle or competitively.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Gravitas
description:
Gravitas is the game that gets people thinking and talking again. The game is simple; there is no board, no tokens, and no dice. It is a game of questions and discoveries with no right or wrong answers.

“There are life questions and deeper philosophical questions,” says the creator Alan Gratias. “The game gives us permission to reveal ourselves by answering questions we have never been asked before.” For example, one card picked at random asks the following: How much is enough? What do you wish your mother understood about you? Who is riding in your sidecar? These questions and 426 others make up the inquisitive game of Gravitas.

The rules are straightforward. The player with the birthday closest to the date of play asks the first question. The opening questioner selects any card and picks one of three questions. Each player answers that question. Then the questioner decides which player has the best answer and awards that person the card. The first person to win three cards in a short game, or five in a long game, is the winner or the ‘Gravitarg’ of the occasion.

Gravitas is available online at www.gravitasthegame.com and retails for $39.95.

name: Ya Wanna Bet?
description:
Do you like gambling? Looking for a board game that duplicates the games found in a casino? This is the game for you.

Players take turns moving around a board and playing famous casino games betting against each other. Last player with money wins. Game time varies greatly depending on how much luck swings during a game. This game is very heavily based on luck.

Ya Wanna Bet? includes simulations for such games like slots, roulette, craps, and blackjack.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The IF . . . game
description:
'The If... Game' is meant to help improve every relationship in your life. Players travel around a board and answer question that will help them see conflicts from other people points of view as well as open up channels for communication to resolve problems. As players travel around the board they will also collect Insight cards, these contain questions relating to the way people think and feel. The winner is the player who makes it all the way around the board and has become the most Insightful.

Everyone can play, families, co-workers, and friends can all better their relationships and fix problems using "The If ... Game"

name: Pesispeli
description:
Pesispeli is about the Finnish national sport of pesäpallo, a sport somewhat similar to baseball. The game was developed by Pasin Pelit in the early 1990s.

The game can be played with dice only, or a combination of dice and nine action cards. The action depends upon the roll of the die (action 1-6) as well as the cards are situation-specific, e.g. if you're batting you use one card, or if you're between first and second base you used another card to decide what happens. The objective of the game is be the first to get five runs, a run completed by going through the 53 points on the board.

Components:
1 board depicting a playing field
1 die
4 playing figures
9 cards
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stop & Go
description: A game that involves luck and the ability to write numbers. Each player takes a die and when the starting player says go, he starts rolling the die while the next person writes numbers backwards from 100. When the starting player rolls a 6, he yells "Stop!" and then the next player rolls the dice. The first player to write all the numbers wins.

name: Behind Closed Doors
description: This couples-only board game makes getting to erotic play even more fun. The object of Behind Closed Doors is to be the first to make it to the Winner's Circle; however, along the way each player must perform small, sensual acts such as setting the mood, removing an item of clothing or making out with their partner, as well as collect Foreplay, Positions and Items cards. The first player to finish gets to then incorporate all of the collected cards into the ultimate lovemaking session!

name: Scrip-Tour -- The Bible Book Game
description: Bible Rack-O. Players attempt to arrange cards, each bearing the name of one of the books of the Bible, in their personal racks in biblical sequence. In standard Rack-O fashion, cards can be drawn from either the face down draw deck or the face up discard pile and must then be placed in the same slot from which the old card was removed. First to fill their rack in correct sequence wins.

name: Just One Die Soccer
description:
Just One Die Soccer is a solitaire statistical, replay-oriented game on Soccer.
It is based on the comparison between the goal for and against for the two teams involved in the match, with several additional options (as random period of form, etc.).
After a few simple calculations, each game is resolved with a single die roll: so it is possible to replay a season in one sitting.
Basic game comes with rulebook, charts, Italian Serie A 200/2009, Swiss Superleague 2008/2009 and Austrian Bundesliga 2008/2009. More seasons and leagues soon to come.
Available directly from the designer (send an email to pumaye@virgilio.it or pumaye@gmail.com)
Also available through wargamedownloads.com

name: Golliwog Ring Game
description: Throw the rings around the hooks. The hooks are numbered 1 to 13. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Rommel's Quest For Jesus Tel el Elisa July 10-15, 1942
description:
The area the Australians had taken on July 10th included the coastal ridge from Point 26 up to Point 33 and extended from the coast, south to the railway line. The surrounding terrain was flat and open, offering little or no cover. In such a flat expanse, ridges and rises a mere twenty or thirty yards above sea level give commanding vantage points to their occupants. The height advantage is so slight that one can scarcely appreciate it until actually upon the feature. The 26th Brigade began the difficult task of digging in while reinforcements of artillery, anti-tank guns and machine guns were quickly brought in. Rommel now gave his inevitable response; an all out counterattack to retake this vital ground using threadbare units. Over the next five days, holding this salient would prove extremely tough, with some places changing hands several times. At times the shelling on Tel el Eisa itself made it too hot for either side to occupy.

The Game

Each turn is 12 hrs, with 400 yard hexes. Units are company and platoons for AFVs.

After the Australians had nearly ruptured the Italian line on July 10, Rommel diverted many of this available troops to stop the hemorrhage as it threatened his rear area. However, the coastline ridge of hills and the Hill of Jesus (Tel el Eisa) barred their success. Once the Australians had secured their advance and held the hills, Rommel had no choice but to try to seize them back and from the 10th through 15th, this is what he did.

name: The Pinocchio Game
description:
Rescue Gepetto from the whale in The Pinocchio Game by searching the village for a ladder. The first player to reach the whale's belly wins. The Pinocchio Game comes with a unique two-part game board that lets the children create adventures and enter their favorite fairy tale.
Contents: Two-part game board, four playing pieces, a spinner, game cards and complete instructions. Ages 3 to 8, no reading required.
University Games, 1990.

name: Komm mit ins Zahlenland
description:
The concept of the game is to translate the abstract number range of 1-10 into a number landscape, where children can grasp and comprehend numbers as something concrete. The Numberland (Zahlenland) concept has been developed continuously since the 1950’s – notably by one of the designers,Dr. Gerhard Friedrich. The basic idea for this game is taken from the German bestseller “Komm mit ins Zahlenland” (“Come with me to Numberland”) by Friedrich de Galgóczy. The game can be used for as preparation for school and as a learning companion during the first school year. The following mathematical concepts and skills are addressed in gameplay:

Cardinal number aspect (quantity aspect): Numbers are used to indicate the number or cardinality of the elements of a set (e.g. 6
apples, 3 pine cones).

Ordinal number aspect (order aspect): Numbers are used to indicate position in an ordered set (e.g. first, third etc.).

Arithmetic aspect: Numbers indicate the result of an arithmetic operation, e.g. an addition (e.g. 5 = 3 + 2)

Geometric number aspect: Numbers are used to identify geometric shapes (e.g. pentagon, triangle).

Numeric image: Numbers are represented with the aid of numeral and dice images.

Gameplay: Numberland consists of 10 number houses, in each of which a number lives. Numberland has to be constructed correctly. But the number goblin, Jumble, is on his way from Mistake Forest to bring disorder to Numberland. Can the players stop him and build Numberland? Luckily they have the Number Fairy to help them. The players roll a die and if they roll a Numberland symbol they can construct on one of the buildings (which are completed in numerical order). If the players roll the Number Goblin their constrcutions will be mixed up and remain so until someone roll the Number Fairy, then the mix up can be corrected. Once all houses are finished we will see if Numberland is still jumbled or correct!

name: Mein erstes Buchstaben-Spiel
description: This game consists of the 26 letters of the alphabet. While "y" is only one card, the other 25 letters are "puzzles" of two cards each. One side depicts an item, the other one the spelling. There are three games described in the rule. One is "Old Maid" ("Schwarzer Peter", or, "Das schwarze Ypsilon" in this case), one is a trump game in which the letter which appears first in the alphabet is the winner, in the last one the players have to form words with their letter cards.

name: 1 on 1 Sports Soccer Bitty Bucket
description: A two player game in a bucket. Play your own tabletop soccer match. The bucket includes one shooter figure, one goalie figure, one goal, three soccer balls, two practice cones, one ball flicker and a half-field playmat with instructions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Miniatures, Sports

name: Let's Bomb Iraq
description:
From the box:
"In this strategy card game for 2 players, players assume the role of conservative billionaires. Taking advantage of "connections" with influential politicians, players advance their conservative agendas by relaxing pollution standards, banning gays from the military, supporting the death penalty, and performing other noble actions."

Components:
2 sets of 9 'Influece cards'
2 sets of 9 'Power cards'
1 set of 9 'Agenda cards'

name: NanoVenture
description:
NanoVenture: The Nanotechnology Board Game explores the connections between science, specifically nanotechnology, and society. In this game, players become leaders of a new country. The leaders are challenged to make decisions regarding their country's use of nanomaterials and nanotechnology for industrial expansion, military applications, economic security and basic scientific research, while maintaining a high approval rating from the citizens of the country.These decisions require players to carefully analyze the interplay of technological advances, regulations, public perception and risk, while also learning about the emerging field of nanotechnology.

It is best to play NanoVenture with four to five players. However, teams can be used if there are more than six players.

Each game includes:


Game Board (1)
Game Rules (1)
Glossary of Terms (1)
Player Tokens (6)
Dice (2)
Population Chips (30)
Yellow $5 Million Chips (200)
Blue $1 Million Money Chips (150)
Budget Management Cards (6)
Decision Cards (15)
Development Cards (18)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Materials Research Science and Engineering Center

name: The Ethics Challenge featuring Dilbert and Dogbert
description:
This game was developed in 1997 by the Lockheed Martin Ethics Awareness Training Development Task Force in cooperation with United Featured Syndicate. The game is a component of employee ethics training.

The game uses a game board, character figures based on the Dilbert comic strip and a team guidebook.

Players are divided into 2 to 6 teams of 3 to 7 people and are led through a series of ethical case studies. A simple ethical situation is presented along with 4 possible responses. The teams must decide which is the correct response and present it to the group. Answers provide that team with movement points between 0 and 5 -- better answers grant more points. The teams then use their points to move their figure around the board an collect reward tokens. After 5 cases are answered, the game is over and the winner is the team with the most tokens.

The real objective is "to stimulate thought, discussion, and analysis of the issues that we all must deal with in our work."
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Voting

name: Philadelphia Scene
description: One of many Monopoly clones that John Hansen Co. produced to promote local tourism and commerce. This one is for the City of Brotherly Love.

name: Monsters VS Monsters
description:
"In the middle of the 21st century, a world-wide television company decided to use its newly purchased genetic engineering division to design a new breed of combatants for an Arena based Reality TV show. The scientists chose 10 creatures of legend from around the world, and created these monsters for the show. A Bigfoot, the Wolfman, the Yeti, the Chupacabra, Loch Ness, the Mummy, a Skeleton, a Zombie, Frankenstein, and a Vampire were genetically designed in a lab. Once these monsters were born, they were trained in the habitat from the tales to become the perfect fighting machine. Monsters VS. Monsters is televised live and streamed through the internet in over 130 countries. Even though the show is loved the world over, it still ranks as the 2nd most watched show on the planet."

Combining the simplicity of War, with the exciting elements of a dice game, MvM allows players to play an addicting game where loss can be defeated with a lucky dice roll. Each deck was designed to be a 1-2 player experience.

Monsters VS. Monsters was designed with one goal in mind, to be a low-cost fun and engaging game for children ages 5-18.

name: Das stärkste Tierspiel
description:
The game contains cards numbered 1-72. The lowest card wins the trick, the player with most tricks is the winner.
This simple basic mechanism is packed into an animal theme, which gives the animals a kind of "rank" according to their strength.

name: Sign: The Personality Game
description:
Game includes: 12 different zodiac sign marks. game pieces, dice, task and issue cards, instruction booklet (in Finnish) and hourglass

Goal of the game is collect 4 different zodiac marks and clarify all tasks, quests and challenges.

Sign the Personality Game' is a great discussion of possible sign of the zodiac characters traits and relationships with other issues as well as a variety of life issues. Questions and tasks, subjects ranging from human relations, the love of the life and work. The game includes circa 1800 different questions, challenge and tasks.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Zauberenhändler
description:
The trading card game for BGG.Con 2009, based off 2007's Piratenhändler and Sid Sackson's Haggle.

Each card has a person's name, a hint about two other people's ages, and a bonus. Players can turn in a set of five cards: the score is the five ages of the people, plus any bonuses.

name: Fussball-Quiz: Der goldene Ball
description:
German Football trivia game containing 1500 questions and answers for 2-4 players. The questions are very outdated and as a result many of them are nearly impossible to answer nowadays except by absolute experts.

Example questions: To which club did Hrubesch change in 1985? Where did Paulo Cesaro play in 1967/68?

name: America's Cup: The Game
description:
Released soon after Australia won the "old mug" in 1983, this is a simple roll and move game.

From the box (capitalization and punctuation are as they appear on the box.):

America's Cup - The Game is based on the thrilling performances of Australia II in its duel with Liberty during the 1983 America's Cup Challenge.

The Game incorporates much of the excitement and problems that both yachts experienced during this epic battle.

America's Cup - The Game - will bring some of the mystery and the magnificence of 12 metre yachting into your home.

name: Savannah Game
description:
From the rules: The "Savannah Game" is a family game which reflects Savannah's beauty, history, and culture. It may be enjoyed by all ages and should provide an exciting and educational benefit to the players.
The objective in the "Savannah Game" is to obtain the most property by correctly answering "Examination Questions" concerning the history and culture of Savannah and Georgia.

name: Vem befriar Old Shatterhand
description:
In this cowboy and indian games you compete to be the first to reach the middle of the board and save the cowboy hero, Old Shatterhand. The game recalls Ludo but with some extra features. For example, the board can be swirled around and push the pieces either to a new location or entirely removed from the game.
In the middle of the playing field is the hero Old Shatterhand tied to a totem pole mede of wood. Old Shatterhand is an approximately 5 cm high plastic cowboy that you tie with a small enclosed string.

name: Dungeon Keeper Unofficial Card Game
description:
From the rulebook:

"So You Want to Become a Dungeon Keeper? Want to Create a Dark Underground Fortress and fill it with Wicked Minions? Want to Create an Evil Empire, bringing Chaos, Death and Destruction? Want to Bash pitiful, useless Heroes? Welcome to the Unofficial Dungeon Keeper Card Game."

"You've got lands (Rooms). You've got Creatures. You've got 20 LifePoints. Just like in magic. Different Rooms are needed to Summon more Creatures, or to research Spells or to build Artifacts, and in general to be more Powerful."

"But there's come the fun part. Creatures can't be anywhere: they must be In a Room. To represent this, you need to put your Creatures near the Rooms they're in. A creature in a Room can defend it, but cannot defend a different Room . . . So be wary not to expand your Dungeon too much, or you will be unable to defend it."

"A Creature in a Room can also use the Room. So, for example, your Warlock in your Library will be able to research a Spell (or to defend the Library). If you want him to defend the Lair, instead, you can move him in the Lair (in the appropriate Turn Phase), but then he will be unable to research a Spell (as he need to be in the Library to do so)."

"You can win in two ways: 1) Kill the Avatar when he's attacking your Dungeon (The World Will Be Mine! Victory), 2) Kill the other Dark Lord (BWHAHA ! Victory)."

name: Bible Books Rummy
description:
The player will be able to categorize the Bible's sixty six books by placing them in correct order under appropriate titles.

Played like Rummy

Components:
Blue Old Testament cards
Pink New Testament cards
1 Bible Books Rummy Game Board

name: La Course au Fret
description: French game from the 1980s. Each player represents a transportation company that drives on the roads of France (depicted on the board) with their truck. At the start of the game each player chooses his truck in his preferred color. Each color is linked to a regional department and the player will start in the capital of that department (Paris, Lyon, Strasbourg, Bordeaux, Nice or Brest). Each player also receives a starting capital of 62000 French Franks. Then the players draw a card that indicated what good they have to transport, the weight and to which city. As a return they get a reward if they deliver the goods in time but the trucks can be delayed along the road and they have to stop for gas or food as well. The player with the most money at the end of the game is declared the winner.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bible Boys Card Game
description: Early 20th century card game with a biblical theme.

name: Limited Life-Span Theatre
description:
Notice: I have removed the old rules and files due to there being a completely new version in the works, and the previous versions had too many "bugs".

A game full of less brains and more shooting. Create your character, grab some items, and destroy your buddies. Build your play area however you want, using as many or as few obstacles and pickups as desired!

Gameplay consists of drawing weapon and equipment cards as well as special cards to help break the rules. From Death Matches to trying to be the Last Man Standing, there are several match types to suit different styles of play.

Move around the play area by rolling dice and measuring out the distance. It's like a single man skirmish with you trying to be the winning player as you complete the terms of victory for various match types.
categories: Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Haunt
description:
From the box:

Build your own haunted house. Whose attraction will be the best?

A portion of the proceeds from the sale of this game will be donated to "Scare for a cure". Scare for a cure is an Austin, TX based nonprofit organization that raises money for local breast cancer charities.

Players build a haunted house attraction by purchasing "Scares" or areas of a Haunt. These areas are intended to give customers thrills and chills and hopefully given the right theme, be successful enough to produce points during your turn.

Once your attraction is open for business, each player attempts to see if area of their attraction is successful. Various type of patrons may be played on any player's attractions to increase (or decrease) the chances of successful attraction.

name: Toc Toc Toc à la rescousse de la Grubule
description:
Snakes & Ladders variant with children tv show theme. Get to the last square (no50) before Mr Craquepoutte and everyone wins. If Mr craquepoutte gets first, you lose. That pawn is played at random after everyone has played. Or play just plain snakes & ladders rules.

Viens vivre une aventure avec les personnages de la populaire série Toc Toc Toc !

Arrive le plus rapidement possible au nid de la Grubule pour la sauver du filet de Monsieur Craquepoutte ! Mais attention, tu rencontreras des obstacles sur ton chemin.

Le premier joueur à atteindre la case no.50 (le nid de la Grubule) est déclaré gagnant.

name: Bible Wonders
description:
From the front of the box: "The game of memory & morals."

Memory: The object of the game is to collect six gold coins. You travel around the board on one of six different roads. Movement occurs after turning over a picture that matches the picture next to the next space on the road. Each road is three pictures long and ends at an inn where you collect the gold coin. You may then choose to move to whichever road you want to travel next.

Morals: The pictures next to the roads show the consequences of 18 of Christ's miracles. The pictures that you turn over to match with them are the same scenes before the miracle occurred. The rules also contain a short story of "Malek's Journey" wherein he learns the secret of great wealth.

The game comes with instructions, a game board, 6 "Malek" sandal pieces, 6 flat leather purses on which you lay the coins, 18 match pictures, and 42 cardboard coins (6 coins in 7 colors).

name: Essen-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the city with the world's largest game fair. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Bible Blitz!
description:
Bible Blitz! is a frantic card game for 2-6 players. A variation of the classic game "Doubles Solitaire", each player attempts to get their cards into the Point Zone while playing out their Blitz Pile. Whenever any player gets rid of their Blitz Pile, they shout BLITZ!!!, and the round is over. Points are awarded based on how many cards are in the Point Zone, plus a bonus for the player that blitzed out. Play continues until someone reaches the victory score based on the number of players.
-back of box
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bible Blitz! Booster
description: Bible Blitz! Booster is a frantic card game for 2 players. This game can be played as a stand alone, 2 player variant of Bible Blitz!, or it can be used WITH Bible Blitz! for an insane, 6 player game!!!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Wizards of Soccer Expansion
description:
This expansion for Wizards of Soccer includes:


6 Special Spell cards, two each of three new spells
12 Mana cards, a new type of card which can add power to any spell
18 new Team cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Sports
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Along Bible Roads
description:
Players receive a number of cards with 8 spaces on them, each containing a Biblical name or reference.

The leader takes the smaller cards one at a time, and reads the question on them. Players shout if they have the right answer on their scoring card, and the right answer is checked. If they are correct, the question card is placed on their scoring card; if incorrect, then the player with the correct answer may take the card.

Players win when one of their scoring cards is full.

name: Slaapkamer Geheimen
description:
A trivia game about sex.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Little Milkman
description:
From the flyer: "Children love to play this familiar 'make believe milkman or milkmaid' game. they can make their own deliveries and collections or even run their own dairy business."

The game components are beautifully crafted. Six wooden enameled milk bottles fit neatly inside of the sturdy steel wire carrier container or a red wooden carrier in later editions.

The game was first published in the late 1930's.

name: Suleika: 2 Teppiche
description:
Suleika - 2 Teppiche is an expansion for the base game Suleika.

This expansion replaces the dice with cards.
Every player get an identical set of cards. Holding 2 of his cards in his hand a player can decide what card to play and than picks up a card again.

The cards have 2 areas. People have to decide before every game if they will use the grey or the yellow part of the cards.

name: Bible Match-A-Verse, Book of Psalms
description:
"A Game That Helps You Learn the Scripture"

Playing mats are divided into six squares, each of which contains a passage from the Book of Psalms with certain words missing. On each the 48 cards are the missing words that apply to one of the passages on the mats. Players draw two cards at a time and attempt to match the cards to the passages on his or her mat.

After playing several games of Match-A-Verse, a player will learn and be able to quote many of the Scripture passages contained in the game.

Designed for Broadman Supplies by Bridges and Gottschalk, game designers Louisville, Kentucky. (Broadman Supplies was the publishing arm of the Southern Baptist Convention, later known as the Baptist Sunday School Board and now known as LifeWay.)

name: Grip kortet!
description:
Simple Disney-themed recognition and dexterity game for children. The cards of the game are distributed among two or more players. They then take turns to flip up a card from their stack. When a pair is flipped up in sequence, all players must reach for the "QUACK" card in the middle of the playing area. The one who grabs it gets all the upturned cards to add to the bottom of their stack. A player with no cards is out of the game; the goal is to collect all cards.

Note that this is not the same game as that which is called Quack Cards. Published under Egmont Kärnan.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Foreplay Connect
description: Get connected! The Foreplay Connect Game is a fun way for lovers to bring new excitement to the bedroom. Each player takes turns placing their chips in the game board. On each chip are foreplay suggestions. The first player to get four chips in a row gets to have all those actions performed for them. The game includes 21 chips for each player, pink for ladies and blue for men, and a game board. Where will foreplay take you!

name: Bean-Em
description: An ETHNIC Bean Bag Game from 1931. Certainly not appropriate now. The indoor game of skill was played by tossing bean bags (approx 4" squares) at a pair of targets SAMBO and RASTAS. Hitting SAMBO scored 10 points while hittin RASTAS scored 5 points.

name: Das Grosse Hilton Spiel
description:
From the rules:
'The object of this exciting game is to become the greatest possible owner of Hilton Hotels. In pursuit of this goal a little optimistic speculation is as important as being lucky at dicing.'

Similar to Monopoly, you roll a die, move, then take/add to a hotel or take a card if you land on the right space.

name: Schneeballschlacht
description:
Dice rolling game for the very young, promoting the Austrian stationery manufacturer Brevillier-Urban. The players are pencils in a snowball fight against the evil eraser pirates who are hiding in their snow fort.
Each player gets the same number of snow ball tokens. Then they take turns rolling a die. On a roll of 1-5, they either place a snow ball in the catapult (depicted on the game board) with the corresponding number (depicted on the game board), or, if the catapult is already occupied, they take the snowball from that catapult. On a roll of six, they land a hit and place a snow ball in the snow fort. The first player to run out of snow balls is the winner. There is no decision making what so ever; just roll the die and see what happens.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Taxibo
description:
From the rules:
Taxibo is a unique Surinamese board game, which takes you by taxi through the centre of Paramaribo. It is a game for 2 to 4 players and consists of 1 dice, 16 pieces in 4 colours and a board.

From the website:
First Surinamese boardgame, developed by Gerrit Baron for the whole family. Taxibo is a taxi game which takes place in Paramaribo. Each of the four players owns a taxi company, who's four cars stand in four different garages. very exciting and above all educational.

Discription: Taxibo is a basic role and move game with some similarities to Sorry. Players move their pawns (taxi's) by rolling dice. The board represents (in an very abstract manner) the streets of Paramaribo. The end goal is getting all four taxi's to the central square. The players who first achieves this wins. Some of the spaces of the board are related to famous sights in Paramaribo and require a player who lands on them to do things such as skip turns, roll again, etc.

name: Die kleine Hexe: nach dem Buch von Ottfried Preußler
description: In this game - following the children's book of Ottfried Preußler with the same name, each player will play the little sorceress once. The little sorceress tries to break the evil witches operations. So she attempts to burn the grimoires and witches' brooms. That child, whichs acts best, will win.

name: Noggle Stones: The Card Game
description:
"White, gray, and black stones scattered ‘cross the board, now you must unite them to become the Noggle Lord!”. Based upon the novel of the same name by Wil Radcliffe, Noggle Stones the Card Game is a game for 2 players. One side plays the Heroes and one side plays Shadow

The "stones" represent the 5 Hero Characters...Manchester, Bugbear, Maga, Riley and Tudmire. They must unite to form the Noggle Lord in order to destroy the evil Shadow Smith. Each Hero Character must gather its Attribute card and combine together to begin creating the Noggle Lord. They are opposed by the Shadow Characters…Ollamh Cron, Duergar, Constable Pawe, Magistrate Dunderbeck and the Shadow Smith. Players use Ally, Relic and Event cards to help them gain advantage and do battle against each other. A fast paced game with loads of strategy, players face different challenges in each game they play.

Game Components
50 Hero Cards
50 Shadow Cards
1 Dungeon Card
Rulebook
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Der blaue Kristall
description:
Das Blaue Kristall is a boardgame about solar power plants.

During the game, players acquire solar panels that they can use to build their own power plants, or to take part in the community power plants. On other playing fields, players will draw an action card. Some of these cards are question cards, which contain a question on the subject of solar energy.

Goal of the game is to produce and sell a pre-set amount of solar power.

name: Golden Goal: Olympic Soccer
description:
Following on the tradition of the TCS games dedicated to other olympic sports (Water polo, basketball,field and ice hockey), Golden goal is a fast and easy to play statistical replay game on Soccer, featuring all the Soccer tournaments, both male and female, from the early olympics onward.

Game is easy: both teams are rated for attack and defense, you compare the factors and roll a die to see how many goals each team scored. But there are random factors, incarnated by "third die", a random die roll that may have strong effects on the initial factors.
A tournament may be completed in less than an hour

name: Additional Trivia
description:
Trivia game. It is a stand alone game but was primarily aimed at Trivial Pursuit players looking for more questions/categories. Each card has 6 questions, each in a different category. A die is provided. The player rolls the die and answers the question allocated to the die roll. The 6 categories are;
Books
U.K.
Films
Rest & Play
Music
Pot Pourri
The first player to get a correct answer in each of the 6 categories scores a bonus number of points and the game ends. The player with the highest score at that time, wins

name: Extra Trivia: General Knowledge
description:
Trivia game. It is a stand alone game but was primarily aimed at Trivial Pursuit players looking for more questions/categories.Each card has 6 questions, each in a different category. A die is provided. The player rolls the die and answers the question allocated to the die roll. The 6 categories are;
Living World
People & Places
Words & Phrases
Titles & Portrayals
All Our Yesterdays
Miscellaneous
The first player to get a correct answer in each of the 6 categories scores a bonus number of points and the game ends. The player with the highest score at that time, wins

name: Trucker
description:
Ruthless game about speed and hours of fun with a 30 ton diesel.

Goal of the game:
The aim of this game is to be the first to deliver all the parcels from your warehouse to the correct addresses. The first to do so and return to his warehouse wins the game.

Gameplay:
- Each player gets shipment cards in the beginning of the game. These define the deliveries that have to be made.
- On the board there is a road network with 4 delivery points.
- Each turn, players roll the die to determine how far their truck moves on the game board. Then they move their truck, trying to deliver their goods at the correct delivery point.
- When a truck ends on a telephone, the player must take a phone card; phone cards provide additional instructions for the player.

Box contents:
- 1 game board
- 1 die
- 4 trucks
- 19 phone cards
- 22 shipment cards:
- 16 regular
- 6 express
- rules
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tibor
description:
From the back of the box (translated from croatian):

"Tibor becomes a vampire. To return among normal people, Tibor has a long way from his village to the castle of Countess Zarina Sibilskog in which Kosinius, a scientist created a magic potion for the vampire. Will Kosinius' magic potion help Tibor to become again an ordinary person?"

Content:
1 board
40 playing tiles
10 scoring tiles

In this simple game the players place tiles on a grid, trying to connect their village with their castle (if they place a tile with a garlic on it, they gain a score tile with 1-3 points). The player who first reaches the castle gains ten points.

name: The Vampire's Keep (fan expansion for Talisman)
description:
Indie expansion set - including boards, cards and rules - for Talisman third Edition a board and card game in a fantastic world where players attempt to collect Talismans for Victory.

From the rules:
"The Vampire's Keep is designed to expand the world of Talisman in a dark new way. Throughout the course of the game, Characters may discover several points of entry to the Keep. If this expansion is used with the new accompanying rules, the only way a Character can successfully obtain a Talisman is through the bowels of the Keep. The Keep exists on a mysterious plane and is riddled with terrors, traps and treasure. Only the strongest adventurers may survive the perils of the Vampire's Keep!"
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy

name: Magnetic Football
description:
This game is based on a 7 by 8 grid made to look like a football pitch. Each player has 5 outfiled players and a goalie. Movement is by rolling a dice and players can challenge for possession of the ball.

Players play the game for a fixed amount of time, decided beforehand, and if the result is a draw, then there is a penalty shootout to decide the winner.

The game is supplied in a metal tin and the pieces are also magnetic, so the game is also portable.

name: Farmish
description:
Farmish is a game about “co-operative” farming with limited, random resources. The Seed & Feed stocks a random number of seeds of differing types that they give out to poor, local farmers. These farmers all share the same land and operate as a small co-op. The only problem is that the farmers are rather insane and decide, by lottery, which plots of land each farmer tends.

This is a game for 1 or more players. The materials needed are the included game board, chits, dice labels, 10 beads (tokens, chits, M&Ms, coins, a spinner–a d10 works wonderfully here.) to keep track of which turn you’re on, and 3d6. There must be one standard die with the numbers 1-6 printed on it and you need 2 blank dice (or the willingness to put labels over your standard dice).

The object of the game is to score the most points after 10 rounds of game play.

name: Kynstrin öll
description:
From the publisher: Kynstrin öll is a fun and different trivia game with interesting and funny questions. The game will start rowdy discussions between players on just about everything concerning the interaction between males and females and sexual issues. Interesting information about issues anyone should know is dispersed all through the game. This game is the first one of it's kind in Iceland.

Players roll a die which indicates from which of the five categories their next question will be. The goal is to be the first to answer correctly a question from all of the five categories.

name: Kampen om Luleå
description:
From the publisher:
Kampen om Luleåis a game about the Swedish city of Luleå. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history. Players move around a track on the board and acquire properties and answer trivia questions about the featured city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bratz Starchaserz
description: In this exciting game you must race around Stilesville collecting Bratz autographs. On each turn, the 'Local Star Radio' tells you where the Bratz have been seen. But can you get to the Bratz before they move again? The first fan to collect all four autographs wins the game and collects the 'Winner's Medal'.

name: Dice Age Elementary Edition
description:
This Game is the french Bonide dice game adapted into a card game. You play with decks of cards. Each deck represents a die, and each card within the deck represents a side of the die. Thus a six sided die is represented by a six cards deck with the same back.
At the beginning of the game, decks and tokens are distributed. Your goal is to get rid of all your tokens.
It's a risk-taking game.

When you choose a deck on your turn, you get rid of tokens, depending on the color of the deck. You can then draw a number or an effect on the game. If you draw a number, it has to be lower than the last number played, or you take all of the pot.

name: Double Dragon: Klix Pocket Travel Games
description:
Join your friend Billy Lee, the heroic master of the Martial Arts, on a mission to rescue Marian from Jimmy, the evil crime boss. Players compete to be the first to get both of their playing pieces through the dangerous streets to Jimmy's hideout.

To complete the rescue, you must get BOTH your markers to the finish space before your opponent. One of your markers is you - and the other marker is your friend Billy Lee. Don't forget - it takes BOTH your markers to foil the crime boss.

The player going first snaps the dice. Move forward the number of spaces shown. Than snap the dice again, looking only at the 2 dice with the fighters on them. Go to the fighter table to see who won the fight. If you are on a 1, 2, or 3 space, move your marker forward or backward that many spaces depending on if you won or lost. If you are on a Billy Lee square and you won, move your marker that is farther behind up to the one that is ahead. If you lost, move the marker that is ahead back to the marker that is behind. First to get both of their markers to the finish space is the winner.

name: Mike Read's Pop Quiz Card Game
description: Mike Read's Pop Quiz Card Game is a music trivia game. The game contains three instruction cards and 37 double sided question cards, each with seven questions on a category such as a band, singer or genre. The game is for two or more players who take turns answering questions, scoring points for each correct answer.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Horsin' Around
description:
Horsin' Around is a children's game of dexterity from the 1960s. Horse tokens are placed on a carousel which is spun around. Pressing a button launches one of the tokens in the air and players attempt to catch it. There are three tokens in each of four colours and a 13th black horse. If a player catches a coloured horse they keep it but if a player catches the black horse they are allowed to steal a token from another player. If a player collects all three horses of a colour these cannot be stolen. The black horse is not kept but is replaced on the carousel. When all the coloured horses have been won and the black horse is the only one remaining, the game is over and the player with the most horses wins.

From the box: "Spin & win - how many horses can you catch?"

name: Superpfeife
description:
Get the stadion's atmosphere into your living room.
Try to to predict the referee's decisions before him while watching a soccer game. Who best forecasts them wins the game.

The game is played while watching a soccer game. Each player gets a whistle, a red card, and a yellow card, and tries to use them, anticipating the referee.

Every time the referee decides the same way as a player, the player gets bonus points, otherwise minus points. Who has the most points at the end of the soccer game wins.

name: Tailgate Touchdown: The Helmet Racing Game
description:
Tailgate Touchdown is the ultimate party football game. The portable convenience of Tailgate Touchdown makes it a favorite for all sporting venues. At a tailgate or in your home, Tailgate Touchdown is easy to play, and designed to provide hours of fun for everyone involved. Get ready to step up to the field, and roll yourself into the end zone.

The object of Tailgate Touchdown is to acquire the most Touchdown Chips. Touchdown Chips are acquired by being the first player to "roll" into the end zone (score a touchdown) for each game.

Contents:

Game Board,
6 Assorted Helmets,
8 Dice,
Dice Rolling Cup,
Touchdown Chips.

name: Treasure Trails Bible Game
description: The goal is to obtain the most Crowns upon arrival at the "Celestial City." Players fill in the words missing from Bible verses on the clue cards and move the number of spaces shown. If a player cannot supply the missing words, they flip the card over to the other side to see the answer, and then move the number of spaces shown. The game is over when all players have entered the "Celestial City" or dropped out due to bankruptcy.

name: Auction
description:
The game consists of a deck of forty-nine cards. There are twenty-two pairs of similar items; the higher priced item is several times more valuable than the lower priced one (For example: diamond rings valued at $100 and $500) plus two old trunks (three are valued at $1000, one at $200, and one at $50).

The deck is shuffled and five cards are placed face down for auction so that the players know what is up for bids but not its value. The high bidder of the open auction gets the cards and the amount spent is noted. The game continues until the deck is depleted. (There are four cards left over. I presume these cards are not auctioned but the rules don’t say.) The value of the cards won by each player is totaled and their value is subtracted from the amount spent. The player with the highest grand total is the winner.

The Deluxe Edition includes play money. Players are given $6000 in this edition and are forbidden to spend more than that.

name: Bratz: All Out Card Game
description:
There are two ways to win ALL OUT - EITHER be the first to get rid of all your cards, OR be the first to collect a set of ten cards with matching icons.

Players collect sets of 3-10 character cards with the same icon. In his turn player plays set in front of him face up or add card with a matching icon to any set already on the table.
Player may also play an event card.

Player who gets rid of all your cards or has a set of 10 matching cards on the table in front of him must shout "ALL OUT!!!". He is the winner.

name: Times Seven: Forgiveness
description:
"Challenge your memory and test your luck as you race to collect seven Bible verses over seven rounds and win the game!
Learn what the Bible says about forgiveness as you lay down one completed verse per hand. Then discard key words from the verses to outscore your opponents. If you can't complete the verse before the round ends, you must try, try again!"

Each round, players attempt to collect a set of four numbered, color coded cards that complete a Bible verse. This is done by drafting and discarding. Once a complete verse has been collected the player then lays down their set and tries to go out as soon as possible by discarding their remaining cards on other players' sets. Keyword cards and other action cards add an extra twist to the gameplay. At the end of each round, points are 'awarded' based on remaining cards-in-hand, and after seven rounds the lowest scorer wins!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Religious
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Squadron Insignia
description:
There is a 17 pairs of cards and one odd card - The Enemy - in this game. The two cards of a pair have a same insignia and numbers. Each player must matches as many pairs as possible.and lays them face up in front of him. Then the players one by one start to draw cards from the right neighbors and if possible match a pair. The Play continues until all pairs have been matched. The Player left with the black airplane card is the Enemy.
Scoring: 1 pair Bombing Squadron = 65 Enemy Planes, 1 pair Torpedo Squadron = 50 Enemy Planes, 1 pair Scouting Squadron = 25 Enemy Planes, 1 pair Fighting Squadron = 10 Enemy Planes, Player holding Enemy card deducts 50 planes from his total.
Player with the greatest number of enemy planes wins.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Children's Game, World War II

name: King & Country
description:
Object of the game is to be the first to get 1 figure to the opposite end of the board.

One player controls 4 miniatures, the other player controls 1.

The single figure can move forwards, backwards, sideways but not diagonally. And only 1 space at a time. The opposing player can only move forwards, one piece at a time. No jumping and no capturing.

The winner is the first to reach the opposite site end.

name: A Question of Television
description:
45 cards, each posing one or more questions. All the questions centre around television programmes.
There are six categories: Mystery Celebrities, TV Wordmix, One Minute Round, Name that Ad, Quick Draw, Name The Programme.
Played in teams, each team gets a question from each of the six categories. The game is played over four rounds per category, the team with the most points, wins.
Game published to advertise Scotch Videocassettes.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Dallas dollars
description: Based on the famous tv series. The players must race thru the board's spiral track, an every time they stumble on a character's square, they must roll the dice and follow the instructions on the character's card (advance some squares, wait some turns, pay or recieve money). The first to reach the final square without going broke, wins the game.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Selten so gelacht!
description:
119 cards + a rules card.

Card game, intended to break the ice at a party. Each party-goer is given a number of cards, say, 4 blue, 4 red and 4 green. How many cards is decided by the host and his or her decision will be made after seeing how many party-goers there are.
Each player walks around chatting to the party-goers and tries to find two cards that 'go' with the card she or he already has. You need to trade your card with another, to make a set of three. In case you can't remember what to do, the cards are in three colours (and you need one of each to complete your set), and they are numbered 1, 2 or 3 (you need one of each to make a sentence. The sentence starts with the blue card text, then the red card text and, finally, the green card text. The sillier the sentence, the more chance you have of winning.

Once you have one sentence of nonsense, then you start collecting another sentence. At some point during the party, an end to the game is called and the collected sentences are read out. The winner is the one who colloected the most absurd sentence (in a show of hands by the party-goers.

The title means 'Never laughed so much' and the box says 'For adults; An Advertising Salad - Well seasoned'.

name: Clockworks
description: Clockworks is a betting game based on Poker. There is a card dealt into the middle of the table which is shared among all players' hands. When a player is dealt a card of the same suit it dealt, he or she can pay to replace the card in the center of the table. Subsequent players can buy the replaced card for their own hand in lieu of being dealt a card. The common card that will actually be used for all hands isn't actually known until the end of the hand. The winner is determined using the regular rules of poker.

name: Comic Answers to Queer Questions
description:
The box promises "Enough to make you laugh".
160 cards with questions and answers. Unlike most trivia games, this is intended to be funny, especially when people give the incorrect answer.
First to win an agreed number of questions, wins.

name: Bayard
description:
From the rules sheet:

The Legend: Bayard was a huge horse of tremendous strength. It is said that he saved the lives of four knights and ridiculed the army of the great King Charlemagne by jumping hills and rivers from Spain to Germany. Like Bayard, you must use strategic skill to avoid the opponent's soldiers. Bayard, a game easily learned, is an exciting and challenging way of increasing your reasoning.

The game plays very similar to checkers but with some twists.

Object of game - capture all opponent's soldiers and Bayards.

The board is 10 rows of 5 circles with lines connecting them.
The players set up their 20 soldiers (glass beads) on opposite sides of the playing mat. Like checkers, each soldier can only move forward one space. Unlike checkers, each soldier can capture a piece by jumping forward or backward. If a soldier reaches the opposite side, it becomes a Bayard, and a different colored bead is used to represent it.

The Bayard moves and jumps like a King in checkers. However, unlike checkers a Bayard piece can move several spaces at a time. Also, can capture pieces by jumping even if there are several spaces between the opponent's pieces.

name: What Do You Know?
description: A trivia game, with 12 numbered cards, on each of which are 6 General Knowledge questions. Play as teams. Replayability is not good but I guess the intention is to break the ice at parties, so it does exactly that.

name: Football Fanatic
description:
Players watch a game of American football on TV, and use cards to try to score points based on the plays made in the actual game.

From the rule card:
Football Fanatic is an interactive football party that is played by two or more players. The limit to the number of players depends on availability of cards. There are 39 cards in the standard football Fanatic game allowing for 39 players. Get more cards for more players.

name: Halmette
description:
This is Game #13 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

This is a game that started as an attempt to come up with a game in the Halma family, which also includes Chinese Checkers. As it developed, it began to take on its own flavor, which includes pieces starting off the board, sending enemy pieces back to their reserve area off the board when jumped, and exiting one's own pieces from a single space on the board.

name: Boxing the Fox
description:
This is game #17 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

This is a game in the Fox family of games, which includes Fox and Hounds, where the object is for the Fox player to escape, and the Hound player to stop them. In the game, the Fox player faces an onslaught of Hound pieces, that merely rush forward, and then can recycle if they form a line, and then keep pouring in from the top of the board.

name: Georgia Skin
description:
Georgia Skin is a game that has to be seen to be believed. When it's played by professional gamblers, you see it but you don't believe it! All cards are dealt face up. Players bet against the dealer and against each other. What they're betting on is that the face up card in front of the player they are betting against will be matched (paired) before their face up card is matched. That's all! Rank and suit of cards have no meaning in Georgia Skin ... and no one has an advantage. It's a dead-even gamble. Player with the most money is the winner.

Components:

1 Felt game mat
2 Standard decks of playing cards
1 Set of play money
1 Best Little Book Ever Written About Poker

name: Movur
description:
A streamlined system of fantasy miniature combat designed to be open, fun and flexible and to eliminate the need for thick books, dice and rulers. The game is aimed at players who are more interested in enjoying the experience of the battle rather than keeping track of minute rules.

The object of the basic game is to eliminate your opponent's force, but scenarios can be created with practically any objective.

Gameplay involves players taking turns activating their troops in each of 5 phases: Decision (planning), Displacement (movement), Shooting (ranged combat), Brawl (melee) and Deceit (magic, sapping, burning, etc).

name: Office Dice
description: Office Dice puts each player in control of one ‘team’ of a faceless corporate giant, where the only currency is completed projects, and the only job security is never being noticed. Players compete against each other to put the finishing touches on each project to reap all the rewards for everyone’s hard work. It’s all about who handed in the report, not who did all the work. Oh, and watch your back, because every empty cubicle means someone is trying to get you fired while they’re on break.

name: Zombie Rush
description: What is Zombie Rush? It's a cartoonish strategic and life treating choice card game by C&M Games. The Zombies are at it again, and they are very hungry for fresh human brains. The object of the game is to try not to be the main breakfast, lunch, or dinner, of course. Stay alive by avoiding a certain amount of Zombie cards. But you have to be on your toes and make quick decisions or it can cost you your brains. But don't panic, you've got your old faithful shotgun and handgun to help you out. It shouldn't be a big problem, or will it? Components of the game consist of 88 Cards and easy-to-play Rule sheet.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Top Team Soccer
description:
This game is actually in two parts which together make the whole game.
In game 1 a team of 11 players is built up by moving round a 4 lane track in monopoly like manner, acting on the instructions on the square in which you land. At the start of each turn you decide which lane you will start your move in and if you are blocked by another player you stop in the square immediately behind him(thus giving a bit more control than in Monoply). The object is to built the best team of 11 players that you can.
In game 2, using the team created in Game 1, you play soccer on a 22x16 pitch which is divided into 10 player areas corresponding to player positions. You move the ball by die throws which can be mitigated by skill cards obtained in game 1.
The object is to score the most goals in a set time.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Junior Bass Fishin' Game
description:
This is children's dexterity game with a fishing theme. The kids use magnetic fishing poles to "catch" bass tokens which are placed on a huge 36" x 36" fishin' hole mat. The fish tokens have hidden values. Players score points based on these numbers.

This game is designed to be enjoyed by 2, 3, or 4 players age four and older. It teaches counting and adding skills during play.

Includes four poles, 24 fish, the plastic mat, and instructions.

name: Escape from the Dead City
description:
