Escape from the Dead City is a card game of survival horror, where each player must control a group of survivors trapped in a putrid zombie infested city. Players will have to stock up and prepare as best they can before they escape from this hell full of undead.

During the game, the survivors will visit the city in search of other people, weapons, food, water, vehicles and anything that might be useful. Despite being a competitive game, players can cooperate if they are in the same place, but only one can win. The first player to get Survival Points needed may flee the city, thus winning the game.

But it will not be easy to escape, because danger lurks around every corner, and zombies are not the only ones who can end the life of the group.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Ancient Game of GOMI
description:
A card game for multiple players with a wizard theme.

From the box art:

A game of strategy and luck where fortunes are won or lost at the turn of a card.

Play for a few minutes or play all night. You control when the game ends. Play against the other players while you play against the dealer. Accumulate the most cash and you're the winner. Easy to learn, tough to master, this action packed, fast paced game has something for all ages.

With six phases, make the most of the cards dealt to you as you choose your "COLOR"; go "HIGH or LOW"; and "COVER" your GOMI cards.

As the deal rotates to you, it is your chance to call for the GOMI to get the other players to "PUT" more than they "TAKE". If they don't there's always "DEALER'S REVENGE".

Any strategy is legal. Play conservatively or risk it all. The right strategy can put you in a position to double or quadruple your cash. Choose your cards wisely because in this ancient game, fortunes are won or lost at the turn of a card.

name: Ghoulash: The Last Game on Earth Board Game
description:
You live in a world that has become infested with a mysterious green, glowing substance called Malectoplasm. When activated by the presence of a living being, the Malectoplasm grows and morphs into the deadly, soulless creature of destruction known as a Ghoul!

You're one of an intrepid band of courageous Ghoul Hunters, setting out to find and destroy the Ghouls before they can attack and kill innocent humans.

This is the world of GHOULASH: The Last Game on Earth, the game of intense adventure and challenging strategies that drops you into a dangerous arena where every decision you make could be your last.

On your quest to locate and destroy the malevolent Ghouls, you'll fall into deep Holes, be crushed by deadly Debris and struggle to find First-Aid Kits before you die from your wounds!

Each Ghoul Battle brings Victory Points if you kill the Ghoul or wounds if you're defeated. The first player to 10 Victory Points wins! Take too many wounds from the Ghouls, however, and you're dead!

Players assume the identities of characters from the GHOULASH Adventures series of short stories and web comics. These scientists, soldiers and Ghoul Hunters are members of the Aberration Deterrent and Eradication Forces (ADEF). Each character possesses unique advantages that help the player during the game.

Battles are won with the use of Value cards; you attempt to outmatch the Ghoul's strength with your own. Beware, however: Your opponents can challenge you in your battles and throw obstacles in your path!

The four two-sided game tiles can be arranged in hundreds of configurations, ensuring that no two adventures are ever the same.

Adding to the adventure are Scenarios, special adventure conditions that can be incorporated into the game to add additional obstacles, weapons and strategies!
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Quest DVD Video Show
description: A trivia game that involves a board, cards and DVD, and bring questions about soap operas and other programs of TV Globo, a Brazilian television network. More than 2,000 questions that will test your knowledge, reliving moments from the TV, with videos and pictures on a DVD.

name: Greedy Pigs
description: Each player controls a scoop, made in the likeness of a pig. Marbles are released into a central reservoir and the player must direct his pig's tongue in such a way that it 'licks up' a marble and then the player must carefully take that marble to his storage area. The player with the most marbles after they have all been taken, is the winner.

name: The Conflict
description:
The Great War (1914)

It is the summer of 1914. The Archduke Franz Ferdinand (heir to the throne of the Austro-Hungarian Empire) and his wife have just been assassinated in Sarajevo. In retaliation for this offense, Emperor Franz Joseph of Austria-Hungary has declared war on Serbia, an ally of Russia. This sparks a world of controversy and very quickly large military powers such as Germany, The Ottoman Empire, France, and Great Britain join in the fray. Two allegiances emerge, The Central Powers & The Allied Powers, with one goal in mind: WAR!

Do you have the economic aptitude and tactical know how to help your nation survive The Conflict and rescue a world in peril. Are you brave enough to face tanks, planes and other modern warfare in order to lead your alliance to victory? “The Great War” has begun, and ready or not, you better lace up your boots and prepare for battle.

The Conflict is a global-strategy based game designed around the economic and military conditions of Europe in 1914. Players play in one of two alliances, The Central Powers or The Allied Powers, to defeat their opponents. Players choose among seven nations (Austria-Hungary, Germany, Great Britain, France, Italy, Ottoman Empire, and Russia). After selecting a nation, players take turns completing their objectives during each round.

Note: The Conflict requires players to strategize both economically and militaristically in order to win the game.

Note: Military units will vary per nation, based on the technological restraints of the nation and its overall capability for growth.

Planned release date is 2012.

name: Across Africa with Livingstone
description:
Objective:
Racing game; follow a path coloured blue and then changing to red - see image. Players may receive rewards or penalties (instructions are listed in a small rule booklet and inside cover). Be the first to reach Quilimane (Mozambique)

Roll and Move...
Playing surface shows an outside of the lower half of Africa - title at the top, a scale map of the UK in the lower right corner and a miles scale at the bottom, illustrations of animals and events from Livingstone's travels together with the names of towns and areas.
Rules of play are pasted to the inside of the lid.

Equipped with a small box only for a spinner, meeples and rule booklet. Size of the board: 16 x 16 inches

name: Ledici Dice Football
description:
Ledici Dice Football is a very small game consisting of only 3 custom dice, which attempts to simulate a football game. The game is published by Ledici.

Components:
Drawstring Bag
Rules Leaflet
3 Custom D6's (Blue, Green and Red)

The aim of the game is to 'score' more goals than your oppenent within a certain time. Rules state "Players decide the druation of their game before they start or they play for as long as the wish.

The game itself is pure luck, the starting player rolls the blue dice and follows an action based on the roll. There is a 1 in 6 chance that this will mean the green dice can be rolled. Rolling the green dice is the only way to score a goal, again a 1 in 6 chance. Additionally the red dice can be brought into play which contains penalties, inluding a concede a goal side.

The theme feels thin at best in what is essentially just a blind rolling game with no strategy at all possible. The rules state the game can be played solo, however no rules are provided to this end.

name: Französisch für Kinder
description: The question cards in this Quiz/Learning game come from the daily life of a child. The front side shows the German word and a picture. The backside of the card has the French translation and the phonetic writing of the word to teach the correct pronunciation. Furthermore there is a simple sentence which uses the word in and easy context, also with phonetic transcription and the German translation of the whole sentence. The game board shows the map of central Paris.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Hamsterdam
description:
"Hamsterdam is the best dam game around."

"The flood waters are piling up and the noblest of creatures are all that remain to protect us."

How to play:
Create a "dam" made up of a line of cards numbered 2 through 12 and distribute your hamster cards (20 regular + 2 special) on top of the numbered cards. Take turns rolling the dice to see which spot in the damn is weakened. If a hamster is on top of that number, that hamster is used to plug to the hole and is placed to the side in a reserve pile to come back into play in the next round. If a hamster is not on that number, a flood token is placed there until the end of the round, at which time it can be removed by taking a hamster card permanently out of play. If a flood token is already located on a number that is rolled, another flood token is placed in a special pile of tokens belonging to that player which cannot be removed. As flood tokens pile up, your stock of hamster saviors dwindles, and flood tokens pile up all the faster. The game ends when any player accumulates 10 flood tokens (counting both those in the permanent pile and those currently on the dam). The winner is the player with the fewest flood tokens. In the case of a tie, the player with the most remaining hamster cards wins.

name: Spare Squares
description:
A massive social-trading puzzle game designed for BGG.con 2011. The game was created using 5,000 unique square cards, each with a symbol on each edge and a number in the middle.

Each player is given four cards. The object is to trade cards and then arrange four cards into a highly-valued set, where points are awarded based on matching the colors, fillings, and shapes of the symbols on interior and exterior edges.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Rupert Bär Spurensuche
description: Rupert and his friends meet in the woods, the have a picknick and play hide-and-seek! Their tracks tell the players where to find them. Each player has a coloured picknick basket, all tiles are laid out face-down. In your turn you pick up a tile - if the tracks underneath are in your colour, you keep the tile and place it next to your basket. If it shows another colour, give the tile to the owner of the basket and take a treat to put into your basket. If you are the first to assemble Rupert and all his friends around your basket, you win the game.

name: Transalpin
description:
Description:
Players control the fate of several regions in the Alpine arc (Rhône-Alpes, Piedmont, the cantons of Uri and Tessin, Tyrol, South Tyrol, Carinthia and Slovenia). Each two of these regions are connected by the Alpine crossings of Mt. Cenis/Fréjus, the Gotthard, the Brenner Pass and Karawanken. At each round, traffic increases. Within ten rounds, regions must try to contain the consequences of traffic by taking actions in the fields of economy, tourism and the environment as well as by implementing measures for transport regulation.

Aim of the game:
The player with the most intact region at the end of round 10 - that is, the player who has obtained the highest scores in Environment, Economy and Tourism and therefore has managed to govern the traffic volume - is the winner.

Course of the game:
The game is played over 10 rounds, in which the following three stages are repeated:
1. Drawing of traffic and event cards and execution of tasks
2. Investment of money
3. Determination of consequences.

Regions can invest only the money they have collected. Players can decide to impact on Tourism, Economy or the Environment and move the corresponding game piece of one field per money invested.
Also, they can play the action cards with traffic regulating measures. The prices for these actions are indicated on the corresponding cards. Some cards can only be played with other regions.
Other cards affect the traffic in neighboring regions and therefore these players must find the right countermeasures to control this new "unwanted" traffic otherwise the situation get`s out of control and the environment is ruined loosing many points.
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Keine Panik! Junior
description: Image search under time pressure! For each question there is to find the called number of matching images. For example, "Find 4 pictures with something that has eyes" or "Find two images with a fish." Who is in it, gets all the playing pieces, and it will read a question. Then the timer is started, and the player tries to find as quickly as possible, the popular image maps. Accompanying photos are marked with a character. If all images have found, the timer stops. The remaining time is the points standings for the block. After four rounds the player with the most points wins.

name: Faggles to Faggles
description:
Faggles to Faggles -- an outrageous, queered-up party game for you to enjoy with the girls. In this game of judging (hey, it's what gays do best), each card is more outrageous than the next.

Here's the deal: grab three friends or more and then draw a card with an adjective on it. The rest of the players, who hold cards with nouns on them, must play the card they think you would choose for that adjective. So, if you drew the card “racist” would you pick “the French,” “Miss Piggy” or “rainbows?”

Each card has a unique, hilarious definition that will keep you in stitches time and time again. A small investment of fifty bucks will get you hours and hours and hours and hours of entertainment. Believe us, we've played this game with dozens of people for hundreds of hours and it never gets old.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Na Logo!
description:
Objective: improve pronunciation speech therapy ==> dyslalia
collect chips for correct solved instructions
- linguistic game/logopedics -
- acting by turn -
different games/different expansions
1. basis game (very young ones): each player gets a collector's card, throws the die, moves according numbers;
landing on an action space => draws a card, may collect a 'Trolli-chip' if description and pronunciation is right
winner: collector's card filled up with chips
2. similar procedure: active player has to draw or explain
what's on the card; both, 1st to name & pronounce it
correctly + active player are getting chips
3. Additionally to above described approach (age 7 -12):
active player rolls coloured die, according to result term
must be drawn, mimed, described...
depending on difficulty level players are getting chips
4. depending on age/difficulty level additional tasks are:
spell the word
spell the word backwards
find a matching rhyming word...
5. similar approach, but focussed on letters instead of words
content basis game:
- board
- meeples
- chips
- collector's cards
6 sets (out of 20 - free of choice) with 32 cards each:
training of consonants/sounds: sch, s, r, k, f, tr/ dr, ch, l, kr/gr, g, w, t, b, d, mouth 'motor skills' ...
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Word Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Motorrad-Rennen
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line
- moving by turn/simple 'Roll and Move' game -
each player pays entry fee before starting
drive through the board twice (1-50 & 51 - 100)
if you land on a marked space follow instructions
1st gets 2/3, 2nd 1/3 of the fee
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Holly Dolly Dixi
description:
This game uses the power of static electricity to ‘activate’ and move a small dart around a playing area under a plastic dome. The dart's position on the board at any one time allows players to claim cards to add to their scoring trays. The winner is the first player to get all 12 of their cards not only on the scoring tray, but in their correct positions on the tray.

Game contents
1 x ‘Holly Dolly’, a game board unit comprising a transparent plastic dome mounted over the playing area and containing a dart.
4 x sets of 12 numbered cards in four different colours
4 x ‘Dixi’ cards in four different colours
4 x plastic scoring trays
1 x game storage tray
1 x rules leaflet

This is a most unusual game. The rules suggest that players experiment with rubbing the top of the dome to see which method of activating the dart is best for them.
Apparently, the movement of the dart can be different for different people due to the varying static charge everyone carries with them.
This charge varies, mainly because of skin moisture or the type of clothing worn; wool, cotton, nylon etc, which can produce static electricity of different intensities.

name: Cryptic Counsels
description:
Party game.

Each guest (or team) is given a card with 21 well-known proverbs, but the words, in order, have been jumbled up.
For example;

EERHTSINYAMAPLISWITXTEHTUCPADNHTEIPL

WOULD BE

THERE IS MANY A SLIP TWIXT THE CUP AND THE LIP

Imagine doing that after a couple of drinks!

The team or guest to get them all correct, wins. Or the ones with the most correct answers when the host calls time, win.

Part of the company's Puzzling Pastimes Series

name: Jumbles
description:
Party game.

Each guest or team are given a card with clues to 13 sets of words. Each set has three answers and they are all anagrams of each other.

Their example is curious;

Highest Point is Acme
Statt is Mace
Approached is Came

It is curious because I always thought Acme was the company that provided the Coyote in his attemps to catch the Roadrunner.
And as for Statt, I have never heard that word before.

The first guest or team to hand in 13 correct answers, wins. Or the guest or team win, who have the most correct answers when the host calls time.

name: Tons of Geography
description:
Party game for 4 to 8 individuals or teams.

Each participant is given a card with 27 clues to British towns ending in 'ton'. For example;

Where the Rheumatic and Gouty seek relief, would be Buxton.

The guest or team that gets them all correct first, wins. Or the guest or team win, that have the most correct answers when the host calls time.

name: Fruits and Vegetables
description:
Party game for up to 8 individuals or teams.

Each guest or team are given a card with 24 cryptic clues on it. As they enjoy the evening, they try to work out the answers. Example question;

Clue: Half a figure
Answer: Fig

The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

name: Tally Ho!
description:
Described as 'An Indoor Cub Hunt'.

Party game for up to 8 guests or teams.

Games instructions: Here is a novel form of "CUBBING". The answer to each of the following questions is one word containing the 3 letters C U B. The numbers at the side of each question indicate the amount of letters in the word forming the correct answer. Note: the letters C U B may occur in any order in the answer.

Each participant is given a card with 24 questions. Example:

Question: Bludgeon (4)
Answer: Club

The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

name: My Odd Grocery Order
description:
Party game for up to eight indivivuals or teams.

The varous item of the order are suggested by this example:

Clue: An old sailor
Answer: Salt

Each participant is given a card with 24 such clues. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

name: Game Dressing
description:
Party game for up to 10 guests or teams.

Each participant is given a card with 24 clues to 24 different items of clothing. The clues can be quite cryptic so the game would have been better played as a team game. Several brains are usually better than just one. Example clue:

Clue: A bay
Answer: Cardigan
(Cardigan Bay is a well known area of Wales)

The answer to each clue is an article or wearing apparel. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

name: Well-Known Fruit and Vegetables
description:
Party game for up to 10 individuals or teams.

The answers, given correctly, supply the name of a well-known fruit or vegetable. Example:

Clue: Seen in a village, and relatives
Answer: Pumpkin
(You have to know that, back then, before water mains were fitted, rural villages had to use a village pump everyday, to get their water)

The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

name: Find the Bird
description:
Party game for up to 8 individuals or teams.

Each participant gets a card with 32 clues. The correct answers are well-known birds. Example:

Clue: A cricketing term
Answer: Duck
(For those of you who don't play or watch cricket, a Duck is the term for a player who loses his wicket without scoring a run).

During the evening, players should complete the card with as many correct answers or guesses as they can. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

name: The Stately Homes of Great Britain
description:
A rare party game from the Goodall company.

Each guest or team receive a card with anagrams of the names of well-known Stately Homes. During the evening the guests can look at the anagrams and work out their answers. When the host calls "Time", the guest or team with the most correct answers, wins.

name: Who Knows?
description:
Party game of trivia questions.

Each guest or team is given a card with 36 questions on it. During the evening they are encouraged to fill in all the correct answers, or just guess the ones they don't know. When the host calls "Time", the guest or team with the most correct answers, wins.

name: Paper Trails: American Revolution!
description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the hero of the Revolutionary War in the HISTORIC SITES! edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Each player starts from a starting position. Players roll dice to see how far they move. A bad roll results in damage. If a player receives too much damage is out of the game. Once players reach a checkpoint, they must roll dice each turn until their total equals/exceeds that checkpoint's number. The first player to clear all four checkpoints and reach the finish wins the game.

name: Rigamaroles
description:
In Rigamaroles, players compete over a series of rounds to be the last two players standing. In each round, role chits will be placed in the center of the room. When given the "GO" by the moderator, players race, and grab one chit. That chit determines the role that player will act out. There will always be one other player in the group who is acting out the same role. Each player must find his/her match quickly, link arms, and sit down on the outside of the room to be safe for the next round. In each round, the last two players standing are ELIMINATED! Play continues as such until there are only two players left and those two players are crowned the Rolemasters for that game! Play several games for a full night of laughs!

The game plays quickly. Averaging about one minute per number of players! You can play it with as many players as you wish. In fact, the more the merrier! Unlike other player-elimination games, Rigmaroles is such a blast to watch, and the rounds go so quickly, that nobody minds being eliminated.

Although players must know how to read to play, there is a variant that allows even non-reading children to join in on the fun. So players of all ages will enjoy Rigamaroles!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Das Bibel Quiz
description:
Objective: improve your knowledge about the Bible - Old & New Testament
- acting/moving by turn -
roll the die, move, draw a card, get the correct answer

name: Det is Berlin
description:
Objective:
Find matching combinations of hidden cards placed on the board collecting winning points (3 or 4)
- acting/moving by turn -
1 mix & place cards (pairs of buildings & sights/bears) upside down on free spaces of the circuit (board)
2 move your meeple (1 - 7 moving points)
3a ending on a card check it secretly and change places with another card
3b ending on a space with a bear move forward to next unoccupied bear space
4 at the end of your turn you may flip to adjacent cards:
5a if they show similar coloured markers (same building) you gain one winning point and the cards are removed
5b if there is a bear card next to your cards ==> gain an additional point

name: A Question of Sport: Soccer
description:
Set of cards for board game based on popular BBC TV-Show. This time with questions about soccer.

Players roll the dice, answer the question and if it was correct move the number of spaces he rolled. Player who reaches finish first is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Petit Poucet
description:
The ogre fell asleep at the foot of a tree, Tom Thumb and his brothers will benefit for they rob him of all his gold?

In turn, the player must roll a die and advance the number of spaces indicated, and then act on the square where he stopped taking gold at the ogre, take his next turn etc.
But beware, fall on the bell box too often wakes the ogre!

Players win if they get back together all the pieces of the ogre before he wakes up.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bible Bingo
description:
A religious take on the Bingo type of game. The game for the youngest in the family is straight Bingo, although adults should make sure the children understand the scripture references on their bingo card.

The game for older children requires them to name a verse or story from the bible relating to the colour they draw. If other players have that colour and can name another verse or story reference, they too can cover the square on their bingo card.

In all versions, the first to create a line of five covered squares, wins.

name: Exit: Sing Sing
description:
You are a prisoner of the Sing Sing prison and your goal is to be first to break away.

All players start from the cell in the center of the plate and try to win one of four outputs located at the four corners of the plate.

In his turn player draws a tile from the bag without looking and lays it on the board before placing his pawn onto it. So all players try to build their own path to the exit.

But the route is convoluted and depends on the draw: unexpected directions. or different barriers: bars, fence, wall, reinforced door. They can also pick the tools they need to overcome these obstacles: lime, squeezed, chord and key.

It's a game of chance but where interactivity between players and tactics come in.

name: Les 1000 Bornes de la Bible
description:
A Mille Bornes variant in which players must score maximum points by exposing the maximum cards in as many rounds as possible (there are 12 series: the beginnings, the Patriarchs, Moses, To the promised land, the time of the Kingdom, the time exile, renewal, a new prophet, Jesus' encounters, the messages of Jesus, the passion, the early Christians). Each set contains 6 cards.

Draw a card to your hand, play or discard.

The game ends when one player has placed a series of six cards and he managed to shoot down six cards in his hand. The game also ends if no cards remaining in the deck is playable.
Each series reported scores up to 40 points, 10 bonus points triggering endgame, foul play by 10 points.
The winner is the first totaling 500 points after several parties.

name: "Who Knows?"
description:
Party game with 26 unusual clues to names of 26 things, each one beginning with a different letter of the alphabet, starting with A and ending with Z.

The clues are given as part of a verse. For example;

"A" is a Continent - enormously big
"B" stands for part of the flesh of a pig
"C" is a film-star, you know his face
"D" stands for a very well-known horse race
etc.

The answers to the above are;
America
Bacon
Charlie Chaplin
Derby

The first to hand in a card with 26 correct answers, wins.

name: Find Your Partner
description:
A party game designed to persuade your guests to mingle during the evening.

Each guest either gets a blue or red badge for their lapel. The blue badgesfeature a number. The red badges have a clue to a number. The idea is to find the clue you think that might be the answer to your number, or find the number that you think might be the answer to your clue. The first pair to 'match-up' are the winners (and, I suspect, will get a small gift from the host).

The matching pair are now partners for the evening and must partner each other for things like Novelty dances (such as the Gay Gordons).

name: How Provoking!
description:
A party game that tests your guests' trivia knowledge.

Each player gets a score-card, to record their answers. On the left of the card their are categories and alongside that there are 5 blank boxes. Between these two things (the category and the answer boxes) is the word 'Swaffield', going from top to bottom. D. E. Swaffield was the founder of the publisher. He designed some of its games and wrote some of the books that it published.

Swaffield has 9 letters in its name and when written vertically, it provides the initial letter required to answer the category correctly. For example:

The first category is 'Names of noted men who have written books' and the first letter is an S (as in Swaffield). The second category is 'Things in or one the sea' and these must begin with W, the second letter of Swaffield. And so on down to the last category called 'Counties in England and Wales' which will need the initial letter of D (the last letter in the word Swaffield).

The object is to write down five things that are indicated by the category and all five must begin with the associated letter. The host should set a time limit and the winner is the guest with the most valid answers.

name: Gollipop
description:
Shooting game featuring a highly collectible Golliwog as the target. The idea is to shoot off his buttons and his eyes with your Air Pop-Gun.

Each player takes equal turns and the one with the most successes, wins.

name: Fan De
description:
Board game for teenagers with CD included.

2-5 called fans compete with their knowledge of the superstars.
They are singer, stylist, manager, journalist and actress. Each turns must to collect stars in a bending test players answer questions from the four themes:
. In the shoes of a star
. Graffiti
. Song
. People

In addition to having a perfect knowledge about the lives of celebrities, players demonstrate their artistic talents: one that marks the end of the box titled Graffiti player draws a movie title or song in order to make opponent guessing. That evil spirits do not stir, each wins: if the rival is fulfilling its mission, it will be rewarded with a Fate card.

name: Continental Soccer Game
description:
An action football (soccer) game.

You must assemble the game before you can start play. The board has four legs and is, in effect, a table. Insert a number of rods on each side. When assembled properly, the rod handles will freely rotate when you twist them. Along any rod there will be a number of football players.

When the ball is in play you can twist a player so that he 'kicks' the ball. Of course, your opponent is trying to do the same thing at the same time so play becomes frenetic from the start. The onject is to kick the ball into your opponent's goal. The player who scores the most goals, wins.

These type of games are most often seen at gaming arcades in Britain and I guess the same applies to the States.

name: Veilig Verkeer Spel
description:
An educational card game published by the Dutch Safe Traffic Agency, meant for teaching and checking knowledge of Dutch traffic rules and regulations.

Game contains a to-be-assembled die, cut-out chits and playing cards.

Per round the top card is drawn and a die roll decides which category question or task must be correctly answered to win that category's chit.
Each card contains three traffic rules questions, a pictionary-like assignment (traffic-related: draw a traffic light) and charade-like task (mime turning right on a bike). Each question or task has its own category. The game should be played by teams of at least two players. The team who first collects all 5 different category chits wins.

name: Leap Frog
description:
A mini game for 2 players by David Smith

Published in Plato magazine

Before You Start


Draw a large circle and place 9 circular spaces at equal intervals around the circle.
One player uses 4 small silver coins as pieces.
The other player uses 4 small bronze coins.


The Play


Each player in turn places one of their pieces on the playing board until all but one of the nine spaces is occupied.
Then each player at each turn must either
move an own piece into an adjacent space in either direction or
single jump one own piece over one adjacent enemy piece into an empty space immediately beyond the enemy piece (As in Chinese Checkers) or
double jump one own piece over two enemy pieces one space apart with vacant spaces between and immediately beyond the two pieces jumper over. (Like a double jump in Chinese Checkers).

Pieces jumped over are captured and removed from the board.
Last player with a piece or pieces still in play wins the game.


Copyright 2007 David L. Smith, NZ

name: One-Dimensional Connect Four
description:
This is the traditional Connect Four, but played in just one dimension or line. Originally proposed by Angus Lavery in a Games and Puzzles magazine in 1994, the only known source as of now is an instructables article by "Kiteman"
The game consists of a line of 10 tokens in 2 colors that are arranged alternately. On her turn a player takes 3 tokens out of that line from any position and puts them back at any end of the line in the order they were taken. At least one token of the players color must be among these 3 tokens. The gap is closed by pushing the tokens back together. The goal of the game is, as in the original connect four, to form a line of 4 tokens of your color.

name: The Magitech Wars
description:
SYNOPSIS

"Since the Ascension, the universe is a hard-fought setting of the Technomagi. Besides their schemes and secret agendas, they fight a power struggle for the most valuable resource that is known to sentiment beings: Crystallium. This substance fuels all Magitech, an invention that grants godlike powers by fusing magic and technology. Mighty legions and armadas of spaceships became obsolete within the blink of an eye, as the Technomagi tapped into the possibilities of Magitech. In the far away future, battles are fought and decided by a selected few instead. Accompanied by their Minions, Technomagi strive for nothing less than ultimate rulership over the universe. And Crystallium is the key to victory..."

SUMMARY OF PLAY

In "The Magitech Wars" - players take the roles of mighty Technomagi - competing to claim Crystallium Sources on the plane, through skirmish battles. Using customized Vaults of cards, a hex-tile gameboard, six sided dice and tokens, they let their minions fight to become the emperor of a fictitious multiverse. From turn to turn the players summon Minions and move them around the board to let them battle. Players gain crystals by putting some of their Minions into the crystal zone, and win the game through gathering six victory points. Those points are scored by controlling the most Places of Power on the gameboard, or by banishing enemy cards.

OBJECT OF THE GAME

The first player who scores six Victory Points, wins the game. This is done in two different ways:


Control Places of Power.
Banish enemy cards.

name: Dinosaurs The Game
description:
The aim of the game is to race along the ground avoiding all the hazards such as, the Earthquake, the Dinosaur fight, the Marsh etc before you can be the first to cap the erupting volcano.

Each player has its own playing grid to move along, which is three squares wide, you role the dice and move the appropriate number of squares, you can only move straight ahead or diagonally, so keep an eye on what instruction squares you want to miss and which ones you want to land on. Knocking down a tree allows you to move extra spaces (2 squares for a small tree, and 4 for a large tree). Instruction squares may move you forward, may move you back, may allow you to place a tree on your playing grid, or remove a tree from an opponent's playing grid. If you land on a fight square you must fight the player to your left, highest dice role wins. The winner moves forward three, the loser goes back three. The first to cap the volcano wins.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Telektonon: The Game of Prophecy
description:
From the description:

"Telektonon is the sword of light, the technology of telepathy, revealed as the day-by-day unfolding of the Thirteen Moon 28 Day Calendar. In the form of a game, Telektonon consists of a playing board with thirteen moving pieces and an accompanying set of 52 playing cards."

"The playing board and deck of 52 cards are the tools used on a daily basis for achieving the goal of putting you back in time with telepathy."

Includes the instructions, a "Sarcophagus Box" to hold the cards, a text describing the "Talking Stone of Prophecy", 4 time calibrator stones, three turtle tokens, 5 oracle pyramids, 1 crystal, a poster, a colorful board, and a cloth storage bag.

A player will move around the board and assemble a card layout; this pattern is cross-referenced with special charts to determine fourth dimension power.

Although the game can be enjoyed as a group activity, each player conducts his or her own metaphysical journey. The rules appear to reward the player who completes a session with greater cosmic power with a higher "score" which would then be compared to the "scores" of the other players during their own effort to obtain enlightenment. A complex set of charts is used to determine a players fourth dimension power.

name: Bible Charades
description: A Charades game that has a stack of religious quotes to act out. Play as individuals or teams. A player reference card advises about the usual Charades-type signals for book, play, etc. but it also gives a lot of signals especially thought up by the designers to be useful in a biblical connection.

name: The Bible Adventure Game
description: User summary: Roll and advance along a board by answering Bible trivia questions. Questions have three levels of difficulty. Game also has Gift and Peril cards that can reward or hinder your progress. Other spaces cause you to change spaces with another player or roll again. Game board also has a bridge that can be used as a shortcut, but you have to roll the correct number. First player to finish wins.

name: Caribbean Sea
description:
Grab the bigger boats, sail on and pick the biggest treasures. It will do more to bring your loot safely and avoiding other buccaneers who will not let you do so easily.

Caribbean Sea is a dice game. On each turn, you roll as many dice as pirate your fine team have available. Then according to their value, you place your pirates on the board for hire new pirate, borrow boats, get cards with special effects, or place yours buccaneers on the best place on the trail to treasure. You'll also be able fomater mutinies to take the place of pirates enemy, attacking enemy ships and send them to the bottom and take them treasures, but also try to place your pirate in their crews to take advantage of their wealth.

In the end, the player who collected the most treasures will be proclaimed the master of the oceans ...
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Krok Nik Douil editions

name: Bracket Brawl
description: This is a party game in which a player and his opponent debate an issue that is determined by a card draw. The debate is judged by the other players according to a criterion that a spinner decides, eg, funniest, most unique, worst, etc. The judges award chips to the players. Play continues through each bracket, with the two players who have collected the most chips squaring off in the finals.
publishers: JACD Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Game of Bible Objects
description:
Game has 105 cards, each bearing a picture of some object connected with the Bible or Bible times and in most cases one or more Bible references. Shuffle the cards and deal 10 cards to each player. Each player tries to make books. Three cards of the same class of subjets make up a book. These completed books are placed aside till the end of the game when they are counted. Whoever has the most books wins.

Each player calls any player he wishes and asks for a card from any series - (Animals, Trees etc.) If successful then the player may continue asking for other cards from any player he wants until he asks for a card from a player and that player does not have one that he asked for, at which time the active player draws 3 cards from the deck and play passes to the next player to his left.

Game #4012

name: STD: The Game
description:
The object is to "infect" as many players as you can using the cards in your hand and those available from a 5-card draw pool before the draw deck in gone. Each STD has a point value. At the end of the hand, the lowest score wins.

There are 3 ways to "infect" another player:

1- creating a 3 of a kind and passing it to a player
2- after each turn, give 1 of the STDs from your hand to the player on your right
3- using a special event card that allows you to give half of the STDs you've been "infected" with to another player.

Beware of the HIV card... if you end up with it at the end of the game your points double.

name: Casus Belli: Act of War
description:
In this game, players will try to overtake the monarch’s throne by expanding their duchies at the expense of neutral and rival territories. The players will need to use intrigue and diplomacy in order to justify their aggressive actions.

Each player will build his duchy by collecting resources and building up a glorious army to oppose any throne claimers on the battlefield. The game offers 4 different royal houses to play, each with their own duchy tile, representing their initial territory. Each territory has different topographic and economic characteristics. The fast-paced battle system infuses both random and tactical layers into a thrilling conflict resolution system.

Each player also has a court, and will need to appoint the right ministers, nobles and generals to the right tasks in order to pull off their great rebellion. The game offers a unique trading system that enables enhancing your military campaign with the best soldiers gold can buy. The player with the most impressive army, the deepest pocket and the best court will rule over all others.
categories: Economic, Medieval, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Animal Circus (fan expansion for Animal Upon Animal)
description:
Premise:

Each player is a circus manager with the primary act the animal acrobats that make up the pyramid in Animal upon Animal.  You will purchase animals to make the pyramid.  Some animals can easily woo the crowd and will give their owner-managers a bonus when they are successfully placed. Some animals are easy to come by and can even be obtained for free.  Some animals just aren't desirable and thus are easy to obtain, but likewise the crowd really doesn't want to see them either and you'll lose money for placing them.  Finally, of the animals fall they sustain injuries that cost money to treat them, even the birds can be injured by other animals in the pyramid.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: 5 x 5 War
description:
This two player print and play game is actually inspired from a variant of Fire from the Sky. This game depicts the battle between two small armies of 9 soldiers each in a board of 25 grids(5 rows and 5 columns.) Three dice are also used. Each player takes the control of an army.

All the soldier tokens are placed in the board, one token per square. The soldiers are imagined to have both melee weapons(sword or mace) and ranged weapons. The players can throw up to three dice per turn to determine an action to be taken on the war field (board). The number of dice thrown are determined by the number of soldiers he has left on the field. Nine to seven soldiers means he can throw three dice. Six to four means he can throw 2 dice and three to one soldiers means he can throw just one die.

Out of the dice he can choose any one as a row number and the other as column number. (means more the number of soldiers he has more choices at his disposal). If the grid on the field selected using this row and column has an enemy soldier, the enemy soldier is removed. If it has the player's own soldier, he can move one square and can capture an enemy soldier if there's one in that square.

If the user threw six, he can use it to destroy an entire row(chose a six and a row number ), or an entire column (chose a six and column number) or a combination of both (when he chose a double six for row and column), killing enemy soldiers and maybe his own soldiers as collateral damage.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mr. Tom
description:
A first introduction to calculations for very young children. The centerpiece of the game is a plastic octopus with two arms stretched out. Around it, fishes of various values (and weights) are placed. The active player picks a large bundle of fish and hangs it on one of the arms, then tries to find several individual fishes for the other arm. If successful, octopus Mr. Tom looks straight and the arms are balanced, if not, it is losing focus and balance.
In the two player version, one child can pick one side and let the other player make the calculations for getting the octopus back into its balance.

name: Piłkarski Manager
description:
Piłkarski Manager is an unique boardgame connecting football and economy. Each player becomes a football team manager. Their goal is to build the strongest team and win the league.

On the board we can:

buy and sell players
expand training school and draft junior players
use airlines to move team between spots
place bet at the bookies


Each player in our team has certain abilities with point values assigned. Our team strength depends on all its player abilities. The better the players, the more chance to win the match.

To play the match you roll the dice and compare the result to the game outcome table which takes into account different strengths of two teams.

name: Darkey Ten Pins
description:
A throwing game from an age of racist Americana.

The game features ten 6-1/2 inch heavy cardboard lithographed figures on wood bases. The figures are made to look like stereotypical african-american humans caricatures of the period. In the game, players roll balls at the figures, and whoever hits the most wins.

Sold as an novelty game, it was first published in 1914.

name: Jogo Dos Grooms
description: The Players have to shoot black soldiers with a sling. The soldiers are dressed similar to valets. Made from Majora.

name: The Game of Sambo
description:
A ring toss game. Comes in a wooden box that has hinges on the front. The inside of the box has the instructions and more information about the game. The gamepieces are a wooden black man, a stand, a pipe and 4 red and black rubber rings.

The players toss rings and try to hook them on Sambos pipe which sticks out from the standup figure. The instructions are on the back of the figure.

name: The Game of Ten Little N*****rs
description: A variation of Old Maid that features Black characters exclusively. The deck contains a pair of each of the ten "Little Niggers" plus one oddball to get "stuck" with.

name: Jeu de Massacre
description:
A Throwing game In which Players try to hit black humans with colored coins. Published in France.

The three figures are attached to the cardboard of the box. There are three cardboard disks that are used to throw at the figures. Each one of the figures has a minor slight crease in the neck area.

From the game box : Get the game ready by placing the subjects upright throw the quoits while standing at a distance od 10 feet from them. Each in turn, the players may get threee shots at the black persons and the game is played in 10 Times The player adds his points and puts the fallen pices right again for the following competitor.

name: Airborne In Your Pocket: Currahee!
description:
This expansion put the "Airborne" in "Airborne In Your Pocket"!

It allows the players to play a mini-game, before the regular game, to simulate the parachute jump to the Drop Zone. All players have a set of Events and place their figuring on the special "Drop" Location. They start on the plane, then must decide when to jump, and how long their wish to stay airborne before landing. Of course, they must be careful not to miss the Drop Zone!

Contains 40 “Parachute Event” cards (enough for 4 players), 1 Special Operative (The Jumpmaster), and 1 big location (The Drop).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Airborne In Your Pocket: Hooah!
description:
This expansion allows you to reach the Drop Zone by landing on the beach with the rest of the boys.

It allows the players to play a mini-game, before the regular game, to simulate the beach landings. All players have a set of Events and place their figurine on the special "Beach" Location. They start when their feet touch the cold water, then they must decide when to advance to the bluffs and reach the (relative) safety of the Drop Zone. All this time, they will be exposed to enemy fire and shelling. Who said landing was going to be easy?

Contains 40 “Beach Event” cards (enough for 4 players), 1 Special Operative (The Hero), and 1 big location (The Beach).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Jolly Coon Race
description:
Taken from the description of the box

A new and very comical game for two or three people. Metal Figures of darkies with moveable arms, racing along three poles. Their comical actions are very funny. All start at the same time and it is exceedingly amusing to see the race.

name: Zulu Tribe
description: A throwing game from 1925. Inside the box ten pins with minstrel faces and exotic costumes are to be found. The person who hits the most black persons, wins.

name: Heineken The game
description: The game can be played by 2 to 6 players. Goal of the game is to collect 6 Heineken stars as fast as possible. You collect a star by answering a question card right. The questions are about the history of the beer and about Heineken. That's how players learn about Heineken. The board is a worldmap. This is how players travel from continent to continent. To illustrate what kind of export product Heineken is. Heineken the game is educative, enervating and fast played!

name: Storm 1995
description:
A boardgame that is based on the real Operation Storm, from 1995, when the Croatian army liberated Knin from the Serbian-Chetnik aggressor. This game is shows the heroic Operation Storm in a educational way so that the heroic acts of Croatian soldiers may never be forgotten.

The game is meant for 4 players, and each one has its figure and throws the dice. Depending on the dice result, player takes over the fields on the board, and the start position is in the area of Croatian Kostajnica. All along the line where Croatian army passed are drawn tanks aswell as Croatian soldiers and Serbian-Chetnik occupators. The winner is the first one that liberates the city of Knin. There is a pamphlet with real-life historical facts about Operation Storm.

By this educational and fun system the goal of this boardgame is to commemorate the heroism of the Croatian Armed Forces during the Operation Storm, and may it never be forgotten.

name: Smoking Sambo Ring Toss
description:
A ring toss game - comes in a wooden box front.
The gamepieces are a black head, a cigar and 3 (red,blue,white - 25/10/5 pts) rings.

The players toss rings and try to hook them on Sambo's cigar which sticks out from the mouth.
The first player to accumulate 500 Points is declared the winner.
The instructions are on the back of the lid.

Similar to The Game of Sambo

name: Hot Wheels Turbo Duel
description:
A children's game for two players sold under the Hot Wheels branding. Compare the "speeds" of cards, with the higher speed wins both cards. A draw results in dealing out another four cards each, comparing the fourth cards to win all ten. The object is to collect all 52 cards.

A redevelopment of the game War

name: Euroland
description:
The aim of the game is to travel around Europe for a vacation with a budget set at the beginning, and bring maximum points (no money, whew!) At the end of the game.

The game board represent the Old Continent with countries, cities and capitals. The counters are four animals (rabbit, duck, sheep, pig) probably because the animals know no borders!

At start each player is dealt 7 cards with "cities" they must to visit during the game and then return to their capital. The game begins with a preparatory phase to travel, with a maximum of 5 rounds, for which players can interact with each other or with the deck, one card per turn to plan their journey.

In his turn player move on the board visiting cities, playing special cards, buying souvenirs.

The holiday ends when first player has visited all 7 cities (he also wins a bonus of 30 points).
The winner is whoever has the most points for his "Souvenir" cards and "Cities" cards.

name: Reise durch Ägypten (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Egyptian map for Ticket to Ride.

The map uses the original Ticket to Ride rules (i.e. no tunnels, ferries as introduced by Ticket to Ride Europe). I have not yet tinkered nor played this extension but it contains plenty of both long and short routes.
8 additional tickets (short-routes as in Mystery Train).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Transportation, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Gumnut Game
description:
Using the enchanting May Gibbs characters from the classic story of Snugglepot & Cuddlepie that has delighted generations: be the first to grow the grandest gumtree in the land. Protect your tree and survive the fires and dangers of the forest.

The Gumnut Game pits up to 8 gumnuts babies, as they attempt to survive the harsh conditions of Australia. This is determined by spinning both a Weather Forecast and Fire Danger Indicator as determined by the spaces that players land on as they progress through the game. Along the way players have the opportunity to pick up Reward, Danger, Surprise and Safety cards which either provide advantages or disadvantages to the players.

The winner of The Gumnut Game is the first player whose gumnut baby is able to traverse all 99 spaces and survives the dangers allowing it to grow into a River Red Gum.

name: Emils multiplikationsspel
description:
Swedish card game to teach children math.

Two decks of cards - one with questions, one with answers. Each player get five question cards. One answer card is placed face up on the board. The first player looks to see if he has any question card that matches.

For instance if in the answer pile lays "=7" and the first player has the card "7x1" then he can pick up the answer card and take the pair and put it to the side. If the first player has a pair but does not know the answer another player can take his question card and get a pair for himself.

If nobody has the question card to the answer card it is put into the center of the table. Then a new answer card can be turned up and the game continues to the next player in turn. Each player gets a chance to see if they have a matching pair.

name: Soccer: The Great New Card Game
description:
Interesting card game that marries Poker to a team-building football game. There are 54 cards in four 'suits' of eleven and ten reserve cards. The 'suits' are four football teams - Red Rovers, Blue Devils, Green Goblins and Yellow Dwarfs. A team consists of 1 Goalkeeper, 2 Full Backs, 2 Half Backs and 5 Forwards.

Each player receives an equal number of counters. At the start of every hand, a player must pay i unit into the Big Pool (a 'pot' that is taken by the winning player). Everyone then get five cards and can chooseto keep the hand or to discard any number of cards and receive replacements. Once this has been done for everybody, each player may discard the hand or support it. If he does indeed support it, he must pay three units into the Small Pool After everyone has had the chance to discard or support their hand, the hands left in are revealed and the winning player takes the Small Pool. The hands are valued as in Poker, except that it is possible to have five of a kind.

The winning player of each hand may take from his winning hand any cards that he might be needing to form his team. For example, if he was collecting red players and he won the hand with cards Red Full Back x 2 and a red forward, he may take those three cards and lay them out in front of him. When any player has all 11 players of the same colour, he has won. Reserve team players can be in the team, substituting for actual red player cards.

If you run out of units, you are out of the game. The player who first builds a complete team wins and takes the units in the Big Pool. The units seem only to be interesting if you are playing for real money. If not, their only function is to remove a player from the game should that player lose all his units.

name: Bingo Pinball Boardgame
description:
Using direction dice you will be trying to shoot five balls into numbered holes on the playfield. They will light corresponding numbers on the backglass. Try to get 3, 4, or 5 numbers in a row on the backglass cards.

Numbers must be ADJOINING each other connected by a line. Only highest score per card registers.

Coin 1: 5 balls on card 1

Play as many (or as few) coins as you wish.

Coins 2 - 6: lites Cards 2 thru 6.

Coins 7 and 8: lites Diagonals on Cards 1, 2, 3 and Cards 4, 5, 6.

Coins 9 and 10: lites a Magic Number for Cards 1, 2, 3 and Cards
4, 5, 6. Hitting the Magic Number will DOUBLE the odds on those cards.

Coin 11: lites DOUBLE-DOUBLE payoff on one card. Hitting the Magic Number will DOUBLE-DOUBLE the odds on that card.

Coin 12: lites ALL PLAYFIELD SCORES. Now, if you make 3, 4, or 5 adjoining holes on any one row ON THE PLAYFIELD, you score as indicated on the 3rd card.

Coin 13: lites PLAYFIELD SCORES. Now 14, 15, 16, 17, 18 score as 5 in-line, and 23, 24, 25 score as 4 in-line. You score as indicated on the 6th card.

Coins 14 and above: increases the odds on each card in turn, or lites a feature like '4 corners score as 5 in-line' or a SUPER LINE. (SUPER LINE scores 2 in-line as 3, 3 in-line as 4, 4 in-line as 5). Or, a coin might lite a playfield button to lite the CORNERS or SUPER LINE feature.

After playing the 13th coin, you may (if you wish) play another coin and lite the Golden Star Game. Each coin increases the Golden Star Game odds. A maximum of 20 coins may be played. When lit, after shooting your first ball, five gold numbers will lite in a star pattern on one of the cards. Any 2, 3 or 4 in the Golden Star will score as indicated.

After shooting the fifth ball, you may try to improve your game with 1 to 3 EXTRA BALLS. The maximum payoff on the next ball is shown, as well as the cost of an EXTRA BALL. (The higher the potential win, the greater the cost).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Memeology
description:
Game Play:
The goal of this game is to be left with no cards in your hands. The goals of this game isn't matching meme picture to meme picture but matching either meme picture to their said tag lines or matching tag lines to who said it. This game does require some knowledge of popular internet memes. Memeology’s deck consists of two different tag lines to a meme. Any future booster packs won’t duplicate any meme but will consist of different memes to be added to your original deck to expand game play and the amount of players. Memeology has 3 different types of situational cards that can either help or hinder your ability to win.

Change your mood, change your thinking, change your life!

More info here and here.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mount Everest
description:
The game contains a two-piece 'staircase' with a total of 12 steps representing Mount Everest, 4 'jumper' playing pieces and 3 dice.

The aim is conquer Everest, i.e., to climb to the top of the stairs once and then climb down again. The first player to succeed in doing this wins.

Each player receives a playing piece and places it at the foot of the stairs. The younger player begins and game follows clockwise with all players trying to climb the stairs 1 to 12 and then to descend from 12 to 1 using the numbers on the three dice. The following rules apply:


All three dice must be thrown for every turn
The playing piece can only be moved forward if the number of the next step is contained in the sum of any combination of the dice
If the combination allows, more than one step may be climbed in a single move
On the descent, the exact numbers must be thrown, e.g., if the piece is on the third to last step, a 2 and a 1 must be thrown to reach home
The first player to reach the summit may throw again
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aasia reis
description:
Similar to Euroopa reis but this time players travel to Asia.

Game is basic roll and move, with treasure collection and trivia. Each players goal is to travel to a location shown on the card they have. Game comes with a rule book which contains info for each country destination.
Be the first to reach destination to win the game.

Game comes in the nice box shaped like a briefcase.

name: The Winner Takes It All
description:
Rules:

- Each player begins with 12 coins, which he positions anywhere on the six rectangles on his half of the board (for example, all 12 coins can be placed on the same rectangle).
- The start player is determined throwing the die.
- Player 1 then begins the game throwing the die. The number shown corresponds to a rectangle on Player 2's half of the board. Any coins positioned there are then removed to the central dish. Player 2 can then re-position his remaining coins if so he chooses.
- Player 2 then throws the die and play continues as described before: all coins in the corresponding rectangle in Player's 1 half of the board are then removed into the dish. Player 1 can then reposition his remaining coins if desired.
- The round ends when only one player has one or more coins remaining on the board. This player receives points corresponding to the number of coins in the dish.
- The overall winner is the player with the most points after a previously agreed number of rounds.

name: Jungle Race
description: A simple roll-and-move game printed on boxes of Kellogg's Coco Pops breakfast cereal. Coco the monkey and Croco the crocodile must traverse 22 steps from start to goal, with 6 possible events along the way. A die must be supplemented, and the game suggests using Coco Pops for pieces.

name: Arrazzles
description:
Arrazzles is a game/sculpture crossover, with the metallic-colored cards having five different patterns of cuts or slots on them, allowing them to be combined in all sorts of arrangements.

In addition to being a freeform building tool, Arrazzles contains rules for a number of games, such as a memory game in which players try to match the colors on the cards and a building game in which other players try to guess the object that you've created. In "The Shift", players divide the cards equally amongst themselves, then take turns creating a sculptured arrangement of cards in the center of the table. Try to be the first player who places a card so that the cards shift and fall into a new arrangement.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Scrabble: Bible Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Everyone's favorite word game is now offered in a Bible version. Celebrate your favorite stories from the Bible in this fun new word game. The Bible Edition of Scrabble features new Bible rules and a specially designed game board. Also, included is a new Bonus Word Guide. No two games are alike as you draw on your biblical knowledge to spell unique words with spiritual significance.

name: Fancy Nancy Ooh La La Tea Party Game
description: "Ooh la la, it's time for a tea party!" No one knows fancy like Nancy! Join Fancy Nancy in this fun-filled tea party game where players spin a spinner to collect Colorforms Stick-Ons and place them on their special tea party play scene boards, competing to be the first to place all six respectively.

name: En resa i sagolandet
description: A typical classic children's game, based on racing mechanics, where you roll the dice, move your pawn along a numbered path and follow instructions on some of the numbers, if you land on them. The theme is a mix of many farytales. The Swedish version is from the 1940s.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Biblebanz Game
description:
Biblebanz is a game that when played will increase Bible knowledge, vocabulary, and perhaps the faith of all who participate. There exist many card games for enhanced learning. A unique feature of this card game is that it consists of plastic adjustable headbands worn on the foreheads of each player. This feature makes it fun and exciting to learn about the Bible. More specifically this game relates to a method of learning about people, places and things found in the Bible in a fun and unique way. It has been said that a family that prays together stays together. I would also like to think that a family that plays together stays together. Therefore, it is the purpose of this game to bring goups of people together in the form of family, friends, or other small groups to learn about the Bible in this fun unique way, increasing ones Bible knowledge, vocabulary, and their faith in the Bible and in God. Churches and Sunday school teachers are always looking for new, fun and creative ways to teach their students about the Bible. This game will satisfy that need.

Each Biblebanz game comes with 6 headbands, 94 Bible cards, 6 blank cards, 24 chips and a timer.

This game is a game for the whole family for ages 7 and up. It is for 2 to 6 players. The Biblebanz Game Cards features things found in the Bible. Examples are: animals, food, people and bible objects. Examples are: Jesus, Noah, Ark, Fig tree, apple, church and so forth. The cards are simple enough for the whole family to join in on the fun. Each round only lasts one minute. At the start of the round you have to start the sand timer. As the time runs out, the player whose turn it is must ask yes or no questions to figure out what his card is. This will help to increase your Bible knowledge and Bible vocabulary. It's very entertaining to say the least. There are 6 blank cards to be used with a dry erase marker. These blank cards are great for young children who need easy words or Bible schoolars who want harder words to figure out. You can write whatever word you want out of the Bible on them. You will never run out of words to use this way.

Rules Of The Game:

The rules of Biblebanz are simple. Each player is dealt a single card and three chips. The player’s must then place the card on their headband without looking. The youngest player goes first. Then, play passes to the left. Set the one minute timer. Next, start asking questions in yes or no format. If you've found out your identity, you just ask, “Am I ________?” Fill in the blank with what you think you are. For each identity that you guess correctly, you discard one of your chips. If you guess your identity before the one minute timer runs out, take another card and put it in your headband. If you do not guess your identity before the timer runs out, then keep it and continue to guess on your next turn. The person to get rid of all of his or her chips is the Biblebanz winner! It's so much fun!

Great for birthday parties, bridal showers, Christian retreats, sleep overs, children's church, youth groups, Bible study groups, and more!

Biblebanz is a trademark of Christian Book And Toys LLC. ©2012 Christian Book And Toys LLC. All rights reserved. Patent Pending. Conforms to product safety standards CPIA, regulatory requirements.

name: Angulus
description:
Angulus is the classical logical game created by Marek Łukaszewicz in November 2012. This strategic game for two players is played on the board 8x9 squares. The chessmen move in all directions from one to three squares in maximum depending if it is a pawn, a piece or a king.

The goal of the game is to capture the opponent's king.

In each turn the player moves only one chessman.
In the game there are three kinds of chessmen: pawn, piece and king:

- Pawns can move one square in each direction (horizontally, vertically and diagonally) and capture the opponent's chessman diagonally.

- Pieces can move and capture from 1 to 2 squares in each direction (horizontally, vertically and diagonally).

- King can move and capture from 1 to 3 squares in each direction (horizontally, vertically and diagonally).

The opponent's chessmen are captured like in chess game.

name: Soccer Flow
description:
Soccer Card Game is a two player card game, each player will have his players with their own abilities in a representative 52 card deck.

The players will have to manage their hand, and place the players in the field, according with the ability of each player so they can move the ball toward the goal. But...the defensive player will have to work on making it hard for the attacker... One way or another the ball will move!

Finish your deck to end the first half, go for a second round for a full game...

Quick to learn, easy to play, a fast and blast of a game! ;)

-- V3 --
A WHAT CAN BE GAME:

In this V3 of Soccer Flow, i added Tactic Cards, that allow coaches to choose the starting tactic and add some special cards to the team deck.
I also add the Special cards, that allow the game to be more unpredictable as a soccer game should be!
Now each player, will have a different number depending on each position they will play, allowing the teams to be more competitive, and each coach has to choose wisely the players for the team deck!
Each player will have a combination of 0 to 3 special abilities, and a star number that indicates the max. number of cards of that player that can be in the team deck.
So coachs will have to choose 10 players +1 Goalkeeper, and the sum of the star numbers of each team will difer, as so the number of actions each team can do in the game!

In real soccer, my team is always best than any other!

name: Spanish Civil War: The World War of Spain
description:
With a great deal of support, a coalition within the Spanish Military (called Nationalists) declared their revolt in July 1936. The Nationalists allied with Conservative, Fascist, Monarchist and Catholic groups to “save” Spain. The democratically elected government of Spain (called Republicans) gathered Left-wing Republicans, Socialists, Communists and Anarchists together to fight these “Nationalist” insurgents. The Nationalists were primarily supported by Nazi Germany, Fascist Italy, and the dictatorship of Portugal. The Republicans were primarily supported by Communist Russia and Mexico. Other countries remained neutral and followed official policies of non-intervention. Many neutral country’s citizens however made their way to Spain to volunteer in the International Brigades and fight for Republican Spain.
In Spain the sides are clear. Can the red tide be stopped in Spain? Can fascism be given its first real defeat here? Whatever happens, the conflict in Spain will echo on into the coming war that will likely engulf the world.

Winning the War:
Every territory has resources of men and material to gain or lose until final victory is in sight. On your turn you build, maneuver, and deploy your land and air forces to gain territory for yourself, and deny it to your enemy. In a civil war you fight until one side surrenders. In Spanish Civil War: The World War of Spain, this is the case. You fight until one side surrenders or until one side controls every province of mainland Spain.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Trenches
description:
Trenches is a fast-paced card game for two players, set in the trenches of late WWI.

The players will fight off for the best of 3 conflicts in order to win the campaign. Each conflict is decided using victory points, that are awarded by breaking a stand-still between two sides of trenched foes.

Each conflict represents a battle to hold 5 different objectives. To win the objectives, each player drafts a hand of 6 cards that will be played by turn (face down) on a chosen objective, until all players pass or finish their hand.

Then the players reveal the cards and start activating the special actions, in ascending order. Each side tallies the objectives they have obtained to determine if they broke the tie and won the conflict!

The game features a unique intense experience of drafting, deploying, deceiving and triumph!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, World War I

name: Die Innovationsregion Ulm
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of greater Ulm region each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Educational, Travel

name: Bratwurst, Bier und Gartenzwerge
description:
translation: bratwurst, beer and garden goblins
Objective: find out, who mostly behaves as a typical German, have fun
- acting simultaneously -
active player draws a card & all players vote (mostly yes or no);
(weird) questions are rated by points - depending on the answer -, the more points you collect the higher the chance that your 'obsessive' behavement indentifies you as a typical German...
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Find It!: The Bible Scavenger Hunt
description:
In about all Bible trivia games, players are required to do memory dumps from their mind. In Find It! it is different. In Find It! it is different. In the game, players are allowed to look through a Bible they have, to find the answers.

Each turn, a player takes the role of a moderator, and asks a question. Players would then rush to try to find the answer in the Bible. First player to find the answer would score points.

Player to first reach a target score, or have high score after a set amount of time wins the game. The game can vary difficulty by given clues as to Old or New Testament, book, and also chapter. Players can also play with either preset cards, or have players create questions on the fly.

name: Time Soldiers
description:
A Sci-Fi twist where Allied forces battle to destroy a time-travel port that guarantees the survival of the enemy's supreme human race.

Time Soldiers is a turn-based game for 2 players (Axis & Allies) or two teams of up to 3 players each. Played on a board divided into 3 separate areas for temporal jumps (Giza, Egypt 2560 BC, Holy Roman Empire 1248 AD, and Central Europe 1945 AD), and 1 area where soldier reinforcements can be acquired by each team. Located in the center of the board is a time-travel port that transports soldiers through both time and space to engage in battles.

The primary object of the game for the Axis Powers is to finish their two-stage plot to rid the world of the human race in 1945, then time-travel to the future in 1946 to start a supreme human race. The primary object of the game for the Allies is to locate the time-travel port, battle Axis forces to gain control of it, and shut it down before the Axis Powers finish their two-stage plot. If either stage of the plot is finished, the dynamics of the game changes drastically with battles in both time and space.

Players control and move soldiers of different ranks and powers in an attempt to battle and control element cards used in the Axis Powers’ two-stage plot, with movement and battle results determined by dice rolls. There are multiple successful strategies that could be used to win, and both sides have an equal likelihood of winning.

Created by award-winning video game designer and artist Ray Shingler, utilizes lessons learned from a 15 year career in video game and virtual world user interaction.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Pactio
description:
In Pactio all players build the same city. However as all of the players get different roles, they might have different agendas, and ideas for the city.

The game center point is buying buildings and developing them, as they often synergise with themselves, or your role. They also serve as your source of income to fuel your actions for the future. In addition players influence public figures and/or make deals with each other to further aid your goal.

The goal of the game is to get the most victory points by the end of 16-th turn, that is when the game ends. You gain them, again, from buildings, but also from role's missions, which might be related to buildings, but might be completely unique things. For example Pishop gets 5 Victory points if all other players' final scores are not too far apart (difference can't be bigger than 6).

Unique aspects of the game include that all deals are binding, meaning they are enforced by the game rules. Also the implementation of roles in an economical environment leads to loads of new and very interesting gameplay.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Connect With Pieces: The Lord of the Rings
description:
