The game components are the (700) pieces of a jigsaw puzzle. Each piece has one of five symbols embossed on it. Solid-color pieces may be able to fit in more than one position in the puzzle, but other pieces will only have one valid position.

The players are all working to assemble the puzzle; using the main set of rules, one player plays for a minute at a time, with the others using this time to select pieces from the box. There are also "scramble" rules in which all players can select pieces and play them as they wish.

Regardless of the rules used, players score points for playing pieces, with more points being awarded for playing more pieces and for playing rows of three pieces with the same symbol or squares of pieces with four different symbols. Points are also awarded for correcting misplaced pieces.

Players can play for a given amount of time or until someone reaches a given score (or until the puzzle is finished).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Dr. Arch's Mutations
description: Each player begins with a card that represents one of four strains of bacteria. Each player maintains a hand of five cards that can include mutation cards that will permit the player to grow other players' strains in addition to his own. Other cards are random events, antibiotics (used to interfere with other players' cultures), and bacteria (used to help grow one's own cultures). Players play one or more cards on their turns, and play continues until all cards have been played. Players receive points based on the success of their cultures and a bouns if they have grown all four cultures.
publishers: Dr. Arch Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: OCCUPYology
description:
It's one player representing the 1% versus three players representing the 99%. Players take turns rolling dice and moving around a board that contains spaces called Wall Street, Media, Pentagon, Banking, and the like. The 99%ers work together to occupy spaces that will improve their influence in the media, Congress, and other institutions. The 1%er tries to drive the other players out of those spaces and into his or her holdings.
The 1%er wins if all the other players are broke, in jail, or in the hospital. The 99%ers win if they control seven spaces at once.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tycoon
description:
"A rich-man's game".

"The object of the game is for the player to put up as many businesses and make as much money as possible before the game is over."

A Monopoly-like game, minus the bidding and trading, manufactured in the Philippines. 2-6 players move around the track by rolling 2 dice and moves forward as the total roll allows. The player can acquire the business he lands on. If the space is already owned, then the player must pay the owner as indicated in the amount shown in the property card. Players have the option to construct or put up a one-storey or two-storey in any of the business space he own in order to increase it's value. The game ends wen all but one player has declared bankruptcy or when the bank runs out of money.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Z. Year One
description:
Z. is a 2-4 player card battle game that pits Survivors against the Fallen (zombies). It combines elements of Magic: The Gathering and other card/tabletop classics with video game sensibilities and a horror movie atmosphere.Each new match allows the players to create and live out their own zombie horror film. Every card in Z. is a high quality image featuring real people and real horror makeup/effects in place of 3D art or illustrations.

In Z., the Survivor and Fallen players take turns playing new cards from their hand, which are drawn from their deck. These can include new characters, weapons, traps, etc. Additional resources needed for playing cards are generated automatically at the beginning of each turn, but may also be manually increased or altered through various gameplay mechanics.

(Since the Fallen cannot “think” and strategize per se, the Fallen player not only controls his or her units directly, but also acts as a sort of director for the overall events of the game . Many of the Fallen’s cards and especially Killstreaks can modify the core rules of the game.)

In the middle of the play field are three Location Decks, each one representing a unique setting (Cabin, Police Station, Hospital, etc.). Everything in Z. revolves around these Location Decks:

-Survivors must send out characters (units) to search the Location Deck for Supplies, items, other units, and objectives.
-The Fallen must simply wipe out the Survivors before they complete their objectives, regardless of what mode is being played.
-Survivor and Fallen units that occupy the same Location can encounter (attack or use abilities on) each other.

The cards found in each Location Deck are also themed after that Location, adding a greater variety to the gameplay and types of cards available. Not all Location Deck cards are Survivor-friendly, however. These Locations are usually overrun with Fallen, as well as other dangers and obstacles.

The Z. Year One "Core Set" includes over 450 cards, with all six Starter Decks for the Survivors and Fallen, plus the first Location Set.
categories: Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: DexQuest
description:
DexQuest is a family fantasy dexterity game in which you roll a specially weighted ball down a ramp, down a series of 3D steps made from the large box and a series of smaller boxes inside. The ball is weighted to stop when it slows and even very young gamers (5+) will soon get the hang of stopping it exactly where they want as it’s quite a bit easier than flicking.

Your rolls down the steps relate to movement and actions on the map. For example, if you want to move to a river location on the map, you will need to roll the ball to stop anywhere on the middle ‘river’ step. You might also catch a fish or find a gold coin in the water if the ball stops on one of many special icons spread across the steps. Be careful, though – if your DexBall finishes out of bounds or on an ambush icon there will be consequences!

The map locations are seeded at random with purple event cubes which players can travel to and undertake quest challenges. In true fantasy tradition these quests might be instant treasure chests, challenges, or monsters. All challenges and combat are completed by aiming for different sections of the 3D steps, which include many different ‘zones’ in which you must land to win gold. The game ships with 10 exciting and varied adventure cards, increasing in difficulty, each containing a short story and 20 quests. The game can be played PvP competitively (up to 4), co-operatively, and solo - the different adventures are tailored to these different game types.

In the Standard game the launcher location changes between 5 positions each turn to make aiming the DexBall that little bit more challenging. In Easy mode the launcher stays in its central position meaning you can aim with real accuracy every turn. Beginners are also allowed more rolls.

The game really comes to life when players have collected enough gold to buy an upgrade from a choice of 16 on their player mat. Upgrades include LEVITATION: being allowed to move the DexBall’s finishing position by one ball width; FISHING ROD: which allows you to collect fish when landed on, which can then be eaten for bonus re-rolls and travel rolls, and SECRET MAP: allows you to use the shortcuts on the map meaning you can move faster and track down more gold quicker. Other upgrades give you more control choosing quests, faster map movement and extra gold bonuses. Upgrades must be made left to right in sequence on the mat making for some painful decisions as you will want them all!

Early adventures are very easy and designed to help all players acclimatise to the idea of rolling on the steps then moving on the map to travel and collect goodies. Later adventures are more challenging, with tougher monsters to fight and traps enabled on the 3D steps. Your opponents will take on the role of monster each time, making rolls to add to the monster’s base strength, meaning you never quite know how tough the next growling beastie will be.

DexQuest’s art and design and manufacture is by Isla Tetra and Isla Tetra 2’s Will Sargent and will be published by Solway Games in Jan 2019. Reserve your copy of the first collectible 300 now. A Kickstarter campaign will follow if anyone is remotely interested in the game ;)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Lucky 13
description:
This is a twist on the basic Tiddlywinks game. The winks come in four sets, red, green, yellow and white.

The target is 7 shallow cups arranged into a hexagon. One in the center, and six on the outside.

The play is in rounds. Each player plays his winks, then scoring is done for that round.

The twist is that the scoring points for each cup are on the bottom of the cup. The cups are supposed to be mixed up so that the players won't be able to identify an individual cup. First player to 100 points wins.

name: Bakin' with Bacon
description:
The Basics

Bakin' with Bacon is a card game for 2-4 players consisting of 2 decks of cards: The Bakin' with Bacon game deck and Bacon Playing Cards (a standard deck bacon-themed deck of 52 cards + 2 jokers + 2 extra cards). The game deck includes recipe cards, action cards, wild cards, and instruction cards.

Each recipe is made up of 4 ingredients, represented by specific cards from the standard deck. The goal is to collect all four ingredients to complete a recipe and then to complete all 3 recipes. The first person to complete all 3 recipes wins the game.

Gameplay

Each player begins with 7 cards held in his/her hand and 3 unique recipe cards face up on the table. Players take turns in a clockwise direction. At the beginning of a turn, a player draws one card from the deck. The player ends a turn in one of three ways: applying 4 ingredients to complete a recipe, playing an action card, or discarding an unwanted card into the discard pile.

When a recipe is completed, that recipe and the 4 cards used to complete the recipe are no longer in play, unless reactivated with an action card that specifically affects cards that are out of play.

At any point during the game, if a player draws the last remaining card from the deck, at the end of that player's turn, the discard pile is shuffled and then becomes the deck to draw from.

The game ends when one player completes all three of his/her recipes and is declared the winner.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company, Vända Playing Cards

name: Sportz Dice:  Soccer
description: A dice game that has nothing in common with Soccer except the name and terminology. The game consists of three dice which include one "Defending" die and two "Attacking" dice. The first player rolls his "Attacking" die and if "Shoot" is rolled then the 2nd player rolls the "Defending" die trying to roll a "Miss" result, whereupon the 2nd player now posses the ball and begins "attacking". The game continues a succession of PASS, TACKLE & SHOOT attacks and GOAL, CORNER & MISS defenses with possession passing between the players. Play continues until a predetermined score (agreed upon before the game) is reached.

name: Verfolgung
description:
A small game for up to 4 people!
Each player tries to chase the other players and kick them off the gaming board at this fast game of dice.
If a player steps on a space which is occupied by another player s/he kicks it out. The last player in is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Religion, Feste im Kirchenjahr: Lernquiz Grundschule
description:
Religions, churches - learning trivia for elementary school

With this trivia game students can test how well they have mastered the basic knowledge on the topic and how far they have understood the key concepts of this area of religion.
For each task there are four answers to choose from - but only one is correct. Which answer is correct (and why), is shown on the backside of the card. Each player plays one of the four answer card: A,B,C or D, and all players reveal these simultanously. Then the trivia card is turned around as well to check the correct answer. Each correct answer scores a point. Player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

name: Tyrant Soul
description:
Tyrant Soul pits a group of unique and powerful heroes against against a variety of encounters that evoke the feeling of an epic, set-piece "boss fight." Each challenging encounter requires long-term strategic thinking, precise tactical execution and optimal usage of resources to conquer.

Tyrant Soul was inspired by end-game raiding popularized by MMOs, but also draws influences from a diverse collection of RPGs, miniatures skirmish games and TCG/LCGs - along with its own mechanics, including (optional) digital integration features.

Key Features:
> Tile-based battle map makes for a different battlefield in every encounter.
> Each playable character has a unique skillset and mechanics that make them play differently from the others. From the rapid-fire, combo-based style of the fiery Kindleborne to the reality-bending Traceless who leaves behind "shadow copies" of herself that can copy her attacks and movements.
> Gather power from the "Soulstream" that permeates the world (represented by a set of poker-like cards with custom suits) - put together the right combinations to activate powerful Heroic versions of your base skills that add new twists and enable new combos.
> The "recharge" mechanic is a quick, intuitive and visual take on cooldown mechanics popular in video games.
> 5+ epic boss monsters and encounters - each with its own theme and mechanics
> Every encounter follows an "AI script" with a combination of set and randomized events to create a dynamic challenge - no "GM" or "Overlord" needed. Digital extensions make it a snap to run the encounter from a tablet, smartphone or laptop.
> Compete with other players around the world by taking on special, super-difficult "achievement" challenges. Our online leaderboard will ensure that everyone knows your accomplishments.
> Playable as a modular single session game or an extended campaign where players grow in power and attain new powerful items and skills.
> Expanding World: New boss encounters and character classes to be released regularly!
> Alternate Game Modes: Take on your friends in PvP combat, or enter the Gauntlet and face an endless horde of randomized foes
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Euregio
description:
Objective: Be the first to get rid of your cards (location & action) by traveling through the five regions of the Euregio Meuse-Rhine. Learn more about the Euregio region.

- acting by turns -
Each player draws 5 location - one from each region - and 4 action cards. Choose your starting place, roll the die trying to follow the shortest route. If the die shows an action symbol you have to draw (and may perform) an additional action card; usually action cards help you to fulfil your goal faster.

First player who has visit all his locations wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Mathematical Dice
description:
Mathematical Dice is played with two 20-sided dice with the numbers 1 to 10 and -10 to -1 on their sides. On a turn a player rolls the dice and can add the sum, difference, product, or quotient (if it's an integer) of the two numbers to his or her score. The object is to reach a specified target total.

Another game is suggested in which the letters of the alphabet are assigned numbers to be generated by the dice, with the object being to form words, but complete rules for this are not given.

The rules were published in Games & Puzzles #28 (September 1974).

name: Number Ten
description:
"The Game of Promises and Ultimate Power" is mostly a roll & move design with some negotiation and voting in the long version of the game.

Themed around British politics with the iconic black door of 10 Downing Street as the box art, the object of this game is to become Prime Minister. In the short version of the game, the winner is the first person to do so whereas in the long version, the role of Prime Minister can change hands and the game is said to be won by "the last person to remain in the game after all the other players have tired of the Prime Minister's leadership".

Players roll and move their way around the board, trying to pick up Vote cards and debating other players if they land on the same space. In the short version, such debates are decided by rolling dice but in the long version the players must act out their side of the debate and the winner is chosen by a vote of the other players. Players must also face "chance"-like Affairs cards when they roll doubles and may end up in Jail or Hospital where they must roll dice to be set free.

Players consecutively work their way through the Town Hall, Parliament and Ministry spaces to reach Number Ten. They are paid a higher salary for reaching each of those levels but then require a greater number of votes to proceed to the next. In the long game, the current Prime Minister can influence this process by exercising special powers such as awarding a government grant to a player or sending someone to Jail.
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Shut Your Mao!
description:
A commercial version of the standard deck playing card game Mao. The game was Kickstartered in 2013, but never released.

The game ran into problems when their Chinese-outsourced printing company explained to them shortly before the end of the Kickstarter that it was "prohibited from printing any images or likeness of Chairman Mao". The designers gave a print-and-play version to backers and went silent, and the game does not appear to have been published beyond that.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game, Political, Print & Play

name: Tambudschi
description:
Stand up the 3D game board at the end of the table. The players standing at the other side and throw the balls trough the cardboard person's mouth.
Each player in turn throws all the balls, and score each that goes through the mouth on the score board. A certain number of points is set as the limit of the game, and the player who first score that number wins.

name: Gaudimax
description:
The game Gaudimax is based on a former German television show of the same name.

During play, the players move around a game board and whenever they land on certain action fields, one person reads a joke from one of the 110 joke cards. Whoever first guesses the punchline advances on the "Lachometer" (Laugh-o-meter), and the first player to reach the top of the Lachometer is awarded the title of "Gaudimax" and wins the game.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Rox Rox'n Roll
description:
In this game the crooks hide in the warehouse! Who touches the door as first to tackle them? Jump to other jobs and use the Roxgadgets!

Crooks have hidden in the warehouse, but you can help Rox to reach their hideout by rolling the dice. Watch out for the bombs, change lanes and use the super cool Roxgadgets time to achieve the warehouse first!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Racing

name: Loose Ends
description:
Line Up The Gemstones To Win! Loose Ends is an entertaining game of constant surprises, where good old-fashioned fun meets strategy and luck. Just roll the Pyramid Die and start taking the Gemstones out of the bag. But where should you place them on the Grid? Line them up in color patterns to form Scoring Combinations and win points. But fall short and your opponents can take advantage. So think carefully before you act: everyone’s fate is intertwined. It’s easy to learn and always intriguing, with enough twists and turns to keep you on your toes!

Includes: Large Gameboard, Glass Stones, Gemstone Bag, Pyramid Die, Scoring Chips, Instructions
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: MicroSport Soccer
description:
MicroSport Soccer is a fast-playing finger-flicking action game played with a portable board and small coin.

The basic game revolves around players taking turns flicking the coin in an attempt to land it on the goal. Individual player zones govern ball possession, while additional rules cover passing, turnovers, throw-ins, and goal kicks. The adjustable size of each team's player zones and goals allows amateurs to compete with experts.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Games on the Brain

name: The Bible Game
description:
The Bible Game is a trivia game based off the Bible. There are 4000 questions and Answers with Bible references. There is also seven different categories;

1. Life of Christ.
2. New Testament.
3. Old Testament.
4. W.W.W. Who, Where, or Woman.
5. Quotes.
6. Alpha and Omega.
7. General Knowledge.

name: President Wars: Battle Through The Centuries
description:
President Wars is a card and dice game that takes the traditional game of war and
transforms it into a battle of epic proportions. The deck contains every president from
George Washington to Barack Obama. Each president is given a hit point value based
on real life statistics determined by time spent in office, popularity and war experience.
On every battle card we added facts about each president. Our country's complete
leadership over the past 200+ years packed into one game.

This game is easy to learn and fun for all ages young old and with so many card
combinations, this game has unlimited replay value and should never be the same
game twice. Each card represents a different time and era in American history

Rules of War

2 Player

Each player chooses their favorite die- Republican, Democrat or Independent (red, white or blue)

Shuffle the deck and deal each player 22 cards. -Do not look at them- Place them in a pile face down in front of you. Both players turn over the top card on their pile and battle. If your card wins the battle you place it on the bottom of your pile for future use and if your card loses you put it in a separate pile, this card is no longer playable. A player wins when they successfully defeat their opponent's entire army.

1 player

Choose between 1 and 6 cards from the deck either by random or by choice and these will be your battle cards. Play through the deck to see how many presidents you can eliminate before you are taken out. Keep track of your score on score pad.

Rules of Battle

Each player rolls their die at the same time. The player who rolls the higher number gets the strike. The damage= difference in dice. Opponent then must subtract it from their battle card. The battle is over when one card loses all their hit points or an eagle is rolled.

Example - If player 1 rolls a (7) player and player 2 rolls a (1)......Then player 2 must subtract 6 from their card.

Battle Dice- 10 Sided- Numbered 2-9 with 2 symbols

Eagle- If you roll an eagle, you steal your player's card and place it on the bottom of your pile.

Shield- If you roll a shield you defend your opponent's attack and they must subtract their total roll from their battle card

name: Sofia: Komm mit zum Schloss!
description:
The player princesses in Sofia: Komm mit zum Schloss! all want to reach the castle first. On a turn, a player rolls the die, then moves her character to the next space on the path of this color; land on someone else, and you bump her back to start. Roll the amulet symbol on the die, and you draw the topmost amulet, then move to the space on the path showing this character.

Whoever first reaches the green space in front of the castle wins!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Yoo-Doo
description: Yoo-Doo consists of three six-sided dice, one with letters, one with numbers, and one with colors, 200 orange chips, and a rectangular board divided into a 12x18 grid of squares, each indexed by a letter, a number, and a color. Players take turns rolling all three dice and placing chips on the corresponding squares on the board. First player to place a chip on an existing chip then collects all the chips from the board and tallies his score for that round. The player with the highest score after five rounds wins the game.

name: 7 Dice Wonders: Civilization
description:
A Print And Play dice expansion to the contest winning game "7 Dice Wonders".

The Expansion introduces Battles, as well as more Trade, and more unpredictability.

It is partly based on "7 Wonders: Leaders" by Antoine Bauza from Repos Production.

Variants:

Rulers - adds a new die to the game, and makes it possible to have rulers in your empire - which can be bribed (taken away) by others.

Players roll seven of the eight dice per round (age).

Teams - adds a corporation between two players (or with the bot) for a combined victory or defeat.

Territory - adds an map for the wonders - first come, first serve.

Components:
1 Die. 5 Rulercards. 4 new Scoresheets.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Age of Aventinus
description:
The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" section (castle). Movement is controlled by dice and cards. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each other's pawns. Captured pawns are returned to the jail; if you can free them - try to throw them successfully into the castle so that they pass one gate; they must start their journey again.

The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".

Note:
Game mechanisms make it seem that it should be played by children, but the theme (beer/brewery) does not match at all.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Brullende Sequenties
description: Brullende Sequenties is a children’s game in which they learn the meaning of the word “sequences” and become familiar with the terms “before”, “after” en “finally”. Players connect jigsaw puzzle-shaped pieces with scenes from the movie Cars on it in order to complete a logical sequence. Adults can help the children by telling the accompanying stories which come with the game. The game provides 6 different sequences of 9 scenes each, which are combined if played with 2-6 players. On their turn players choose a piece from the table and check whether it can be connected with the previous/starting piece of their sequence or not. If so, they can keep the piece, otherwise they has to put it back on the table. The first player to finish his sequence wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Educational, Puzzle

name: Evilution
description:
You're a mad scientist with the goal of evolving cute animals into minions in order to destroy the enemy's animals. Each creature can evolve into three different evolution trees, each with their own unique skills.

Evilution is a stand-alone card game. Each player chooses four animals to start the game with and performs actions each turn to further their position. Once you kill all the opposing creatures, you win the game.

In order to evolve your animals, you'll need to purchase evolution trees. You can earn money through sponsorships as well as completing objectives. You can also use the money to hire lab assistants and purchase equipment.

Also, every turn you'll either navigate random events or discover potions with good and bad effects. Some of your creatures may die, but that's a sacrifice you must be willing to make.

Do you have what it takes to be the best Mad Scientist? Only time will tell.

name: Street Proz
description:
Street Proz was a street football collectible card game. Each player had a deck of at least 30 player cards, each with an Offensive, Defensive, and Wild rating. Dice are rolled to determine which player from each deck is matched up, and yardage is won or lost based on these ratings.

There was also a online fantasy football league tie in at the now defunct StreetProz.com

name: Poochie Giant Card Game
description:
Poochie challenges players to a friendly game of tug-of-war. The object of play is to build the longest length of rope between Poochie and her boyfriend, Fastball. Players take turns drawing cards and placing them in a row in front of them. When a player has a Poochie card at one end and a Fastball card at the other end, she is out of play. The remaining players continue play until they have also completed their ropes and dropped out of play. The winner is the player with the most rope cards between the characters.

—description from the back of the box

name: Rats vs lion
description:
Almost-RPG wargame about Rommel campaign during the Tobruk siege.

Games focuses on view of battlefield from perspective of a firing team.
Each player controls a small squad of soldiers operating during major ww2 battle. Each soldier belongs to a specific class with unique abilities like heavy gunner, rifle man, mechanic, driver, medic and gun operator. Each unit consists of 2-4 soldiers (each unit is built around a commanding officer). Every soldier can gain a level up, making him more efficient in battle, or giving more abilities.

During players turn player issues a basic order to his troops like "advance","fall back","move to left/right flank",attack a unit. While orders can be precised to specific units and target. Way they're handled is up to units and their officers in command. During action units that suffered a casualty might flee, decide to fortify, or even advance in counterattack. Goal of the game is to gain control over battlefield by either eliminating enemy units or gaining points of interest. However, the player is operating in a small section of battlefield and has to take into account that not only units visible on the map are a threat.

Original game design was for 2 players. But solo campaign and cooperative play are also in works. Also game is prepared to take into account game masters possibilities using special set of story and event cards.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: CATCH-UP!
description: In this children's dexterity game, players use hooks on strings to move plastic fish vertically onto a tree-like structure. The player who completes the task first is the winner.

name: Monsanto Trek
description:
A Game that was published by Monsanto. On first glance it is similar to Career, but there are many differences.
It is quite possible that it was used to find executives with the right mindset, since the questions and answers use games derived from game theory, like "Bach or Stravinski". It uses cards, which give the player 4 choices. Each choice will change the possibilities for a career. Whoever gets the best answers can move forward.

From the Box :

Welcome to Monsanto Trek. This is a game of careers and career choices. Like life, this game is about solving problems, making decisions, reaping rewards and suffering consequences. There are many different paths you can take on your Monsanto Trek, just as there are many paths you can take during your Monsanto career. There is no correct path, just the one that's right for you. So choose wisely, take a few risks and have fun.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Toplshteyner: An All New Dice Game
description:
Toplshteyner (Yiddish for dice) Is a new dice game from the mind of Christopher Bush. Fun and fast paced, Toplshteyner can be played for money or just for fun.

Object of the game: To be the last man standing!


Each player starts the game with three lives. Each life is represented by an amount of money agreed upon before the start of the game (50p or 50c a life for example). If playing for fun, just exchange the money for three of anything you can get your hands on. Poker chips, matchsticks etc.



Determine who is going to roll first by each rolling a die. The highest number rolls first.



The first player rolls the dice. They will have either rolled a “point” or a “consequence”. All double rolls (1-1, 2-2, 3-3 etc.) are consequence rolls. Every other combination, except those that equal seven, acts as a point roll.



Consequence rolls have different effects on the game. See the “List of Consequences” section for full details.



If a player rolls a point, they must attempt to re-roll that point before they roll a seven. If they manage to re-roll their point, their life is safe and the dice go to the next player. If they roll a seven, they lose a life and the dice goes to the next player. Note: Seven NEVER acts as the point. If a seven is the first number rolled, the player must continue to roll the dice until a valid point or consequence has been rolled.


List of Consequences


1-1 “Snake Eyes” – Player loses a life. Valid only once per turn. If rolled first the player will lose a life then their point will be two. Rolling double one for the second time will save you a life, not cost you one.



2-2 “Saving Grace” – Players life is safe and their turn is over. Play moves on.



3-3 “Threes” – Even if a point has already been set, if 3-3 is rolled, the point is changed to six. The player must then attempt to re-roll a six before they roll a seven, but if they do so by re-rolling 3-3, ALL lives are lost and they lose the game entirely.



4-4 “Crazy Eight” – Point is set or reverted to two. The player will not lose a life by rolling 1-1. But their odds of re-rolling their point before rolling a seven have vastly decreased.



5-5 “High Fives” – Elect a player to lose a life. If rolled first it acts as both the point AND the consequence. Valid only once per turn.



6-6 “Trick Sixes” – Extra Life to a maximum of four lives. Extra lives earned can be reclaimed from the pot if the player has less than three lives. The fourth life is optional because it must come out of the players own pocket. Note: If playing for fun, the fourth life can be taken from the pot also.

name: Breakaway SportACTION Soccer Card Game
description:
"This action packed soccer card game is the next best thing to being on the field! It's a race to be the first to assemble your winner soccer team. Recruits and Substitutions are allowed. Watch out for penalty calls! Fun for the entire family!" -- From The Manufacturer

Using a card drawing mechanic, players attempt to complete their "team,"by assembling player cards for each position (of the same color). Different cards represent the different positions -- Forward, Midfield, Defensive Line, and Goalie, as well as special cards which cause different game effects, and wild cards which can replace other player cards on your "team."

name: Meepile: Box & Bits
description:
A box you say? Yes, an official box for your Meepile!
Since the first edition of Meepile did not come in a box, we decided to create one. Yes, we've created a nice little home for your beloved Meepile. Now your Meepile no longer needs to be dusted before play, and can rest snuggly on the shelf, between your other Simi Game Knights small box games.

While we are at it, we might as well add some bits. Because you can never have too many bits.

Oh, and a few cards, because there was still a little room in the box.

How about a new way to play? Because you can never have too many ways to play with your Meepile.

Bits -
Each player has a collection of 6 interestingly shaped wooden bits to place on the Meepile. Each player also is given a deck of 6 cards that represents each of their 6 wooden bits. The cards are shuffled and on a player's turn one is revealed. The player then is required to place that piece.

As usual, all pieces knocked off of the Meepile are gathered into your stockpile, so if you turn over a card and you have more than one of the matching shaped bits, you may attempt to place all of them. Work your way through the 6 cards and then shuffle and start again, until someone has placed all of his/her stockpile and wins the round.

Additional way to use these bits and cards are included in the game box.

name: Potje Duizend
description: Potje Duizend (Game of Thousand in Dutch) is a simple game of dice throwing with a calculating aspect. Every player gets a sheet with a matrix of 9 cells, divided in 3 rows of 3 cells each. On his turn a player throws 1 die and notes his result in one of the cells on his sheet. Doing this he should try to achieve a result of one thousand (or as close as possible) when making a final addition if the matrix is full (by considering each row of 3 cells as a number and adding those 3 numbers). The player closest to thousand is the winner. Attention! If one of the diagonals shows 3 same numbers, this number may be multiplied by 10 and used as a bonus to come closer to thousand.

name: Final Lunge: Typhoon at the Gates of Moscow, November 1941
description: Final Lunge depicts the German operation, Typhoon, to assault Moscow from mid-November to Dec. this was the last lunge to continue an epic event that had started in June, 1941. At one point, in early October, it actually seemed possible to reach Moscow before the winter because there was little to halt them. That chance was wasted and the weather turned against Hitler’s forces. By the time this game takes place, both sides were like mighty but weakened warriors. The German strengths on average had been reduced by 50%- a division was now only a regiment in strength. Panzer divisions were lucky to have 50 operational tanks. The Russians were no better off, they simply had more weak units to toss in the way, Weather made the fighting bitter and the Germans did not have winter clothing. Fuel and ammo Corps’ depots frequently had only enough for one division on a limited basis, not 3-4 divisions, which was the norm.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Damn You Autocorrect: The Board Game
description: Damn You Auto Correct is the game of text message madness. Players have 30 seconds to guess what the mixed up message on the card REALLY means. You won't stop laughing until someone reaches the finish line.

name: SpeakEasy a Bold Pub Game!
description:
SpeakEasy is a game where players complete social missions. Most missions involve meeting people and making new friends. Others involve competing against your friends in outrageous challenges! Missions are printed on reusable coasters, which fit right in at your local bar, cocktail party, or picnic!

SpeakEasy is so simple to play, even an inebriate could learn! Here are the rules:

1. Draw a coaster. Read the mission out loud to the group.
2. Assign the mission to another player.
3. That player has 3 minutes to complete the mission.
4. If they succeed, they win the coaster. If they fail (or refuse!), you win it.
5. The first player to collect 5 coasters wins!

SpeakEasy has over 25 missions. Each one is designed to stretch your social circle, and introduce you to new people! Here are some samples:

name: Sheep Soccer
description:
The Golden Fleece Cup is the most coveted championship in the world of sheep soccer. Players take the roles of the two teams who've made it to the championship game. The rules of sheep soccer are vastly different than the game played by humans. So, players will need to strategically place their sheep throughout the board as they jump, nudge, kick, and block the ball as they try score.

Sheep Soccer is a strategy game for two where players use their three sheep pawns to try and score three goals before their opponent.

name: Relic Knights: One Shot
description:
One Shot is aptly named. It is said her relic's massive Goliath Cannon can bring down a starship. It is a theory that few enemy commanders are willing to test. One Shot combines her devastating fire power with an unmatched skill commanding her troops, guiding their fire into the enemy ranks with surgical precision.

Gifted with rare and mighty gifts, Relic Knights are the ultimate leaders for your cadres. More than just powerful game pieces, these stunning models are beautiful centerpieces for your miniature collection!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Relic Knights: Sophia Drake
description: Sophia Drake grew up among the mercenaries of the Galactic Merchants' Guild, so it was no surprise that she would join Black Diamond as soon as she was of age. Now she commands Black Diamond's elite heavy infantry division, the Black Dragons, and seeks to restore Black Diamond and GAMA to its former glory.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Magic Jinn
description:
Magic Jinn knows what you're thinking!

Take an animal in mind and answer Magic Jinn's questions. Will he guess the right animal? Then he wins the game! But can you fool with Magic Jinn and be the smartest around the table? Then you'll be the winner of this game!

name: Rubber Road
description: Rubber Road is a connection game which uses rubber bands as the game pieces. The object of the game is to continuously connect opposing sides, while your opponent tries to do the same in the perpendicular direction. Opposing color rubber bands may not overlap. The best games are those with simple rules, but deep and complex strategies. Anyone can learn to play Rubber Road in 2 minutes, but mastering it will take a lifetime.

name: Relic Knights: Kisa & Scratch
description:
Where Kisa goes, bad luck is sure to follow. Cursed to an insatiable curiosity and mercurial nature, Kisa always struggled within the rigid confines of the Doctrine Academies. The appearance of Scratch, her cypher, gave her the freedom to explore the universe and uncover all of its many mysteries.

Gifted with rare and mighty gifts, Relic Knights are the ultimate leaders for your cadres. More than just powerful game pieces, these stunning models are beautiful centerpieces for your miniature collection!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Relic Knights: Kasaro To
description:
Kasaro To, The Beloved of Nozuki, is Dragon Fleet To's slave master. Through his serpent's cunning the slave pens of Dragon Fleet To are the envy of all. His reputation, even outside the Noh Empire, is infamous and his name has become a byword for the depredations of the Noh species.

Gifted with rare and mighty gifts, Relic Knights are the ultimate leaders for your cadres. More than just powerful game pieces, these stunning models are beautiful centerpieces for your miniature collection!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Highland Game
description:
Object of the game is to be the first to get 1 figure to the opposite end of the board.

One player controls 4 miniatures, the other player controls 1.

The single figure can move forwards, backwards, sideways but not diagonally. And only 1 space at a time. The opposing player can only move forwards, one piece at a time. No jumping and no capturing.

The winner is the first to reach the opposite site end.

name: Toy Story: The adventure game
description:
The adventure game based on the film
Through luck with the die and skillful challenges with Buzz and Woody you want to be the first to reach the removal van on one of the target squares.
On players turn, he rolls a die and moves along a path to reach the target the van.
There are a number of action fields of the kind:

Van moves to a further away target field
Additional turn
Take the long way.
Challenge: Duel with one other player using special Cards. Winner moves 3 fields.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zero Agents
description:
With the rise of a powerful yet mysterious Shadow Organization, several countries send out their own Zero Agents to investigate. Upon hearing that this organization has already gathered dangerous intel, the Zero Agents must infiltrate the enemy HQ and quickly hack into their systems and recover the master plans.

As a Zero Agent, your other objective is to ensure you have more intel than the others in order to give your Country the advantage in the overall power struggle for leadership.

Will you accept this mission?

Zero Agents is a fast paced, tile-based miniatures game that utilizes dice and card strategy. The game requires your agent to hack computers that randomly appear, while fending off guards that continue to spawn in response to player dice rolls. Your goal is to get as much intel through hacking and stealing from other players as possible. Once the guards sound the alarm, there is a mad dash to the extraction point before the enemy base is overrun by guards!

name: Bible Master
description:
If you are not familiar with the Bible Master card game, it is an easy to learn card game designed to challenge your knowledge of Scripture.

Players win verse cards by filling in the blanks with word cards like the ones below. Action cards keep the game challenging with wild cards, skips and more! The winner is the player with the most verse cards at the end of the game.

Our first version “Salvation” includes Bible verses focused on the Gospel. As your family plays, you are reinforcing Scripture memory in a fun yet challenging way.

There are 12 verse cards, 14 action cards and 28 word cards in the 54 card deck.

Why the Salvation theme?

1 Peter 3:15 says, "But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:"

Through testing the game play I learned that there are some Christians who have been Christians for years that don't know some of the foundational scriptures used in this game.

My goal is to help players of all ages be ready to share the hope of the Gospel by helping them memorize scriptures that will allow them to share their faith with confidence.

The initial production run will be in the King James version. Though others may be available in the future.

name: Crate Packing Simulator 2015
description:
Welcome to Loot Crate's first original board game! The goal is simple: be the first player to have all 5 items in your crate!

This is a roll and move game. As the players move around the board, they can land on spaces to allow them to get a piece of loot, or challenge another player to a duel using rock, paper, scissors dice! The first player to get each of the five types of loot in their crate wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: Noteworthy
description:
Noteworthy is a card game that teaches "ear training" by prompting players to race to arrange cards with musical notes on them while listening to a melody played by the Noteworthy Game app.

The fastest players to arrange their scores get bonuses before scoring points based on the accuracy of the notes and timing of the melody. The player with the highest score wins!

Each card has a single note (A-G) that can be modified in length based on how cards overlap each other (including cards that mark rests in the music). The arrangement of these cards represents the melody that players are trying to perfectly match.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Math, Music, Party Game, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Singing

name: Noonka Bored 4D game board
description:
This game board is a 4D HYPERCUBE or TESSERACT with four inch sides, projected onto 2D space. On this game board all coordinates are in units and chess pieces (zees) are used as game pieces. The first number in each coordinate is how far from the game board Origin (0000) in the X direction (right/left), the 2nd number is how far from 0000 in the Y direction (diagonally upward); the 3rd is how far in the Z direction (up/down); the 4th how far in the T direction (diagonally downward). Point 4204, for example, is 4 units in the X direction, 2 units in the Y direction, 0 units in the Z direction, and 4 units in the T direction (from 0000). There is every 4 digit combination of 0, 1, and 2 making an 81 coordinate grid (3^4 = 81). Other “Noonka Boreds” are 4", 6” and 8” sided Tesseracts where coordinates are 4 digit combinations of 0,2 & 4, 0, 3 & 6, and 1, 4 & 8 respectively.

Zees are arranged on the grid of this game board to play variant forms of games such as Checkers, Chess, and Solitaire with up to 8 players; however the board is very versatile in that many games can be played with modifications and enough different styles of zees. Role playing games can be played in 3D space with 3 different time periods. There are enough zees with each basic game board to play 8 player 4D Checkers (or 4 player 4D Chess). JetEyes are caps placed onto the zees to indicate an increased status including moving forward and backwards rather than just forwards around the 4D grid board. A jetEyed Pawn is a King.

Games can take between 15 minutes and 3 hours depending on the game, number of players, and their experience levels. There are many ways to modify the games so that it takes more or less time, or to accommodate different experience levels. Note: the game has an abstract feel to it that appeals more to the math-geek. The beauty in the board is that it helps you visualize four dimensional space-time. Think of the grid as a 3D cube on a time-line, with 3D cubes at T=0, T=2 (red cube), and T=4. There are also 3D cubes where Y=0, Y=2 (green cube) and Y=4, Z=0, Z=2 (blue cube) and Z=4, and X=0, X=2 (brown, light blue, or yellow cube on website and poster sized boards), and X=4. In fact, because there are midpoints on each of the cubes, there are also 96 smaller 3D cubes on this board. You get so caught up in the geometry and numbers that time passes and you are “Never Bored” (Noonka is Spanish for “Never” (misspelled from “nunca”))!

name: Haulomancy
description:
Haulomancy is set in a Fantasy Steampunk world full of cogs, crystals, and currency. The Grand Wizard Council has just allowed the construction of a permanent transportation network, asking each race to send their best Hauler to pioneer this feat. You are that Hauler. Build Track. Upgrade Transport. Avoid Sabotage. Welcome, to the world of Haulomancy.

In Haulomancy, Haulers are tasked with putting in place a system of rails that connect the worlds major cities together, allowing for faster trade between the nations. To do this players will physically draw track on the board between points, with cost increasing with distance drawn. Haulers will also take to steel, skies, or seas in order to deliver goods to keep their coffers fat and their empire afloat.

To secure the final round, Haulers must have a rail network that connects to the major cities, as well as having fully paid off a steep loan from the Goblin Bank. One final round is played, and the richest Hauler wins.

name: Swipe it!: Take what's yours...
description:
In this exciting, fast paced card game, players are competing against each other to acquire as many cards from their opponents as possible! Some cards are worth more than others though, so be strategic about which cards you decide to “Swipe” from your foes!

The game is played in rounds, and in one single round only four "Master Points" are available for players to win, either splitting the points between the players, or one player winning them all. Rounds continue until a single player reaches five Master Points, in which they win the game. The four Master Points in any given round consist of the following: 1) Master Number Point 2) Master Color Point 3) Master Shape Point and 4) Master Total Point.

The game starts out with the dealer revealing the "Master Card" for that round (which is a Power Card that gets placed in the center of the playing field). The Master Card will have a number (1-10), a color (red,blue,purple,green), and a shape (X,O). Whatever the elements might be are what dictate the four ways to earn the "Master Points" in that round. For example: If the dealer reveals the Master Card that has the number 7, the color red, and the shape X, then players must steal cards from each other that have any of those elements (7s, reds, X's) and always high numbered cards. At the end of a round, players will reveal to each other all of the cards they have acquired throughout the round. In this example, the player who acquired the most cards with the number 7 wins the Master Number Point, the player who acquired the most cards with the color red wins the Master Color Point, the player who acquired the most cards with the shape X wins the Master Shape Point, and the player who acquired the highest sum after adding up the numbers on all acquired cards wins the Master Total Point.

There are only two main types of cards in Swipe it!™ There are the Power Cards (cards with a number, a color, and a shape; one of these cards gets promoted to master card at the beginning of the round) and then there are the Swipe Cards which have an "S" and a swipe arrow . Players need to combine one of each type of cards in order to initiate an attack against another player. Players can only acquire Power Cards from each other in order to gain points, where Swipe Cards simply allow the player's Power Cards to make an attack. In Swipe it!™ a combined pair (a Power Card combined with a Swipe Card) can always freely attack a lower numbered Power Card or enemy pair. Example: a 10 on a Black Swipe Card can freely attack an opponent's 9 on a Black Swipe Card). Now the intensity rises when you are using a combined pair to attack a higher numbered Power Card or enemy pair. This is where the dice and rock-paper-scissors comes into effect, where essentially the attacker is wagering their lower numbered Power Card in a series of battles against their opponent's higher numbered Power Card. If the attacker loses, their opponent acquires the attacker's Power Card in play. This is especially huge when the attacker is risking their Power Card that happens to match the "Master Number", "Master Color", "Master Shape", or is a high numbered card like a 9 or 10. On the other hand, if the attacker is wagering a Power Card that is low like the number 1 and does not match any of the Master Point categories, then who cares if they lose to their enemy right? The attacker may as well take the risk with that type of card in order try and win a great one.

There are also three different types of Swipe Cards (Black, Silver, and Gold) each one offering unique abilities; such as the Gold Swipe Card raising your Power card by +2 when it is attacking and by +1 when on defense, or the Silver Swipe Card granting the ability to "Punish" another player's Swipe Card, or being able to "Reassign" a combined pair with a different Power card (if you had a 1 combined with Silver Swipe Card, you can switch it to lets say a 10 on the Silver Swipe Card allowing you to attack higher numbered enemy cards for free). There are also some special rules too, such as "merge", "master merge", and "cash-in" which can help players out of some sticky situations. A "merge" allows you to combine two Power Cards that share the same number (such as combining a 9 with another 9), forcing the combined cards to act as if it were a Black Swipe card, giving you the ability to combine a third Power Card to it to make an attack. "Master merge" is the same as a "merge" with the exception that the combined cards match the "Master Number" in play, forcing them to act as if it were a Gold Swipe Card. Lastly, the "cash-in" action allows a player to discard two alike Swipe Cards (such as discarding two Black Swipe Cards) to receive one new card from the dealer. This action can only be done once per turn, so if you were hoping for a particular card, you will not be able to cash in another pair of Swipe Cards until the dealer makes its way around to you again.

The round ends once the dealer has dealt the last card, and the player dealt the last card takes their final turn. All players discard any remaining face up cards. They then flip over all acquired face down cards and determine the winners of the 4 Master Points for the round in this order; Master Number, Master Color, Master Shape, Master Total.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: The Nobles: Kickstarter Exclusive – The Ranger
description:
The Ranger is a new character the designer decided to add as a bonus for all those people helping to get The Nobles funded on Kickstarter.

She comes with two new playing cards, a new player mat, and of course her game piece. For those who backed at The Lord level, she will come as an upgraded miniature.

name: X-Wind
description:
Players in this game compete to be the first to collect the 6 cards depicting the 6 pieces of the Armor of God. The first person to collect all 6 cards and discard all other cards from his hand wins.

The players start with 3 cards each. On their turn, they draw a card from the draw pile and decide to either keep the card or play it. The rules do not mention a hand limit but logically a hand limit of 6 should be applied. Otherwise there is no way to win the game.

Cards can be pieces of the Armor of God, or action cards. Action cards include :

Drop 1 and Reverse - the targeted player needs to discard 1 piece of the Armor of God failing which they will miss a turn. Then the direction of play is reversed.
Drop 2 and Reverse - Similar to Drop 1 and Reverse except 2 cards need to be discarded.
Jumper - This card can be played at any time and takes precedence over all other cards. Play jumps back to the player who played the card.
Skip - This skips the next player's turn.
Little Angel - This counters the Drop 1 and 2 cards.

name: Rats!
description:
In this fast paced family card game, you must get your rats from the dirty bilges of the lower decks to the life rafts on the upper levels of the ship! Race the rising flood waters and other rats to the top. But beware! Your opponents will try anything to slow your progress and beat you out!

Rats! is all about friendly competitive play. You and your family will have hours of fun leading your rats to safety. Use well placed cheese and holes to stop and slow your opponents down before they do the same to you!

In Rats! players have three moves to move their rats from room to room. Cards players gain can increase the number of moves they have and also can be played on other players to slow them down. Rats can only go up a level when they find a ladder after exploring the doomed ship.

After each round of play, each player rolls a die to determine if they can flood the ship. Each flooded space is removed from play, along with any rats trapped inside.

To score points, players must escape the five levels of the ship to safety. The player with the highest score wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Third Eye
description:
The darkness spread all around the chamber with the quiet howling in the background. There was a spectral sensation in the room, dark and ominous. Don’t get spooked though and sit around the mystic board in a vain hope to catch the spirit... Before it will manage to catch you.
Third Eye is the truly terrifying hybrid card game of cutthroat decisions, quick wit and brutal interactions. Be the last one to survive a haunting from beyond and never hesitate to lead the malignant presence towards other, unfortunate souls!

name: Trivial Gay
description: The game contains 140 questions, which can be answered by the players. It also contains 10 activity cards with a variety of tasks to be carried out. It basically works like a travel edition of the game Trivial Pursuit.

name: Soccer World Cup
description: Players decide either to set a time limit for the game, or to stop the game when one player has scored a pre-set number of goals (a target of 3 is recommended). Each player flicks the spinner three times and the one who 'scores' the most goals kicks off the game. The ball is placed at the centre of the board on a member of the team who will start the game. The player can move any one piece on his team (except the man who has possession) at the start of each turn, one or two sections in any direction on the board, to 'cover' the ball. Then he uses the spinner and follows the instructions, moving towards his opponents goal. The goalkeeper cannot move out of his box (which consists of six sections).

name: Gods of Adventure
description:
In Gods of Adventure players take on the roles of classical Gods who together influence the motivations and emotions of a group of eight fantasy adventurers, slaying creatures and overcoming obstacles. However, unlike many Richard Launius games, Gods of Adventure is not a coop.

The game plays either 3 or 4 players. Every God's (player) deck is identical except for color and another small but important detail: the spoken words on the cards for each hero (divided by color) are all different, reflecting your temperament based on the God you are playing. Each player will have a unique power associated with your temperament. The four temperaments are associated with Greed, Good Fortune, Aggression, and Deceit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Hunters: Enter the Darkness
description:
Hunters: Enter the Darkness is a team based, player-vs-player, tactical board game that allows the greatest minds to draft characters, then battle it out in different modes of play like the lane pushing "Assault" Mode or the all out brawl that is the "Arena" Mode.

As games progress, players will earn money to upgrade their characters dashboard with new equipment, skills and feats, all unique to that character, allowing for different builds and tactics with each champion and team!

Only the strongest and smartest champions will prevail, hunter or the hunted? That's up to you as these epic battles unfold!

Hunters: Enter the Darkness features:
- Incredible Miniatures
- Action Point turn system
- Unique development of your character
- Modular Boards
- Custom die for the combat
- Mechanics of popular MOBA video games like DOTA, DOTA 2, League of Legends and Heroes of the Storm

name: Hotel Manager
description:
Two Hotel Managers are struggling for reaching the Budget: selling 15 rooms!

Will you manage? Or Overbooking or Bugs will stop your sellling?

A fast pace card game for two-four players (but expandable!), 10 minutes of play, starting from 8 years.

Each player gets a room counter and puts it at 0.

Each player gets 2 cards.

Each turn a player may:

play a ROOM(s) card and score the relative value (1 or 2) adding it to the room counter;
discard one card and take a new one from the deck;
resolve a Problem as per indications (e.g. decrease rooms)
play a Problem card against the other player;
play a Solution card and discard with solved Problem;
play the Jolly as soon as a Problem is played against him and play the second card as well, then play again.


At the end of its turn, each player must hold two cards. Reshuffle the deck when necessary with the played cards.
A player wins at 15 rooms sold.

Italian description:
Due Direttori di Hotel si sfidano per il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di budget: vendere 15 camere!

Chi ci riuscirà per primo? L'Overbooking fermerà le vendite? Oppure le soluzioni trovate spianeranno la strada alla vittoria?

Un veloce gioco per due-quattro giocatori (ma espandibile!), durata 10 minuti, dai 10 anni.

Ogni giocatore riceve due carte e può nel suo turno scartare una carta Camera ed aumentare così il numero di camere vendute (il primo che arriva a 15 vince!), oppure scartare un Problema all'avversario, che non potrà vendere camere fino a quando non scarterà una Soluzione o un Jolly oppure scartare una Soluzione per risolvere il Problema che lo blocca. Alla fine di ogni giocata ogni giocatore deve avere due carte in mano.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Desafio Carioca
description:
Desafio Carioca is a racing board game that tests your knowledge about the city of Rio de Janeiro.

On the board you can see 20 tourist attractions; 10 beaches and 6 neighborhoods in Rio (Tijuca, Barra, Centro e Zonas Sul, Norte e Oeste). During the race you'll have to answer questions on 6 different themes: Samba; Favelas; Sports and Health; Amusement and Art; Places; and Historic Facts.

During your race throughout the city you may be stuck in traffic or choose to get the subway to go faster. The goal is to visit 3 major tourist attraction, 1 beach and arrive first at your destination!

name: Ladybug Dice Game
description: Ladybugs eat aphids, be the first player to roll the dice and eat 5,000 aphids for victory. Eat fast and win!

name: Chaos Stone
description:
From the designer:

Chaos Stone the Board Game is a game inspired by the hit-classic, Nexus Ops, this is a first ambitious attempt by a rising designer in the scene, Calixtus Ashley Wee, with aid gained from his friend and first employee, Matthew Zhao. One of the core differences from the game of its homage, is the main issue of having entirely symmetrical playable factions remade into asymmetrical ones. The four factions in the game are fighting for control of the large deposits of Chaos Stones, the namesake of the game, in a moon at the centre of the galaxy.

Each have different methods of engaging the enemy, with The Civilisation of Humanity boasting superior technology and the ability to promote your ordinary troops into higher elite ranks, maintaining its theme of being focussed on defence, as reflected in its regard for the maintenance of the precious lives of humans, as part of the enlightened doctrine that represents the utopian ideas of this advanced Civilisation of the future.

The second faction in the line-up is The Animagusi Coven, a very powerful sect of spellcasters who are adept at wielding magical powers, for which they use the potent concentrate of energy held within the Chaos Stones as fuel for these spells, to commit feats that even the Science of the technologically advanced Humans can barely achieve, for which they have resided in secret within the laws of their society, hidden from knowledge. They are arguably the most interesting of the factions to play, not to mention challenging and the most complex, given your need to manage two decks consisting of either Energetic State Cards, that determine the success rate of spells, or Magical Element Cards, for which are used in combinations in order to synthesise the various magical spells that form their arsenal, to destroy the enemy. Biologically speaking though, they are just a different group of humans with separate goals, but the focus of all factions is eventually the seizing of complete control of the moon that contains these precious Chaos Stones. The Animagusi actually take their names from the shapeshifting powers of their original members, able to transform into different animal forms.

The third faction in this sequence is called The Evolved Bionids. As the name suggests, they have characteristics that puts them in similar categories to the Zerg of StarCraft, or the Tyranids of Warhammer 40,000. They are a very interesting race that is focussed on the macromanagement aspects of a board game, centrally about managing your economy to produce and upgrade your Strains in huge and various amounts, and have the most diversified and myriad of all unit choices, given each Base Strain can be mutated into two Divergent Strains, with distinct and separate utility between their abilities, although you are not restricted from morphing both. The Bionids in fact have management of a secondary resource, as an emphasis of their distinct playstyle focussed around fuelling the pump of this living engine of war, to outproduce and overrun by sheer production of numbers.

The fourth and last, although designed second in order, is The Great Rhuds, the natural residents of this moon that is being contested over. And this moon, which we can call the Lunalode, is prized over precisely because of the presence of its great wealth of Chaos Stones. These powerful objects have a close symbiotic relationship with the Rhuds, in fact the cause for their sentience in the first place. Being rather primitive and unevolved compared to the other sentient beings in the galaxy, they make up for their lack of formidable technology by relying on the Chaos Stones for power, so in comparison to all other factions, they are the ones to utilise the power of the Chaos Stones most directly and efficiently, and depend on them as a technology to engage on par with the other races, for nearly all their weaponry and warfare. A large focus on the Rhuds, or The Great Rhuds as they refer to themselves, since they are arguably the least advanced, they have a reliance on cheap and numerous troops, the usage of speed and mobility through interconnecting tunnels they can create throughout the board, and the potent yet risky power they harness, presented by Chaos Stone Tech Weapons. The sheer power of the Chaos Stones, of which among the four factions, The Great Rhuds are the only ones to tap most directly into with raw effect, and access its potential in the way that it can ultimately or best achieve, make them the most able users of that particular technology.

If you read the categories and mechanics that the game falls under, you will realise it is an ambitious synthesis of many elements, some inspired and taken from other board games, into a complex and elegant whole. How the factions almost have their own mini-game within the mechanics of how they play, and the focus of each separate mechanic makes for very different playing experiences, and differing tactical and strategic approaches to winning the game.

Above all else, to know how the game is like, it is best experienced and played. It is my belief you will enjoy it, and with your support, you can expect the possibility for three expansions already planned.

name: Borneo (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Canary Islands (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Game of the Visit of Santa Claus
description:
Typical and simple spin and move race game. The first player, who cross all the road first, wins the game. There is "gift" cards, which players collected as they played the game.

Based on the famous poem "A Visit From St. Nicholas," first published anonymously in 1823, which inspired countless illustrations and spin-off goods for sale.

name: Tabletop Dungeon
description:
From the introduction:

The Heroes are trapped in the monster infested, ever changing, dungeon of the Lich King! They must find the exit and escape before the Lich King summons an undefeatable Dragon to kill them all!

User comments:

Bulk of document consists of print-and-play components, primarily paper maps to construct the dungeon and paper counters representing the players and various monsters. Game play consists of placing character tokens on a starting map, surviving combats and collecting treasure, and then moving into new areas looking for the dungeon exit. Game provides four character "types" (Wizard, Archer, Barbarian, Knight) and three monster "types" (Orc, Goblin, Dragon).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simulation

name: The OutWorlds Revelations (fan expansion to Ophidian 2350)
description:
The OutWorld Revelations is a 140-card expansion set and has as his main theme some characters from the OutWorlds. The set is based in the Fallen from Grace Fan Fiction, the Grakkan's Union & Grakkan’s Union Revised Fan Fiction and various official Storylines that took place in the OutWorlds region. The set also brings more Ophidian League Gladiators that weren’t part of any Fiction, but are showcased on the Ophidian League Bios on the Main site.

The OutWorld Revelations also features 2 New Card Types:

Managers
This card type works like the Reinforcements, but they will have 0VP, and may be played at the beginning of the first wave. The Managers have Life, Rage & ADMG values, but they mostly do not interfere in the Wave. Their special abilities may change the nº of cards in the hand, the nº of CP, and other skills, like giving some additional abilities for the Team of the manager (for Teams see above).

Sponsors Cards

You may play 1 Sponsor at the start of the game, after playing your Gladiators. This card is not part of your deck, and cannot be discarded, nor placed out of play. Some sponsors will override the standard rules of CP, VP, Cheer, Hand Sizes, Bonus Cards, and Victory Conditions.

And a brand new Mechanism:

Team affiliation

Some Gladiators cards will include a new keyword that will indicate that they belong to a Gladiator Team. Example: The Gladiators Freakshow, Striking Dragon, Ryla & PK have the keyword indicating that they belong to the Team Machine, as seem in The Saga showcased in the Main site.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck Construction, Player Elimination

name: Transylvania (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game with a vampire theme and the option to visit Dracula's castle. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes (detailed in coffins instead of rail spaces)and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop). You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for the latter. Engines are wild cards but only for the central red and black routes.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Secret Santa: Mrs Claus
description: This is a free promotional card that expands the game Secret Santa. Its power is the game is either the same as that of an elf, or to trump Santa Claus.

description:
