categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Eternal War of the Candy Realms!
description:
A candy themed card battling game, where players compete to win real piles of sweet loot!

I noticed that there aren't a lot of games that both kids and adults would want to play. Either games skew too young, and parents get bored... or the games engage only adults and are way too complex for a child. So this one has a lot of references aimed at the 20-40 year age range, but is totally family-appropriate for most kids 8 and over!

The gimmick is that each player brings a pile of real sweets (or a candy substitute of your choosing) to fuel their warriors in battle against each other, with a "Land Card" mechanism that keeps it from becoming "pay-to-win". Its perfect for gatherings with a lot of snacks, or for the holidays when there are lots of sweets to be divided up!

Why would you want to win a giant pile of candy? Candy is awesome! Who doesn't want first dibs on a giant pile of candy!? Plus, you can share it with your friends and family, silly!

name: Gogglebox TV Trivia Board Game
description: Gogglebox is a fun-packed TV trivia board game based on the BAFTA winning observational documentary series. Gogglebox can be played by up to four players or in teams. Each starting on the nearest ‘Start’ space to them the players must successfully negotiate their way around the coloured squares on the board answering TV trivia, ad break questions as well as questions on the Goggleboxers themselves to try and win Gogglebox tokens. Each player takes it in turn to roll the die and move onto the appropriate space, different colour spaces represent different types of question or activity. Landing on a yellow space can mean having to return some of your Gogglebox tokens or steal some extra ones! The TV Trivia includes questions such as ‘Who called the Queen a ‘top bird’? and ‘Name the island where Father Ted is set’. The Gogglebox space means it’s a multiple choice question on the Goggleboxers themselves! This fun-packed game is perfect for after dinner entertaining or just for playing with friends and fans of the show. It is certainly guaranteed to test your TV trivia knowledge!

name: Werk in Uitvoering
description:
English:
This designing of this game was commissioned by the Dutch "Rijksgebouwendienst" (government building service). It is an attempt to make the changing in their organizational structure more transparent through a boardgame. During the game, player collect points by completing projects en cooperatively realizing the construction of a building. Completing projects is accomplished by negotiating with other players for the right "people". The game contains 6 types of people, each with their own special skills, represented by game chips.

Note: The game was published in order of a department of the Dutch government and was therefore only published in Dutch.

Dutch:
Dit spel is ontworpen in opdracht van de Rijksgebouwendienst. Het is een poging om het het kantelen van haar organisatie inzichtelijk maken middels een bordspel. In het spel moeten de spelers punten verdienen door projecten uit te voeren én gezamenlijk een gebouw te realiseren. Het uitvoeren van een project gebeurt door te onderhandelen met de andere spelers over de juiste mensen die moeten worden ingezet. Het spel bevat 6 type mensen, met verschillende capaciteiten, vertegenwoordigd door spel fiches.

name: Magnomania
description:
Magnomania was developed and produced for Magnus Management Consultancy (since 2009 called Eurogroup Consulting) by Identity Games International B.V., Rotterdam, the Netherlands.

From the front of the manual:
It's amazing what you can accomplish if you don't mind who gets the credit.

From the back of the manual:
Magnomania (some higlights):

You are an entrepreneur for Magnus
Establish your consultants in as many countries as possible
Try to get 'In Business' with your projects
Plan your strategy and make smart choices
Collect the points you need to win Magnomania


From the first page of the rules:
In this game you'll take part in Magnus' worldwide expansion.
Are you the sharpest entrepreneur? Will you be the first one to achieve your goal?
Consider your investment decisions carefully, execute takeovers, and make sure you get the biggest share of the market.
Play Magnomania, plan, decide, and win!

Quick game overview:
As a player of Magnomania, you are a Magnus entrepreneur. You travel as an entrepreneur around the gameboard and try to be the first to earn the required number of points in order win. You earn points by taking the biggest market share on a given continent and being 'In Business' internationally. As soon as an entrepreneur (pawn) arrives in a country he can begin a consultancy project. You indicate the stages of your project by a consultant (disc). When a project is completed, you as the entrepreneur are 'In Business' in that country.

name: SamenSpel
description:
The Dutch word samenspel has the meaning of: working together towards a common goal. A bit odd, considering that samen means together, but spel means game, not work.

The game was published in 1987 and given to employees of the AZU (Het Academisch Ziekenhuis Utrecht or the Academic Hospital in Utrecht, the Netherlands) as a Christmas / New Years gift.

In 1989 the AZU, part of the Universiteit van Utrecht (University of Utrecht) moved to a new building. The construction of that building started in 1981 and in 1986 the first preparation were made towards the movement, which required all patients to be moved in only two days.

This game was published in 1987 and given as a Christmas / New Years gift to the employees. The name of the game (SamenSpel, working together) is a reference to the effort of the individual employees to make the moving a success.

SamenSpel is a game about collecting pieces of illustrations related to the hospital and the moving to a new building. This is done by moving a pawn on a board one step in any one direction (somewhat like a rook in chess) and taking the piece (one quarter of the full image) from the board.

The game has one pawn, one gameboard and 12 complete images (each to be divided into four segments) but no dice. The pieces are shuffled and randomly distributed over the board, putting two pieces on each area of the board, the board has 25 spaces (the center space has no image). Whoever collects the compete images first, wins the game. When moving the pawn back to the center space, a player can "claim" a segment of an image of another player, provided he/she already owns at least one segment himself/herself.
publishers: Ned Strongin Creative Service, Nova Carta BV

name: Justitie Keten spel
description:
Subtitle:

"The weakest link determines the strength of the chain"

Description:

This game was made in cooperation between the Dutch Justice Department and Identity Games. It represents the chain (the Dutch word "keten" means "chain") of organizations and how the inter operate with each other to get criminals convicted.

Naturally, it is a simplification of reality. It only has the main portion of the process to show the general working.

The game was published in order to help the general public understand the working of the Dutch Justice Department better.

Apart from a custom playing board, there fifty-five "strategy" cards and fifty-five "question and answer" cards, a custom six-sided die and twenty pawns.

The pawns are in four colors, one for each player. Each color has five symbols, representing the five "chains" in the game, namely (1) civil law, (2) juvenile law (sub-divided into youth civil law and juvenile criminal law), (3) criminal law, (4) administrative law and (5) immigration law.

The fifty-five "strategy" cards are similar to "Chance" cards in the Monopoly game, they are "events", things that happen either in favor of the current player or in favor of other players.

The fifty-five "question and answer" cards are used in a Trivial Pursuit style. Every throw the player is asked a question on one of the cards. If the answer is correct they may move the pawn (according to the number on the die) and choose to throw again. If the answer is incorrect, they ends their turn.

The single six-sided die has only three possibilities. There are three sides with a single dot, two sides with two dots and one side with a capital "S" on it. If the player throws either a single dot or two dots, he / she has to answer a question. When the player throws the "S", he or she gets to draw a "strategy" card.

The main target of the game is to educate people about the working of the Dutch Justice Department. The way to win the game, is to have your five pawns move along their respective paths and complete each of the tracks first.

name: Punched!
description:
The years’ 1965 and you’ve just gotten a job in one of those brand new “Data Centers”. Your job is to feed endless piles of punch cards into different computers and tally the results. Problem is, you kinda all overstated your experience with these machines and you don’t really know what you’re doing.
You and your colleagues will feed the computers with punch cards and hope that everything goes well and that no computers jam and overheat!
Who knows, maybe you’ll get to be the supervisor!

Gameplay:

Players get number cards.
With these cards, they need to combine these to form equations (addition, subtractions, divisions) or to form whole numbers.

Then they get to enter these values in one of the computers, in various bases (base 2, base 3, prime numbers, tec...)

For each values that match. the player puts one of his cubes in the column, to gain majority and points.

The player with the most points wins and becomes the supervisor.

name: Isle of Man (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city:others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. There are tunnels, ferries,flights and a mountain railway.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - these are in the hands of the Gods. Thus there are God cards but also Goblin cards!

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Backup Storage War: Exagrid Vs. EMC Data Domain
description: Very simple roll and move game that while you play tries to convince you that Exagrid's backup solution is better than EMC's.

name: Breakthrough! The Bible Board Game
description:
Object:
Travel through various biblical eras (primeval history to early Christianity) answering questions about people of the Bible that address the who, where, when, what, how, and why of their places in salvation history. Players determine length of time and game play by choosing from any of the designated starting and stopping points on the board--the Garden of Eden, Egypt, the Promised Land, the Temple--with New Jerusalem as the final destination. The team or individual that collects the most character cards wins the game. Board game includes a free Bible!

This game is designed to be played two different ways:

Learn-as-you-play:
If you're new to the Bible, the learn-as-you-play mode will help you get acquainted with Breakthrough! The Bible for Young Catholics and all the wonderful stories, characters, and lessons it holds. When faced with questions, you'll be free to look up the answers in the Bible.

Test-your-knowledge:
If you're more experienced, you'll be able to test what you know about the Bible by answering the questions from memory with the test-your-knowledge mode of play.

name: Friendship Island
description:
This game focuses on making friends, being a good friend, and resolving disagreements in a win-win way. The game is designed so that players cooperate and help each other as well as answer questions about friendship to win points for themselves. The game also helps shy and socially delayed students explore friendship issues. Features two different games that use the same board but have separate questions. The second game involves more strategy, harder questions, more advanced vocabulary, and more opportunities for negotiation.

A “Teachers Guide” with complete lesson plans for both versions of the game is included. Students practice reading skills (reading the cards) and math skills (handling the point certificates). Students are challenged to use critical thinking in answering questions and in forming their strategies for playing the game. During the post-game discussion students link their experience in the game with real life.

Includes game board, six game tokens, one die, Making-a-Friend cards, Good Times cards, Solving Problems cards, and instructions
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Winnie-the-Pooh (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

The board does not have any grey tracks. Each paw-print track can be used by each player.

There are some new options in the rules: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn, and you can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: West Country (UK) (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - colour choice and parallel routes are in the hands of the Gods. Thus there are God cards to help you.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: When Europe Raped Africa
description:
At the start of the 19th century, the exploration and exploitation of the African continent began in earnest. During this deplorable period in world history, the major European powers — Britain, Holland and France — would mercilessly explore, colonize and fight over its many resources for a hundred years. Naturally, native populations would come to resent and rebel against their foreign exploiters and seek independence, and so it is in this swift-playing game for two, where you emulate a European nation and compete for a continent.

Players get a hand of cards in four types: Explore, Colonize, Exploit and Conflict. Some cards are restricted to a region, others to a single area. Exploration leads to colonization, which leads to exploitation, and sometimes to a conflict between the rival powers. Hand management and timely card play is important in this game.

If more colonists arrive in an area than it will accept, a native uprising will occur. The roll of a die and simple charts settle uprisings (and conflicts) quickly. Choosing the right time to initiate negative action against your opponent can be crucial.

name: Crazy Brother
description:
There are many sudden events we never consider possible that could happen to us. There are as well many realities that we ignore or perceive far away from us. But this is not how life works, and in this game you are going to discover it.
Moving to another city it's always a big change – to someone it can be more stressful than to others. You, as part of the Fonte family, are going to face events that will change your life.
Living a quite normal, if not lucky, life, Eric is a model student. Member of the football and the astronomy club, Eric is going to start college soon after family relocation in Arlington.
Looking at him and his sister Emily, it seems it's her who is going to have the most problems, moving during high school and leaving all her friends. Everyone has great expectations out of him, but then again nobody knows what can happen.
Many unexpected things will happen along the way, and only standing together and focusing on Eric's wellbeing you will all be able to reach the final goal: start a new life again in where Eric’s disturb will be accepted and lived with, giving you a new vision of life.
Together with the other family's member you'll help Eric to go through the discovery of his own schizophrenia, watching him and all of you react and adapt to the situation.
It's not a simple task, but life never is.
Put to test your family relationship and chemistry and discover what you are capable of.

AIM OF THE GAME
Your aim is to prevent Eric's stress exceed the value 10. You'll also have to avoid all characters to be in Recovery at the same time(see Recovery Phase).
If one of these conditions occurs, the game ends immediately with players defeat; if otherwise you are able to reach the eleventh turn of the game, you win (see End of the game). Crazy Brother is a cooperative game, meaning that if you win, everybody wins. If you lose, you'll share the defeat.

The game unfolds in turns, up to eleven. Each turn is made up of four phases:

1. Events and Accidents Phase

2. Actions Phase - made up of three under-phases
2.1 selection of the Action Cards
2.2 resolution of the Action Cards
2.3 discard of the Action Cards

3. Eric Phase

4. Recovery Phase
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Gulf States (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: they also give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Crossing borders require extra attention.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board has only one grey track and no parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for a colour change.

There are many new options in the rule:exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Spin-it Bible Trivia
description:
This is a trivia challenge with a Bible theme. It uses question cards and a spinner. Players twirl the device and answer a color-coded inquiry matching the result. Points are scored based on the difficulty level... once again this is determined by the color-coded cards with purple earning 3 points, green 2 points, etc.

The first player to score 10 points is declared the winner. For a slightly longer game a specified time limit can be set. Age range is (perhaps) 10 and older.

Includes the spinner, 21 cards, and a score pad.

name: Cards Against Sobriety
description:
A joining of 4 classic drinking card games

Kings – Lay all eighteen cards on the table face down. Each player takes a turn drawing a card and performing the Kings action described on the card. Any players not required to drink earn a point for that round. After each action is complete, lay the card on the table in rows to form a pyramid. The bottom row will have five cards and the top row will have one card. Once the pyramid is complete, move the remaining three cards in front of all players. Each player will choose one of the cards (multiple players can choose the same card. Now flip over the three player cards.

Pyramid – each player takes a turn flipping over a card, starting at the bottom row of the pyramid. If the flipped card is higher than the player’s card, the player drinks for one second and keeps the card. If the flipped card is lower than the player’s card, the player gets a point and keeps the card. If the flipped card is equal to the player’s card, the player drinks double and keeps the card. Play continues into the second and third and fourth rows, with losing cards resulting in drinking for two, three and four seconds, respectively (still for twice as long for an equal number). After the last card at the top of the pyramid is flipped and drinking or points are resolved, it stays on the table face up. The players claim the player cards, so that all players have roughly the same number of cards.

Circuit – each player puts his cards into a face down pile. Players take turns flipping their top card and laying it next to the last card on the table. If the card is the same color or same number (the white bordered number nine cards are wild), the circuit continues, the player gets a point and does not have to drink. If the circuit is broken, the player takes a drink and play continues. At the end of the game, keep the longest circuit on the table face up. Put all of the other cards in a face down pile.

The Long Road Home – each player gets one chance to walk the road (which was the longest circuit). Starting with the first card on the road, the player says whether the top card on the pile is higher or lower than the face up card. If he is correct, he moves to the next card on the road. If he is wrong, he takes a drink and has to start over. If he completes the road before the deck runs out, he gets five points. Every player gets the same chance to walk the road. The highest total score after this game wins.

name: Aether Captains: Clash of Corsairs
description:
Clash of Corsairs is an expansion for Aether Captains and not a standalone game. This expansion includes new components for the Navy Commander and the Empire as well. Clash of Corsairs adds 2 new ships for the Navy Commander as well as new Action Cards but also different and new Objectives for the protector of Arkady that increase the replayability of the game.

The main focus in this expansion is to give to the Commander alternative missions, alternative game endings as well a variety of new ships and Action cards that introduce to the base game new effects and abilities. At the same time the Land of Arkady is expanded since the new hex tiles grow the whole Empire adding new locations and revealing new powers! Lastly you will be able to discover new Crew Member with unique abilites that will help you during the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aether Captains: Fleet of Doom
description:
Fleet of Doom is the 2nd expansion of Aether Captains and is not a standalone game. This expansion includes new components for the War-Captains. It adds the triple dice-ships for the War-Captains along with new rules and strategies. The triple dice-ships are quite similar to the Navy Commander’s ones but are also equipped with new abilties and Action cards. The War-Captains fleet will be enpowered however there is a flow. These ships are part of more than one dice therefore a War-Captain can choose just one of those ships.

At the same time you will discover the new powers of the Action cards as well as the new Crew Members. Additionally new Objectives will turn the game into a challenge for those who join the enemy’s forces. The new Objectives offer different missions and targets for the War-Captains.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bible Battles
description:
Conquer one Enemy card held by another player before someone conquers yours (2-4 players).

1)Shuffle 9 Enemy cards and give two to each player (3 if a two player game). Each player places his enemy cards face up in front of him. Remove leftover Enemy cards from the game. Shuffle the rest of the cards and deal 5 to each player. The rest become the draw pile.

2) A player begins his turn by discarding as many cards from his hand as he wishes and places them face down near the draw pile in a discard pile. He takes the same number of cards from the draw pile, always having 5 cards.

3) In time the player tries to collect any 5 that form a set listed on the Enemy cards. Divine Intervention is wild but can only be used once and never on Satan.

4) A soon as a player discards and draws, the next player takes his turn. If a player assembles a victory combination, he places those on the proper Enemy card (owned by an opponent) and declares "The battle is the Lord's" and is the winner.

name: Killer of Pirates
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




海賊殺 (Killer of Pirates) is a game based on the game Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha), and shares many rules with BANG! The players play cards to try to eliminate the other players, and win if only players of their own team is still in play. The game has the theme of One Piece.

This is a table card game suitable for 4-10 people. The shapes of the characters and props in "One Piece Kill" are all set according to the style of the original Mr. Oda. There are 162 cards in the game (104 game cards, 38 character cards with special abilities, 10 strength cards, and 10 identity cards). The character cards are the collective wisdom of 3 painters. The game cards have been revised several times, and the drawing is exquisite. At the same time, the game cards are laser printed with high-quality copperplate paper to ensure the quality of the cards.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Killer of Tokyo Ghoul
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.

mechanics: Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Game of Bible Questions
description:
This 36-card deck is organized like a Happy Families deck into nine "books" of four cards each. But its play is based on answering questions about the bible, not on simply asking for cards.

Each card indicates which "book" to which it belongs, a topic word (such as Matthew or Calvary), two questions with Bible chapter and verse references, and one answer to another card in the same book.

Each player is dealt six cards. Each in turn asks another player one of the questions on one of his cards. If that person holds the answer card, he hands it over; if not, he becomes the next questioner. If a player holds the answer and either doesn't realize it or refuses to give it up, he must hand over all of his remaining cards!

When a player completes a book, it is set aside and the one with the largest number of books at game end wins.

name: Src:Card 3-4 Player Expansion
description:
Src:Card 3-4 player expansion adds 60 additional cards to the game to allow 3-4 player play. The pack also contains extended instructions on how to play with additional players.

This is not a stand-alone product.

name: Czech Republic (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Czech Republic is a fan-made expansion to the Days of Wonder, Inc. Ticket to Ride series created by Alan R. Moon. This expansion is designed for players who are already well familiar with Ticket to Ride’s standard gameplay and mechanics. Standard, Big cities and Mega variants are available.

Published by permission for non-commercial use. All rights to the Ticket to Ride name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or playtested this expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Railways and Canals
description:
From the publisher:

We are in the English county of Devon in 1830. The rivers Plym, Yealm, Erme, Avon and Dart, along with its many creeks and estuaries, lead to the rise of river transportation by building canals; but also it helps the steam railway expansion across all England. Tycoons and investors will struggle to impose the conveyances most prestigious (and, of course, valuable to them).

In this context, several companies are founded: the Tiverton Canal Co. strive for boat transport and canalization, the South Devon Railway Co. puts its efforts on the railroads and Dartmouth Steam Co. (also known as 'the Independents') diversify in building railways and canals at the beginning of this exciting race to dominate the transportation of passengers and goods in the region.

Both players start with a pile of 9 tiles each one and a common starting tile. They will expand a modullar board (made up alternating tiles and hollows). Each hollow closed by four tiles will be awarded with a victory point at the end of the game to the player with the most connections pointing to this that gap (all vertical and horizontal projections of the board count!). In addition to its own meeple, players have the valuable help of an external company that may be outsourced... but be careful of not to abuse this option because it can stop working in the area permanently.

When the last player places his last tile, representing the end of construction of the region of Devon, victory points will be distributed following the scoring criteria. The player who gets most victory points wins the game.

From the publisher (Spanish):

Nos situamos en la región inglesa de Devon en el año 1830. Los ríos Plym, Yealm, Erme, Avon y Dart, junto con sus numerosos arroyos y estuarios, propician el auge del transporte fluvial mediante la construcción de canales; pero el vapor también ayuda a la expansión del ferrocarril por toda Inglaterra. Magnates e inversores pugnarán por imponer el medio de transporte que más prestigio (y beneficios) les puedan reportar.

En este contexto se fundan varias compañías: la Tiverton Canal Co. apuesta por el transporte en barco y la canalización, la South Devon Railway Co. pone toda la carne en el asador por los caminos de hierro y la Dartmouth Steam Co. (también conocida como ‘The Independents’) divide sus esfuerzos en la construcción de vías férreas y canales en el inicio de la contienda por dominar el transporte de pasajeros y mercaderías de la región.

Los jugadores, con un mazo de 9 losetas cada uno y a partir de una loseta inicial común, irán expandiendo un tablero escaqueado (formado por losetas y huecos). Cada hueco cerrado por cuatro losetas otorgará un punto de victoria al final de la partida al jugador que más conexiones de su color estén apuntando hacia ese hueco (todas las proyecciones verticales y horizontales del tablero cuentan). Además de sus propios meeples, los jugadores disponen de la valiosa ayuda de una compañía externa que podrán subcontratar... pero mucho cuidado de no abusar de esta opción, ya que pueden dejar de trabajar en la zona definitivamente.

Cuando el último jugador coloque su última loseta, que representa el fin de construcción de la región de Devon, se repartirán los puntos de victoria siguiendo los criterios de puntuación. El jugador que más consiga ganará el juego.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

description:

These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. There are multifunctional God cards too. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but you can move forward 2000 years and time-travel to Rotterdam by the Gotthard Base tunnel for extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: and many more. categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Adapt
description:
Adapt is a highly strategic survival card game where you take on not only the environment, but your closest friends. Players take turns facing challenges on the island, exploring, hunting, and deciding when to betray the other players all while they are hunting down the precious relics to win the game. You can avoid dangerous misadventures by collecting and holding onto the right supplies, like the fanny pack!

At the beginning of each player's turn, they must draw an action card that they must play..the island gives them no choice! Players then take turns rolling a 4-sided die for the actions they can perform. During their turn they can choose from 5 different actions: Gathering, Exploring, Stealing, Attacking, or playing a card's action from their hand! To perform these actions, the player must roll the 20-sided die and get a 10 or higher (for attacking, gathering, or exploring) to be successful, or a 15 or higher for stealing! As the game progresses, the players must collect all three relics and keep hold of all 3 to win! It's either holding the relics, or be the last survivor standing.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Sports Bogglers Baseball
description: 1-2 players compete in a baseball game simulated by the rolling of dice, marking baserunners on a pegboard, and keeping score on paper. Follow standard baseball rules.

name: Sports Bogglers Basketball
description: Based on the active player's roll of the dice, passes are completed, fouls are committed, shots are blocked, two- and three-pointers are made, and more in this travel-sized light basketball simulation.

name: Estonia (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. 4+ players may need stations.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also 6 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Bible TCG: Genesis
description:
From the publisher:

Easy to understand and play, the Bible Trading Card Game has been designed for ages 8 and up.

The Bible Trading Card Game Second Edition Genesis is a race game where players rush to recreate Events from the biblical book of Genesis.

Players start with their own custom built deck of a minimum 40 cards. Taking turns they play resources cards and events cards from their hands. Trying to complete their events or the other players event first. Player use both Sometimes and Anytime cards from their hands to help them complete events and to hinder the other players from completing their events.

The game ends when a player completes three different events.

name: Språkspelet
description:
Språkspelet ("The Language Game") is a set of cards with phrases in Swedish and Northern Sami, intended as a tool to teach and promote knowledge and use of the Northern Sami language. In addition to use of the cards as a teaching or conversational aid, they are sold as a game with several largely similar modes of playing. Gameplay can be summed up as:

1. At the start of the game, each player gets a portion of the deck as a draw pile.

2. Every round, each player picks up a card from their draw pile.

3. The current player reads a question from their card (in Sami).

4. Each other player in turn selects and reads a statement from their card (also in Sami).

5. The current player decides which other player had the most fun or appropriate response, awarding them a point which is tracked by setting aside a card. The next player clockwise will then read a question.

6. Play continues until a certain number of points has been reached or a certain number of questions has been read, at which point the player with the most points wins.

The game is sold as a box with a book and three decks using different forms of declension, or as a single deck.

name: discover.bb
description:
This is a game about getting to know the German town Böblingen developed by a group of pupils at a local school.

The gameplay is inspired by Monopoly. Players take turns rolling a die and moving around the board, buying properties they land on. Landing on an opponent-owned property requires you to pay money to them. landing on your own property again allows you to advance to higher position there, increasing the amount of money you get when others visit the property.
There are also spaces that require players to answer trivia questions about Böblingen.

The game ends when one player is broke, and the player with the highest amount of money (including acquired properties) wins.

name: East Africa (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

There are border controls which require special passes.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.

There is also a minimap which can be used for a shorter game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Bible Spell-A-Gram
description:
Two Bible word games in one box.

Bible Spell-A-Gram: Alphabet tiles are placed face down between the players. Each player draws 20 tiles and takes turn spelling as many words as they can in 3 minutes. They replenish tiles at the end of their turn. First player to spell 10 words wins.

Bible Spell-Across: Each player gets a set of alphabet tiles and takes turns placing words, crossword style, on a grid on the back of the box.

name: Holmenkollen
description:
This is a compilation of 4 skiing games.

1. Der Spezialsprunglauf (Ski jumping)

Each player has 3 jumps and the 2 best results count to the end result. First the player rolls the 3 white dice to determine the length of the jump. If one die shows a "0" the jumper has fallen. Then the 3 black dice determine the posture grade. The Result of each jump is marked on the game board by plaques with the starting numbers of each player.

2. Langlauf (cross country skiing)

The players take turns to roll the 2 white dice with the single digits and move their figures. The first player to reach the finish gets 240 points, the second gets 235 points. Each arriving player gets 5 points less than the one before.

For the nordic combination, the results from the two first games are combined to determine a winner.

3. Der Abfahrtslauf (downhill skiing)

On the square grid route is marked with 20 red flags which have a distance of 5 squares from each other. The players roll the 2 white dice with the single digits and move their figures. The players have to pass each flag on an adjacent space.

The second player starts after the first one has rolled and moved three times and so on. The player who completes the route with the fewest rolls wins the game.

4. Der Torlauf (Slalom)

This is played like game 3, but the flags are placed as gates in a slalom track.

The back of the rules includes the number sequences "111/9/105", "144" and "0742/1/73", which may or may not indicate the time of publication and/or a product number.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Track Movement

name: The Old Ball Game
description:
Grab some peanuts and Cracker Jack and pull up a seat to The Old Ball Game!

TOBG is a head-2-head, traditional base ball game, featuring real-time pitching (no charts or die rolls to determine results). Players can enjoy a full 9 innings or set a score and play only the 9th.

The emphasis in on the heart of the game - pitching, with timely hitting sprinkled in and solid fielding (except for the occasional error!)

TOBG moves along smoothly and quickly, with the time of play dictated by the time to pitch. Meaning you can take your time or play fast - it's up to you. There are special rules for stealing and bunting; and old-fashioned score boards keep track of the count and score, for that Authentic feel.

Pitching: The pitcher has 7 pitches to choose from. The pitching happens in 2 stages with the batter saying 'Take' or 'Swing' at each pitch. The result is a ball or strike. As the count goes deeper, the batter gets the advantage and knowledge will prevail over luck.

Hitting: When the batter swings at a Strike he gets a potential hit - he flips over a batting card to reveal a single, double, triple (or home-run!), hit to various areas of the ball park. (There are also infield flies.)

Fielding: The fielding team will select which fielding card to turn over to make the play. Results are Out, Hit or Error.

name: Pombie Lake
description:
Pombie Lake is a game for two to six players that plays in 15-25 minutes. Each player starts from their “home” tile with a team of three photographers one boat and one driver. Photographers are dropped off in eight different types of locations that are home to eight different types of mythical creatures.
You and rival photography teams have traveled to this remote area at the foot of the Pyrenees mountains in France to capture shots of Yetis, Chupacabras, giant sand worms, shadowy lake creatures and more. The first player to get a convincing portfolio back to their publisher wins fame and fortune, and the game!
The remote area makes long-distance communication impossible, so you are very much on your own. Technology is limited to film cameras and walkie-talkies. The creatures can overwhelm members of your team and rival photojournalists are looking to thwart your efforts.
The board is comprised of pentagonal location tiles with a four tile lake in the middle. Each player starts their turn by moving their vehicle up to four times, dropping off and picking up their photographers and boats as they go. Each player ends their turn by drawing the top card for the creature deck. The deck has been shuffled and contains six cards of each monster and four identical “full moon” cards. When the full moon is drawn, the next three creature cards are drawn before the next player takes their turn.
If one creature emerges on a location you occupy, you capture a picture token when you successfully leave that location. If that location activates twice, that photographer or boat has been, gulp!, overwhelmed…
Pombie Lake is fast paced and presents many agonizing decisions as players try to balance speed with safety. Players need to be alert as everyone is possibly affected by everyone else’s turn.

Along with the base game, an expansion is included that grants each team a special advantage. The expansion is a small stack of 6 tiles.
Each team randomly draws 1 at the beginning of the game.
Advantages include:
1. Harpoon Boat
Boat will be sunk by three creatures, not two.
2. Telephoto Lens Photographer
Can capture shots from adjacent tiles. Must be placed on joining edge of adjacent tile to capture. Will not die if adjacent tile is activated twice, they are not in harm's way.
3. Turbocharged vehicles
Five moves per turn.
4. Larger photography team
Fourth photographer on your team.
5. Creature Descendant Photographer,
Not killed by creatures EXCEPT UFO.
Special Power (kin warning/hex): disable one location tile
by laying red square token.
6. Motorcycle Meeple DISCARD ONE PHOTOGRAPHER
Able to move anywhere on land, will be killed by 3 creatures, not 2.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Take That

name: Mascarene Islands (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This game is a combination of the three games: Réunion & Mauritius, Mauritius & Réunion and Rodrigues & Mauritius. The rules for each game are consistent and apply to this game also.

You will need all three boards (side by side in that order) and tickets plus each player will need three sets of wagons (one for each board).

You will start with your markers at zero on each board. Begin play on one island (Rodrigues, Mauritius or Réunion) and, if you wish, stay on that board throughout the game. However, when you reach the coast, you may take a ferry to another island – now you may still play on that board or you may continue your journey from the port of arrival on the next board.

You may travel in any direction from board to board, always travelling to a part-island and then moving to the same port on the main island. Or stay on one or two boards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: The Hot Dog Race
description:
This Depression-era game involves manipulating a string to move cardboard dogs. There is a sheet of very thick cardboard that is folded into a three-dimensional row of four kennels with a starting ledge in front of them. A thick cardboard dog is attached to each kennel by a string.

Players stand in a line equally distant from the kennels and with strings of equal length. They line up the dogs by leaning them on the edge of the starting ledge, and then wiggle or shake their strings so that their dogs move toward them across the playing table. First dog across the finish line wins. Any player touching a dog is disqualified.

name: Hang 12
description:
''Hang 12 is a push-your-luck party game!

Do you know what your friends are thinking? Guess correctly to surf bigger and bigger waves, but if you answer incorrectly, it will all come crashing down! Ride your wave in to shore before you lose it! You may even get to hang 12 and cry "Cowabunga"!

Try to guess what other players think in order to catch waves. Then, ride the waves in to shore to score points. Be the first to collect twenty-four points to win!

name: 1-2-3 räknar Mamma Mu och Kråkan
description:
Swedish children's game based on the popular "Mamma Mu and Kråkan" series. Translation: "1-2-3 counts Mama Mu and the Crow". The main object of the game is to teach young children to count.

The game has two spinning wheels and ten areas numbered one through ten. Players take turns spinning the first wheel to get a number between one and ten. They then move their piece to that space. After that they spin the second wheel, which will tell them what they need to do (clap hands, jump on one leg). After the player has performed the task the same number of times as the number they first landed on, they are awarded a medal. The first player to a certain amount of medals win.
categories: Children's Game, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme
