The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also chance cards which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in this pack.

There are 36 possible mountain railway excursions which give you extra points and a big bonus for the most trips.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: combined points for two journeys: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Hispaniola (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There is also a treasure hunt as you go along the tracks which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there you may dig up some options as you go.

The 9 bonuses give you extra points including a large reward for finding the treasure.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: World Soccer
description:
"The game the world watches you can now play"

Provides entertainment for all soccer fans.

The object of the game is to be the first person to make their way around the board, answering as many questions correct as possible and making the least amount of errors.

Players roll dice and move along a round, soccer ball shaped playing board. Players then answer soccer based trivia questions, collecting goal tokens for correct answers. Make a mistake or commit a foul though, and you could end up with a yellow or red card!

Description from the back of the box:

The following questions are an example of what you'll find:

Who won the World Cup in 1934?
Which country does Roberto Baggio play for?
What shape is a soccer ball?


The answers are made up of:

multiple choice
true or false
plus some real brain teasers


Included in V.N.J's World Soccer:

A round playing board
6 player tokens
6 plastic player holders
1 playing dice
70 goal tokens
22 red cards
22 yellow cards
330 question and answer cards


This board game is made in Australia by:

V.N.J. World SOccer
Tapleys Hill Road, West Beach
South Australia, 5024, AUSTRALIA

name: Kanalresan
description: Simple roll-and-move game of the Game of Goose variety, probably sold in the 1940s or 1950s. Two Dutch children find a giant clog in the attic and set out on a circular trip down a canal, using the clog as a boat. While the kids mostly want to take their time sightseeing and collecting some choice tulips, the goal for the players appears to be to return home as quickly as possible. Various spaces contain the usual instructions to take a detour or shortcut, move a number of spaces ahead or back, or lose a turn.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Black Sea (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride: Rails & Sails)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the Ticket to Ride Rails and Sails game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the pieces and the cards from the base game.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. There are also choice cards which may help or hinder you.

There are bonuses to give you extra points.

There are new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Diagonals
description: Diagonals is played with black and white stones on an 8x8 grid (i.e., the intersections of a 7x7 gameboard). Each turn a player places a stone on an empty space; there are no captures. When a diagonal line is full, the player who placed the last stone on the diagonal line scores the number of friendly stones on that line. The player with the most points wins when all spaces are occupied.

name: Carrotia: Carroting
description:
Carroting is the first expansion of Carrotia and comes along with the base game. In Carroting the Master Rabbit is trying to avoid the river's currents and find the exit on time but at the same time he must face the fishes.

River's Currents: When the Master Rabbit is moving along with the river's currents nothing happens, the game continues as you know. However, if the Master Rabbit is moving against the river's currents, then for each move you make, you count 2 moves on the Rabbit-Meter.

New Rabbit Characters: In "Carroting" expansion you will discover three new characters. The Steam Rabbit, the Wizard and Ms. Lovely. Each of these characters has a new ability. Example: Ms. Lovely ignores the river's currents.

Updated Quest Cards: The updated Quest cards indicate where you will place the fish tokens as well as the fishing spots. The fishing spots are hidden and you don't know what they hide unless you move the Master Rabbit there and you claim such a token.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Carrotia: Noscarrotu
description:
A dark journey is awaiting Master Rabbit in the land of Noscarrotu. This time, Master Rabbit will have to encounter Vampire Rabbits. Walking through a dark maze, Master Rabbit must create a path leading outside the maze in any of the four corners of it. He must collect at least 10 carrots and escape before Noscarrotu awakens!

This task though, will not be easy to achieve. Vampire Rabbits and Noscarrotu have special abilities capable to stop Master Rabbit. Noscarrotu has created a magic meter, the Noscarrotu meter. As long the numbers are decreasing, special effects take place in the game, effects that work in favor of the dark master and his puppets. Master Rabbit will have the chance to succeed having the support of three great heroes, the Psychic, the Priest and the Hunter.

Who will prevail through this dark encounter?
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Maze, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Barsoom (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

It is a sci-fi map of Mars conceived in the books of Edgar Rice Burroughs and developed by cartographer Oberon Zell. It also featured in the Disney film John Carter.

It follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of explorer cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also challenge cards which may help or hinder you. The 9 bonuses can give you extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Carrotia: Tutancarrot
description:
Master Rabbit returns and this time must face the powerful and cunning Tuttancarrot. The mighty Egyptian king has ordered his servants to protect well his kigdon. Mummies are walking around to prevent Master Rabbit from achieving his victory. Master Rabbit must fight to keep the Amulet Power-meter at maximum power and at the same time must collect at least 10 carrots in order to defeat Tuttancarrot.

In his mission, Master Rabbit will receive some unexpected assistance from the bonuses that he will find in the Sarcophagus tokens. Yet, the path to the victory will be full of traps as Tuttancarrot demands to build the maze in the formation of a pyramid in order to move freely through it, so he can defeat Master Rabbit once and for all!

Will our hero come victorious through this trial?
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Maze, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Yellow Sea (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride: Rails and Sails)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride Rails and Sails game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need all the train and ship pieces, the train and ship cards and the rules from the base game.

There is an extra set of Explorer cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also Challenger cards which may help or hinder you. The bonuses and the secret city card give you extra points.

There are many new options in the rules such as 'exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones' and 'discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones'.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains

name: Which Shopkins Are You?
description:
Players race their Shopkins around the board collecting cards and answering personality questions. Do you like fashion or sports? Do you prefer ice cream or pie? Be the first player to earn 6 cards and find out Which Shopkins you’re most like.

Game comes with 4 exclusive Shopkins characters that can only be found in this game.

Source: Pressman Toys Web Site

name: Shopkins Designer Dash Game
description:
To be the first player to complete a Shopkins outfit by collecting a hat, shirt, bottom, and accessory.

The youngest player goes first by holding his/her Shopkins character behind his/her back and making a fist with the Shopkins character hidden inside. This player is called the “Hider”. Keeping both fists tightly closed, the Hider holds them out in front of his/her body. The Hider picks any other player to be the Guesser for this turn. The Guesser tries to guess which of the Hider’s fists has the Shopkins character in it by gently tapping that fist. The Hider opens the fist that the Guesser tapped to reveal whether or not the Shopkins character is in that fist.

If the Guesser guessed correctly, the Guesser moves the Hider’s playing piece along the path either one or two spaces of the Guesser’s choosing. If the Guesser guessed incorrectly, the Hider moves his/her piece along the path either three or four spaces of the Hider’s choosing.

When players land on an Outfit Space, they pick up any one Outfit Card from that category from the pile on the table, regardless of the picture on the space.

Each player may only hold one Outfit Card from each category at a time. When players land on a Wild Space, they pick up an Outfit Card from any category they don’t already hold. When players land on a Borrow Space, they take an Outfit Card from any other player. Players may only borrow Outfit Cards from categories they don’t already hold. When players land on a Switch Outfits space, they must hand all of the Outfit Cards they’ve collected to any player and take all of that player’s Outfit Cards. When a player is done moving and/or collecting, play passes to the left.

The first player to collect one Outfit Card from each category wins the game.

Source: Pressman Toy Site

name: Game of Pathfinders
description: Pathfinders is a game for two to four players. Players roll one die from a dice cup and move a small colored piece around the oval path. Beginning on the farthest path from middle, a player strives to reach the central space first. A player, when landing on a space with an arrow pointing to an inner loop, moves towards the middle. In order to win, he must have an exact roll to move onto the center space.

name: Marco Polo SHARK!
description: Marco Polo SHARK! is a press your luck, player elimination card game based on the swimming pool game you played as a kid with a fun twist of adding a shark to the mix. This fast-paced game plays in less then ten minutes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That, Trick-taking

name: RUMBLESLAM: Vitamir
description:
"Built to endure the sub-zero temperatures of his homeland, Vitamir is clad in thick hair that acts as both insulator and armor. During his travels, the bear-like wrestler created dozens of folk stories and rumors. The Sasquatch? Just Vitamir taking a stroll through the woods. The abominable snowman? Just Vitamir lost in a snowstorm."

Fan favorite Vitamir is a force unto himself. A giant of a man, he has some of the best movement and action points of any WEIGHT 3 wrestler. He's got great stats and high damaging special abilities. His Man Against Wild ability does extra damage when targeting Feral Den or Forest Soul wrestlers, which makes him the perfect Kaiser's Palace wrestler to add a little extra oomph to a Heavy Pounders team.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: WaySpotting
description: WaySpotting is an innovative board game for adults and kids who like to spot ways. The game was inspired by the diagrams of Mark Lombardi, and by the idea that every way can be represented by a series of colors, a concept we named WayDNA. At every turn, players try to spot low budget travel routes with two stops and to visit new attractions around the world. They can also use an online companion app to win missions and money. The game has over 10 different types of missions and 1000 trivia questions for all ages. It is an intuitive and fun way to learn about geography, low budget travelling and graph theory concepts.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Maze, Transportation, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hockey
description:
User summary:

Cheap bare-bones roll-and-move game in the same vein as some of the games included in the Sportmagazin compilation series. You roll, move and hope not to be killed off near the end.

At least one of the photos on the game board may be from the 1969 World Cup in Sweden, but this is speculative and probably does not indicate the year of publication.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monkey Fractions
description:
Story and concept
MONKEY FRACTIONS is a fun carnival where monkey is hero and stress is zero. With large picture cards, work with your fraction skills. You will master the fundamentals of fractions including fraction as a part of a group and fraction as a part of whole. The fun increases as you play more and explore more fractions with curious monkeys. Hoot hoot!

Skills
• Fraction as a part of group
• Fraction as part of whole
• Strategic thinking
• Memory
• Data interpretation
• Cognitive and Developmental skills

Practice jump
8 times over class room or worksheets
At Logic Roots, we are passionate about Math and work with the vision of Reinventing how kids practice Math through gamification of its concepts. Our Board Games, Card Games and Apps are widely used by top schools and homeschooling parents to help their boys and girls fall in love with Math. These games are best used for Learning, Education and gifting purposes for children.

Target group
Grade 1 and above || 6 years and above

Game Play
All the cards should be placed face-down on the surface. Players will pick two cards up in every turn. If the fractions on the cards math, player keeps both the cards. If they are not same fractions, player has to leave the cards face up. The player who gets maximum number of cards in the end wins.

Contents of the box
• 32 large and glossy cards
• 1 rule book
• 1 Game themed wall poster
• 4 write and wipe slates

name: MetaCheckers: Soccer
description:
Brings the mechanics of MetaCheckers into the game of soccer.

In MetaCheckers, the checkers become chess pieces and make chess moves in an attempt to capture the king.

In MetaCheckers: Soccer, the checkers become soccer players and try to score a goal using chess moves.

—description from the publisher

name: Happy Hour!
description:
From the makers of Dinner's Ready!, Happy Hour! is the first card game to help get you buzzed, challenging players to collect and deliver cocktails based on actual recipes! Not only is Happy Hour! fun and competitive, the more you play, the more familiar you'll become with cocktails!


Drinking IS NOT a required element of playing the Happy Hour! card game, but we do have suggested drinking rules for full enjoyment!*


Happy Hour! is easy to set up and fun to play!

Happy Hour! is a game that fundamentally parallels the bartending experience of assembling mixed drink orders as quickly as possible.

Overview of gameplay: Players are dealt a hand of INGREDIENT CARDS, containing alcohols, mixers, and toppings.

INGREDIENT CARDS: There are four kinds of alcohol ingredients: vodka, whiskey, gin, and tequila!
There are a handful of MIXERS, including triple sec, sweet & sour, club soda, tonic water, ginger beer and vermouth!
The TOPPING cards consist of garnish (orange/lime/lemon/olive), cherry, and mint!
There are also ACTION CARDS which can help or hinder your drink-making progress, including spilled drinks, restock the bar, "scratch that," make it a double, and wild cards!

THE BAR: A row of ingredient cards available during each turn.
THE COUNTER: A row of recipe cards that must be fulfilled.

Using these cards in combination, players can create any one of the 21 drink RECIPE CARDS. Drinks range on a scale of 4-7 points, depending on quantity of ingredients required.

The first "bartender" to collect 21 points wins!

Happy Hour! is a fun card game for 2-4 adults, with rounds typically requiring 10-40 minutes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That

name: Listening Lotto: Sounds on the Farm
description:
In this educational children's game, players match farm animal noises photographs of those animals. To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear. Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: The Junior Bible Game
description:
This game is the Junior Edition of The Bible Game.

From the instructions:
The Junior Bible Game will be a welcome addition to any family, Church, or Sunday School group. The game provides an opportunity to learn the Bible in a fun and challenging way.
Families will especially appreciate the 5 different levels, allowing young children to play alongside older brothers and sisters. Sunday School and Junior Church leaders will find the game to be a popular addition to their program.

There are a total of seven categories in The Bible Game:
1 Life of Christ
2 New Testament
3 Old Testament
4 W.W.W. (Who am I? Where is it? Women of the Bible)
5 Quotes
6 Alpha and Omega
7 General Knowledge

name: BLAZE Card Game
description:
Description from the designer:

BLAZE is a RACE to BLAZE through the MAZE with color, aura and grace.

It a fast fun game to BLAZE-A-Way to the other side.  A game of memory, luck and strategy.  Have fun blazing a way...
but be careful – do not fall into the black hole... and it can all turn around.. with the color twist and magic wheel!

- BLAZE Game Play -

BLAZE has a new game dynamic.

Each player has their own starting point and intended end point. To win -You have to be the FIRST to BLAZE a path (or jump onto someone else's path) to reach your end point.

A path can be BLAZED using cards that are near each other in the RAINBOW Color Spectrum or by numerical order. Plus there are fantastic action cards and wild cards which can totally delight, surprise, make someone fall off their path, relocate paths, start again.. etc.


BLAZE is an original card game with a Brilliant design.



It involves memory - dynamic memory(as the cards can be moved around) luck and a great strategy.



A perfect choice for family or party gaming occasions.



It is quick to learn and offers a fun challenge!



It's the game you can play again and again! Every game is a brand new experience!



And you’ll be surely sharpening your mind and memory gaining BLAZING memory prowess!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Maze, Memory, Number, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area-Impulse, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Touched On: Neighbus
description:
Enjoy a slice of suburbia with a daily commute to the cul-de-sac on Australia’s most dramatic bus.

This is a booster card pack for Touched On, something to add more players, more sugar & more fun.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Transportation

name: Cetro
description:
The players have to get their 14 playing pieces (crowns and bishop's miters) from their starting position to the starting position of their opponent.
Forward movement is by jumping diagonaly over friendly or opponent playing pieces. The pieces may move diagonaly backwards to get in position for other pieces to jump over them.
The playing pieces can't move onto the white spaces.

name: Watch Ya' Mouth: Redneck Expansion #1
description:
Go git your kids, git your mama and daddy, and get ready for a good time! All the Watch Ya Mouth fun you love, with a knee slappin’ twist…redneck style! If you’re huntin’ for your next family game night belly laugh, you just bagged it!

Redneck Expansion Pack beefs up the original Watch Ya’ Mouth party game
Hampered by mouthpieces, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, like:
Country as cornbread
Way over yonder, and up a piece
Too poor to paint, too proud to whitewash
Watch Ya’ Mouth Redneck Expansion Pack comes with 155 rowdy, knee-slappin’ phrases. Our cards are strong and durable for years of hootin’ and hollerin’.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Swimzania
description:
Swimzania is the unique interactive family board game that’s all about swimming. Created by ASA qualified swimming instructors, it’s an exciting, fast-paced tabletop game that gets children learning more about swimming as they play.

The board is the pool, the counters are swimmers. Players throw the dice and race each other up and down the lanes. Land on a SWIM QUIZ space and answer a question card; land on DO IT to complete a challenge. Try to avoid getting CRAMP or a STITCH and you might just be the one to lift the trophy!

Swimzania has been carefully researched and developed by ASA qualified swimming instructors, taking inspiration from the lessons taught in the pool. It embraces competitive and cooperative play, and is a brilliant way to reinforce kids’ (and adults’!) knowledge of swimming and water safety awareness.

“We wanted to develop a board game that would appeal to both children and their parents. So Swimzania is not only fun to play, it also has important educational benefits,” says Vladimir Scepunov of Swimzania. “We have developed three levels of difficulty so that gamers of all ages can play and enjoy it, and we’ve combined question cards with interactive challenges to get the players having fun and feeling good.”
“We firmly believe in the power of learning through action,” says Vladimir. “Swimzania supports everything our students are taught in the pool, so it’s a brilliant way to reinforce and strengthen their understanding of swimming. And they have so much fun while they’re playing!”
Swimming and water safety are now included in the National Curriculum, so there is no better time to get kids playing a game that boosts their weekly lessons. A recent survey by Swim England reported that an overwhelming 94% of parents believe it is important for their child to be able to swim competently by the end of primary school. Playing Swimzania will help them to reach that goal even faster!
—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Sports

name: Sensation!: Crazy Athlete
description:
One player takes on the role of an athlete giving a tricky interview to three journalists. However, the athlete is exhausted after a hard training session and is fed up with all the interviews. Wanting to get rid of the journalists as soon as possible, the other two players are coaches who stand behind the Journalists and make motions helping the athlete decide what to say. The Journalists have to guess what topics the athlete is talking about.

Over the course of 6 rounds, each player scores points based on how well he does in his current role. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Sports

name: Ultimate Conspiracy
description:
1920, Witsand City, several young women mysteriously disappeared without leaving any trace. The police suspect a serial killer. You're going to investigate and find out it's much more than that. An incredible machination awaits you and many people are involved.

Your goal will be to unravel all this and put an end to this conspiracy forever!

For your investigations, you will have to choose from 6 very different characters. Depending on your choice, you will not experience exactly the same adventure.

The abilities of each character are: strength, charisma, intelligence, skill, and search.

In addition to these abilities, you will gain additional skills during the game. These skills will be very different for each character. They will be very important to the success of your missions and you will keep them from one investigation to the next. Your characters will also have health and mental health points. You will have to watch them very carefully, because if they fall to zero, your character will either be dead or completely crazy.

Ultimate Conspiracy is a true narrative game, you will not only have to thwart a conspiracy, but also complete many secondary quests that will help you in your investigation. You will also find many objects, but as in real life, you won't be able to carry as many as you want. Each object has a size score and this is limited according to the characters and their strengths.

You all play against the game together. You decide which character should do which action? Is it better to stay together or separate?

To solve each investigation, you will visit different places in the city, in the country and even in the world.

Playing Ultimate Conspiracy is very simple, you are free to visit the places you want in the order of your choice and as many times as you feel necessary.

You’ll have to solve many puzzles to progress in your investigation. Keep in mind to observe the items as a whole and if the solution seems complicated, do not hesitate to come back to it later.

In between time, money, investigations and puzzles, you’ll always be under pressure in Ultimate Conspiracy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Exploration, Horror, Memory, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Memory, Role Playing, Storytelling, Trading

name: Match Fishing Dice
description:
Welcome to a great game of match fishing for those times when you can't get to the waterside. It's very simple to play, with any number of people, and everyone has the chance to be a match winner.

In Match Fishing Dice, each player begins by rolling the "Peg" die to determine if their final score will be doubled, halved, or left as is. Then players take turns rolling the other colored dice in a set sequence to determine the daily fishing conditions, whether their cast was successful or not, which species of fish was caught (if successful), and how many pounds (victory points) were reeled in. Each set of 6 unique fish a player catches will earn a bonus of 10 pounds. After a minimum of 15 rounds, players tally their total pounds caught, adding any set bonuses, and then doubling or halving their score if necessary based on their initial Peg roll. The winner is the player with the highest score.

name: Cat & Mouse
description:
Cat & Mouse is a simple roll-and-move game where players roll a die to move around a square board with an inward spiral track.

While in the lead, the other players are chasing you from the board, thus naming the lead marble the Mouse and all the other players the Cats. The Cats are chasing the Mouse!

With the luck of an opponent's roll, they can bump you back to the beginning and replace you as reigning Mouse of the game.

name: Ultimate Werewolf Legacy: Replay Pack
description: An Ultimate Werewolf Legacy: Replay Pack contains a new diary and an additional set of family cards for use with Ultimate Werewolf Legacy, thereby allowing you to use the components of the base game to play through the entire campaign again. Maybe different things will happen this time; maybe you won't be killed at the hands of your fellow villagers...

name: Apothecaries and Tithes (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: This expansion adds apothecaries to the world of Carcassonne- prepare concoctions to improve your realm, or destroy that of your enemies...
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Drought and Pestilence (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
1. Place a tile
The tiles are placed in accordance to the normal rules. The tiles depict the following new element:
Rat infestation
The tile has rats in the city and a skull-and-crossbones icon.
Drought
The tile has a dried and cracked piece of land and a crossed water-droplet icon.
2. Deploy a follower
Followers are deployed to the rat-infested city as a knight
per the usual rules. Followers may not be deployed
specifically to the drought area but may be deployed to
the farm surrounding the drought area as usual.
If a barn1 is played to a farm that has one or more drought
icons, or if a farm with a farmer is joined to a farm with a
barn and the resulting farm has a drought icon, farmers in
that farm score one point less per city prior to being
removed from play.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Fields and Vineyards (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Based on the original idea by wellidesign, and tiles by Gwommy, which enables double turn for shrines.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Fisherman (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
description:
The Fishermen series of expansions changes the river such that it becomes like any normal tile feature. The 60-tile Fishermen expansion may be added to a game of Carcassonne independently of the others. All the other expansions in the series require that the Fishermen expansion be played with. This series was developed by Novelty

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum

Adds the Angler, and introduces the Tournament for rivers.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum

name: The Ocean (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The Oceans series of expansions introduces Oceans as a new landscape feature. Oceans divide the playing area into two and allows for swashbuckling adventure. All the other expansions in the series require that the Oceans expansion be played with. The series may also be played as a standalone (i.e. without the other Carcassonne expansions).

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: The Orders of Chivalry (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
If the player places a chivalry tile onto a city that he has occupancy in, he may exchange one follower of his own colour for another of his own colour. For example, a Yellow regular Knight is deployed in a city. On his turn, Yellow draws and lays a chivalry tile that extends his already occupied city. He may now exchange the regular Knight in this city for another legal follower.
1,
2 It is irrelevant how many players occupy the city or who has the majority in that city at the time of exchange. An exchange occurs instead of ‘moving the wood’
3 and must take place at the time of laying the chivalry tile.
The idea of exchange is one of promotion or demotion. Knights who served their position well might be honoured to a higher Order. Those who neglected their duties could be stripped of their title.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: The Pope of Avignon (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Preparation
The Avignon City tile is mixed in with the other land tiles.

Placing the Avigon City tile and deploying the Pope
The Avignon City tile is placed in the same way as a normal tile.
When the Avignon City tile is drawn and laid, the player who laid the tile deploys the Pope onto the city segment of the Avignon City tile.
The player can place the tile and connect it to another city that already holds a follower.

Scoring
1 point is added to every tile of the completed city if it holds the Pope.

Taking the Pope over to another city
Adding a Cathar tile or a siege tile to the city that holds the Pope will allow an opportunity to redeploy the Pope to any incomplete city on the playing area.
Then later in the game another city may get the bonus points for the Pope.

Acknowledgements
Thanks to Jonathan Warren for comments and suggestions

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Wells: Wishing Wells (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
This 12-tile expansion by meepleater and Novelty allows a player to make a wish and carry out action during another player's turn.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum

name: Head to Head Soccer
description:
Game introduction:

Head to Head Soccer is a game played with cards and two dice. A schematic board may be used as well. Using the cards, players manipulate the position of the ball on the playing field and attempt to shoot at the opponent's goal. Dice determine the outcome of shots, corner kicks, free kicks, and so on.

User summary:

Head to Head Soccer was designed to support in-person as well as postal play (play-by-mail). The time noted here (30 - 40 minutes) assumes in-person play by experienced players.

The board is presented as a schematic to visual play but need not be used as an actual play surface. It is divided into the familiar zones of soccer with letter designations for the zones. The game is played between two players who alternate taking turns.

Players begin by drawing eight cards from a standard pack of French playing cards; three cards are revealed and five are held. Cards may be played from the hand or from the tabled three. Not all game actions require a card play, but played cards move to the discard. Cards determine what types of passes, defensive plays, fouls, and shots may be attempted - the correct card must be available to make the desired move. A series of tables enumerates which card values, or greater, must be played to attempt various moves in or from various zones. Because some cards are visible to the opponent, some candidate plays also are known. Each player's hidden cards, however, complicate planning and anticipating.

A few specific actions - for example, making a corner kick - are determined by die throw rather than cards. This method prevents "certain" scoring in various situations, replacing a card play with an element of chance.

Head to Head Soccer was written by Lewis Pulsipher and published in Chimaera (Issue 69 - Nov 1980).

Another simple arithmetic card game/activity for young children, also called "Räknespel"/"Counting game" in the rules. The deck consists of cards numbered 1-9 and players draw from it in turn. Whenever a player has cards adding up to 10, they can bank those cards for one point a card. Cards left in hand when the deck has run out count for minus one point per card. The rules suggest playing several rounds with cumulative scores.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Bitten: Survive The Dead
description:
You and your group are survivors of the zombie apocalypse. Your supplies are low. Tension is high. On your last supply raid, there was an attack...and it is possible one of you has been bitten...

You have five minutes to either gather enough supplies to leave your group...or you must discover and eliminate the player who has been bitten.

Bitten: Survive the Dead is a tense and exciting casual game for 2-8 Players with a 5-minute time limit. Players must attempt to gather one food ration, one water ration, one weapon, and the one available vehicle to leave the group, or they must discover which, if any, of the members of their group, have been bitten before time runs out and the bitten player becomes a member of the walking undead and eats your brains.

The original version was text only on cards in a tuck box. The second edition features all new artwork, modified rules including a few new cards, clay tokens for the items, and full illustrations on all the cards, the box, and the tokens.

-description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game, Zombies

name: Where's Baby Jesus?
description:
Where's Baby Jesus? is a simple children's game where players spin the spinner and move the indicated number of spaces. When they land on a space that shows a picture with a missing object, they can then immediately move to the space that shows that missing object. The first player to reach the final space on the board wins the game.

As described on the back of the board, this game is supposed to stimulate conversation with children about the birth of Jesus, as depicted in Luke 2 and Matthew 2.

—user summmary

name: Supremacy 2020: ACW2 & Brazil
description:
This expansion includes a complete set of yellow pieces for a new superpower: Brazil. This exciting new power (and member of the BRIC) can completely mix up the strategic balance you have unknowingly grown accustomed to.

Also includes a tense 2 player scenario for the 2nd American Civil War. Escalating conflict between Democrats and Republicans plunge America into civil war as California and the North East secede.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Trading

name: mas o menos
description:
mas o menos ("More or Less"), the main idea is to go to discard letters, until being without any in hand to win. The game is not based on the competition or strategy, it does not have to do with actions determined by a special die (8 faces), and also by another of 4 faces, which will establish the course of the game, generating a constant interaction between the participants . With numeric cards and action tokens, the game managed to keep the players throughout the game.

—description from the designer

name: うかい (Ukai)
description:
Ukai is a historic form of fishing at night on rivers in Japan, using cormorants to dive for fish. The fish caught are usually ayu (sweetfish). A rope on the bird's throat stops them from swallowing the fish they catch. Once they have caught enough fish for the fishers, the birds are fed.

The most famous location for Ukai in Japan is on the Nagara River (Nagaragawa) in Gifu province. The fishing people go out in long wooden boats, with a large wood fire raised up on the boat to light the way.

In this game, players move up the river, a tableau of cards laid face down. As the fishers move up river, the diving birds reveal cards. Some have sweetfish (1 to 5 points), others have hazards, such as the bird striking a rock. Some cards have special effects too. The game ends when all the 'bonfires' in the game are exhausted, meaning time is out. The player with the highest score in fish is the winner.

The game is published in a tiny matchbox box (no striker), with a deck of small cards and includes matches. It was recently shown on Twitter as the smallest doujin game in Japan.

name: Club Super 3. Joc de Daus
description:
The goal of the game is to obtain the maximum possible score, reaching the maximum number of figures of the board itself.

The player can throw the dice up to three times. Each time you take the dice, you can decide to reserve some and drop the rest. Until the third throw, the player is not obligated to decide which figure chooses.

If at the first shot, or between the first and the next, you get 5 equal figures, you can no longer shoot again.

After the third dice rolling the count is made. The player will receive as many goals as dice has removed from the same figure. Then he will put them on his board.

name: Sokhazania: The Soccer Board Game
description:
Sokhazania is a unique game of chance for the whole family, designed to simulate a football match in 15 minutes of game time. It is easy to learn the rules and start having fun immediately.

Sokhazania works on the rule that you will always lose the ball when rolling a 1 or 2, and you will always be able to pass the ball to one of your players or take a shot at goal. If the dice lands out of the box you lose the ball to the other player for a throw-in.

Shots at goal must be defended by the goalie by rolling the dice. If the goalie rolls a 1 or 2 the ball is lost to a corner and the attacking player gets a chance to strike again. If the goalie rolls a 3 or 4 the goal is scored and the game restarts from the centre. A save is made the goalie throws a 5 or 6 and the game restarts from the Goalie Dot.

The player who scored the most goals in 15 minutes is the winner. Extra-time can be played on a draw or the game can be decided with a Penalty Shoot-out.

name: Bionicle: Toa Nuva Reconstruct Starter Box
description:
A Bionicle Trading card game!

The first person to build their Bionicle wins! By building one piece per turn or taking away pieces from your opponent. Use the card set and paper playmat that comes with it or use your real Bionicle figures!

When the Toa are exposed to the strange energies of protodermis, they are transformed into the mighty Toa Nuva. Although they seek to use their newfound powers, the Toa Nuva are no match for the elemental fury of gigantic wind funnels. The funnels strike the Toa Nuva tearing them apart and scattering their pieces all over the landscape. It is your job to recontruct the Toa Nuva or Mata Nui will be defenseless against Makuta's evil.
publishers: The Lego Group, Upper Deck Entertainment

name: Story Game Journey into Space
description:
Roll the dice, and check the number and colour on your Astro board. Try to mark each spaceship’s trail with planet tokens and be the one who shouts “Blast off” first. This modern classic keeps the players on their toes right to the end!


Huge content with Astro board and over 100 Planet tokens!
The game play is simple but addictive.
The story really comes alive in the game!


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Soccer Farkel
description: This is a newer, Soccer Themed, version of the classic Farkel (or Farkle). Game mechanics are similar to original but special bonuses that follow the Soccer theme. Basically a Dice-Rolling Math Game with Football Features and Chrome. Good stocking stuffer gift for a soccer fan. G-O-A-L!!!

name: Leros: November 1943
description:
Leros covers the German air attack and amphibious invasion of this Aegean island.

It comes with the usual Perry Moore photocopied map and 473 uncut counters. Units are platoon level. The rulebook is 20 pages and there is also a five-page "study folder" for the battle/

name: Der Schatz von Anubis
description:
Treasure of Anubis

Does the treasure of Anubis actually exist?
The players put themselves in the shoes of the Anubis characters and move their pawns from one mysterious room to the other in the boarding school and the antiquity shop.
